Reviews.Title: “Power Outage and Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: judy A
Reviews.Content: When the transformer burned and left us with no power for two days, the management chaged us full price and refused to compensate us. No hot water, no room service and we still had to pay $300 a night for our room. If I had the chance to stay somewhere else I would.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ambidextrous
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for four nights and it was very good. It is well situated for seeing the sights as there is a subway station nearby, although we also did a lot of walking! The nearby shopping mall, where there are a number of eating places, is accessible from within the hotel. There are also a number of restaurants within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Left something to be desired but would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: mleechap
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great spot in Boston. It is connected to the Prudential and Copley malls and there is plenty to do within walking distance. The room in the south tower was priced well but was dated. The room also room didn't have a safe or a fridge. However, the lobby area and newly renovated fitness center and pool are very nice. I will stay at this hotel again, however I will ask for a more updated room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, not a very relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Michelle C
Reviews.Content: The walls at this hotel were very thin and I could hear everything from the room next door and the hallway. I stayed for 8 days and signed up for the green housekeeping option. However, housekeeping did not clean my room on the day they were supposed to and even when I called the next day to have the room cleaned they did not clean. When I got my bill at the end of the stay I had been charged multiple times in a day for internet service and had also been overcharged for parking. The front desk staff was very helpful in getting it corrected once I pointed it out. I would only stay here again if there weren't other options available nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room and unhelpful, hostile staff.”
Reviews.Author: kavitab
Reviews.Content: Cons-The linen was dirty, furniture had suspicious stains, the front desk staff rude, 24 hour room service closed for 3 hours in the afternoon without notice (we needed it because of odd convention timing), heating in room didn't work properly (it was 36*f outside and snowing). We heard every noise from the room next to us and the hallway. Pros-The location is ideal for everything from shopping to restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, more business focus then leisure”
Reviews.Author: Canes99
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and the work out facility and pool are very nice, but you don't get a lot for your money. Internet is a separate charge and no breakfast, many of the services are geared towards the business person. It is located right next to a T station, but it is a commute to get to any of the other attractions like the kids museum, the aquarium, or the Cambridge area. For business at the prudential center I would highly recommend it, but for sightseeing I would stay more in the center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tsfl61
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with friendly staff in a great location. Only reason I didn't give it "5" is because when I pulled in to park, the valet was non-existent and the doorman offered no help. I would up self-parking in the garage which was a little spooky for a woman traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: hmflyer
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Boston is an excellent hotel. Very nice, modern lobby with many computers for guest use. There is also a very nice Starbucks. The room was contemporary and clean. Nice flatscreen TV and fast internet. The bathroom was a bit on the small side. The bed was very comfortable. They have an excellent fitness center which includes a swimming pool, big enough for laps. A really great asset of this hotel is that it is attached to a mall. You don't have to walk outside to get to the many shops and restaurants in the mall. Some of the restaurants were Legal Seafoods, PF Changs, Dunkin Donuts and Au Bon Pain. A great choice for a hotel in Boston

Reviews.Title: “We got a great deal and the staff and location are great!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferKevin
Reviews.Content: We got an awesome deal, so obviously we we're probably easy to please, but the location is worth more than we paid! It's within a block or so of several subway lines. You can get anywhere from here. The pool and fitness equipment are great, the only negative...no hot tub. The north tower rooms are much nicer than the south tower, but for us, the south tower was good, pretty standard Sheraton. If we'd spent more time in our room the variety of tv channels and bathroom would be the only things I could have complained about. The concierge staff is quite knowledgable and well connected. They arranged Celtics tickets within minutes of our asking. Boston was great and we enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to stay at the Sheraton Back Bay Boston”
Reviews.Author: littlehaven59
Reviews.Content: Coming from the UK We stayed in the Sheraton Back Bay Boston for a week from February 14 2012. Although the hotel is often very busy as it is a large conference hotel, it does not diminsh the service and courtesy of the staff. My husband and I have stayed at this hotel before and have enjoyed it on both occasions, I have also stayed previously with my sister. Although I understand that it may not suit everyone as it is so large we have found it to be a very good hotel. Although my last visit was three years ago, Jason on reception remembered me and greeted me warmly. Our room was on the 16th floor and had great views. The two large beds in the room were extremely comfortable and the room was spacious, clean and comfortable. It was equipped with Tv, toiletries, an iron, hairdryer etc.The breakfast served in the hotel is a bit pricey but well worth it as you can choose from freshly made omelettes and eggs,pastries, fruit salads, meats and sausages and in fairness after one of these breakfasts you don't have to eat until late evening, so you can carry on sightseeing. The hotel has a friendly bar and restaurant and also a Starbucks, where as an alternative to breakfast you can buy coffee and pastries to eat in or take to your room. In the very large lobby there are bowls of apples ,lovely flowers and plenty of seating. There are plenty of PCs and free internet access for hotel guests. There is also a gift shop which also stocks essential such as toiletries, reading glasses,travel guides etc. The hotel is attached on the second floor to the Prudential tower and shopping mall, so if the weather is inclement you can go out shopping without ever going outside. Apart from shopping,the hotel is located in a great area.Outside is one of the stops for the Old town trolley bus, a guided tour with a hop on hop off facility.It is also within walking distance of Trinity church, Boston Public gardens and Common and the State house. We walked the whole of the Freedom trail starting from our hotel and making our way through the common and following the clearly marked trail through historic areas of Boston. Harvard and JFK museum and library are short train journies away. Don't forget to ask the concierge about train journies.theatre tickets ,restaurant reservations etc. They could not have been more helpful. A good tip for theatre tickets is to go on the day to BOSTIX in Copley square or near Faneuil hall to get discounted tickets. Quincy market is a great place to sample worldwide food and cheaply. We also visited Concorde, to see Louisa May Alcotts house(Little women) and also Salem to the museum about witchcraft.(trains go to both destinations from North station). Boston has a lot to offer and should not be overlooked, unwind in one of the many Irish bars or an upmarket restaurant or after a busy day visiting all the museums, shops and sights relax with a cocktail or a pint of Guinness at The Cup in Hand the oldest pub in America (apparently), before going back to the Sheraton for a night cap,then sink into a big comfortable bed , before starting all over again the next day.(Oh by the way if you eat too much, the Sheraton has a gym and a pool too). enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: T_R_Grant
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton while in Boston for work for several days and had an enjoyable stay. My room was comfortable and well-appointed. The location was great for shops and restaurants. I left some clothing at the hotel, and the staff were very helpful in locating it and returning it to me. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Room Service Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: C S
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Sheraton Boston, and I can honestly say I was very pleased from the time I entered the hotel lobby until I reached my room with the fabulous view. I have chosen to adopt a vegan lifestyle, so when I travel I make a special effort to find food that accommodates this personal choice. I called down to room service to make my selection and I explained to Brenda that I was a vegan, she mentioned that one of her co workers were vegan as well, and she would speak with her. I am so happy that she did, her name is Tia and she suggested a meal that was fabulous from the first bite, absolutely delicious. It was so good that after dining I called down and thanked her. Thank you again Tia for making my experience complete.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLobsters
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Sheraton Boston 4 times (in the past 2 years) at all levels of Starwoods preferred guest status, and this past weekend was the silver status so the room was a conventional king size bed (and not a suite as in our 3 prior stays). You can't beat the river view from the North tower, and I love being connected to the Prudential Center and Copley - so weather isn't an issue. The pool, sauna and exercize facilities are very nice, and the rooms are clean and nicely furnished. We use (4,000) rewards points plus $60 per night for our stays, and I hesitated to write a review for fear that the hotel will be sold out, once the "cat is out of the bag."

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with lively atmosphere in the heart of Boston attractions”
Reviews.Author: Carol41699
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights, and found the location walkable to all the attractions we wanted to reach, whether Symphony Hall, Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum, Copley Square, the Public Garden, Boston Common, Beacon Hill or the Theatre district. The pool was unusually large for a hotel pool, and there was a nice buzz of activity in the lobby whenever we passed through. The hotel connects through the Prudential Center and mall to the Westin Hotel, all indoors with shopping and a variety of restaurants, so bad weather would not spoil things, though we happened to have great weather.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice But Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Ken E
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a weekend convention. Great location, nice room and staff but pricey and lots of add- ons. Parking at $39 was a rip-off!

Reviews.Title: “Conference Type Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: VoyageursNJ
Reviews.Content: Typical conference type hotel everything is over priced....Star Bucks in the lobby...in hotel restaurants way over prices...A few okay restaurants around the corner...Hynes Convention Center connected...clean with their Sweet Sleeperâ„¢ Bed... Interesting reuse our towels to conserve water program called Green Choice Program offers guests $5 or 500 Starwood points a night to refuse housekeeping service for up to three nights, aiming to save water, energy and resources. I like getting something back HOWEVER there is more cost then just saving water 37.2 gallons of water, .19 KWH of electricity, 25,000 btu of natural gas, and 7 oz of chemicals in just one night . What about payroll of those not hint to do the room cleaning, washing ... I like hotels that at lest try to give something back but the bottom line here is really saving money for them! Internet is 412.95 for 24 hours ..fee in the lobby and in the all ways of the room floors...then just walk into your room and you have it all the time... So would I stay at this hotel again..not unless I was at the Hynes Convention Center

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful.”
Reviews.Author: Marium22
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for a night on Oct 20 2011. I had the misfortune of being very unwell and on my own that night, in a hotel and far away from family and friends in the UK. "Positives" (1)clean rooms but outdated decor - pink -tiled bathroom from the 70's! (2)is definitely a corporate hotel - would be more appropriate for a business person (3) I was allowed to check in an hour early when I mentioned to the receptionist that I was unwell and she offered to have tea sent to the room and assured me that there was availabilty for the next night if I was unable to fly home the next day. Negatives!!! I could have essentially died in that room and no-one would have known. No tea arrived (although I was so sick I didn't really care) and no-one called to see if I was okay - it is of course possible that I was expecting too much, especially from such a large hotel but maybe some concern if a guest, checking in on her own, mentions she is unwell and breaks down in tears in front of you at check in??? I was suffering from acute vertigo and became so unwell that after several hours of trying, managed to bundle myself into a cab and go to AE at Brigham and Womens Hospital - three hours in AE, $3000 bill but life savers. I eventually woke up at 11 the next morning, marginally better but still not well. Having spent 30 mins trying to get through to the front desk, I ordered room service and mentioned to the lady on the phone that I couldn't check out straightaway. She informed me that the hotel was full (thankfully I was able to fly that day) and said I could stay in the room for another 4 hours at a cost of $100. I was so desperate that I of course paid the money to stay in the room. I eventually left the hotel at 4 o'clock and flew home that evening. The Sheraton is a large, corporate hotel and it is possible that a smaller hotel would have offered a more personal service.The staff are polite but I would be hard pushed to say they have any genuine interest in their customers - noone seemed interested in " doing that little bit extra" to make the stay more pleasurable. Maybe if one was on business, this hotel ticks all the boxes and it certainly was busy. For a person on holiday, this is not the hotel for you! It is clean but seriously outdated in terms of decor, impersonal and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business and vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mricha1111
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Boston Sheraton for a conference and brought my wife along so we could vacation afterwards. Our room was comfortable and clean. Service was quick and easily contacted. Easy walking distance to most Boston attractions. Would gladly return on our next visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Large corporate-conference type hotel, but does a good job of it”
Reviews.Author: Rob T
Reviews.Content: I am not the biggest fan of these huge American hotel chains, but for a conference venue it ticked all the boxes. The rooms were comfortable, although the bathroom needed a face-over. Internet in the room was not reliable and colleagues had the same experience, but always worked in the lobby as a back-up. Good location for shopping and very close to the flag ship Apple store. I would recommend Newbury St. for clothes shopping. The swimming pool was a big plus and the gym was reasonably good although split between two rooms separated by the pool (water in the room with the running machines would have been nice!). It feels very corporate-conference type hotel, so if you are in Boston for vacation you may want something more personal.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been great, if not for one issue ...”
Reviews.Author: baseballguy83
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is awesome. Walking distance to Fenway Park, and a ton of great pubs and restaurants just right around the corner. Check in was easy, the staff were all great, and the room was clean and comfortable. We we're in town to catch a couple games at Fenway Park, and it was cool to see the visiting teams we're staying in this same hotel. The only issue was one night while sitting in the hotel bar, there was a mouse running around on the floor that couldn't seem to find his way back into his home. It was enough to make us get up and leave; very disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JMUstu01
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several spots near Copley Place and this is my new favorite. The staff was fantastic. There is a Starbucks in the lobby. They have some very nice suites available for upgrades. The beds and rooms were very comfortable and the hotel is connected to Copley Place...very convenient. I have no complaints about this hotel and will be staying here again on my next trip into Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alank1101
Reviews.Content: Conveniently connected to the prudential tower. If you are taking the train in from the airport. get off at the Prudential stop on the green line and you go right into the mall. Short walk to the sheraton. The hotel was packed when we visited, though we still managed a upgrade to the starwood preferred floors. The room though had a small closet for hanging your coats and clothing. Mattress was slightly worn, needs to change soon. Bottled water complimentary 2 per day. A continental breakfast was offered, fresh fruit, yogurt, pastry, cereals and beverages. Pretty much the same spread everyday. Computers (2) were available to use in the lounge and at the lobby but for some reason they were very slow in loading the pages. Took the taxi back to the airport, was about 30 dollars.It was a good stay here at the Sheraton Boston. Will visit again,

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel,”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just solid for travelers, especially businesspersons. The rooms are well maintained, clean, and the staff is pleasant and professional (but do not go out of there way to make it first rate.) Staff is better than the Westin. We have not had any problems with the 15 or so times we have stayed here. Restaurants are traditional hotel fare. VERY convenient to the Prudential Center and connected Mall. You do not have to go out in inclement weather. Downsides: Club Lounge for Platinum only. Why are we still paying for internet? You can come down to a very noise lounge and use it there. Lobby is always cold and very noisy. WORST Thing - Valet parking is a TERRIBLE. You wait to get into the area to drop off and it is normally a 45 minute wait to get your car!

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap but at an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: JurgenRaedts
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an ideal location in the heart of the city and close to the baseball stadium. I registered online before booking which gave me a nice free upgrade: I got a top floor room on a corner with views of half of the city on the preferred guest level. Breakfast is expensive though and the same goes for the bar. Staff is very friendly and helpful except for waiters in the bar lobby. There is a starbucks inside the hotel. Although it is a very large hotel with a few thousand rooms, it doesn't feel that way.

Reviews.Title: “Location Excellent and Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: Nibbles
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get this hotel at a great rate on Hotwire and stayed here for 3 nights prior to a cruise. The location of the hotel couldn't be better, as many reviews have pointed out. We suffered bad weather for some of the time but didn't even need to leave the hotel to get to some lovely shops and restaurants via the Prudential Centre. We made great use of the trolley bus which has a stop right outside the hotel. We also walked from the hotel to the start of the Freedom Trail, so it's really central for most things. Coming from the UK we were up VERY early in the morning and loved being able to take advantage of the gym and pool which opened from 5 am. The pool is the biggest I've ever since in a city centre hotel, and really good for a proper swim. I would imagine it would be really nice in summer as it has a retractable roof. We didn't use the restaurant but picked up breakfast from the Starbucks in reception and had a drink at the bar and found the staff to be polite and attentive all round. The hotel also has free wifi in the rooms (with a really strong signal) and a bank of large computers in the lobby which are free to guests (via a code). Whilst we were there the hotel was hosting a big conference but this didn't really impact on our stay other than the fact that there were lots of people milling around at certain times.We requested a high floor, quiet room and got just that - great views from the high floors, we could even see our cruise ship on our last morning. The room was a standard Sheraton-type hotel room but a reasonable size, clean and with all the amenities we required - all we really need from a hotel room. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again or to recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in an ideal location in Boston, particularly if you can get it at a good rate on Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay for location and hotel facilities”
Reviews.Author: mick p
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Sheraton Boston in Jan 2012 for 4 nights. the room we had was on floor 26 and was excellent. The Sheraton Boston is an excellent hotel and the gym and pool are second to non. the staff couldnt have been more helpful. the location is ideal for getting around to see the sites and shopping on Newbury street. the hotel is also connected to the Prudential mall, so if you want to eat or shop without going outside then it is ideal. I would definitely recomend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location but rooms need some attention.”
Reviews.Author: thatgrl88
Reviews.Content: We went on a combined family/business trip. Great rates for Boston and the location was very convenient for us. People were friendly enough. Food services staff was exceptional. Rooms need some attention. Drain in tub was slow...took 10 mins to clear. Hair dryer attachment was broken. Rooms are not soundproof at all!! Created an interesting situation having a young teen with us and some (ahem)loud neighbors...enough said! Pillows are way too soft which left us with neck pain. So just little stupid things...but disappointing for a Sheraton. Also...they spray some god-awful scent through the lobby/elevator areas (ala Hollister/Abercrombie)..please don't do that, it triggers allergies! We have to go back in June and may consider the Colonnade which we've been to before & love, or try the Hiilton (both also convenient) The best rate will most likely trump minor things. I can't not recommend the Sheraton I just think they need to up their game to make it more of an experience! Oh...and let people combine their SPG 20% off breakfast with their "I opted out of maid service" $5 coupon. That would have score some major points with me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, service and location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: DecioKra
Reviews.Content: I was at Sheraton Boston for 11 days this January 2012 and it was a great experience. Starting with the front desk check in, with Ms Michele, that supported me and my family - 2 adults and 3 kids, always kind and helpful. We also had great and a kind service from the restaurant professioanals, always kind and with great service. The hotel is in a perfect location in Boston, close to the T subway and also connected to shopping malls at the Prudential Center. Rooms and services very good, very good pool and fitness room with new threadmills. So, I recommend this hotel and will stay there again. Decio, from Brazil

Reviews.Title: “large rooms and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: loristraveling
Reviews.Content: Had no problems! Hotel was perfect. Regular room was perfect for 4 people. Nice bathroom (a bit small, room for 1 at a time), but the water was not hot enough for us. Probably because it was dead of winter and very cold! The heater worked real good. The size of the room was perfect. Had a ledge for extra luggage or sitting, with a nice view of the city. Stayed there for 4 nights and only on the last night did housekeeping remember to give us extra cups, coffee, creamer, sugars and shamppoo/conditioner for the 4 of us, but really that's no biggie, it was just a phone call away.... just thought I would mention for those of you who like service. The location was perfect. We used the subway one day, which was pretty much connected to the hotel. The charge for parking was expensive ($46 per night with in and out privledges). We parked across the street to save $16 a night! LOL

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton, Boston,MA”
Reviews.Author: ladivabella
Reviews.Content: I staid at the Sheraton for four days and i highly recommend it. Walking distance to everything and on a winter day you can get around in the inside shopping center which connects to other spectacular hotels and the Prudential building. No need or dare to rent a car. Parking is very expensive and hard to find. I also highly recommend the Open on-off tour bus. The service in the hotel is excellent and the hotel itself is beautiful with great amenities. worth the stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! But $46 for parking? Really?”
Reviews.Author: OBXtoSXM
Reviews.Content: My dad and I planned a last minute trip for the Patriots vs. Broncos game and we weren't disappointed. This hotel was actually the top recommendation from the Southwest Airlines website so we figured we'd give it a go. Check in was a breeze, we walked right to the counter and were greeted by a very friendly clerk. After getting our room key we headed to the elevator to get to the 23rd floor. We opened the door and were immediately impressed by the view from our room. It was also nice not being able to hear any of our neighbors or anyone in the hallway too. Being that we were only going to be in the city for 2 days, it was very nice to have a hotel connected to one of the nicest shopping areas too. Just a short walk from the elevators was the entrance to the Prudential Center shopping area. Overall the stay at the Sheraton was great and I wouldn't change anything about it. The only concern I had was the amount of money it cost to park. I understand how overpriced it was to park in this city period, but $46 is ridiculous. Even the garage at the shopping area wasn't that expensive! The only tip I can give is that if you're staying over the weekend, find an empty metered spot, they don't charge from 8pm Saturday until midnight Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: birdwlfd
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed here numerous times when visiting Boston. It is connected to the Hynes Convention Center, Copley Plaza and the Westin. We find it perfect for winter visits. We often stay here for New Years because once we arrive we can stay inside if we want. Since it is connected to these malls, there are plenty of restaurants to choose from and shops to visit. It is also connected to the Prudential which has a very nice sky lounge if you are looking for something upscale. With a decent gym and pool, the Sheraton Boston has everything you need. There is also a T stop hearby so you can easily get to all parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: kathy g
Reviews.Content: I had such a nice weekend in Boston and staying at the Sheraton was the best choice I made. The location was perfect. The hotel had connection to the Prudential Center and the other mall/hotels that made our walking trip indoors a blast versus being in the cold weather in the month of January. The rooms were clean, soft beds, quiet and an amazing view of the city on the 25th floor was such a plus. The downside is 12.95 internet service for the luxury in your own room. Beside that, I will come back again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: SJB1209
Reviews.Content: Wife stayed in December with young baby visiting hospital. Desk staff were excellent and upgraded room, they could not do enough for us. Hotel was very clean and beds comfortable. Location is great as it is connected to the prudential centre - no going out in the cold weather for a cup of coffee or a spot of lunch. Booked through discount website so price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Boston visit.”
Reviews.Author: Eam77
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Boston Hotel was a great location to see what Boston had to offer. The hotel was busy but coped well with the numbers. Room was very good as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxclancy72
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed for one night on New Year's Eve. The location of the hotel is its main appeal; a great base of operations to explore Boston and Cambridge either on foot or the T. The room was clean and tidy. Everything one would expect in hotel in this range. Check in was a bit of a cluster. NYE is probably one of their busiest nights, but a little better organization would go a long way. I, like many others, had other plans for the 45 minutes I spent in the unmarked line for Sheraton Preferred Guests. The receptionist did make an exception for me, which was appreciated, but a better system would help. In the elevator I spoke to a guest who stated he was there for a friend's 1200 person NYE party in a ballroom, which raised a little concern for late night noise. While there were several 'amateurs' in the lobby early in the evening, the security did start checking room keys at the elevators before 8PM. By the time we returned to the room at the end of the night, there was no loud party/noise issues at all. We did eat at the hotel restaurant, Sidebar, which was the highlight of our stay. Waiter Jimmy was one of the best I've ever had. Thorough, timely, and genuine. No problem to get a table for 7 on short notice. Food was good and fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun that I could see myself living in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTati
Reviews.Content: On a whim (and an airfare deal), I spent New Years Eve in Boston with a girlfriend. We're both single and in our 30's and were looking to take in the sights, history, and great food of Boston... all while delving into some fun. The Sheraton was a great base! We were there for 5 days and the stay was over New Years Eve so hotel rates usually shoot up. We ended up spending a little over $600 (which we split in half) for a spacious room with 2 comfy double beds. The temp in the shower didn't want to regulate (and there wasn't a fan) so things got a little steamy at times, but the hotel is in a great locale right off Boylston St.. It also has an indoor connection to 2 T lines (Boston's subway) which was a huge bonus on a chilly windy day. The staff was very friendly. Free computers for guests to use in the lobby. A large indoor pool, sauna, and fitness center (although we did wish there was a hot-tub with all the walking we did).

Reviews.Title: “Very good conference hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rtalbert
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the AMS/MAA meetings in January 2012. It was probably the most agreeable conference hotel experience I've had. The good: - The location of the hotel is outstanding. It's in the heart of downtown Boston close to the "Back Bay" area. I had a beautiful view from my window overlooking the Back Bay, Charles River, and MIT on the other side of the river. And only 20 minutes from Logan Airport. - The hotel is attached to a shopping mall, which was really handy when I wanted to eat but didn't want to go to a 5-star restaurant. I guess there's shopping there too, which I am not into. - Good service and a spacious, clean, quiet room. - I used the fitness center there on the fifth floor, and it was really nice with lots of state-of-the-art elliptical machines and whatnot. The not-as-good: - Others noted that the rooms lack some of the amenities you might find elsewhere. A refrigerator would have been really nice, since there is a supermarket within walking distance. - Wifi in the room is $13/day. The practice of nickel-and-diming business travelers with expensive wifi continues to be a peeve for me. I wish some big-name hotel would step up and stop charging for it. (At least the wifi is free in the lobby and in the Hynes Convention Center.) - Fairly limited dining options if you want something relatively inexpensive and not a chain restaurant. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: samSG81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Dec 2011. The rooms were of a good size and clean, however the hotel was a bit old. It is conveniently connected to the Prudential Center and I loved the Starbucks coffee machine in every room. The T station and bus stop were conveniently located within a 5 mins walk of the hotel. We stayed there over the new year and there were very rowdy guests on the entire floor that did not tone down even after the hotel security paid them a visit at 3am. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing room!”
Reviews.Author: snufflypig
Reviews.Content: The location, the lobby, the service and the conference facilities were all of a good standard. However, the quality of the room was considerably below the standard that I expect from the major hotel chains, the floorspace is limited, there is no minibar or fridge, the bathroom was dingy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: yangleila_92593
Reviews.Content: Being the first time in the city of Boston, the Sheraton gave me a warm welcome to the beautiful city. Being the largest hotel in the New England states, this property does well to serve its guests. The friendliness of the staff distinguishes this hotel from the surrounding competitors. Staying in a king room in the south tower, I had a lot of space to spread out. Shopping can never be made easier when the Prudential Mall is connected to the Sheraton on the 2nd floor. Starwood hotels never fail to impress and the Sheraton Boston would be my first choice whenever I return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Average room.”
Reviews.Author: msg82256
Reviews.Content: You'll always get good value here, though there's no real flash. I booked this through Priceline, so got a great deal for a room during the busy Christmas season. It is well-located in Back Bay and an easy walk to great shopping in Copley Place, Boylston St and Newbury St.

Reviews.Title: “A typical convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bikers_Mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a 5 day conference in January and were underwhelmed. There is no refrigerator in the room. The king bed mattress was lumpy with a "hole"on one side and a "shelf" on the other side. The bathroom is small and the toilet is noisy. We kept the bathroom door shut to minimize sounds from the neighboring bathroom. The TV has Ã¶ver 20 channels". 20 oz soda bottles cost $2.25 in the vending machine on the floor. On the plus side, it was easy to control room temperature and the heating system was silent. The pillows were soft and comfortable, and the wait for elevators was reasonable. One day when I returned at 3:30 pm to the room, it was not yet made up. I called guest services and someone was sent to make up the room within 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....”
Reviews.Author: Lisa29503
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with our kids between Christmas and New Year's, had a king suite which had a view of the Charles River, lovely room. The hotel is connected to the Prudential Mall which had some lovely stores and restaurants. It's also a short walk to Copley and the Public Gardens. The staff were great at the hotel too. My only complaint is $46 for overnight parking is too much.

Reviews.Title: “Never take a connecting room, South Tower!”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodRealtor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, gold SPG members, stayed one night, New Year's Eve, and were given a corner king, 2456 upon check in. Nice corner room with two walls of windows. Everything was fine until 2 AM when our neighbors in 2457 returned. This room was connecting and allowed us to hear everything, and I mean everything from next door. The young lady did a lot of praying, evoking the the Lord's name many times during the next hour. We could hear every word they said and they continued to talk loudly until 5:00 AM. Not a restful night's sleep. I did mention it upon checkout the next morning, and my points were refunded. I have stayed at many Sheraton locations, and the noise from the halls and the adjoining rooms was the worst I've experienced. Front desk was very good at check in and at check out, as I have found as standard at Sheraton, but the physical limitations of the South Tower would limit me from returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Nick E
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for New Year's Eve as a 3.5 star hotel on hotwire. Not really sure why its not a four star however. Very inline with other four star hotels. Was able to check in early and got a view of the Charles River and the Boston Back Bay on the 20th floor. Very very nice location in the prudential center. Rooms are a little small, but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated and great location!”
Reviews.Author: LovesPR
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and really enjoyed it! We asked for a high floor and we were given the top (29th) floor, club level. Nice club level lounge with great view of back bay and cambridge. Service was great. I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location and value”
Reviews.Author: thespeechgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel New Years Eve 2011. We were in the north tower and had an amazing view of the Charles river on the 24th floor. Ask for a room facing the Charles river above the 20th floor or you may end up looking at the Hynes convention center! The rooms are quite small but very nice and at 3.5 star level at least. There's a coffee maker but no fridge. Very amazing bed! Front desk was friendly and efficient. Room was very clean and new looking. The view was BREATHTAKING. We turned off the lights to just gaze at the river. The hotel is connected to an upscale male called The Prudential Center Shops with tons and tons of shopping. You don't have to even step outside into the cold winter air...it's all via walkways. Lots of upscale shopping but regular shops too. There's a Starbucks in the lobby of the Sheraton. No wifi for free except there. Just outside the hotel is the Copley square area and you are just 5 minutes walk from Newbury Street shopping and 15 minutes walk to the Boston Garden. There's a subway right down the street. Great area. Very safe and upscale area of Boston. Tons of restaurants. Sel de la Terre is incredible french food and very good value for money. The parking garage...well...terrible in terms of price. $45 a day. If you can park at the Boston Common Parking Garage for $11.00 per day and walk to the hotel (15 mins) you will save a bundle on the weekend but not weekdays. Don't pay $24 for breakfast at the hotel. There's a Duncan Donuts and an Au Bon Pain steps away from you in the Prudential mall. There's a fabulous foodcourt too with wonderful Indian food and a host of other foods. The pool is nice but was filled with rug rats so we passed. No hot tub. It's a big hotel (1100 rooms) but feels so much smaller! We paid $150 a night by doing Hotwire and chose the 3.5 star hotel with a pool and 95% recommended it and saved almost $75.00. We loved it and will do it again next New Years eve for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A big hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: 4ever_traveling
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night at the Sheraton Boston before heading out on a cruise, so our time was limited. From the airport, a cab ride here cost us around $40. Even though the enormous lobby was bustling, check-in was a breeze. We are Starwood Gold members, so we were offered late checkout -- at the same time another non-member was told she'd have to pay for late checkout, so beware if this is a need for you. The room was clean, though a little small. Bottled water was included. We didn't spend much time in the room except to sleep, and this wasn't a business trip, so we didn't have a need for wireless and other biz essentials. The room was quiet, though quite a hike from the elevator. The hotel bar was crowded and pricey, but the waitstaff was pleasant and took care of us quickly. They even helped us find a table that would accommodate our party of four, pushing together two tables and asking for cooperation from other patrons. The hotel actually is attached to the Prudential Center Mall, which allows you to walk the Back Bay District area without going outside -- a bonus for us because our visit coincided with an impending Nor'easter. The concierge was very helpful, drawing a map for us to help us find a specific restaurant. We were able to navigate to the restaurant -- several blocks away -- without being exposed to the elements. The pool was good-sized, and the gym facility was huge, with lots of modern equipment. The view from the gym was spectacular, too. When we travel, we usually stay at Starwood properties and generally find the staffs to be exceedingly pleasant. This trip was no exception. The location was convenient to the cruise port and the trendy Back Bay area. The hotel was expensive, and while we didn't eat in the restaurant, we did check out the menu pricing. I suppose it's probably in line with much of Boston's pricing. It seemed to be a popular place among the business set -- probably because of the large convention rooms. We'd stay here again, if we could score a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a conference in Boston”
Reviews.Author: lpo1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location in Boston making it easy to escape for breaks from work to experience glimpses of the city. I had a gorgeous view of the prudential and the river (ask for a high floor). As a bonus it's attached to shopping malls, so I could get early Xmas shopping done too. Great restaurants and bars are all really close by. My room was spacious and on the corner, with plenty of space to work. The only downside is that the feel is very cookie-cutter corporate. Motivating for getting work done, but not cozy or interesting or anything like that. But I prefer small hotels and that's just my preference. There was nothing wrong with it per se-- very clean and friendly staff and all that-- I just prefer more interesting spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: elmcitytraveller
Reviews.Content: I got the room through Expedia. One of those four star hotels that you don't know the name of until, after you pay. We have been very fortunate so far doing that. They valet park the car for $42.00 a night, which is the Boston average. The entry way is very nice. To the right is a restaurant and lounge. There is a Starbucks in the lobby. A real starbucks that is, very convenient. The staff were nice enough, they put us on the top floor which yielded a very nice view. The bedding was nice and comfortable. The room was spacious enough for the two of us. The hotel is very close to Newbury and Beacon streets, and of course the Taj Mahal of Boston, Fenway. It was 2 weeks before Christmas and everything in and around the Hotel was perfectly decorated. We had a very nice time. The only problem was that the TV in the room was analog. I found that very strange and annoying in this day and age, especially since I wanted to watch the Patriots stomp Tebow and the Broncos. I chose to watch the first half in the common area of the lounge, as that tv was digital. Anyway, it was a good value, and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: 21Ross
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the start of December. We has booked a Club Room but were told upon check in that this was not on their system.We were told that there was no Club rooms available & that we could check back in the morning. We arrived at the hotel at 11.15pm & were far to tired to argue, so decided to take the room allocated to us & sort things out in the morning. The girl on reception told us that there was no difference in the size of the room, but when we arrived at our room, we beg to differ. There was barely over a foot in space between one side of the bed the wall, which was a bit hard not to bang into if you had to go to the toilet in the middle of the night. There was no beside lamp this side of the bed which made it equally hard to find your way in the dark (sure where would you put one). We went down to reception early the next morning & after still being told that there was no Club rooms available, eventually low & behold one became available. On thinking back it was probably available all along & we'll know better for again in case it ever happens. Besides all this we had a wonderful stay. Love this hotel & the convenience to everything. The Concierge is excellent & booked us a lovely Italian restaurant - Giacomo's on Columbus Ave. She also booked the Wrentham shopping trip. Looking forward to our next trip already.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ljcoolk
Reviews.Content: Just back from as the title reads another fabulous stay in the Sheraton, Boston. Upon arrival we signed up for a Starwood preferred guest programme and as a result we were upgraded to a junior suite with free wifi access for our state, I couldnt fault the suite, roomy spacious and clean. The staff are courteous and most olbiging especailly Sara on the check in desk, she is an star. This was our 3rd time staying in the Sheraton and choose it simply because the location, right in the heart of Boston, connected to the Prudential centre, a block from Newbury Street and Boylston Street right on your door step . The old Boston Trolley tours stops right outside the hotel which is very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location is All this Place Has Going for it...”
Reviews.Author: CJarvis
Reviews.Content: I want to say up front that the location is ideal. It is convenient to shopping and it is easy to navigate around the city from the hotel. However, I want to report my less than acceptable service when I stayed recently. I had trouble checking in to start. They could not locate my reservation, even when I gave the front desk my confirmation number. After several calls, they figured out what the problem was and allowed me to check in. After checking in, I went to my room only to find that they had placed me in a room with one bedroom after I had clearly paid for a double. I had to go back down with my belongings and have them assign me a different room. The woman at the desk was quite rude but saw that I was correct and gave me a different room. I was pretty irritated at this point and do not understand why I was treated that way after the front desk had made several mistakes. The room was quite tight, and I also found a dirty knee high in the bottom of my bed. Not wanting to deal with the poor service at the front desk, I ignored it. I also noticed that the walls were paper thin and I could clearly hear my neighbor watching tv. Lastly, the desk charged my card 2x for the incidental hold they issue. I would never stay at this hotel again until they had an overhaul with the front office staff. And maybe cleaned the rooms better. Also, is it too much to ask to check in with no problems and be charged the correct amount?!

Reviews.Title: “A solid performer in all categories”
Reviews.Author: Chgo_Biz_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times over the past two years and wanted to update my review of 2 years ago. The construction is finished, and I usually get a room in the North Tower. The new rooms are not luxurious, but they are clean, well lit, and functional. The club lounge is very large, with a great view, and very comfortable. I am a Platinum, and usually get upgraded to a junior suite which has a large entryway and a living room. My understanding is that Plats frequently are upgraded at this hotel. They also have a great health club that was recently renovated, with a locker room and a sauna, and an 18-yard lap pool which is nice but kind of warm for swimming and also somewhat overchlorinated. On my recent stay, the club level was closed due to "low occupancy" which was kind of annoying, but they gave club floor guests a free buffet breakfast so that really made up for it, since I don't usually use the club in the evening. I should note also that I have stayed at the Westin Copley Place, and although it has fancier and more luxurious decor, I think that in all other respects the Sheraton is just as good, and is usually cheaper. As others have noticed, the location is also extremely convenient to Pru Center and Back Bay.

Reviews.Title: “the club offers excellent value for the prize”
Reviews.Author: martha988
Reviews.Content: perfect location great views wonderful complementary breakfast rooms are not big but very nicely remodelled

Reviews.Title: “Liked it a lot”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravellerUK
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was excellent in many ways and got a very good deal so I was perhaps already in a positive frame of mind regardless before my stay here. Positives for me: - Location is excellent, attached to a mall and right in the city so lots of restaurants, bars and attractions just a walk away. - the view from the room (i was on the 26th floor) was phenomenal. When the sun rose it was staggering and the twinkling lights of the city were so good i never shut my curtains the whole trip - Bedroom was decent size and complimentary stuff was nice as was teh pool and fitness centre. - subway station is within teh mall so you dont have to go outside to reach the subway to and from teh airport and sights, plus the trolley bus tours all have a stop outside the hotel !! - perfect - The concierge was particyularly helpful , printing off maps and timetables on demand, very good - there is a starbucks in the hotel and the mall has a food court so if you get a good rate without breakfast go for it as there are plenty of options to choose from without even venturing outside. - free internet terminals in lobby and wifi were nice but you have to pay to have wifi in your room, bit odd but not a big deal - the bar was cosy , not sure why but it had a nice feel about it could be improved... - bathrooms are very small, i normall dont notice but for a 4 star hotel it seemed odd

Reviews.Title: “Great room, fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: smilie62
Reviews.Content: Room was beautiful, immaculate, and a lovely lobby too. Location is great for business - attached to the mall & conference centers, but a bit farther from shops/park/the action than some others. Bed was fabulous & great amenities. I did have a problem where they charged me for parking when I didn't have a car and it took many calls to resolve, but otherwise, grand.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: newrock
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in a standard suite and the overall experience was very positive. The room was large, with a king bedroom separated from a living area by a sliding door. The living area had a nice sofa, chair, desk and tables. There were 2 flat screen tv's in the room as well. The bed was very comfortable and the room surprisingly quiet given the size of the hotel and its central location in Back Bay. The hotel has a very large indoor pool. However, the best feature is the location. It is connected to the Prudential Mall complex, with direct access to that high end mall, and it is in the heart of Back Bay, with easy access to everything in that part of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room, great view, good service”
Reviews.Author: PShermanATL
Reviews.Content: Be prepared, I was a little bit shocked at the size of the rooms. They are small. And the bed was a queen bed, not a king. But I had a beautiful view, everything was very clean with a nice work space, very friendly staff and my morning room service was perfectly on time each day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jimmyyee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here nov 2011. There was 7 in our group. The first night we got there they had double booked us but couldnt have been more apologetic or accommodating. They upgraded our rooms, left a personal note in each room & a complementary basket of sweets etc. Hotel was extremely clean and staff were very friendly and hepful. Location is very central and close to every mode of transport. Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Ladybentley
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 6 night stay with a good rate on Hotwire while on a sightseeing trip. Presumably I got one of the standard rooms given to Hotwire customers because I couldnâ€™t imagine paying the full rate for a room with a view across to an enormous blank wall. There was a slightly better view sideways from the bed. However that was the only downside in the room. Though it was a little small the room was a reasonable size and I certainly paid more for smaller rooms in other cities during my trip. Though the bathroom was definitely very small it was just OK for one person. The room was clean and very nicely furnished. The bed was very comfortable and there was space for a comfortable armchair as well as a good desk chair. The staff were professional if not particularly welcoming. I arrived late at night exhausted after two long and stressful flights but there were no staff available to take my bags and all I got was a wave in the direction of the elevators so had to manage on my own. However, the lobby is spacious and attractive and the use of free computers with limited printing plus free wifi was good. The location is excellent with easy access to the adjoining shopping mall with food outlets and the Cheesecake Factory as well as the subway station which I used throughout my trip. I had emailed ahead to arrange for a parcel to be delivered during my stay. However I wasnâ€™t warned that there was a charge for this service nor did anyone give me clear instructions on where to find the â€˜business centerâ€™ to pick it up. When I finally got there, they couldnâ€™t find my parcel for quite some time despite the messages delivered to me at the front desk and on my phone that it had arrived. Fortunately it was finally found and I wasnâ€™t charged for the pick up. I would stay here again for the convenience of the location especially if I got a good rate again.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: abrolly
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a great location. When we arrived, we were moved to the Park Plaza for a night due to over-booking. However, the lady (Jennifer) refunded 2 nights of the stay and she upgraded us to 3 Suites for the remainder of our stay. She also had a food and drink tray left in each room for us (Beer, water, fruit, bars etc). The free computers and printing facilities in the lobby are great. Wifi in the rooms is quite expensive, but if you don't mind going to the lobby, there is free wifi there. The breakfast in the hotel is expensive (about $23), but very good...the buffet breakfast is the best option! There is a Starbucks in the hotel and the Prudential Shopping Center can be accessed from the 2nd floor. The general area around the hotel is great...Boylston Street & Newbury Street are very convenient if you go through the Prudential Center. Overall, one of the best hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and stay”
Reviews.Author: ComputerMaverick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in September and had a great experience. The room was most comfortable and was a great size. The hotel has been remodeled recently and the room was excellent. While the bathroom was small, it was updated with great amenities. The hotel is locate close to the Back Bay area and is connected to great shopping and restaurants. The staff was excellent and we will stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “OK but...”
Reviews.Author: Howie089
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay was fine, but I received an e-mail immediately after check-in that $742 had been held from my credit card. Considering that the room charge was about $250/night my first thought was that this was an error. Nobody at the front desk could trace this in the computer system, but the reception clerk said it was high because the taxes were $77/night. In the end this was not correct and the correct amount was billed to my account. But it ruined the start of my stay. Other than that, check in was very friendly and I was upgraded to a Jr. Suite. The room had a separate seating area, but no fridge or microwave. Very convenient for the Convention Center but expensive. I walked to and from Back Bay Station through a park and local neighborhood which was very pleasant and only ~ 15 mins. I wanted to ship pre-paid items from the business center but the handling fee was exorbitant. There was a drop off box hidden in the Exhibition Center with no fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a conference”
Reviews.Author: PSandWC
Reviews.Content: i spent four days at this hotel for an academic conference. it was very easy and good for business travel. while the hotel is a bit old, the rooms are comfortable and quiet and clean. the location is excellent. it's connected to the mall and to the convention center which are really easy. we actually stopped in Barnes and Noble and got to meet Bill Clinton when he was doing a book signing. very fun.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but a few quirks to it”
Reviews.Author: nimen_hao
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference at the Convention Center, and it was the closest hotel to the Center (main tip: by far the closest!!!). It's a good hotel, but there are a few things that make it less than desirable. The room doors slam so they often woke me up, and the walls seem really thin. My neighbour's alarm woke ME up, but not him! The beds are comfy, and they have a green program where you can get a $5 certificate to use at the cafes in the hotel if you decline housekeeping for a day. As I was there for a conference, and it was a conference hotel, there were peak times for the elevators to be in use, but the wait times were pretty ridiculous. It often seemed like only a few of the 6 elevators were working, and I waited several minutes, many times, to either go up to my room or down to the lobby. It has lots of amenities nearby with the mall and Newbury street, so it's very convenient in that respect. Overall, good location, convenient, but not the best hotel given a few quirks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, walk to shopping centers, Boylston and Newbury,”
Reviews.Author: canadaJohnc
Reviews.Content: River view room is a bit small, but the view to Back Bay and MIT/Cambridge is so impressive that we don't want to close the drape. We came from Logan Airport using the shuttle bus and subway to Prudental station, then walk through the mall to the hotel, very convenient. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: abwoli
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several days while attending a conference. The service was wonderful -- the staff were attentive and friendly. I requested a high floor at check-in and was given a lovely room on the top floor with an outstanding view of the city. The room was spacious, very clean, and the king-sized bed mattress was comfortable. The sheets had a lower thread count than most hotels in this class have. The bathroom shower tile/fixtures are in need of an update, though, and the water pressure was suboptimal -- minor flaws. In the fitness center, the elliptical machines were new and complimentary earbuds were a nice touch. The location of the hotel is outstanding. We could walk to the Prudential Center, Hynes Convention Center, and T station without going outside into the cold! It is a short walk to the shopping and restaurants of Newbury St. You can also catch a ride on the Duck tours at the Prudential Center -- making this a great location for tourists. Though in room internet access requires a fee, access is available throughout the lobby. This hotel was a great value given its location and quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for tourists, especially with Hotwire rate”
Reviews.Author: k17
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Hotwire and made a good saving. This hotel is like a five star - the decor is beautiful, it is impeccably clean, and the staff were very attentive. We arrived at midnight, after 24 hours of travel, and having just had our luggage lost by SouthWest. It was an absolute pleasure to fall into the comfortable bed (and the staff member who received us upgraded us as well - even though it was a hotwire rate!) The hotel is conveniently attached to a higher end mall with lots of shopping and food options, we frequented the Cheesecake Factory and Cold Stone Creamery there. There is a subway line as well for easy access to the rest of the city - downtown/Boston Common are only a couple of stops away. There are a number of great bars and restaurants all within minutes walking distance, including a great little sports bar across the street which is owned by a member of the Dropkick Murphys. It is also conveniently located to Fenway- we walked there and back twice for games.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, average stay”
Reviews.Author: PJ_SYD
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel just before midnight after a long flight from Sydney - hotel has a massive lobby but totally devoid of staff. Literally waited at reception for 10 minutes until someone finally appeared from the back office to check us in. I think we had a room in the south tower. Both bedroom and bathroom were clean and modern but quite small. Our room had a "view" of what looked like a parking garage wall across the street. Bed was comfortable and location of hotel was great in the South end and also connected directly to a shopping mall. Convenience of having a Starbucks outlet in the lobby although the staff behind the counter were arguing while I was waiting for my coffee - highly unprofessional. Overall a decidedly non-descript stay. OK hotel I guess for 1 or 2 nights on business but I not really one I'd recommend for a holiday. Luckily we only stayed one night before continuing on with our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and comfortable place to be”
Reviews.Author: nilulu
Reviews.Content: Service was awesome and staff were very helpful. I had room with excellent view. The location is just the best, close to best shopping centers and restaurants. Loved the experience!

Reviews.Title: “what a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: dobarann
Reviews.Content: In general I loathe major chain hotels because they are very much the same, expensive have no character and you could be in Kuala Lumpur or Cincinnati and you could not tell the difference if your courtains were drawn.I spent a week end for a conference at the Boston Sheraton on November 4th to the 6th. I went with my parents, and asked for 2 connecting rooms. Because of the hotel full booking the gave us 2 " club rooms" at over 500 dollars/day ( which they charged me despite the fact that they are the ones who upgraded me, I am still waiting for a refund) which had the privare elevator( nice, much less time waiting to heve everyone get on or off) , and the use of the " club". and " complimantary continental breakfast", which is fine with me because I cannot eat eggs in the moring, having been brought up at cappuccino and croissants. Location of the room, nice. Good view of Boylston rd, The famous "club room' had music AND TV( on CNN only) on 24/7 clashing with each other, ( very annoying)and they only served a breakfast of a few muffins chewy croissants and chunks of melon or strawberries, yogurt choice was Dannon fat free only one flavor: strawberry unimpressive granola. Coffee was the usual starbucks, and there was literally litte else. They had ONE computer ( always taken) and the tables wesere such that you were perched like a parrot on a stool, instead of comfortably sitting at normal level, or there were 2 windows-facing narrow tables for people who liked to look at the Charles river and MIT ( also always occupied at peak breakfast time). The rest of the day ( after 10 am)there was no tea, no refreshemnts NOTHING except a few bottles of water and some granola candy bars. That was the big whoop of being on a club level. The room was absolutely identical to the lower cost ones, and the bathroom so small that if you took a deep breat you would run out of oxygen! No robe, miniscule towels, no fridge ( what happened to those? Why hotels decided to do away with in room refrigerators?), same toiletries atht would leave your skin dry and your hair flying. The Tv had a very limited choice of free channels, heaven forbid they would have HBO... everything vas "on demand" and cost money I watched one movie( no free previews either) and it cost me over 14 bucks! It was available for 24 hours but at home, the same movie goes for 5 dollars on cable: COME ON! The rest of the hotel, lobby banquet rooms etc is as bland as they come. The staff is hurried and busy, as in any such hotel. The ONLY positive aspect of the Sheraton is its proximity to the conferecnce center and the fact that you do not have to wear a coat to go from the hotel to the conference, because the whole thing is enclosed in one of the noisiest and most crowded malls I have ver had the misfortune to see. I guess I should be happy I did not bring home bed bugs , but for over 500 bucks/night I expected much more: at the very last snacks in the club room, more confy bathrooms, a robe in the room and a decent size towel to dry myself off... and nicer bathroom amenieties would not hurt... PSST Mr Sheraton, just so you know: The W chain has BLISS toiletries in their room, bathrobes and huge bathrooms and they are a lot cheaper! So if you have a choice ( I did not) stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “This is THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: flossygirl
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel - it is simply terrific! We were two Australian couples who had booked two rooms and arriving for 3 nights on two different bookings - first booking was originally for 25&26 September and then we added another booking of 24 September. We initially had decided to arrive in Boston on 25 September which was my husband's and my anniversary but decided to arrive a day early which happened to be my birthday. I contacted Sheraton via email and asked them to link the two bookings together so that neither our friends nor my husband and I would have to move rooms after the first night. No problem at all they said via a beautiful email! When we arrived the rest of my party were busy emptying out our hire car so I approached the desk to check us all in as the bookings for both rooms were in my name. I was sooooo impressed with the standard of the hotel and the check in process. Due to the fact that I had already 'let on' that it was our anniversary we had been upgraded to a fabulous suite. I also produced my passport (unasked for) which indicated it was my birthday too so that we could have a laugh over it! I certainly didn't expect anything to come of it considering my husband and I had already been kindly given an upgrade. I then enquired whether there was another suite available for my friends to also experience an upgrade (cheeky, I know) and the fabulous check-in attendant said he could accommodate my friends as well and that just made my day! When we went into our rooms it far exceeded our expectations. Our room had spectacular views that could be seen through two wrap-around walls of windows. It also had a great separate sitting area also with a wall of windows to view the skyscrape. I was in love with it! Our friends also had a huge room where the sitting area and the bedroom were altogether which made the room HUGE - they were also in love with theirs. :) But wait, there's more! Our friends had arrived at our suite in order to leave for my birthday dinner when there was a knock at the door. My husband opened it and was greeted by an impeccably dressed waiter carrying a beautiful silver tray. On it was an exceptional bottle of french champagne and massive chocolate coated strawberries. How great is this! The note that accompanied it welcomed us, wished me a great birthday and hoped we would enjoy our stay at the Sheraton in Boston. Signed from Peter. I was on cloud nine. My apologies, Peter, but I somehow misplaced your gorgeous card along the way back to Australia (as happens when travelling for months although ironically I still have the label souvenired from the bottle of the champers - go figure!). I'm relatively sure it said you were the Manager of the Front Reception. I meant to come and thank you before I checked out but time got away from us and that didn't end up being possible. So sorry :( Please accept this Tripadvisor review as being formal and proper acknowledgement for a job exceptionally well done. The bed was to die for, the view was out of this world, breakfasts are mouth watering, the position is terrific for getting around Boston, the staff are second to none, the upgrade was very appreciated and the champagne and strawberries were just the icing on the cake. It all just made our stay in Boston one that none of us will ever forget. Thank you to everyone at Sheraton Boston for making our trip to Boston so memorable. Needless to say we love Boston (Sheraton had a large part in that) and we will return again at some stage in the future. When we do there is no other place we will stay - it is Sheraton Boston for us! Thank you so much! PS Thanks Will for recommending this hotel - you were spot on!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Convention”
Reviews.Author: benjaminwolf
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Boston is a great hotel if you are attending a convention. The Hotel room was large enough, so that a person would not feel cramped: two double beds, Desk and chair, addition upholstered chair and ottoman, multiple door bureau with large flat screen TV. The bathroom was more compact, with sink set in large marble counter, a toilet, and tub with shower--adequate for a convention crowd. What I didn't like about the room was there were not enough electrical outlets! I use a CPAP machine, we have a computer, we like to have space to recharge our cellphones and it would be nice not to have to hunt for an outlet to do these things. I wanted a refrigerator in the room for my insulin, and it was provided free of charge, but that took up outlet space. The shower was really bad--not enough pressure so I had to fill the tub and take a bath each morning. I prefer a hand held spray shower head, so for me this was a problem. Would have liked to have had free Internet access (The room was expensive, why not just charge a bit more and give free Internet?). Breakfast at the hotel was a bit pricey, but very good! I recommend the small panini sandwiches served at the breakfast buffet--excellent! Staff at the hotel was great, but there were certain times that it was hard to get through to them from the telephone in the room. Beautiful Lobby with computer areas and easy access to 2 indoor malls and the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BillMeyers
Reviews.Content: Located in the Back Bay with walkway to Prudential Center and Hynes Convention Center. Easy access to the Boston T subway. A busy lobby at times, but not a great distraction. Gray Line tours pickup in am right across the street on Dalton. We were upgraded to a suite on the 8th floor of the north tower for free. Clean room and fantastic beds. Bathroom ok, but not as elegant as the Hyatt or some other 4 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Hynes Convention Center Meetings and Experiencing Boston”
Reviews.Author: Linda H
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I met in Boston for 3 nights in November, 2011. She had meetings to attend at the Hynes Convention Center, while I came along to experience Boston. The hotel was the perfect location for both. The Hynes Convention Center was only a few steps away, attached by indoor walkways. The Prudential Center's Skywalk, shops and restaurants were also located in the same attached area. The hotel is located in the historic Back Bay area of Boston where you can walk to many additonal individual shops and restaurants. For additional information and tickets for tours, the hotel's concierge service was excellent. The Old Town Trolly Tour stopped in front of the hotel every 15 minutes. Our room was a nicely decorated large double queen room on the 17th floor, offering a very nice view of downtown. We were very pleased with the friendliness of the staff, the services and amenities offered by the hotel, and its excellent location. If given several hotel choices while attending meetings at the convention center, this is definately the hotel to choose! Linda H.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jen83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in October 2001. We had good service from the moment we arrived at the hotel. We stayed in a queen room on the 19th floor in the North tower and had a great view of the Charles River. We got a very good rate through Priceline and after reading some reviews on TA I emailed the hotel beforehand and requested a room in the North tower. The room was nicely decorated and very clean and Starbucks coffee was provided, my only complaint was that he bed was a little bit too hard for my personal preferences but that certainly didn't spoil my stay. The hotel is attached to the Prudential Center shopping complex and there was free WiFi available in the lobby which were both very useful.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Base for a Visit to Boston”
Reviews.Author: PeterPan99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in October 2011 on our first visit to Boston. The Sheraton provided the slick, efficient service that we expected from a chain with a reputation for quality and all the staff we met were very polite and helpful. We stayed in a "Club" Room; they are all on high floors, served by an express lift and give access to the Club Lounge, where there is free WiFi and an excellent continental breakfast is served (included in our room price), with superb views over the river to Cambridge. The room was clean and well furnished. When we asked for more milk and sugar in the tea/coffee-making facilities, it was immediately provided. The Old Town Trolley Bus Tour stops right outside and the Concierge sells tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to explore Boston from”
Reviews.Author: ads102
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and had a positive experience. Check in was friendly and painless. We got a good rate through Hotwire, the room seemed smaller than a normal double for this type of hotel (perhaps a single room dressed for two for hotwire rates?), but it was well kept and clean, Starbucks coffee in the room was nice. The hotel has a number of free to use computers in the lobby which is great for catching up on email, ect.. There is a Starbucks in the lobby. It's also connected to a shopping centre which contains the Prudential Centre Metro, you can cheaply get to the government centre in Boston on this line, otherwise it's not that far and a nice walk. We didn't eat there, but the Cheesecake Factory in the Prudential Centre was very good. I would also recommend the Duck tour which you can get from the Prudential Centre. I couldn't recommend using the swimming pool however, the water was not very clear, seemed to be "greasey" and there was a dark watermark around the edge of the pool, looked like it needed a good clean. Overall I'd stay again if I could get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: KarenEP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location, right next door to a shopping mall, so if you don't want to pay hotel prices for food and drink you can eat in the many restaurants in the mall or even the food court! The hotel is in a perfect location for exploring the city on foot Plus it has an 'Old Trolley' tour stop right outside! The bedroom we had was spacious & clean with a lovely view of the city. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, we will definately stay here again if we ever go back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Excellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Michelle B
Reviews.Content: Pleasant room, with usual items just what you would expect from a chain hotel.It is a large hotel, so not for you if you prefer a more personal service. Good location was able to walk all over Boston form the hotel. Had breakfast in the club room which was excellent and the staff were extremely friendly. connected to the Prudentisl Center so great for shopping. One little gripe: We had we booked the Traditional room and there was only one bedside table which was really annoying as had to put my book etc on the floor, and as the beds were high had to stretch down to get it. Also meant i had to rely on hubby to switch bedside table light on/off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ~ friendly & welcoming staff for a big corporate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Refined-Bohemian
Reviews.Content: The location is great for exploring on foot. We were greeted by friendly people at the front desk, and though our room wasn't ready, we were happy to hangout in the Starbucks located in the lobby until it was. We enjoyed a nice little suite and the best part was the picture-postcard view of the Charles River from the 25th floor. Watching the sailboats on the river prevented us from ever turning on the TV. Everything was clean, comfortable and in good working order -- with the exception that the bathtub is crying out to be re-surfaced or replaced. Though it may have been clean, a previous resurfacing was peeling away -- making it visually unappealing. I would definitely stay here again and I'm sure the hotel will address this one little flaw once they become aware of it. Also, be aware that if signing onto the wifi with your smartphone or computer -- you will pay $10 for each device. I mistakenly signed on 2 phones when 1 would have be sufficient. Learned my lesson anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Boston Hotel Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MNrocks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great stay at the Sheraton in Boston. Great location connected to the Prudential Center with lots of shopping and places to eat. Close to the T made it easy to get around the city. The Back Bay neighborhood was great for walking, shopping, going out to eat, or getting a drink. The trolley tours stopped right in front of the hotel. The room was small, but nice and clean. We were able to get a fridge in our room at no extra charge. Internet in room is 9.95 a day I think, but it is free in the lobby. I enjoyed the starbucks single packs in room every morning and was able to get online in the lobby.
