We were in the north tower on the 17th floor with a view of the St. Charles river. I would not have wanted to be on a lower floor in the same tower. View probably would have been obstructed. My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bevart
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Back Bay area of Boston. Very convenient to the MTA and connected to the Prudential Center. If weather is a concern, you don't need to get outside to catch the metro, eat in a decent restaurant, or shop the mall. Many excellent neighborhood restaurants and shops in very close walking distance. Booked this hotel through Hotwire and got an excellent rate. I did think the breakfast was a little expense at the cafe in the lobby. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Location good - service not so much”
Reviews.Author: DediB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is large and convenient to Newberry Street and the Prudential Center. Rooms are adequate, but noisy. The worst part of the hotel was the front desk, concierge and bellman service. They were woefully understaffed - 3 ppl on the front desk during peak times to check people in and the lines were 40 ppl deep. Same for the concierge and I very rarely every saw a bellman. I heard a number of people that called for bellmen but they never came so they had to manage their bags themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, unbeatable location, amazing views”
Reviews.Author: travelswithdogs
Reviews.Content: Very comfy business hotel, nice gym - read a lot of bad reviews about the South Tower, but I liked my room there. Large room, amazing views from the 23rd floor, tiny bathroom - but more than adequate. Very accommodating staff and nice touch that they give you a 5 $ coupon for the hotel Starbucks when you check out. I did not sleep well, but that was not the hotel's fault ...got it on Priceline, so I can't say anything about the value.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: RetirementTime
Reviews.Content: The airport MTA drops you off right at the hotel. The room was nice and had a great view. There are lots of shops in the Prudential Center, which is attached to the hotel and it's a block from Newbury St. We walked everywhere from the hotel. The restaurant in the lobby (The Side Bar) has good food and a friendly staff. My only complaint is that there is no fWi Fi in the rooms and you have to go down to the lobby computers. I didn't check on this before making the reservation as a lot less expensive hotels have free in-room Wi Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Everything's OK not great”
Reviews.Author: Hoony
Reviews.Content: Average business hotel, nothing exciting. Clean, comfortable beds, bad pillows. Needs a revamp. Typical Sheraton, over priced, low on delivery. OK location near Prudential building in Back Bay area. It's OK. Probably would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average dirty room. good location”
Reviews.Author: Pate80
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sheraton for the location. We did pay more for a deluxe king and while the view was fantastic the room was dirty and very dated with no fridge or safe. Real shame! I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay and good location”
Reviews.Author: Aht_11
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a break in Boston with my mother. We stayed at the Sheraton Boston and enjoyed our stay at the hotel. We were upgraded to a lovely executive suite in the North Tower. The room was spacious with nice views. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was busy and had a lively atmosphere. The Sheraton was conveniently linked to a mall, full of shops and restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel. My only negative was that although the house keeping cleaned our room perfectly, they didn't always leave all the standard hotel amenities, shampoo's, shower caps etc... and we had to keep asking. Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay. This was my first stay in the Sheraton and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with good lobby”
Reviews.Author: florence034
Reviews.Content: Stayed during October and found the hotel was located well within the city. The room was bland without good facilities... Great city but accommodation would be better elsewhere. No wifi, minibar or safe!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KSax19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sheraton Boston for a convention. Location of hotel is excellent. Great customer service. The bed was extremely comfortable. The gym/pool was huge for a hotel. The reason I did not give the hotel 5 stars is because I think it is extremely over priced for what it was. I didn't realize Boston has caught up to NYC with ridiculous prices. However, my guess is many of the other hotels in this area will be equally overpriced. Rooms were very small Additionally, there was no fridge in the room. I cant remember the last hotel I stayed at that did not have a fridge. IF you have SPG points and get a free upgrade, the room is much bigger; still no fridge, but much nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms; nice staff”
Reviews.Author: KLGri
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at the Sheraton Boston. I forgot how much I like that hotel. The rooms are comfortable and clean, and all the staff - from the doorman to housekeeping to the front desk - make you feel welcomed. Even the banquet food was fine (no "rubber chicken"). But I do have 2 small complaints. One is that the service in the restaurant at lunchtime was extremely slow. The food was great, but it really seemed that neither the waitstaff nor the kitchen was prepared for lots of guests before the start of a conference. The other is that I don't understand why if there is free internet access in the lobby there is not free internet access in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PAUL-1512
Reviews.Content: Staff were pleasant and friendly. Rooms were clean, well furnished and ours had a great view. As the hotel connects to a shopping mall it was a good location especially with two teenage girls. Plenty of restaurants locally and public transport on the doorstep. Made good use of swimming pool which also had an opening roof and although not used had a good gym.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Convenience to convention center!”
Reviews.Author: CBlancq
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. The hotel is very convenient to the Hynes Convention - it is connected via a walkway & is about a few minutes walk. The mall is also connected to the hotel and there is a convenient metro station within the Prudential shops. Starbucks is located in the hotel, although it closes at 9pm, which I thought was a little early for being in a conference hotel. There is free Wi Fi in the lobby. The reason the review isn't 5 stars is due to the service. When I arrived, the bellman didn't offer to help with my luggage. On another occasion, there was no one at the Concierge for assistance, and when I returned, there was a line of 4 guests & only one individual at the Concierge. The hotel restaurant appeared to be under-staffed. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was pricey (as expected at any hotel), but you do get a Starwood member discount for the buffet. As for the rooms: very clean, bathroom a little small, but overall, the stay was good. I had requested early check-in & they were able to accommodate that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay with Family”
Reviews.Author: HoS_11
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here for a weekend attending a family event. The room was well appointed and comfortable for my wife and I and 2 young children. The staff was very friendly and accomodating from the front desk to housekeeping to the restaurant. Only issue I had during the stay was the parking attendants overcharged us upon reviewing our bill. However, the front desk staff quickly corrected the charges without hesitation and apoligized for the error.

Reviews.Title: “Close to public transpo; bid for price”
Reviews.Author: Leioa28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very easy to reach by public transportation, and cabs in Boston are expensive. You only need to transfer once from the airport. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the train station, from which you can get to most points of interest. PROS - Starbucks in the lobby and room, easy access to public transpo, clean rooms, friendly service, convenience stores and Whole Foods nearby, hotel is attached to upscale mall w/plenty of shopping and food options, early check-in available, comfy bed *check-in, sign up for Starwood points (free) and received free internet access in room during stay CONS - expected more for what was paid (ex. ceiling in bathroom was peeling) This hotel also issues you a $5 voucher good for restaurants in the hotel if you refuse housekeeping/day

Reviews.Title: “Location is great”
Reviews.Author: jampayella
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic ESP since I was attending conference at Hynes. Very easy to access some of the prettiest parts of Boston also attached via underground walkways to Hynes convention centre and Prudential mall

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Lisa T
Reviews.Content: Our party of 14 stayed at the Boston Sheraton for 2 nights prior to our cruise. After much research I picked this hotel and it did not dissapoint. First impression was the very nice lobby and also Jessica who checked us in. She was very accommodating to our large party and all of our requests. This hotel is connected to a very large mall and was convienent for breakfast and dinner for such a large group. Also, the location is fantastic because you are very close to Newbury street and also the Hop on Hop off trolley stops at the front door. Rooms had coffee maker and Starbucks coffee and were very nicely appointed, clean and most importantly, quiet. No one had any complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: I went to the Sheraton in Boston for a convention and it exceeded my expectations. The front desk was extremely helpful; they helped us find a bagel place called, Finagel Bagel, as soon as we arrived. In the hotel is a Starbucks, a restaurant, and a big screen TV that had the Laker game on (go Lakers). The view from our room was gorgeous day and night, although the room could be considered small. The bathroom on the other hand was large. The location was prime, being attached to the mall and nearby to many restaurants and a grocery store. We pretty much walked everywhere or took the subway. I would highly recommend staying at the Sheraton. Traveled: May 2010

Reviews.Title: “Location great, hotel fine”
Reviews.Author: wendywhite
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights to visit the city. Hotel was fine we stayed in the north tower on the 26th floor, room was good spacious and clean. We had breakfast in the club lounge, fine for a 'free' breakfast. Reception was fast and friendly. Starbucks was a bonus as was having the trolley stop right outside. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “if you value sleep; go sleep someplace else”
Reviews.Author: philgta3
Reviews.Content: If you value a good night's sleep, go sleep someplace else. We stayed on the 20th floor just for a night and had an awful night's sleep. The main problem was that the door was hollow and had a two inch gap at the bottom that allowed sound and light to come through. So naturally when drunkards babbled in the hallway or in the next room: we heard everything and got woken up several times during the night. You could also hear other people's plumbing. so whenever a neighbor flushed or took a shower; it would wake you up Paying over $360 for bad nights sleep feels like getting ripped-off. The flat screen TV is not even hooked up in HD; the cable signal was in Analog LOL in 2011 and $360 hotel hooks upt their flat screen TVs with composite cables. Eeeesshh The food was ordinary, my girlfriend ordered a panini and they gave her a toasted slice bread sandwich muhahahaha. That's not a panini. Save your money, and sleep someplace else Value: 0 Sleep quality: 0

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very good SPG member lounge”
Reviews.Author: NigelMA
Reviews.Content: Located in Boston's Prudential Center it's easy to access shops and restaurants without even going outside. The hotel is one of the better Sheratons with modern rooms (I was in a junior suite overlooking the Charles River and it was very spacious). Valet Parking is very expensive here $44/day.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain in Boston”
Reviews.Author: rakehead
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the end of our road trip to New England, location was perfect for sight seeing, eating and transport. We emailed in advance and asked for a nice view and thats what we got, view of the Charles River and on the top floor great. Thankyou. We booked this hotel on hotwire and got a great price, the only thing to note was the poor picture quality on the tv and the shower made a loud noice when being used, and as we are early risers was worried about disturbing other guests. We had no problems with check in fast and efficient. A Tip to others about parking as expensive in Boston. We parked in the Prudential centre car park. first right out of the hotel (the same one the hotel valet and self park use) and printed off a voucher prior to leaving on the central car park website.This rate was $25 for 24 hours and saved us $14 a day. With this voucher you present it on leaving and pay on credit card. Also it has direct access to the hotel and was very safe. We did have a swim in the pool which was lovely but as a note to management please put some signs up as to how to get to locker rooms, we searched ages before having to go through the gym to find them and wasnt keen on the idea of walking back in swimwear whilst everyone was using the equipment in the gym. (should have direct access to pool). Would definately stay again if in Boston, Thanks for a wonderful stay and forthe beautiful room and view. It was great to go to sleep with all the lights of the city and wake to the boats sailing up and down.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: chris24Lancaster
Reviews.Content: This will be the easiest review I've ever written on here............everything was spot on. Arrived to be met by a smiling very friendly and professional receptionist, who was more than happy to talk about were you were from, had you had a pleasant trip. Explained everything about the hotel, asked if we needed help with the cases, told us there was a pool and gym available if we wanted to use them, directed us to the lift's and informed us that if we needed anything, just call ext 37 and it would be sorted. After going out for a walk, we returned to find a voicemail message telling us there was a special offer on in the dining room that night, avaiable on a first come first served basis. We ventured down to the hotel bar and enjoyed a lovely evening having a drink and talking with the friendly bar staff. The hotel room was clean, huge, airy and the view was amazing. Would stay here again and again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great backbay location”
Reviews.Author: chymba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel many times on marathon weekends. Great location to the finish line and expo. Service is very accomodating. Beds are exceptionally comfortable. The rooms/floors differ in appearance between the 2 towers. One tower has tastefully updated rooms while the other tower is dated and need of a renovation. Views from upper floors are great. The hotel is connected to the mall, convention center and other hotels via walkways which is a huge plus. Many restaurants as well as the boutique shops and cafes of Newbury street are a short walk away. Convenient location to the Charles River for those who are looking for a great place to run. Don't forget to run through the Commons. Fenway is located within a mile from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel, but agree with other reviews about the rate. Rate seems steep if you get an older room with no view. However if you get a newer room on an upper floor, the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel, if you can get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: okedem
Reviews.Content: We generally enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton. It looks recently renovated, lobby as well as rooms and public spaces, and our room was lovely, with a large comfortable bed, table, chair, armchair, and bench. As others have mentioned, the hotel connects to a large mall (Prudential Center), and there are two subway (T) stations a short walk away. It's a very large hotel (two towers, each with 30 floors), and houses a convention center, so it's quite busy and the lobby sees heavy traffic all day. Our room was very quiet though. The staff were friendly and efficient. After checking in, we noticed the A/C in our room wasn't cooling properly. We notified the desk before leaving to see the city and have dinner, and the clerk immediately apologized and said they'll fix it. Upon our return, it was indeed working properly; it was also very quiet, as part of a central system. Two downsides - first, the lack of breakfast (you can pay for it separately, but it's overpriced). That's not too bad - there's a Starbucks right in the lobby, and we just got some coffee and food there. There's also the whole mall, so you won't go hungry. Second - internet costs $9.95 a day - a steep, unjustified price. There is free Wi-Fi in the lobby, along with a few computers for your use. We got a good rate with Hotwire, around $120 a night (and still got a nice room on a high floor), and were pleased with the hotel. The full price (advertised on their website as around $250-300 a night) seems steep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: princess2854
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great location. It is connected to a mall, so there tons of options of restaurants and stores just down from your room. There is a T station right around the corner, so if you are heading out to see the sights, you don't have to worry about searching for a station or a cab. The rooms were a bit small, but we had an amazing view of the river, which more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but very crowded and expensive”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELCOUPLESANDIEGO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 5 nights pre-cruise and found the hotel very crowded and expensive. It was however very convenient to the shopping center/food court next door. We went over to the food court to eat breakfast each day as breakfast at the hotel was more than we wanted to pay. The internet in the lobby was down quite a few times and had to go back several times to get our boarding passes printed out. There was nothing special about this hotel. But it was easy to get to pubic transportation and to a Redsox's game. The rooms were very noisy and we could here conversations and kids crying every night. If we every come back to Boston, we would look for another place to stay. The front desk continually gave us the wrong information about tours, etc when asked.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ItsAboutTheTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located good area attached to the Prudential Center which gives great access to the convention center, restaurants and shopping. The rooms are on the small side, and the bathrooms are really tight. Housekeepers are very inconsistent, and do not have much of an eye for detail. I had a huge dark stained hand print on my shower curtain that went unnoticed for my entire stay. There were always lines at the front desk even at odd hours during the day. The concierge was no where to be found the two times I approached the desk on two different occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Graet Stay At The Boston Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Carlitoways
Reviews.Content: Great location, the service was good; the room was very nice and clean. I would recommend the hotel to anyone planning to visit Boston, Ma.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but no free internet in your room!”
Reviews.Author: scopie100
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights on business with colleagues. The hotel is well located with an adjoining shopping centre. This also has a subway stop. The rooms are a good size with nearly everything you would need. No free internet in your room in this day and age is travesty! $10 a day. However, it is free in the lobby? The beds all come with the softest sheets ever, lovely. The restaurant has good facilities but a very expensive breakfast. the adjoining mall has plenty of food choices at a more reasonable cost. The gym is excellent, well equipped and a great pool with a sun terrace, all very nice. I found the staff all helpful and eager to please. Boston is a lovely city and at only $15 for a weeks subway/bus pass is cracking value. Take a trip to Quinceys market for the biggest choice of food ever! Overall, a good hotel and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible check in service”
Reviews.Author: whertoeat
Reviews.Content: Having arrived at 4oclock in the afternoon when the reservations desk was not busy you would exp ect a speedy checkin. No way. The clerk had great trouble using the computor, even though she was the duty manager. In total it took about half an hour for her to find us a room{ the hotel was not full}. Being a Starwood Preferred guest I expected a better room than the one we were given backing onto the elevators,no mirror in the bathroom, no hairdryer, no luggage stands and barely enough room to turn around in. We had to request another room as the noise from the elavators was unbearable. 5 minutes after our request we were given a better room, an apology and 2 free bottles of water!!!!!!! I would advise people to stay at the Hilton across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Not sound proof”
Reviews.Author: RubyTuesday008
Reviews.Content: I went here for a business trip. My first night the guest across the hallway was watching TV loudly. It passed right through his door, across the hallway through my door, and right into my room. It was extremely loud. Even worse was that the room I was staying in had a connecting door to an adjoining room. As I quietly sat typing at the desk that evening, I heard a crazy loud coughing coming from what seemed like directly behind me. The sound passed through the adjoining door as if my next door neighbor were in my room. Unfortunately, my neighbor had bronchitis and the hotel was full, so I was not able to switch rooms. In fact, I heard every move she made - the next morning she ordered breakfast. I heard her call, place the order, and I heard the clinking of her silverware as she ate. I have a hard time understanding why a hotel wouldn't have more consideration about the ability of their doors to block sound. They doors may as well have been made of tissue paper. This experience made an otherwise totally average/boring hotel a bad place to stay. And it was SO expensive for a Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: rmardis
Reviews.Content: Clean and nice hotel. Rooms was of good size with the immediate amenities required for short stay. Access to many locations directly from the hotel. Like most big cities, parking is terrible and very costly, this should be noted on their website to allow visitors to decide not rent a vehicle. Overall - Average "Sheraton" based on my other stays at this brand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Notably good service”
Reviews.Author: Masood Q
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the hotel, Monday and Tuesday (Sept. 26-28) with a guest. We enjoyed the hotel very much. The location was contiguous with the prudential center shopping center. In the garage right underneath the hotel there is a fleet of about 8 zipcars, and of course there is public transportation all around. Plenty of restaurants and sights are within walking distance too. I had a great interaction with the front desk staff. I called the front desk a week ahead (on a Monday evening, Sept. 19) to let them know I was celebrating my anniversary. From the day I checked in a week later to my check-out they made sure that everything went smoothly. One of the staff (Luzie) even sent us a card for the special occasion. The amenities were also very nice. I stayed in the North tower which has been renovated so the furniture and the bathroom fixtures were clean and new. The water pressure was strong and did not have that "hotel water" smell/taste that I often find in other places. I was lucky to have an awesome view of the back bay and Charles river (as others' photos show). Overall, I couldn't ask for a better location, set of amenities, and helpful staff. They helped make my special occasion a big success. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive; convenient; poorly maintained bathroom”
Reviews.Author: OaklandJeff
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night while attending a conference at the adjoining Hynes Convention Center. Pros: - I got a corner room on an upper ("Starwood Preferred Guest") floor; the room was spacious and had a lovely view. - Fabulous location, attached to the convention center, Prudential Center shopping center, and near many restaurants - Au Bon Pain in the shopping center opens at 6 AM (at least on weekdays), so you can get a very inexpensive, fresh breakfast there. Cons: - Expensive: I paid nearly $300/night including numerous taxes - Expensive extras: Parking is $44/night. Internet is $10/night. Room service breakfast will set you back $30. - Bathroom was truly tiny, and in poor condition, with very old tile, peeling wallpaper, stained grout, etc. It really detracted from the otherwise-luxurious feel of the room. - Room was very dark at night. This was exacerbated by the fact that one one of the lamps was unplugged, and I couldn't reach the outlet behind the bed to plug it back in. The alarm clock was similarly unplugged. That's certainly something that should be noticed and fixed by a housekeeper.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: gabbygrrl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and for me, that's about all it had going for it. It's a standard business hotel connected to the convention center, but it does have an inside connection to the Pru shopping mall and is a short walk or T ride from Fenway. I stayed here with a certificate and I'm very glad that I didn't pay. Honestly, the rooms are so small and the property so depressing, I can't imagine making the decision to stay here with the Marriott and the Westin right across the street. As for the property, it's very blah. Beige, brown, worn out rugs and furnishings. It looks like it's been trampled by thousands and thousands of convention attendees. It needs to be updated and refreshed. The room was so tiny that only one bedside stand fits next to the King bed. The other part of the bed is just about up against the wall. We had a large entry way that was a waste of space. The bathroom was very, very small and almost impossible to maneuver in. The Front Desk was abrasive and distracted when we checked in. It was midnight and both agents seemed to be closing out their drawers or working on reports. They barely pointed us to the elevators. As a Starwood Preferred guest, I expect a lot from Sheraton properties and this one misses the mark. If attending a Sox game, I might check the rates here...but with hundreds of other options that are much better, I'd try a few dozen other places before even looking here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if the price is right.”
Reviews.Author: ncmc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 3 nights staying in the Sheraton Hotel, Boston. We booked this hotel (with the help from the wonderful folk of the Trip Advisor Boston forum!) on Hotwire for the amazing price of $112 per night (guaranteed king bed). It is described on Hotwire as the 3 and a half star in Back Bay/Copley area with a pool. It was well worth taking the risk as the price on the Sheratons website was $249 per night. We arrived at about 4.30 pm on the Saturday of Labor Day, there was quite a sizeable queue for check in, as it was induction weekend for a lot of the Boston area colleges and the line seemed to progress very slowly. When we finally got to check in about 30 minutes later, we were told that our room wasnâ€™t ready and to check back again in 45 minutes. I thought it was quite ridiculous that the rooms werenâ€™t ready at 5pm, we were tired after a long flight and just wanted to get showered and changed, but we had a drink at the bar and sure enough, our room was ready at 6.00. I had emailed ahead and asked for a renovated room with a view if possible. I didnâ€™t expect our request to be granted as we had paid such a low rate, but sure enough, we were given a renovated room in the North Tower on the 23rd floor with a huge picture window and a lovely view over the city. So well worth sending a quick email request! The room itself was nice; comfortable, clean and sleekly decorated very much like any other Sheraton I have been in. The room was nice and spacious, and because our room was disabled access, our bathroom was huge also. The prints of Boston landmarks on the wall were a nice touch. The storage space would be lacking for a longer stay, but it suited us fine as we were only there for 3 nights. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room and bathroom were very well lighted (a bugbear of mine is dark bathrooms in modern hotels). The room and bathroom were spotless and the housekeeping service was good. The Starbucks coffee and coffee maker was a nice touch, we used it every morning, but there wasnâ€™t adequate creamer left for two people, I kept having to squirrel away tubs of half and half in restaurants! There were a few problems though; the room had a large TV, yet the TV picture was the worst I have ever seen! It was impossible to watch anything with the â€˜snowâ€™ on screen. I would expect a hotel like the Sheraton to have perfect TV reception. The shower was big and had great water pressure, yet it made an unbelievable noise. If one was in bed while the other was in the shower, it made a noise like a drill been drilled into the wall. The air conditioning was awkwardly placed; it was facing away from the bed, so it was hard to feel the benefit of the cool air when lying in bed at night. The hotel has a swimming pool and gym. I didnâ€™t use the gym and only used the pool once, it was pretty underwhelming to be honest, nothing to write home about and is quite small. But nonetheless, it was a nice amenity to have. The sauna was not hot enough As previously mentioned, the hotel offers free wi-fi in the lobby, yet charges to use in the room. I find it staggering that a hotel, aimed at business convention delegates, would charge to use wi-fi in the room in this day and age. The hotel is in a great location, it is connected to the Prudential Centre, which has a â€˜Tâ€™ subway stop. Itâ€™s great not having to go outside to catch a subway, especially if it is very hot or raining as it was on our last day. There are lots of great restaurants on nearby Boylston Street and Copley Square is a pleasant 5 minute walk away. Boston is a great walking city and we were able to walk to Boston Common in 15 minutes or some of the historic sites in 30 minutes. We only really used the T to get to the North End and the USS Constitution. I would stay here again if the price was right; it is a nice hotel, just not worth the price they charge on their own website. It is too large and impersonal for me, if I was spending $249 per night on a hotel, I would prefer to stay in a more personal, boutique style establishment. Also, if I were returning, it would be my preference to stay in the Fanueil Hall area or North End area, but thatâ€™s just a personal preference. The Sheraton is a great choice if you get it at the right price, do check Hotwire, it is a huge hotel and they donâ€™t always fill their rooms so it is regularly available on Hotwire at a massive discount.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Sheraton & visiting Boston”
Reviews.Author: lettylake
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was wonderful, best thing was the location, right near the Tube with access to everywhere. The room was fine, the bedding was luxurious, we slept like angels. Everyone very helpful. There is a food court next door in the Prudential Center which was great for really economical meals. Our favorite restaurant was Charley's on Newbury Street. Attractions - first day walked most the Freedom Trail, we loved all the history. Recommend watching the 3 DVD series Liberty on the American Revolution, available thru Netflix. MFA Museum of Fine Arts wonderful, also enjoyed JFK museum & Boston Public Library (awesome building, great murals), last day we went to Bunker Hill & USS Constitution, both very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “There a few days for work!”
Reviews.Author: Texastravelnuts
Reviews.Content: Initially had a room right behind the elevator shaft, and the concierge, Ellen, was so kind to change this to a much nicer room! Much more quiet, and able to rest. The only one thing with the room was that the bathroom sink had a huge crack going thru it. The restaurant there was on the expensive side, so, we did not eat here. It was close to the convention center, for my meetings which was very convenient. And, if you like to eat, there is a huge mall, with many choices. One of the best placed we found to eat was the cheesecake factory - it was absolutely delicious! You have to pay to park here. The train station is convenient for seeing the sites, and, at reasonable rates. This is a very fast place location, a lot of activity around Hynes Convention Center, Prudential Center, Copley Mall. You can shop until you drop!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: yellowpony
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in August while visiting Boston for some sightseeing and a Red Sox game. The location was convenient to get to off the Mass Pike and once there everything was fine. Parking in the garage was expensive, but its Boston, so its to be expected... We didn't spend much time at the hotel, but we found the staff to be courteous and the room was updated and comfortable. Plenty of things to do near the hotel and only a short walk to Fenway Park! I'd recommend the Sheraton for a visit to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: kass_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at this hotel -had a really wonderful large room in the North tower with a great shower (this hotel has 2 towers). The gym is on the 5th floor between the 2 towers -great pool, sauna and gym -just what is needed after a days sightseeing. Its best to eat at the various places in the malls to which there is easy access from the hotel on the 2nd floor. Hotel restaurant is a little pricy but service is good. Many of the other central hotels also are linked from the Prudential centre malls so can also eat in other hotels -compare and contrast standards! I cannot fault the standards of service -great assistance from check in; to the advice of the concierge, room service staff; to help on check out. To get to and from the airport (Boston Logan) I used a shuttle firm recommended by the hotel -it is truly a easy way to access the airport and hassle free plus cheaper than a cab with a guaranteed pick up time. Would recommend the hotel to anyone especially to those wanting access to all amenities around Boston but also security as well.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Bed Linens”
Reviews.Author: tfssnow
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was a great location for our trip to the Red Sox Game. It was only a short walk. The Hotel has a lot of rooms and busy convention center. If you are looking for a quiet boutique Hotel this is not the spot. The pool is great, with a retractable roof. A Big Bonus was the indoor walk to the Prudential Building and all of its shops. The room was clean and very comfortable. The best part for me was the awesome bed, linens and pillows. We will definatly return.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton first class all the way!!!”
Reviews.Author: holdmchmp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 5 days in September and it was wonderful!!! Staff was very kind and helpful and attentive to all our needs. Our room was very clean and comfortable (a little small but nice!!). The shower was incredible -HUGE shower head that felt like you were under a waterfall!! We really had no complaints about our stay. There is an option the "Stay Green" and NOT have your linens changed everyday which we thought was a great concept for saving water and energy!! We chose not to have linens changed at all - only fresh towels every other day. (who washes thier own sheets more than twice a week anyway?) This hotel was close to everything. The trolley picked us up right outside our hotel and took us all over (we recommend doing this!!) If you love to shop the hotel is connected to a shopping mall - no going outside if the weather is crappy!!! Stay here and you wont be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and rates. Safe choice.”
Reviews.Author: KNara
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying here for a business trip. Central location and attached mall. Conference held in the facility. I paid around $200 a night which was fair. It's not a Ritz, but you get pretty good value. Starbucks inside and Wifi everywhere. Staff is efficient. Try to get room on higher floors. Also, I really appreciated the indoor pool and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: greenmonster18
Reviews.Content: Good location as it's connected to the Prudential Mall and close to Fenway Park which was one of the main reasons of our trip. Because it was a home game weekend, there were many Red Sox fans staying and there was a long line to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business stay”
Reviews.Author: WebdudeIA
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights in September for a conference at the hotel. The hotel staff was courteous and professional. They were helpful in recommending things to see within walking distance and food recommendations. The hotel was well maintained and the room was more than ample, in good working order, and clean. I used room service twice. Both times it took quite a while to have the phone answered. The first time, late on a Tuesday, it took over 30 minutes for food to arrive. The second time, very late on a Thursday, it took only 8 minutes for a snack to arrive. This is close to Fenway, Newbury street, and many shopping opportunities if you are interested.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for staying in Boston”
Reviews.Author: BarcelonaTourist
Reviews.Content: This summer we enjoyed a nice family stay at Sheraton Boston. The location in excellent, and the staff very well trained and kind. The rooms were very comfortable and I would highly recommend it for anyone staying in Boston either for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Raymond9858
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sheraton Hotel in Boston on 6-9 September 2011 on our first ever visit on the recommendation of our travel agent and after reading reviews. The Hotel is centrally located and attached to the Prudential Shopping Centre and only 5 mins walk from the designer shops and restaurants on Newbury Street.Our room was on the 20th floor of the west tower and a spacious room with 2 queen size beds and whilst the room was very big the bathroom was on the small side. The room was kept very clean and the staff on reception were very friendly and helpful. Free wi-fi was available throughout the Hotel for guests.The Hop On Hop Off Trolley Bus stops at the door which is excellent and the next stop is Fenway Park home of The Boston Red Sox and worth a visit even on a rainy day. Although it rained for 2 of our 4 days it did not keep us in during our visit and I would certainly recommend the Hotel to anyone thinking of staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive & Old”
Reviews.Author: madtowngrl
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel for work this week. The room we are in is crammed with old furniture so that the room seems very small. Disappointed that the negotiated almost 300 per night rate gives me a room with ugly flannel curtains, a tiny bathroom with peeling wallpaper, an industrial toilet and a shower that should have been replaced 10+ years ago. The drain looks rusty and the tiles are just beat up. The bed is rock hard. Wish there was a room fridge. Know they have them because our elevator stopped at a floor nobody had selected FULL of dorm fridges. (that was after almost tripping into a broken elevator hanging open bit not even with the floor level. The location works. Very close to the green line T stop at prudential and a nice mall with decent options for my non conference attending spouse. Can walk right into the mall from the hotel which is nice in the rain. The room does not meet my expectations for a Sheraton and I have stayed at hamptons that are nicer. Super disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: pc0l224
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip back in early july for sep 16-20 on Priceline after SPG(Starwood Preferred Guest Services),was either unwilling/unable to provide me with any specials.I sent an Email to Colleen at Boston Sheraton to explain my misfortune,but did not get a reply.The ratings on the Boston Sheraton ranged from a great experience to not so great dirty rooms.After not knowing what to expect from this hotel,my wife and I were pleasantly surprised at how spacious and clean the lobby was.Our room,although standard was clean, roomy,and up to date.The staff at the Sheraton were courteous,accommodating,and helpfull in planning our activities.I rated this hotel four stars,as there was little if anything to complain about.For those planning a trip to Boston,you cant go wrong with the Sheraton.It is connected to a shopping ctr.,restaurants,and the Subway(the T as it is called is the only way to get around Boston.)Fenway Park is only a 10 min walk,as are shops and restaurants.Have fun,we did.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: sdbh
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using SPG Cash and Points and was thinking it would be just an okay hotel since I was hoping for a W or Westin. All that was quickly changed when we arrived and had to return the rental car, the gentlemen outside grab our bags and put them inside and directed us to a downtown location that we could return the car so we wouldn't have to travel to the airport...wow did that save time. A short walk back to the hotel, well it would have been short had we not stopped to get a drink on Boylston St, and we checked in. Being a gold member I was surprised to see we were upgraded to a suite, usually doesn't happen when using points, and it was amazing! The room had a sitting area, dining room table, separate bedroom and a great walk in closet. The location of the hotel was perfect, a block to the T, a couple blocks to Boylston St, and a nice walk to Fenway if you want to watch the Sox lose. Overall a great hotel and wished we could have stayed longer and used the pool, but sometimes work calls!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, well placed”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterDaisy
Reviews.Content: Large, clean and convenient and we found this a good location fo our first trip to Boston. Free wifi and computer in reception and Starbucks in the hotel. Beds very comfortable and rooms well sized. Located at the edge of an indoor shopping centre and next door to the Cheescake factory. Trolley tours stop outside, the bus to Harvard is a 5 minute way away and the T stop is even nearer. A nice walk to the common.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: REDMOON_8
Reviews.Content: The Boston Sheraton is walking distance to many great attractions, such as Fenway Park, Newbury Street, Boston Commons... we walked an hour to Harvard Square in Cambridge, in September, and the weather was fine! The hotel lobby connects to a great variety of restaurants and boutiques and you might spend a whole day at the mall next door! The rooms were quiet and the bed nice, though, we would have liked a bigger bathroom. There was no safe in the room either, but that's okay. There was instant Starbucks coffee in the room every morning! Plus, the internet service in the lobby was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tami94118
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what the other reviewers want in a hotel, but the Sheraton was really very nice. The location is awesome, there is so much to do in the area and there is a T stop right outside. The hotel room was large and we had a corner room with lots of windows. The bed was very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and we really had no complaints. Again, the location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Leitrim59
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 3 nights in Sheraton on first ever visit to Boston. Couldn't believe how expensive the hotels were in the city , but got a very good rate through Hotwire. Hotel is well situated , being only a few minutes walk to Boylston St , with its many bars/restaurants and the popular shopping area of Newbury St . The room in North Tower was small but adequate , with coffee making facility , hairdryer and safe. The bathroom was very small , but bed was extremely comfortable , one of the nicest i've ever slept in . The hotel has nice pool and workout area on 5th floor and also outdoor area adjacent to pool with sun loungers . Complimentary internet access is available in foyer. No complaints about hotel and very good value for price we paid , but not for price that hotel were quoting on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: fl_mermaid
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Boston Hotel for three nights at the beginning of August, 2011. Located in Back Bay, the Sheraton is an easy walk to Fenway Park, which is why we chose it. But there is also an Old Town Trolley stop literally in front of the hotel, and we used the trolley as a way to get around town during the day, since you can "hop on and hop off." Newbury Street is two blocks away, with its many shops and restaurants. Boston Common is a nice walk also. In my opinion, the location could not be any better. Regarding the hotel itself--our room was on the 26th floor and included bottled water each day. We had a king room and it was nice-sized. The decor was nice, it had a large, flat-screened TV, and a coffee maker in the room. The bathroom was clean and adequately sized as well. Having a Starbucks in the hotel was awesome! I utilized it day I was there. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, but after our Red Sox game we ate dinner at the hotel bar. We found the prices extremely expensive in the bar, for a Sheraton. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel- nice pool”
Reviews.Author: luischable
Reviews.Content: Sheraton is in a good location near shops and transport. Rooms were very tired looking but the beds and pillows were fine. Hotel is divided into two towers, the South has not been remodeled and the North has but with weird blinds that mean anyone from the South tower can see everything so zero privacy. Pool is very nice and the fitness rooms looked great. Stayed here as Boston seemed full with conferences but would not return if I had a choice. So many better options.

Reviews.Title: “Manages to underwhelm at every opportunity”
Reviews.Author: PrivatePit
Reviews.Content: Nothing that was so bad you wanted to complain, and nothing so good I want to mention it here. Others have talked about the small bathrooms, and the lack of water pressure in the shower. All true. This is a huge bed factory, and conference centre. I was there for a conference and it was very easy to fally out of bed into a lift and straight to the conference. The food in the bar was pretty basic - and whilst not cheap was well presented and served quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and services.”
Reviews.Author: CJs_Squad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a jr suite and it was fabulous. Newly renovated. A big living room and separte bedroom. The bed was super comfortable. There was Starbucks coffee in your room if you wanted to make it. We were on the 18th floor and had a great view of the river. We could even see Fenway Park. The rooms had real shades that kept it nice and dark in the morning. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is attached to a shopping mall (Prudential Center) that is huge. You can also get to the subway without having to go outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: anettski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton in Boston in August.This is the perfect location to stay. Close to Fenway Park-walkable and pretty much walkable to everywhere we wanted to go. Lots of great restaurants and pubs nearby. Beautiful room,great pool that has a roof that opens so it feels like you are outside.We got our room on hotwire for 105.00 a night so it was such a good value for us. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a central location for sightseeing. We did the tour of Cape Cod and tour of the Eastern Coast,both were outstanding. Best place to have lobster were on these tours.They take you some nice little towns with great restaurants that are quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice well appointed room”
Reviews.Author: Globalambition
Reviews.Content: I recenty stayed here for five nights attending a conference. I had a room in North tower on 21st floor. Room was very fresh - looks recently redone. Bedding was a luxury, loverly comforters and four full soft pillows per bed. Starbucks coffee maker and windows the entire length of the room overlooking the city. Bathroom well appointed with loverly shower curtain and rain showerhead, nice bath product and fluffy towels. Room was always cleaned well. Staff very pleasant. Computer stations where you could print boarding pass for free were readily available. Enjoyed the bright orange club chair with lumbar pillow for my sore back (after standing at conference most of the day). The pool is loverly with a roof than retract and give you views of a sparkling city. ' One downside - A card on your desk offering you $5.00 credit if you forgo cleaning your room. I thought that this was a bit cheesy!! Really, I would have appreciated a nice martini at your bar and you would have encouraged interaction of business clients in your lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: drcettie
Reviews.Content: As part of the Prudential Center, you will never have to walk outside to get to the mall, several very good restaurants, or even the Convention Center. It's a short, reasonable walk to Fenway Park, where a very drunk scalper got us some very good seats. OK, the Bosox were playing Kansas City, so it wasn't a very big game, but it's still Fenway! The streets around the hotel are loaded with excellent retail - including a humongous Apple store. The hotel, itself, was what you would expect from a Sheraton in Boston. Smallish rooms, clean and well-appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Sharons_10
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in the Sheraton Boston hotel. The hotel location is good, close to the subway and to many restaurants. The room is very big and comfortable and the bed is just great, it's huge and very comfortable. The lobby is good, with many public areas and free Wi-Fi and even computers for the guests use. The only problem we had with this hotel is that the Wi-Fi in the room is not for free, and cost about $10.00 per day. Other than that â€“ we had a wonderful time there.

Reviews.Title: “Visually delightful, functionally incomplete”
Reviews.Author: grndhog2259
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Boston in Sept 2011 while attending a conference. The hotel was perfectly located as it is an easy walk to the Hynes Convention Center and the Prudential Center as well as within walking distance to Fenway. I was given a handicapped accessible room even though it was not requested nor needed. And after staying in the room, I am not so sure that if I was wheelchair bound, it would have been accessible. The room is visually appealling but a little cramped. The closet in the room was very small and I could barely fit my carry-on suitcase into it. The top shelf inside the closet might have had a 6 in clearance. But at least they had very nice wooden hangers. The chair in the room faced the bed and had to be pulled out in order to watch tv. The bathroom was very spacious and quite attractive with wooden shelves and a granite counter top. The toilet was right next to the counter and the toilet paper roll was located on the wall so that one had to twist completely around to reach it. I nearly threw my back out and ended up using the spare roll that was on the counter. The only towel bar in the bath is located at the end of the bathtub about 6-8 feet away from the counter and the towels are located under the counter. Having forgotten to grab a towel BEFORE I jumped into the shower that counter might as well been down the hall. The lighting in the bathroom is poor, especially if you are trying to put on make-up with eyes that don't see as well as they once did. The mirror on the counter was rather interesting in that it could swivle in any direction, but without a lightsource it was useless. Since this was a handicap accessible room the controls for the shower were at the opposite end of the tub from the faucet. But if someone under 5'-7" needs to adjust the showerhead (which is the sunflower style) good luck in reaching it. This particular hotel has taken on a new meaning when it comes to conservation. Nearly every other hotel I have stayed in offers the option to forego changing the linens/towels on a daily basis. I am fine with that. This hotel takes it a step further.... no service at all!! For a $5 dollar voucher to their restuarants (which includes a Starbucks), not only did they not change the sheets/towels, they did not make the bed or even bother to empty the trash. There is free wi-fi in the lobby with several computer terminal available for guests. But getting internet service in your room will cost you an extra $10 per day. For the price of the room it should have been included.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: tartantravels
Reviews.Content: After considering the Westin, we found this location was offering a great deal over Labor Day weekend and the location looked to be convenient. We hadn't stayed at a Sheraton in a while, but were so happily surprised with the overall quality of this hotel, the accommodations and cleanliness, and the awesome location. We could walk to Newbury and the T; it was in the heart of everything. The service was great, the lobby was inviting and the rooftop pool was a plus. Absolutely will stay here next time we come to Boston. This hotel has changed our perception about Sheratons!

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: Bikemano
Reviews.Content: Sheraton has upgraded many of it's hotels,including the Boston Sheraton. The rooms are now quite luxurious with many conveniences, especially the shelves in the bath room --a rarity for hotel rooms. There are some tradeoffs. The closet in our room was very small and the sliding doors made access difficult. The shower worked well, except that the shower floor was slippery. The staff is very well trained, friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a quiet corner of the city across from the Christian Science Center. It is very close to two T stops, restaurants and the mall. We have stayed here three times. fences

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable, excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: BLB100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 7-yr-old daughter. Our room was very clean and well decorated. The bathrooms were recently renovated, a little small, but nice with granite countertop. The pool was great, and not icy cold like some hotel pools. Our biggest surprise was the quality of food in the restaurants. We were pleasantly surprised. We found the staff to be friendly and quite helpful. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad beginning but got better.”
Reviews.Author: mxtravelingirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Boston last April for 3 nights. I got this hotel through Hotwire. We had a bad start but a good ending. We arrived late to the hotel and were given a double room as I needed. When we arrived to the room it was a little small but nice. After a few minutes I started to realize that our clothes and our bags had animal hair all over. I discovered that there was pet hair, I assume it was dog hair, all over the carpet! I immediately called the front desk but I was told that no more double rooms were available and we are a family of 4. No way I was going to stay in that room. The first option I got was to send someone to vaccum the room. It was 11 pm, my kids were about to sleep, already in their pajamas, and I wasn't going to have someone clean a room that was already supposed to be clean. So then I was told that we could move to the other tower for only one night because that tower was going to be shut down for maintenance and I was going to get another room the next day and a one night credit. So we had to move to the other tower and it was fine and the room was in fact bigger. The next day I was allowed to keep the bags in the same room and I adviced that we werenÂ´t coming back again until late night. When we returned again there were no double rooms available! I was very upset but finally after some calls we were upgraded to a Club Level double room. So finally we stayed 2 more nights with no problems at all. But other than this problem we had at the beginning, we had a very good stay. The rooms like I said are not very big, but are comfy, clean and well maintained. The location is perfect because it's at Prudential Center and there are stores, restaurants and a metro station right there, so it was very easy to move around the city. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cleantravelsnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend over 4th of July weekend. It has an excellent location! We walked everywhere with the exception of when we visited Harvard and when we took a train back after we finished the Freedom Trail. Everyone at the hotel was very pleasant to work with. The rooms were clean and new, and we had a fantastic view of the river. I would definitely stay here again. One tip? The only water for the fitness center is by the weights and not in the actual cardio room. It's a small thing, but it would be nice not to have to walk several rooms away to have a cup of water during my workout.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but I would like to use the free internet in my room, thanks...”
Reviews.Author: Celia D
Reviews.Content: Very very nice hotel. Comfortable beds, very clean....but kind of a rip-off when you're trying to save $$. We got this room through Priceline at a great rate. It was very close to Fenway Park, and easy access to the subway station. Connected to the Prudential Shops (which were very expensive---we mainly used the food court!). The weirdest thing was that you had to PAY to use the internet in your room, but you could easily go down to the lobby with your laptop and use the service for free. That was a bit annoying!! I loved that there was a Starbucks in the lobby as well. Parking was $40 a day, which is another total rip-off, so we parked across the street at the Haynes parking garage for half that. The staff was very friendly, but when we asked to use the luggage cart on our own, we were refused. That was a bit pushy. We had a lot of stuff and had been traveling for 2 weeks. We had our unpack and pack routine down to an art by that point, and we really just wanted to do it by ourselves, but instead we had to tip someone after bringing up our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: Eurotripper
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at this hotel to explore Boston. The hotel is conveniently not only attached to the Prudential Center but has access to Newbury Street (shopping and restaurants) and Boylston Street (restaurants) as well as walkable to Fenway Park and Kenmore Square. The hotel is a large conference facility and there are bustling crowds in the lobby continuoiusly. There is a Starbucks in the lobby and Gues Computers. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was quite standard but the location, service and conveneince is unmatched for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Dutchman9
Reviews.Content: I traveled with wife and small infant for a weekend break. We had "won" the hotel through a priceline bid. The location is convenient just off Boylston St with restaurants and stores. Because we traveled with a 4 month old - we were given a large corner suite with no adjacent guests who could be disturbed by late night crying. The hotel also provided a crib for the baby in the room. I would definitely book this hotel again when staying in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: cbrMaine
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, Boston is pricey, but thankfully we had points through Starwood and stayed here for free over Labor Day weekend. Parking is costly but was offset by the fact that we weren't paying for the hotel. The hotel is located in a great spot attached to the Mall with lots of dining options and within walking distance to Fenway. In the lobby there is a bar and a Starbucks (that had an extremely long line in the morning) but you could easily walk elsewhere for a cup of coffee and a bite to eat. My favorite feature is the swimming pool with a retractable roof and area to catch some rays (you can get food and beverage service here from room service but there is no poolside bar). The rooms are adequately sized, although the bathrooms aren't large by any measure. But it is clean, the beds are comfortable and overall it is a nice place to stay when visiting the city. Just be sure to call for valet service a half hour before you plan to leave because it definitely takes that long.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Great Location. I recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Izel17
Reviews.Content: First off, I got an awesome deal on Hotwire for this hotel. The staff was very friendly & helpful. I was in a room with 2 double beds. It was very spacious & comfortable. What I was most impressed by was the pool & fitness facilities. There is a retractable roof over the pool so it can be opened or closed depending on the weather. Plus they have lounge chairs in a little courtyard so you can soak up the sun there if you so desire. What truly won me over was the location. It was connected to the Prudential Tower. There are tons of fancy shops & restaurants. Plus there are pathways that connect you to 2 other hotels with additional restaurants & shops. Additionally there is a T stop right inside the Prudential Tower and plenty of Boston attractions are only a short T ride away. Lastly, there are plenty of restaurants, bars and shopping within walking distance of the hotel. All in all, itâ€™s a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre At Best”
Reviews.Author: johnb6597
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 7 nights for a business conference. Stayed in a corner room on the 18th Floor of the South Tower. Living area is large and comfortable, but the bathroom is so small you'd think they designed it for little children...barely enough room to breathe in there. Excellent city views from two different windows, since it was a corner room. Everything looked good until we started to settle down for the evening. The showerhead was so corroded from long use that water pressure was nearly non-existent. Even worse, there was hair on the bathroom ceiling and the shower walls...and I don't mean a few...I stopped counting after 7. Also, paint is peeling off the ceiling in the shower, there are large stained cracks in the sink, and there were 3 inches of old water still in the ice bucket from some previous occupant. Stopped by the Front Desk on our way out to dinner to point out these problems and requested they be corrected while we were out. When we returned, Housekeeping had made an attempt to clean the hair off the bathroom ceiling and walls and Maintenance had replaced the showerhead, but they left a huge 13" x 17" puddle of water right in the middle of the bathroom floor. The ice bucket had not been emptied. I took care of the puddle and the ice bucket myself, then used cleaned towels to wipe down the bathroom ceiling and walls. If this were a Motel 8, I would expect these things, but for $230 a night at a downtown Boston hotel owned by Sheraton, I was very disappointed. In the future, when business requires me to travel to Boston, I won't be staying here again. Maybe the Marriott at Copley is a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room in a good location. Central to most routes.”
Reviews.Author: beckya82
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton from the 22nd august 2011- 27 august 2011. When we arrived check. In was quick, explained that we had requested a fridge to store my two yr olds night time mlk and had asked for a king size bed and cot. The receptionist immediatley upgraded us to an executive suite at no extra cost. We were on the end of a corrider which suited us fine due to our loud two yr old. The old town trolleys stop outside the Sheraton and I would recommend this chain of hotels to anyone. Conceirge desk was a fantastic help.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall with One Sour Note”
Reviews.Author: LSmithTO
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the Sheraton Boston for 3 nights. The location is great - attached to the Prudential Center with tons of shopping and restaurants including the Cheesecake Factory and P.F. Chang's. The room was standard, small but clean and the linens were very nice. Pillows were not firm enough for us. The pool was large and my kids really liked it. The hotel wanted $89 a night to park our car with a roof top carrier. We ended up parking it across the street for $30 a night. Service was mostly great but with one bad incident that left a permanent bad taste in our mouths. When we arrived, the car port was absolutely swarming with cars and people. There was nobody to help us with our luggage. My husband was checking in so I hauled all of our luggage out of the car and proceeded to lug it all inside with the help of my kids. We managed to get all of our belongings into the lobby and again looked around for a porter. There were none to be found and my husband had to go move the car. I finally located a luggage cart and loaded up. I made it to the elevator when a porter/valet (approx. 50 - 60 years old) ran up to me and grabbed the cart and told me that he would take it up to my floor for me. I said no thank you as I had managed this far with no help and would return it after I was done. He became very angry (talking through gritted teeth) and told me that I was not allowed to take it up and that it was LAW at the Sheraton "since 1965" that guests were not allowed to take luggage carts. I informed him that I often took my own luggage to my room with a cart to which he responded by shoving hard the luggage cart toward me and hissing "take it" and then stormed away. I was mortified and my kids were horrified. I was really upset that he tried to intimidate me, especially in front of my children. As furious as we were, we never did get to speak to the manager about this as we had to be somewhere asap and again the next day. Because of this incident I will not be staying here anytime soon. There are too many hotels in which to chose.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick613
Reviews.Content: Amazing location! The rooms were great, the staff was so friendly. I was in Boston for 4 nights and could not have picked a better hotel. We walked to Fenway Park, the subway station in a block away, the hotel is connected to a great mall, the trolley tour picks up right in front and you can walk everywhere! Lisa at the concierge desk made our stay special by answering all our questions and accommodating all of our requests!

Reviews.Title: “Massive Hotel with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DCbiztraveler_11
Reviews.Content: I was recently "stranded" at the Sheraton Boston during Hurricane Irene... I use "stranded" lightly as you couldn't tell anything was different unless you went outside. The staff were all very prepared, from the moment I checked in they started giving me tips and hints of how to better make my time go. The room was a double double on the 7th floor of the north tower. It was recently renovated, but the management seemed to have forgotten the bathroom. The beds were fantastic, comfortable and the TV was great. The toilet was weak and the bathroom had no fan. My other complaint is that the ice bucket was large enough to hold ice for two glasses of water - that's just not enough. The staff was great, every request was granted immediately and without hesitation. The concierge recommended a great seafood place across the street from the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Duke_Fairfax
Reviews.Content: Place is clean, rooms are nice. We had a junior suite which was perfect as our 2yr goes to sleep early, so we were able to slide the bdrm doors closed and still watch tv in the other room. Good location to fenway, BU, newbury st. Front desk staff was great. Lobby is nice, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Awesome Staff, Attractive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pdmboston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took some of my family from London to Boston for a night. This hotel was in the perfect location for our trip. We were very pleased to find that the Sheraton Hotel exceeded all our expectations. The location is superb, the rooms are well equipped and very attractive. The lobby is massive and has excellent amenities. There are game tables, plenty of free to use computers for guests, and plenty of places to grab coffee. They even let you print from computers for free! This came in very handy for us. The only negative of our stay was that our A/C unit was not functioning. The hotel facilities staff was able to get it fixed within a half hour, which was great! The hotel is convenient to the best of Boston. Newbury Street and all it's shopping and dining is located a short walk away. The boston common and theatre district are also not far. There is a T stop in the Prudential Center Mall, which is connected to the hotel. This helped out a lot as we did a lot of walking around town and were too tired to walk back at the end of night. One tip: Parking is very expensive, but there are ways to save money. Do a google search for "Prudential Center Parking Coupon" and you should be able to find coupons for the attached garage. We saved $14 by doing this ($25 instead of $39). Best of all the garage is right downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oxfordians_13
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 night at the hotel, it should have been 5, but we got delayed in New York by Hurricane Irene! Hotel is delightful, well appointed and our twin family room was quite spacious. There is a coffee maker in the room and Starbucks in the lobby. The hotel has internal access to the Prudential centre which has upmarket shopping, a food court and plenty of restaurants. We struggled to find a 7-11 type store to buy water and snacks however. The hotel is well placed for sight seeing, using the subway and some places can be accessed on foot eg Trinity Church and Newbury Street which is full of restaurants and shops. Fenway Park is also very close. Would recommend taking the Duck or a trolley tour of some sort to help with orientation. We took an excellent tour of Harvard from Harvard square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,great location,comfy bed,no fridge”
Reviews.Author: Smaguire1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel at the end of aug. Hotel is in a perfect location close to all,tour trolley's,malls,food courts and all important newbry street! Only thing is no fridge it would have been nice to bring bottles of water back and for it to be kept cool instead of gettin ice but other than that it was lovely,bed was super comfy by the way!!

Reviews.Title: “incredible hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: agac
Reviews.Content: We were provided a room on the 2nd last floor of the south tower in the preferred guest floor even though we are not members. check in was very quick and easy. The room had a beautiful view of boston. The room was very clean and large. The beds were vey comfortable and the room quite. The bathroom is spacious. The staff is very friendly. The pool is massive, with the ceiling opening and closing depending on the weather. The fitness centre has excellent and new equipment, the only issue being that the weight machines are in the north tower, and the ellipticals and treadmills in the south tower. The lobby has plenty of computers to use. the hotel is attached to the mall, with a food court. The location could not be any better. Would recomend hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: Barb1058
Reviews.Content: This hotel fit our needs perfectly on a recent trip to Boston. It's one block from beautiful Newberry Street; connected to the Convention Center (so you can walk quite a ways in doors if it's raining); has plenty of restaurants all around (from high end to fast food) as well as a Trader Joes just a block away; 15 min from Fenway on foot; 5 min to the "T"....The staff is unusually helpful! I think you could walk to just about anywhere you'd want to be in Boston w/in 20minutes and otherwise jump on the "T". Best service I"ve ever had anywhere. The lobby is great-free internet-big and open w/a Starbucks. The only thing I wish was different is the bathroom in the room could have been a bit bigger. But really that's not a deal breaker! The beds/bedding were very comfortable. Four of us in the room and we didn't feel squished so that's good!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: censor46
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful and the staff were helpful and curtious. Boston Sheraton is in a great location with lot's of great restaurants within walking distance. The view from our room was breathtaking. Bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynWillow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite the night before going to a red sox game. Accommodations were small but very comfortable and immaculate. Location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JLAA
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at the Sheraton with our four kids, ages 7, 5, and 3 (twins). We booked the Junior Suite since it was cheaper than having to book two connecting rooms for the six of us. The room was great, very clean, and had enough room for all of us. There was a sleeper sofa in the living room area and sliding doors to separate the bedroom area. If I had to complain, it would be the size of the bathroom for this suite. Tiny is an understatement. BUT, what it lacked in size it made up for in cleanliness. Probably one of the cleanest hotel bathrooms I have ever been in It served its purpose. The kids loved the hotel pool. Service in the hotel was great, no issues. The fact that the Sheraton is attached to the Prudential Center mall makes it the best for location. Anything you may want or need is just a few steps out of the elevator. We were able to walk to a bowling alley directly across the street from the lobby, which again, the kids loved (please note that the bowling alley is 21 and over after 6pm so if you plan to bowl with kids make sure it's before then) and we walked to Fenway too. Overall this is a great, clean hotel in a GREAT location. Highly recommend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: SatanicSurferz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice, once for business and once for vacation... and I really like it! I had a large king room, very clean and quiet, at a higher floor with a good view. Beds and pillows are very comfortable and make for a good night sleep. Hotel is connected to the Prudential Center which has many boutiques and restaurants. You can walk to many attractions, including Fenway Park, and metro stations are nearby. Hotel is located in Back Bay which is one of the most beautiful neighbourhood in Boston. Check in/Check out went smoothly, but staff was just OK... what you usually expect at big chain hotels. Everything just seems impersonal. I usually don't stay in large hotels like this, but I managed to find a rate of 140$/night which I thought was very good for Boston. Other rundown hotels in the area was more expensive. The first time I went though, it was 199$/night (for business, room was bigger, with a nicer view and a mini-fridge). And sometimes it can go up to 300$/night depending of the season. There is valet parking at 42$/night which I thought was very expensive! So, if the price is right, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone... but I would'nt pay 300$/night for it (I would'nt pay this rate for any hotel at all!). I had a good time at this hotel and would go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing though good location.”
Reviews.Author: JacBanf
Reviews.Content: On arrival was impressed with lobby area, thought every where would be the same, soon disappointed. Long line to check in. Eventually got to room, 6th floor overlooking concrete. Room really really small all 4 just fitted in. Returned to reception, told suites available but not much bigger and only a sofa bed, extra $50 a night. We were 4 people, 2 adults and a14 and 16 year old so stuck with 1st room. Seemed a lot to pay for not much more space and only a sofa bed.Luckily out most of the time. Stayed for 4 nights, 3 of the nights room only had towels for 3 people. Had to keep ringing for extra. When I asked why this was I was told to just ring if we needed more. As I pointed out I should not have to !! Breakfast in hotel $22 each but had offer on which would have cost $19 each.Thought that was expensive. Ate breakfast at local restaurants for about $6-7 each. Good Starbucks in lobby. Used hotel bar for meal one night quite nice, some friendly staff some not so. Concierge very helpful. On departure day bags left with staff free of charge. Very good system used. Placed on a ticketed trolley and you are given a ticket to use when you collect. Trolley was then wheeled out to taxi when we left. Good location. through lobby up an elevator and you are in a shopping centre, good if it was raining. Old Trolley bus tours stop right outside hotel. Underground ( T ) 2 mins walk. Would I stay here again, probably not. To big and unfriendly for my liking and rooms far to small for a family room. Not what I would expect from a Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: jlkkshic
Reviews.Content: Had a room on the top floor in the North Tower. Excellent view. The room was very comfortable. From check- in to check- out, everything was great. Staff was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ann2010Ca
Reviews.Content: Our room had a great view of the Charles River. The hotel is right next to the convention center and the Prudential center which has restaurants and shopping.
