Copley Square is less than a 5 minute walk. Fenway Park is nearby (15 minute walk). The Freedom Trail starts in the Boston Common which is roughly a 10-15 minute walk. We took the T (public transit subway) to the airport from the hotel: catch the T (subway) at the Prudential Station, take the green line to Gov't Center, transfer to the blue line to Wonderland, get off at the Airport station and catch a free airport shuttle (only $2 per a person and the subway was easy to use). Great location, clean rooms. Only downside, free internet is only available in the lobby of the hotel. Also, Atlantic Fish located on Boylston Street (2-3 blocks from hotel) has amazing seafood!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: killbot2000
Reviews.Content: Located in the centre of Boston, it was a bit on the expensive side for me even with the conversion into euro I found it a bit expensive but still enjoyed it, the beds are really comfortable we both commented on this on our stay, breakfast wasn't included in our price. The hotel porter looked after our bags free of charge on the day we checked out so we cud go see a ball game. the hotel is connected to a shopping mall filled with loads of shops and places to eat. Would I stay again I think so yes

Reviews.Title: “Security may be an issue”
Reviews.Author: pamela c
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel on the night of 5th August after a flight from the UK. We were given a room in the south tower on the 16th floor. After taking all the luggage up, we entered the room with our keycard, only to discover the room already occupied !!! Even an open handbag on the desk (luckily we are honest people). Another trek to reception, joining another queue, then off to the north tower 11th floor. We were worried for our 3 day stay that this hotel was insecure. Apart from that it was clean, convenient and had helpful staff. Would I stay again maybe. Travelled on to the Sheraton, Portsmouth for another 3 nights, safe and secure there. Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: baha23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for almost a week - never had a problem with noise or cleanliness. The hotel staff was pleasant and the maid was very friendly. The hotel is in a great location to see Boston - you can walk to Fenway (yes, there are a lot of Red Sox fans - you're in Boston), hop a bus or trolley right in front of the hotel or walk to the T station down the street. There are plenty of restaurants and shops within walking distance. There is a Starbucks in the lobby for the morning coffee and a nice little bar with friendly bartenders for a nightcap. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION, AVERAGE ROOMS, AVERAGE SERVICE.”
Reviews.Author: review4
Reviews.Content: We went on a 2 week vacation to Boston and wanted to stay at a central location since we were going to visit all the local attractions.This Sheraton hotel in Boston is located perfectly because you can walk to Fenway Park; you have access to a mall from the 2nd floor of the hotel; you can walk to take boat tours; etc., etc. Everything is easily accessible from this hotel. But, we found out that there are several other similar hotels located in the same area, and some of them might be a little less expensive.... so we might stay somewhere else next time. Our room was average/comfortable, but the bathroom was really small! We were on the 12th floor. We did get the WORST view we have ever gotten from any hotel! It was this brown structure, we found out it was the back wall of the mall. For an expensive hotel we were surprised that the coffee maker had one creamer and one sugar and there was no mini bar! Not the best Sheraton we have stayed at. This hotel is REALLY busy all the time. Because of this, there are people in the lobby and in the entrance at all times! Several times the doorman was not able to get us a taxi because he would be overwhelmed with other guests. Luckily there are always taxis parked a block away, so we could just walk and flag them down ourselves. They have good room service and the concierge is very helpful. Their bar is well stocked and they have good service. Overall, it was a very good experience and we would stay at this hotel again. **********************************************************************************************

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably good”
Reviews.Author: schistosomiasis
Reviews.Content: Staying here for conference. On discount rate but got higher floor with river views, a big plus (probably due to my SPG status). Check in smooth , friendly employees. Room is clean and nicely furnished, although with lights out and curtain closed this could be a Sheraton anywhere. Comfy beds. Rooms a bit on smallish side, no light for desk (are you listening Sheraton?) Big plus is it's convenient for my conference. Would stay here again on the right rate if only for location, was at westin waterfront last year for a conference which is a much nicer, newer hotel, but got room with no view and the location of the westin is more isolated. Take T from airport to hynes convention center, under 30 minutes. Adjacent to shopping center.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Marcel D
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to be nicely welcomed and because no more rooms with 2 beds available, they offered graciously a suite with a beautiful view on the river. All staff have been professionnals and very attentive to our needs. Travelling with a teenager has never been so easy! Thanks to the staff and Starwood Hotels ! The hotel is perfectly located downtown near most of the common attractions. Will be back there if travelling to Boston again. Marcel Dumont, QuÃ©bec City, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Crummy Cancellation Policy”
Reviews.Author: bigmikenyc1
Reviews.Content: Don't count on getting your money back -- even if you have to cancel well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Red Sox Games”
Reviews.Author: locokirky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Boston Hotel with my wife and brother in law because of its great location to Fenway park. Its about a mile walk to the park which is great for a younger crowd to get a chance to see some of Boston's back bay area. The hotel itself was nice, the rooms though small were clean and the beds comfortable. The room had a nice view of the older section of the city. One very positive note is that it is connected to a strip mall which includes restaurants such as Legal Seafood which is a very good choice and also PF Changs, among others. Also there were many shops included. The staff was friendly and check in was average. A good choice it seems for business meetings and lectures. There were many pubs and clubs along the way including McGreevys which is the oldest sports bar in the USA. A must stop for baseball fans as it included a lot of memorabilia of the Red Sox and the old Boston Braves. In conclusion, I felt it was a nice hotel. I still love this city!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: GiovannaHabsFan
Reviews.Content: Back to Boston it was, this time not to celebrate the Bruins Stanley Cup victory (which just for the record I did not willingly celebrate!) But it was a return to a beautiful city we just love. Staying at the Sheraton (for the second time) is always a good bet. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable, the view we had from the 16th floor was amazing. Dogs are welcomed here at this hotel which was not clearly indicated on their website when we were looking to book. Which we were happy about, we have a 15pound malti-poo who is very well behaved and doesn't bark. The lovely lady who would clean our room would take the time to pet him the one time we left him behind. Traveling with the dog posed somewhat of a challenge. Since my parents have never been to Boston we decided to do one of their trolley bus tours, hop on hop off. The only one that allowed us to bring the dog with us ("for medical reasons") was the trolley bus green and yellow. That is the best one anyway, it is the only trolley that goes to Harvard University. The Science Museum I recommend if you have children, it is interactive and lots of fun. I love walking down Newburry Street. Although, according to the trolley bus tour guys there's cheaper shopping else where ! We ate at Cheers, (it was one of my dad's favorite shows) At first we thought tourist trap, but we really enjoyed it, and the food was actually quite good. My mom and I had a 'coaches' drink, lots of rum and very yummy! for a couple of extra bucks we got to keep the glass! I enjoyed walking through Harvard, I have been to Boston many, many times and this was the first time that I actually got to see Harvard. Boston is one of those cities you just walk and enjoy. It is clean, surrounded by big trees, the people are nice (even when they found out I'm a Habs fan, which I made sure they new after they served my food!!) It's wonderful city to visit. But like any city, location is key and the Sheraton is well located to walk around a better part of the city. And it's CLEAN, did I mention there's a Starbucks in the lobby!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great location, but no character”
Reviews.Author: Anna L
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton hotel is perfectly located. Restaurants, shops, tourist attractions. They are all nearby. Our room was on the 14th floor and looked clean, modern and fresh. View across the city and hotel pool. What disturbed us were the very noisy waterlines/plumbings. All day and night long. Last year we were on a higher floor in the other tower and the noise was a lot less. Most of the TV channels were horrible to view because of the poor transmission. What bottered us most was the staff at check in/out: not impolite, but cold, careless, uninterested. They really must hate their job or just don't care. The Sheraton wants us to rediscover Sheraton, but should start with their own front desk staff first. It would make a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: melker22
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in Prudential Center next to Hynes Convention Center (you don't even have to go outside). The room felt new, clean, spacious with a magnificent view over Boston. Spectacular nighttime vista. Airconditioning system easy to regulate, bathroom modern and fresh, comfortable beds. Would come again and again. Hotel has a Starbucks so you don't have to overspend for breakfast in the restaurant. The attached mall has tons of places to eat, and lots of tempting places to shop. The complex has a beautiful enclosed garden courtyard to relax in. In the lobby there are lots of computers for guest use so you don't have to pay the room wireless extra fee. My only real complaint is that we were given valet parking as though there was no option and it was $44 a night - and on top of that we were charged an additional $14 because we picked the car up late. We arrived at 6 pm, and we picked the car up two days later at 2 pm, so the car wasn't even there 48 hours. That was annoying otherwise if you can afford it - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located for all the Boston Sights”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: We spent several nights here before heading out to the Cape. Having never been to Boston, we were happy with the location and the fact that we got a good deal, plus an upgrade since we're Starwood Platinum. The rooms are nice, seem to have been recently redone and we had a nice little sitting area and almost a window seat like thing too. There was plenty of space. The bathroom was the typical upgraded sheraton bathroom. Not terribly big, but fine with all the space outside the room. Breakfast was included with our status (well, the club lounge is included) so it was nice to be able to get a little something in the morning before heading out. There was fruit, bagels, yogurt, juice, the basics. No made-to-order eggs or anything, but again, enough to get you off to a good start. The location was really great, you can actually stay inside and head right into the mall. It's also close to the shopping street (Newbury I think), plus we were able to walk the Freedom Trail right from the hotel as well and then we just took a short cab back from the USS Constitution. You can also walk to Fenway Park. A note on parking. We were able to get a coupon for parking in the huge lot that goes under the hotel and under the whole mall. Just print this (it should pop up with the most recent month) http://boston.centralparking.com/Boston-Prudential-Center-800-Boylston-Street-Parking-parking-coupon.html. It's pretty confusing if you're driving around that area and don't know exactly where you're going, but head straight to the hotel and there is an entrance right past the circle to do hotel valet. That's probably the best place to enter for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Well Run Large Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: voyagemom
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed all of Boston from this hotel. We especially appreciated the location of the Sheraton. At the end of a long day of sight seeing - the roof top pool could not be beat! Took advantage of the Pay your Birthday offer and felt we had the best deal in town.

Reviews.Title: “A super deal for a Points-and-Cash stay”
Reviews.Author: FromThe361
Reviews.Content: Check-in was reasonably prompt. The lobby is large, well-furnished, and offers free wi-fi. The rooms were small but clean and attractive. The pool, which lies under a retractable roof, was clean and at a comfortable temperature. The hotel is connected to the Prudential Center, allowing access to the Hynes Convention Center and the subway without going outside. The Prudential Center mall offers numerous affordable eating options, including a Dunkin Donuts a few steps outside the hotel entrance. Because the hotel has a Hertz rental counter, this is a good hotel for travelers who want to stay in Boston a couple of days before traveling to other parts of New England. Look for excellent Points-and-Cash options from Starwood for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel, nice view”
Reviews.Author: mafootje
Reviews.Content: As to be expected this Sheraton is a good hotel, rooms are large and beds are good. I guess all rooms also have a nice view, we overlooked a "play" fountain and the water next to it. But the only thing Sheraton isn't clear about are the additional costs of ammenities. At this hotel we learned that logging on the paid Wifi from different devices you also have to pay for every device. Beside it really isn't a real customer friendly way of adding cost to the allready high room price you'll have to pay it isn't displayed anywhere. After we found out that every device was charged i went through all the blabla terms for using the WiFi connection. No where was to be seen that logging in from multiple devices also meant multiple charges. They where friendly enough to bring back the charge to only one charge when we commented about this. But still the feeling of being charged multiple times for every devices wasn't good. I really think that $10 for 24 hour Wifi per room really is the limit. Besides this everything was possitive, location was good near shops and restaurants. Hotel had a fullsize Starbucks in the lobby. Downstairs well maintained PC's where available for free and also the printing in black and white was free. Wifi in the lobby also was at no charge. Certainly a hotel to like.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TeddyBTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during our recent visit to Boston area. This hotel is connected to the Prudential Centre in the Back Bay area and is close to everything. Most staff were very friendly and helpful but the front office was definitely under-staffed as I needed to queue every time when I needed to speak with someone at the front desk. The only exception is the doormen who did not offer to assist with baggage on arrival and departure and walked away when we tried to get him to hail a taxi for us from the taxi rank that was just down the driveway. No big deal except it was raining. The room is little on the small side but adequate. Clean and tidy. Reasonably good condition. Rented a car from Hertz located at the hotel and was able to returned to car to the hotel valet who was also very friendly and helpful. A complimentary bottle water is provided each day, a very nice feature. Good amenities with free Internet stations in the lobby area. Our bath tub was not draining but was quickly attended to after reporting to the front desk. All in all, a pleasant stay. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small room”
Reviews.Author: kyoung123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were in Boston for a Red Sox game and it was convenient to Fenway Park. I got a great rate via a discount online service and for that rate it was good. We loved the Starbucks in the lobby, the easy access to the mall, and the free internet service in the lobby. However, for such a large place, you would think they would offer free wifi in their rooms. That cost $9.95 a day. The kids really enjoyed the electronic game table in the lobby as well. There were four of us and we felt the room was a bit small. But luckily, we didn't spend much time in the room. This place is in a great location for Fenway. Just an easy 15-minute walk or a $5 cab trip. By the t-shirts being worn by other guests, it looked like a lot of people stay there for Red Sox games. We had to wait a half an hour for the valet to get our car the day we checked out. Not being familiar with downtown hotels, it would have been nice if someone could have mentioned to call ahead for that, instead of having to sit in the lobby for that time with all of our stuff on a cart. There was at least one other family in the same predicament so it seems like it might be a somewhat common occurance. And you should know that it costs about $40 a day if you park your car in their garage. Another "perk" of a downtown hotel. But what else are you gonna do... Anyway, overall, it was a great stay for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ryanwest
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton is centrally located for all sightseeing in Boston. It is surrounded by a large number of restaurants and shops and convenient to the Boston "T". Upon arrival, we found a very spacious lobby with a concierge, bell cap, registration desk, restaurant, coffee shop, and computer station. We arrived extremely early and were appreciative when the hotel was able to accommodate us with an available room. We were in the North Tower and were pleased with the size of our room. There was a foyer as we entered the room and the small bathroom was just off to the right. The bedroom, containing an extremely comfortable king sized bed, was attached to a large sitting area with a couch, chair, and desk in an alcove. The hotel had free internet in the lobby but charged for internet in the room. They also charged the standard "outrageous" big city parking fee, so, unless you really need a car, you should rely on public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel for Boston”
Reviews.Author: Ms30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in August for a few days. The hotel is conveniently located and attached to Prudential Center (which includes fifth/saks, lord and taylor, food court, cheesecake factory, barns and noble etc). We found it to be convenient as it was connected to the T trains, which we took when we went sightseeing. I liked the free internet in the lobby, but the room was only ok. We are Starwoods members and were given a room on the top floor. The room was spacious with fine bedding and standard flat screen. However, it is the washroom that was the issue. The washroom was quite old and despite the marble counter top, the toilet, bathtub and air vents were REALLY showing their age. For example, there was a think layer of dust in the washroom vent and the light switches had black outline (dust/dirt). Also, the toilet did not flush well and typically required 2 or more flushes. Despite this, we still feel this hotel is ok, given its convenience and reasonable price (compared to other 4 start hotels in Boston).

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SummerH01
Reviews.Content: We chose the Sheraton as it was in a great location - attached to the prudential center, so it was near the tube and many restaurants. Also, from looking at the website, the facilities provided seemed great! Unfortunately, they weren't as great as they came across as. In the photos the pool looked gorgeous and was put across as 'one of New England's largest indoor pools'. The pool was disappointingly a lot smaller than advertised as and was really a disgrace. Staff obviously spent very little time looking after it as there were filthy marks around the edge of the pool and swimming around you would find clumps of hair floating around and I dread to think what the other suspicious looking objects were. The gym was actually really great, just not in the best place, you have to walk through the pool area to get to the second fitness room - I witnessed many poor people slipping over! The worst experience I had regarding the facilities was the fact that during my stay they decided to close off the pool deck to us paying customers for a private event. This, I found very unacceptable. You chose a hotel for mainly its facilities, then you get them taken away from you?! It was a lovely day and all we wanted to do was spend the day out on the sun loungers. If they are going to do this, they should inform you before you arrive there or give you a discount, surely? Another issue was that half of the staff were unfriendly and unhelpful. We had a few days when we came back to a room that had not been cleaned - not very welcoming for a good nights sleep. So overall you can see it wasn't a great experience for a family vacation. The hotel definitely has a lot of potential, they just need to take more care of the building and their customers! Next time we visit Boston, I think we will find an alternative hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, less than great service”
Reviews.Author: Gerry V
Reviews.Content: We were travelling to Boston for a dinner and a ballgame. The idea was to share a room near both the restaurant and Fenway Park. WE arrived at 1:30pm and the room was not ready, we thought no sweat, leave the bags with the concierge and go have lunch. We arriuved back at 3pm and now there was a huge line to check in. The room still was not ready. We asked them to get jujst the room ready and to put the cot in later as long as we had it there after the ball game. The cot was not in when we arrived at 11:30pm and we had to wait until 1am before it arrived. This did not make for a great night's sleep since we were flying out early next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: Itsthejourny
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for 5 days. We arrived very early in the morning, and the front desk clerk was very accommodating in ensuring we all had a room. Nevertheless, it was not what I had requested. The staff was very professional and when i described my request made sure I got exactly what I wanted. The room was well appointed, the location was perfect for walking almost anywhere in downtown boston, and the concierge was very helpful! Thank younto the staff for making this trip very pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pathfinder2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton on August 1st and 2nd and had a great time. The hotel is very well located and within walking distance from everything we wanted to see and check out. Yes the bathroom is very tiny, but who cares. We went to see a ball game and we loved the atmosphere at Fenway, we loved it so much that we are making this our yearly summer get away. Boston is a beautiful city to visit, we walked so much during our stay that we didn't have time to gain weight. lol. We booked the hotel through Hotwire and got a real good deal, we would have never known about this if it wasn't for the great people on Trip Advisor that told us about Hotwire and that this particular hotel was in fact the Sheraton. The hotel itself is very clean and well taken care off. If we can get the same deal next year, we will definately book the Sheraton again. I highly recommend this hotel especially in that part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: azracegirl99
Reviews.Content: Purchased via Priceline bid and treated like royalty. Given HUGE top floor south tower corner king size renovated room. Gorgeous Gorgeous views! Comfortable bed, Starbucks in lobby and an ideal hotel location. Easy Walk to Copley Shops, Prudential Tower and subway without going outside. Refrigerator in room upon request at no charge. Stayed July 23-26th post cruise. Huge comfortable lobby with TVs etc.

Reviews.Title: “Overall service was very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rrmeracle
Reviews.Content: My friends and I always choose a city to meet up for our annual trip. This year we chose Boston and selected the Sheraton at Copley. It was a great location within walking distance to most sights around the city. The hotel was old, but the rooms were clean and presentable. I was most disappointed by the service portion of our stay. The bell hop(s) were rarely at their station. We had to wait for awhile to check in our luggage since the room was not ready. When we returned to gather our bags to head to the room, they brought out the wrong lugguage and it took another long period of time to get it straightened out. The worst part of the trip was the concierge. The two that we spoke with were both rude. They gave incorrect pricing quotes for tours and gave my friend an incorrect estimate for a taxi fare to the airport. She did not want to take the time to inform her the best way to get there by public transportation. When there are so many other hotels with better service, why stay here? We will be returning to Boston, but will skip this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: roses4889
Reviews.Content: I went to Boston in June to visit friends and we stayed at the Sheraton in downtown Boston. It was a great location, the rooms were really nice, clean and updated. The staff was excellent, very helpful and polite! The hotel has a connection to the Prudential Center, which was very convenient. We had a lovely time, great city! Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: HotelDeal
Reviews.Content: If you can get a deal on the price it is a good value. Centrally located and convenient. Don't pay full price though because they charge for virtually everything. Small rooms are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Ned14
Reviews.Content: Check in was not good. We booked on Hotwire, I think they look down on you for some reason. After waiting for an hour we got our room. Overlooked the city, view is ok from room 1863. Even though its beside the elevator did not hear a thing. Lots of shops and restaurants around, all different prices. Before we went there I read a lot about it being a pricey area, but there are lots of places to eat on a budget. Walk to Fenway, walk downtown or anywhere. Jog along the river, great for that. Ask at the front desk for a Prudential Center Preferred shopping card. My wife got one, you can some deals at some of the shops and restaurants there. You can also get a $5 dollar credit every night that you pass on room cleaning. We did it a few times, it translated into some smoothies at the Starbucks in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “We would return”
Reviews.Author: karec
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay - got two rooms that shared a door so we could spread out from our kids. Joey at the front desk said our rooms weren't ready when we arrived (a bit early), but he arranged for a corner room with an adjoining room that was just wonderful. Bathrooms were small, but manageable. Most puzzling thing: no towel racks. Anywhere. We had a great picture of the George Washington statue in our bathroom, but I'd gladly have given it up for 2 towel racks! The pool with a retracting roof was a hit with the kids - I think it might be a salt water pool with chlorine as well. The hotel is attached to the Prudential Center with lots of food court options and restaurants, it's across the street from a Shaw's supermarket (we got a fridge and had breakfast in our room each day - saved lots of $!), and there is a T stop in the Prudential Center bottom level. The perfect arrangement for a family with young kids! Plus - there was a deal going on where we paid just $65 for our 2nd and 3rd nights (since my husband was born in 1965!). We'd return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “I have a feeling that management was not listening.”
Reviews.Author: nhpod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Boston Hotel from July 28th to July 30th for a medical conference. We arrived at the front door after battling Boston traffic with lots of suitcases. Normally I am happy to carry my own luggage, but I would have been grateful for some assistance. None was to be found. No one greeted us on arrival or offered us assistance. So, we needed to drag six items to the front desk. I have stayed at many large city hotels and find it unusual that nobody was on duty to help us; especially on Friday afternoon. As a matter of fact, I saw no bell hops in the hotel. Is this no longer a service that Sheraton offers? The room itself was very nice, very roomy with a wonderful view. However, when I went into the bathroom I noticed that there was a leak from around the bathtub faucet. This must have been going on for a long time because there was a water stain. I immediately notfied the front desk, and they sent someone up to repair it while we were away. The "repair" consisted of tightening the handles with brute force, making it very difficult for me to use the shower. I complained to the front desk no less than three times during my stay. I will give high marks to the desk personnel for their concern. They did offer me one day of free internet and $50 off my hotel bill. That was not my concern, I was not really inconvenienced. In an age when all hotels have cards in the bathrooms stating that they are "Committed to saving resources", I am disturbed that the Boston Sheraton Hotel would not take a few moments to repair the leak, stop the flow of water, and save thousands of gallons of water!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Doctor not helpful at all”
Reviews.Author: Canuk71
Reviews.Content: While staying at the hotel, my wife fell ill so we asked to be put in touch with the hotel doctor. My wife discussed her condition with the doctor over the phone, but he seemed much more interested in talking about how he was going to get paid than in her condition (something we're not used to as Canadians.) In the end, his cavalier recommendation for treatment and the prescription he phoned in did nothing to help my wife. Indeed, it was only after getting home a week later that we learned that there were some very basic things concerning diet, etc. that would have made her feel much more comfortable - none of which he mentioned. He was too rudely interested in our credit card number. I would suggest the Sheraton look for a better doctor.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: 5urfbeach
Reviews.Content: Centrally planted, and very well presented. The pool and gym are excellent for those of us who still enjoy exercise. I'd also like to say that Boston is one of my favorite U.S. cities.

Reviews.Title: “Here's some different advice on the Sheraton Boston”
Reviews.Author: Travelswell4fun
Reviews.Content: I don't reinforce other reviews anymore, I just give stuff I think you should know. We were on the eleventh floor of the south tower and could literally (literally) hear every single "T" train that passed on the red line through the Prudential stop beneath the ground. My wife had me think of it as "big ocean waves" which did help, but come on. At rush hour times you will hear it. Since this starts at about 7:30 to 8:30 in the morning and 4:30 to 6:00 in the evenings, you need to know this will affect you too. I did ask someone staying on the 26th floor (and in the North tower) who said he didn't hear the trains. Since I travel with a fan, I was able to drown out some (but not all) the noise. In the Blues Brothers movie, when Elwood brings his brother Jake home from Joliet prison and to his studio apartment located directly next to the El line in Chicago, Jake asks Elwood "how often does the train go by?" to which Elwood responds, "so often you won't even hear it". Well, at the Sheraton Boston you will hear the trains. It wasn't as clean as we had expected it to be. I'm not holding it against them too much though. When there are a thousand rooms in one hotel, it isn't going to be the Four Seasons. It is in a great location for tourists indeed. That alone (really!) is enough to stay here/Marriott. If you do stay here (and I can say it would be a good choice) just ask to be on a much higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price, a bit busy, but enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: Likestotravel454
Reviews.Content: This was hotel #2 on a trip and it was wonderful to walk into a clean, bright, modern hotel with every amenity. If you like to walk to destinations this is a good stay with the shops there, Fenway a walkable 1 mile, MFA is about a mile too....only problem was that the concierge was always super busy so we couldn't get help with directions.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel4Fun
Reviews.Content: My husband and 1 year old stayed here for two nights while visiting Boston. The room was very spacious and clean. The staff was very friendly and even allowed us to check in early and upgraded us to a king size room (instead of queen). The pool and workout room was impressive -- the pool roof retracts so the indoor pool can become an outdoor pool and the weight room seemed to have a lot of equipment. The hotel is connected to the prudential center shops which is very convenient. Also, it's stop number 11 on the Old Town Trolley which made our sightseeing very easy. The only complaint was that the doors to the rooms had about an inch shaved off of the bottom so you could hear everything going on out in the hall and everyone in the hall could hear everything being said (or screeched by our 1 year old) in the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: highjul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and wished we could stay longer! The hotel was updated, with great views. The room was not huge, but it was well-appointed. There's a good restaurant/bar in the lobby, along with a Starbucks. The hotel itself is connected to the Prudential Center (a mall) with lots of food/shopping. In terms of Boston location, you're in walking distance to lots of great shopping and restaurants in the Back Bay area. I'd definitely return to this hotel when traveling back to Boston. Definitely one of the nicer Sheratons I've seen.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: AdrianeNY
Reviews.Content: This hotel was gorgeous and very accomodating. We were on the 29th floor, corner room with 2 windows and had a beautiful view of the river. There's a Starbucks in the lobby and you can also get Dunkin Donuts in the enclosed mall without leaving the hotel. My only complaints are the room service fees-one scoop of ice cream (4.25 on the menu) would have came to $15.53 and the parking, which was $44.00 a night. If the parking wasn't so expensive I would definitely stay there again being it's only a 2 minute drive to my son's college.

Reviews.Title: “OK Business Travel - But a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MarkAW-GRMI
Reviews.Content: We were there for a combo business/conference trip during the day, and then used the weekend and evenings for some fun. While there are probably some rooms with great views, we had a corner room on the 7th floor of the south tower and didn't have that great of a view, unless you consider roof cooling equipment a good view.

Reviews.Title: “Back Bay home away from home”
Reviews.Author: PDXTraveler02
Reviews.Content: I stay here annually when visiting family in the area. Love the central location, right near Newbury Street, and especially loved the fact that so many shops and restaurants are contained within the greater Prudential Center mall. This came in handy during the recent 102 degree heat wave! The rooms are spotless, comfortable, elegant and quiet. Lovely views from many of the windows.

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: islandb8by
Reviews.Content: After a 5 hour flight from SF to Boston, the first thing we wanted to do was kick off our shoes and sink into our hotel room. We got a room on the 24th floor with an awesome view. There were 3 of us staying in the room. The bathroom was quite spacious and the towels were the fluffiest I've ever felt. The best thing about this hotel was the king sized bed. Soooooo comfortable. We also had a rollaway bed, which was also very comfortable. Not your typical rollaway mattress. We were starving from our flight, so we were on the hunt for food. The concierge informed us that the hotel restaurant was open late (at 11:30pm), but when we got there, a gentleman told us that the kitchen was closed. We refused to pay a buttload for room service, so we went off into the night on the hunt for a very late night dinner. The staff was friendly at the hotel and very helpful. They have a Starbucks located inside the hotel, along with a restaurant, a store, and a Hertz Rental Car location. I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: catracho
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from a wonderful stay at the Boston Sheraton. Loved that it was attached to a large mall with restaurants and stores. It was also a departure point for the famous duck tours and a trolley stop on the beantown trolley. It has a T stop (prudential) and an Amtrak station (back bay station) that are in walking distance and all indoors. Loved the pool with the retractable roof too. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel in Prudential Tower/Mall”
Reviews.Author: Waitingforvacation
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for a business trip. I was upgraded to a 19th Floor Suite with great city views/Charles Harbor. The Suite was large, and seemed to be recently renovated. The location is great, right near Copley Square. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “can't believe the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: obannonii
Reviews.Content: My family and friends stay at the Sheraton each time we travel to Boston.....I have read some of the negative reviews and think they must be referrinfg to a different hotel. The staff has ALWAYS been friendly and helpful. The rooms very clean and comfortable. The location is fantastic! We are returning in August and can't wait to return to the Sheraton. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone.......The Sheraton makes our stays in Boston that much more pleasant.......

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: zmaine
Reviews.Content: Convenience is key in Boston. This hotel is conveniently located and connected to the Prudential Shopping Center from the 2nd floor. The shopping center had a decent food court for quick bites to eat, lots of shopping options and a Barnes & Noble bookstore. The Duck Tours leave from the opposite end of the shopping center from the Sheraton which was perfect and well worth the tour. The hotel is a block away from Newbury Street which was great for shopping and casual eateries and people watching too. I noticed that the Old Town Trolley Tours pick up in front of the resort too. There were pedi-cabs outside the hotel lobby. Pedi-cabs are like cabs but on bikes, they can get through traffic through back alleys while you sit and enjoy the ride from a seat in the cart they tow. This was perfect to get to Fenway Park for a Red Sox game. Cost, you pay what you like. They offered a buffet breakfast at Apropos which was conveniently located next to Starbucks in the lobby. I frequented the buffet every morning and it was quick and convenient. Room Service food quality was surprisingly good. The sliders were yummy and perfect for a midnight snack. Computers were available with complimentary internet access in the main lobby. While the timer was annoying (they limit you to 45 minutes), it was understandable since I was surrounded by teenagers. The room was small and the view was much to be desired but that's expected for a city hotel. When I say small I mean small (almost clostraphobic). There was just enough room for one person to be in one area of the room at a time. It was difficult for two of us to get ready at the same time. This just means that you shouldn't stay here if you plan to stay in the hotel room all day. Boston is a great city, get out and explore. The fitness facility was small but decent. If you want excercise, walk the Freedom Trail. By the way the Duck Tour covers about 85% of the Freedom Trail so on a hot humid day jump on a Duck. I loved my sleeping experience. The bed was comfortable, I got a better sleep after asking for extra pillows. Service was as expected from a city hotel, there only when you ask. They did not always meet my expectations but I admit my expectations are high. I was annoyed after noticing that they would take my wet towels but forget to replace them with clean fresh ones for two days. (Maybe I should've tipped more than $5 /day) I noticed that our neighbors Room Service table was left in the hall for nearly 10 hours (it was there when I left for breakfast and still there when I returned to get ready for dinner). Surprisingly for an older hotel with thin walls, I didn't hear much from the neighbors. I did hear the water flow from the other rooms though. I loved my Boston experience and feel that Sheraton Boston delivered what can only be expected at the rate they charge. I'd stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: katrutt
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in Back Bay right next to the Christian Science Center (worth a visit if only to see Mapparium) and attached to Prudential Center (can get to the Skywalk without even going outside). The room we were booked in was not ready when we arrived (asked for early check-in) so we were upgraded to the King Executive Suite, (after a little confusion and waiting for our original room for about 1 1/2 hrs) an amazing room on the club floor with stunning views of Charles River!! It had two bathrooms (they are a little small but that didn't bother us much as we were too impressed with the rest of the room). Scrumptious beds, nice sitting area. We asked for a rollaway bed (free) that fit perfectly in the entrance way so that we would not have to open the pullout couch in the sitting area. Our son said the pullout bed was very comfortable, better than a sofa bed! Also, even if you don't have time to swim, check out the pool on the 5th floor with the retractable roof, great for an evening swim under the stars!!! Only complaint was most of the time there was only one elevator to the club floors...didn't notice anyone trying to fix it while we were there for 5 days..so not sure if it was broken or they just didn't have it running. Highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back when we return to the Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a conference.”
Reviews.Author: Carali_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. The hotel is within walking distance of some beautiful areas of Boston including the Commons and the Freedom Trail. The room was very clean, comfortable, and offered a beautiful view of the river. The bathroom is a little small and plain but I think most people wouldn't want to spend a lot of time in the bathroom while traveling! The front desk staff was professional and courteous. The hotel provided breakfast, lunch, and afternoon refreshments for the conference and the food was very good. I didn't get to check out the pool or other amenities, but thanks to the location I was able to do some sightseeing in the evening. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but we didn't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: viktoriag
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for college orientation and the location was ideal. The Prudential Center, the T, Fenway Park and Northeastern University ... I booked the hotel through unpublished deals so we had a great rate (I can't seem to get that rate again!) but the hotel was clean and the staff were fine. We didn't have any complaints about the cleanliness of the room or the bathroom, although both were a little on the small side. It's such a huge hotel that we didn't expect personal service, and we were plagued by some fruit flies in the lobby when we sat down to enjoy drinks but otherwise it was pleasant...parking is incredibly expensive, but that's the city for you. We ended up moving our car to the college and parking there for free once orientation started, but there were other garages nearby which might have cost less. The valet guys were really fast. We called for the car and by the time we got to the lobby it was pulling up. Also the in-room charges for the internet are always irritating, especially when it keeps cutting out, but the stations down in the lobby almost make up for that. Overall, I would stay here again but doubt I'd pay full price. However, all other things equal, I'd choose this hotel again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A everything cost something hotel”
Reviews.Author: magnolila
Reviews.Content: If you are welling to spend money on every little details then this hotel is just for you. (36$ a day for parking, 11$ for 24 hours of net, very expensive hotel restaurant). I am not saying this is not a good hotel, but at the end of the trip you feel like you could have more for the price. No fridge in room. No microwave. Very spacious rooms though and clean. The hotel is connected to the Prudential Center and to a metro station which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE!”
Reviews.Author: BEG1969
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay ( mix of business & pleasure July 21-24). The hotel is MASSIVE. It connects to Hynes Convention Center, Prudential Center and a shopping mall. The staff was very accomodating for my requests: I am allergic to goose down so I had them remove all feathered bedding and asked for a mini fridge to store some medication. The rooms were a nice size, and clean. The bathroom had some minor paint peeling. Overall no other issues. The hotel was in the heart and walking distance of almost everything. Fenway Park was only a half a mile away. I went to Shaw's grocery in the mall to buy bottled water, ice tea etc... because the hotel prices were ridiculous. I paid $4.27 for a small container of Orange Juice on my first day. They have a nice fitness center and pool with retractable roof on the 5th floor. The have a nice bar that we had drinks at one night. I didn't eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel so I can't comment on it. This was my first trip to Boston and I loved it, just note it is an expensive town but it does have some great restaurants (see seperate reviews for Stephanie's on Newbury, Strega on the Waterfront, Durgin Park and Legal Seafood). I would recommend the hotel and stay again if I had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated”
Reviews.Author: SoCalOma
Reviews.Content: My 10 yr old son and I stayed here July 10th-16th. Upon check-in (which was quite late on a Sunday night), I assumed that our "several" requests would not be honored: 1) high floor 2) microwave 3) fridge 4) rollaway. To our amazement, they were able to accommodate EVERYTHING. The view from the 22nd floor, overlooking the river was incredible. There was Starbucks coffee for the in-room coffeemaker; and you have the option of "opting out" of room service and getting a $5 coupon. Shaw's market is a 10 minute walk through the attached mall. The T is easy enough to navigate that my son was an "expert" by the second day. There was one little mix-up about the availability of ice cream, but the manager kindly sent up a huge selection to our room. The pool area is well-maintained; and the staff is generally quite nice (with the exception of 1 young, cocky, rude concierge)--but we did notify his superior immediately. I felt completely safe here with my son. Would highly recommend. One word of caution--if you are a light sleeper, bring ear plugs because the water pipes (or whatever) are amazingly loud. Terrific hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel but had problems with the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: benhochschwender
Reviews.Content: This overall was a nice hotel but the bathrooms had mold on the ceiling which should have been taken care of right away. Otherwise the pool was pretty nice espcially when they open the roof and you can hear the sounds of the city. The bedrooms were pretty nice overall.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: alwaysthinkin
Reviews.Content: 7/21/2011 Front desk checkin person Justin was a pleasure. Very pleasant and answered questions with a great attitude. My room was on one of the club floors, and allthough very small, it was extremely clean and adequate. The first thing i generally check when going to a hotel is the bathroom. The tub had these disgusting big paint flaking spots on them. It was a huge turn-off. Other than that the room was great. And extremely clean. I'm a bit of a nut when it comes to hotel room cleanliness. (I bring my own pillow-case) If the concierge floor club room is important to you, (it is for me), then this is not the hotel. It's empty most of the time. Nothing there at night at all. You can't even get a beer and enjoy the views. The breakfast was ok in the club room, but nothing great. The club room at this facility is not much of a benefit at all. The only real advantage to the club floors here seems to be the free internet, and the continental (very small ) breaqkfast Overall, the hotel is very friendly and extremely clean and well kept. (except for the tub in room 2703). I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Gold member”
Reviews.Author: darqueaj
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Sheraton in Boston. I am a gold member and the conciere level was booked. They did give us a junior sweet but we really needed two double beds. I have stayed in many Sheraton because I love the beds. This bed is not heavenly. It is very hard. In the bathroom them towel rod is coming of the wall. No water in room and charging us to use club lounge. Club lounge breakfast was very nice

Reviews.Title: “Special and memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: historyteacher50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2011 for one week for our anniversary with our 2 teenage kids. Before I arrived, I had contacted the manager because I was concerned about the room set up with our 2 older children. The manager made every effort to ensure that our room and stay would be as comfortable as possible. He even sent us a delicious fruit and cheese plate with a handwritten note, acknowledging our anniversary and stay. Our comfortable and well appointed suite had views of the Charles River - I couldn't wait to wake up every morning to look at the river and old Boston. I also enjoyed the beautiful Bostonian landmark pictures in the room. The club lounge was a great way to start the day - the attendants kept everything well stocked and fresh at breakfast time. All the hotel employees I met always greeted me with a smile and were very gracious. The location here can't be beat - access to about 3 subway lines (without going outside and walking within the Prudential Center). The convenience of having the Prudential Center, Newbury Street and Bolyston Street nearby gave our family many options for eating and shopping. Although we bought one week subway passes, we walked to many attractions. Since this hotel is attached to the convention center and has many rooms, there were a lot of conventions going on in the hotel. This made for a very busy lobby but the staff still had impeccable service. Canâ€™t wait to come back here soon again! Don't forget to get the Boston Go Card for sightseeing - we got the card for 5 days and visited many tour sites. We even went to Cape Cod for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your spouse to enjoy beautiful Boston”
Reviews.Author: Speaker76
Reviews.Content: Business brought me to the Sheraton, not a brand I usually seek out. But this trip may change my mind. The front desk obliged with a room with a view on the 23 rd floor. My wife enjoyed two days of a Trolley tour and the great shopping nearby. After work we enjoyed long walks along Boylston and Newberry. The rooms are quite well appointed for a city hotel. A new, comfortable lounge chair, large flat screen TV, and excellent king bed made for a satisfactory room. The location truly is key: it is close enough to everything you'd want. Walking gets you to most desireable locations. Great jogging is nearby on Commonwealth to the Boston Common. The T & the bus are cheap and close for Harvard, the North End etc. Sheraton is obviously working at a new image, and the results are pleasant to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: momma1414
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of the city. Right at the convention center with any kind of shopping/eating you could imagine. Great room and great service. Visited twice in june and would definitely return! Travelled around town on the on/off tour bus. A little pricey, but buy a two day ticket and it is worth the money. We got on and off many times!! Boston is a great city. Hoping to return very soon!

Reviews.Title: “That is all you needed”
Reviews.Author: duohrs
Reviews.Content: This is one of the three major hotels connected to the Copley Place, so one is right in the center of action. The room is quite adequate and modern. If anything the bathroom is small but it has good tub and shower, nothing fancy here. I like their indoor pool and fitness center with sun parlor amid them, when the weather allows you can enjoy the sunshine. If you like to shop or have fun, the Copley Place and the surrounding can let you lost for hours. It is also walkable to Boston Common. Certainly don't mind to stay here again when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: DesertDiva31
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to Boston and I have to say that the Sheraton Boston is our favorite hotel. This summer I was travelling to Boston with my husband and kids. We wanted to book 2 connecting rooms but we were told that it could not be guaranteed, so we were better off reserving a suite (with a pull out sofa bed). The room turned out to be very nice, recently updated furniture and very cozy with a great view of the Charles River and MIT/Cambridge. Since the hotel is connected to Prudential Center, Copley Mall and close to Newbury street, we really felt like we were in the heart of the city. We went to almost every desitination by foot, and for those destinations that were a bit farther away (such as Harvard square), we took the underground train from the station which is connected to the mall. We even went to New York City using the train that leaves from Back Bay Station (which is connected to Copley mall). So all in all this hotel was the ultimate in convenience and comfort. The hotel gym and swimming pool were amazing and recently refurbished. Lots of machines overlooking a great view and a glass roof covering the swimming pool makes you feel like you are outdoors. I also forgot to mention that there is a starbucks in the lobby and a very convenient and well designed computer stations in the lobby which allow hotel guests to browse the web for free. My kids and I made use of these computers almost daily. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay at it again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: twetnall
Reviews.Content: We booked an club executive suite. Whilst the room was big enough the bathroom was tiny, only 3 very small towels provided no bathrobes or slippers, the bed only had a bedside table on one side. We we're also very disappointed with the club room, we we're on the 17th floor and it wasn't easy to get up to the 29th floor as only 2 lifts went up that far, so on pressing the lift 'up' button you would have to get off at the 24th floor and switch lifts, bit of a pain. If you happened to be on the 28th or 29th floor then there was a dedicated express lift. Breakfast was ok, usual bagel, breads, yoghurt, pastries, fruit. Not big selection of teas and often found the coffee cold. We have used Sheratons club floors before and we're disappointed to find this was the only time they provided food, there where snack bars there and some soft drinks in the fridge but no, evening drinks or snacks. The bar downstairs was pretty dull and full of little flies too. The position of this hotel though is excellent, just short walk to Newby Street and attached to the prudential building which is also connected to Copley Place via a walkway. We would try another hotel in this area next time though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Clean Room, Comfy Bed”
Reviews.Author: mftcat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated in Back Bay, a lovely neighborhood located between downtown and Fenway. You're surrounded by fantastic shops and eateries (Prudential Center or Newbury St). It's also connected to the T via the Prudential Center, which can get you to any place you'd like to visit including the airport for just $2 a ride. Fenway and the Museum of Fine Arts is about 15 minute walk. Boston Commons and Historic Downtown are another 15 minute walk in the opposite direction. You can even get to the Sam Adam's Brewery via the Orange line within 25 minutes. The hotel itself is very well maintained and updated. There is free wifi and computers in the lobby. You can only use the computer for 45 minutes a day before they begin charging. But that's plenty of time to get things done if you're just a tourist. The pool and gym are spotless. I was very surprised at the amount of exercise equipment they had - they too were using the latest and greatest technologies (multilingual). My husband and I used the gym several times on our trip. The only draw back is they have no free weights, but you can do sit-ups and push-ups for that. The room itself was spacious. The bed was comfy. The TV channels are limited to news and sports, but that's not a real big issue since we didn't spend much time watching TV. My only complaint about the room is that the hot water pipes "whine". So, if you have someone above you that likes to take showers at 6:00am, you may be awakened by the whining pipes. Thankfully, it's not too loud, so you eventually get used to it and fall back asleep. More specifically, we were in the North Tower, on the 6th floor right next to the elevators. The elevators weren't an issue. However, the baseball fans coming in late at night, slamming doors and yelling about the ice machine were an issue. Thankfully, they only stayed one night. You can't help who your neighbors are, I guess. But, you can help if you're near the ice machine. If I were you, I'd request not being near the elevators/ice machine and you may be able to reduce the 'ambient' noise. My favorite thing about the room is the ability to choose the "green" option. You put a tag on your door that tells the Maids you don't need new towels or sheets every day. I like my privacy and am not a big fan of people going through my room while I'm not there. Add that to saving some enegery and water, it's a win win. The best part is that every day you use the 'green' option, Sheraton slips a $5 gift certificate under your door to be used for drinks or concessions at any of their restaurants. If you stay there for a few nights and save up, you can get yourself a free breakfast buffet. All in all, I would suggest staying at this hotel. We slept well. We were perfectly situated to everything we wanted to see. The front desk personnel were helpful. And the free wifi made it easy to download Boston Apps to my iPod. I'd go back in a heartbeat. PS - I got a great deal for this hotel room through Hotwire.com. I didn't pay full price, so bear that in mind for my review.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it here and would love to come back!”
Reviews.Author: vveen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my husband last June and I definitely love this hotel. Not only I found this hotel has a spacious room and great view, the staffs are also very helpful. My hotel room is located in 12th fl and cannot have a better view. It has a very wide glass window and you can see the beautiful red-brick houses lined in front of your eyes. The location is also nice, very close to Newbury St - High St and the closest MBTA station that took me to Harvard Uni at Prudential Center mall is very convenient, too. I was also more than happy to see Apple Store, Traderâ€™s Joe and line of restaurants along Boylston St. Free Wi-Fi is available at common are without password and Starbucks at lobby level.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel/Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelerColumbusOhio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in the city within walking distance of museums, shopping, restaurants and public transportation. The view we had from the 17th floor overlooked the beautiful dome of the Christian Science Center Church and beyond. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable for our family of 4. The pool was also great to have right there on the 5th floor and the hotel is also connected to the Prudential Center with its many restaurants and stores. I will stay here again - it was just so convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MillerCorona
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in June - we contacted the manager in advance (well one day) letting her know we were celebrating a special occasion. Upon check in, we were upgraded to a wonderful suite with a river view (I am also SPG Plat). The suite was large and clean - the only thing I would comment on was the size of the bathroom - both were quite small - which i found surprising for a suite. We were given a bottle of champage and chocolate covered strawberries on arrival - which was a very nice touch - along with a hand written note from the manager. Breakfast at the executive louge was great and complimentary. Location of the hotel is awesome - we were able to walk through most of Boston from the hotel - and its connection to the shopping mall was a great advantage when it rained. Overall, we were very happy with our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mello204
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal from Hotwire for this Sheraton. It is in a good location connected to a mall with tons of dining and shopping options. The hotel itself is very large and can be a bit confusing moving about. It definitely has a convention hotel feel to it which makes it a little bit sterile in feel. Parking is absolutely ridiculous; there is a connected parking garage which is roughly $50 a day and valet parking at the hotel which is $49/day. We made the mistake of parking in the garage, leaving to go out a few hours later having to pay $37 for roughly 5 hours and then the next morning having to pay an additional $37 to leave. The room was pretty small, had a strange layout and was a little outdated. The bathroom was incredibly small. All in all I'm sure you could do better and I'm sure you could do worse. For the Hotwire price, it's probably worth it based on location.

Reviews.Title: “Room booked was not the one I was given”
Reviews.Author: MojitoMaker
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in April for the July 4th Fireworks.In doing this i reserved a Club Room on Club level (floors 25-29)with a river view.I was given confirmaiton of this room,which I also paid more for than a standard room.When we arrived we were told there were no more rooms left on club level.What???Seriously??So after locating my confirmation,they came back and offered us a free upgrade to an executive suite,with a partial river view.Once I saw the room an where it was we called down to speak with management.He said he wasnt sure why I would have gotten a confirmation for that room and after a few minutes,he gave us a price adjustment.Great.at least they did something for us.My real gripe here is that i booked this through the Sheraton directly and if you book a specific room for amenites AND pay more for it,shouldt you get one of those rooms.How can they overbook when you reserve in advance?? And to make it more fun,they shut the pool down as soon as we got there!

Reviews.Title: “They always get everything wrong”
Reviews.Author: LisaMarie19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Boston a few weeks ago with my family and I was appalled at the sheer incompetence of the people at the front desk. Before our arrival, I confirmed several requests with two separate Sheraton Boston employees. Not surprisingly, none of my requests were in the hotel's computer system when we arrived. So after having travelled with my family for over five hours to get to this hotel, we had to basically fight for the things to which we were already entitled (and which I'd specifically confirmed so that this very thing would not happen). For example, as a Preferred Plus Business member I am always entitled to complimentary club lounge benefits and late checkout. However, I had to show the naysayers at the front desk the e-mails that I was sent confirming these very amenities. Check-in should be easy and quick, not a fight to get the very things to which I'm already entitled. And to top it off, nobody at the front desk believed anything I said until I actually produced the e-mails sent to me by Sheraton Boston employees in which they wrote that I was, in fact, entitled to these things on a complimentary basis. And when we received our bill at the end of our stay, we saw that we were grossly overcharged. Not only that, but we were actually billed for several complimentary full breakfasts that we had been granted (in the lobby restaurant). And they had the audacity to even give themselves a tip! (We were charged $44 for one full breakfast, which was supposed to be free, and then $51 for another full breakfast, which was also supposed to be free and which obviously added itself a nice $7 tip). Absolutely unacceptable. Oh, and when we got home, we noticed that we were overcharged for one of the other nights that we stayed there. I called to get that fixed and was told I'd get a credit on my statement. I'll see if that actually happens...I'm wondering if they just overcharge everyone in the hopes that nobody will notice. Preposterous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: MLinNC
Reviews.Content: Check in was not a problem, very freindly staff. Was able to upgrade room with no problems. Very clean hotel, great lobby. Will definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Room and Service Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: 1diva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Boston over an extended Father's Day weekend, while visiting our family who live just a very few blocks from the hotel.The proximity to their apartment was the reason for choice of this property, as well as the reputation , generally enjoyed by the Sheraton properties. It was the second time that we stayed there,having been there several months previous to this, and each time we were pleasantly surprised and upgraded. This time we were graciously upgraded to a suite on the Club Level, and were very pleased with the lovely breakfast choices, fruits, beverages,(teas, coffee,....decafe and regular, water,juices, soft drinks) cereals, ,muffins and bagels. The view of the city and the Charles river was spectacular and we very much appreciated this gracious hospitality as well as the spaciousness of the suite(living room area and second bathroom).We had turn down service on the second evening there, as we were only at the property for two nights.We even enjoyed complimentary appetizers one evening at the lobby bar.Service was quite good there as well.We are grateful for the generosity and hospitality afforded to us, and hope to return to the property (and enjoy similiar ammenities)on future visits to Boston.We highly recommend the Sheraton Boston.There are many excellent restaurants very close to the property.

Reviews.Title: “Good, comfortable rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: littlewol
Reviews.Content: The comforting thing about Sheraton hotels is that they are reliable. You know what you are getting. Some might say predictable, but this is not necessarily a bad thing. The Sheraton Boston is a big hotel with lots of conferences happening at once, not the place to be if you want a boutique-ey feel. The decor could be a tad more imaginative but there is a coffee/tea machine in the room and the beds are uber comfortable. I stayed in a room on one of the club floors. I had a gorgeous view of the Charles River from the room. Club floor rooms come with free HSIA, local and national calls, continental breakfast in the club lounge and soft drinks/muesli bars from the club lounge all day. I thought this was worth paying the little extra for. Room prices are about standard for this area in Boston. The great thing about the Sheraton is the swimming pool. This is heated and they open the roof on a nice day (can be few and far between this time of the year). The gym facilities here are good too. Staff in the club lounge are lovely and the housekeeping staff are good too. As with other hotels in the vicinity, this is a fantastic location in Boston. I would definitely consider staying here again, particularly if I have my family with me as there is a pool for something to do on those wet and windy days which seem to plague this city (maybe I was unlucky with the weather).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cathymccarle
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, great view, brand new! We realy liked this hotel, close to the metro, easy access to most important places to visit...

Reviews.Title: “A little institutional but very nice”
Reviews.Author: skywaker9
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Boston is a nice large hotel located right smack in the center of Boston's Back Bay. The rooms are very nice and the only negative comment is that the service sometimes feels a little impersonal. Still, it is a nice comfortable place and the location is nice. One very nice touch is that the hotel is directly connected to the MBTA Green line Prudential stop via the Prudential Center mall. It is therefore easy to get anywhere you need to go in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay for us and Elderly Parents !!”
Reviews.Author: marmar60
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay as always!! We bought my parents (75) and (80) down for a Red Sox Game. We were upgraded to the Sheraton Prefered Floor and it was glorious! The staff from check-in to check out just fabulous! The convenience to the Top of the Hub, Mall, dining and Fenway is perfect!!! We love the Sheraton Boston and have reservations again for my sister-in-laws 50th celebration in July! Thank you SHERATON BOSTON!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Sheraton Boston”
Reviews.Author: jodi06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights 16 -20 June. Arrived very late and received a warm welcome. The room was not huge, two double beds and very small bathroom. The hotel is centrally located and easy walking distance to everything we wanted to see. Very handy being next to the Prudential Centre. Good fitness room and great pool. In 2011 I find it amazing that hotels still charge for wifi, but there are computers in the lobby and free wifi to connect your own device in the lobby. We booked through Hotwire and I was happy with the hotel for the price I paid, I would have been disappointed if I had paid the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Definently be back”
Reviews.Author: sstarr1114
Reviews.Content: We just got back today from a weekend getaway to Boston. We drove 4 hours from upstate New York and stayed at the Sheraton Boston Hotel. The hotel was easy to find right off of I-90, pretty much 2 turns and you're there. Valet parking for the car (valet parking was a bit much, $44 per day) and quick check in. The rooms were clean and in very good shape. The area it's in is very nice. The Prudential center is hooked up to the hotel which made it nice for shopping or eating. There is a full 24 hour grocery store right around the corner with all the wine, beer or liquor you want. The best part was the subway was at the end of the block, and you had to walk by the Cheesecake Factory to get there! I would absolutely recommend this hotel for it's location and easy access. Everything you would need is right there.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Back Bay (Fenway)”
Reviews.Author: mightymo1961
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine recently came from Costa Rica to Boston to see the Red Sox play the Padres. Being from San Diego, I wanted to join her for this awesome trip. We stayed at the Boston Sheraton in the Back Bay and it was a wonderful time. The hotel was upscale, the rooms were spacious and the lobby was very nice. They offered free internet downstairs and the atmosphere was splendid. There was a Starbucks in the lobby which is very nice when you wake up and can go downstairs and have a good cup of coffee. The location was perfect for our stay. The stadium was about a 15 minute walk, which was perfect. This is a very nice hotel in the neighborhood if you are planning a trip to Fenway Park!

Reviews.Title: “A must!”
Reviews.Author: bosoxfan_8
Reviews.Content: Great place! Great location! Great price! (Son got it on priceline. 100 plus tax.) Nice pool. Nice touch when roof opens. Stayed 4 days with 23 year old son. Went to 3 Sox games. Walked there every time just 10 minutes away. Used the Prudential underground parking and left vehicle in there for the 4 days. Expensive but son found coupon on line and saved 14 dollars a day. Nice! Room was nice. Free internet in lobby with a bunch of computers for guests to use. Very convenient. Would absolutely stay there again. Only question would be is when we checked out I noticed too late a charge of a dollar something for telephone and internet. Don't know what that was for, didn't bother asking because we were already in parking lot and it only was a couple of bucks. Great Place!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Ellee7
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here over the years and this is the last time I'll do so. The staff were so unfriendly and unhelpful, it was surprising-with the exception of the club lounge staff who were extremely friendly. The fitness center is next to the pool, so it feels like a sauna-horrible! The pool is quite, nice though. Room was clean and standard...nothing special. There are much better options for hotels in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: GregoryM2
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel father's day weekend. The staff was awesome, and very friendly. The views of Boston from our room and the Club Room were beautiful. The location was awesome, close to the subway and dining!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and great price off of Hotwire.com”
Reviews.Author: lovemyaspen
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 21st of the North tower which had great veiws if the river and we could also see Fenway from our room. The room was clean, somewhat small but I think most rooms in Boston are small. The bathroom had a good size tub with a big shower head. Another awesome thing about this hotel is that it is connected to the prudential center, you don't have to leave the hotel to go to it. It is a very nice feature for when it is raining and you want to get something to eat. We booked this hotel on hotwire and got a awesome price of less than $110 a night, which was awesome BC everything is in walking distance including Fenway. I wouldn't pay the normal asking price per night but the hotwire price is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Susan39564
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here and we were able to turn in points to stay on the Club floor. The view of the River from our room was wonderful, the Continental breakfast was fabulous, and the complimentary evening appetizers were lovely!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, inviting hotel. No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: phillyjolie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend while we attended an event at the Hynes. Very convienient location - attached to the Prudential Center Mall & Hynes. There is a T stop inside the Prudential very close to the hotel enterance so I was able to come in on the train from the airport for only a few dollars. I booked a room with one queen size bed which was very small. The bed basically took up the entire room. I didn't mind the room being so small since we just needed a place to sleep at night and it was close to the elevator and had a great view of Cambridge/MIT. The staff were friendly but I'm not the type of person that usually requires much from them. I will probably stay at this hotel again if the price is right. My room looked like it had been recently renovated with modern sleek furniture. I had friends that stayed at this hotel in 2010 and their room looked nothing like mine (it had more of a dated motel look). I'm not sure if all of the rooms have been renovated or not so they may not all be as modern. The hotel bar was nice in the lobby. The entire lobby/lounge area had a very relaxed and inviting feel. The bar iteself wasn't too expensive, but I only ordered a few beers which usually don't break the bank. Met a lot of interesting people at the bar which really enhanced the atmosphere. In my opinion, this area is one of the best locations to stay in Boston as there are a ton of restaurants and shopping nearby (a pretty equal amount of chains and local stuff at various price levels) and public transportation to take you everywhere else. The Christian Science center is nearby which is worth a visit even if you're not religious and it's an easy walk to the Public Gardens/the Common.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, but the quality of the stay felt a little cheap”
Reviews.Author: SGNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May for a reunion and was a little disappointed. First, the benefits of the place: I was upgraded to a suite, which had a great view of the Christian Science complex. There was a small sitting area. Internet access (which I had to pay for) was fast. Room service was fast (really fast) and pleasant. But, the minuses: scratchy, polyestery sheets. Windows don't open. Chintzy towels (like the kind you get at the gym), and cheap toiletries. And the upholstery on the furniture in the sitting areas had several stains on them. I chose the hotel because I was offered a really reasonable rate, and the reunion was taking place downstairs in the ballroom. But, I had just spent the prior weekend in the Washington Hilton, which served a similar purpose (large conference hotel) and felt that the quality of the rooms were far better. Boston hotels are more expensive than other large cities. But next time, I would rather spend a little extra money for a little more luxury

Reviews.Title: “Great location for visiting Boston”
