Reviews.Author: p0ssum11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while my husband attended a conference and I enjoyed tagging along to explore a new city. Since the weather was iffy it was nice to not have to go outdoors to go to restaurants or shop. Our room was supposed to have a king sized bed - if it was a king - it was the smallest I have ever seen! Since we were there for 5 days a larger room would have been nice. I don't know if it is because our room was handicapped accessible ( not our choice) but there was only one chair in the room so even while watching TV one of us had to sit on the bed. Checkin and the service from the hotel employees was great. We spent a couple of evening in the bar watching the Celtics games and enjoyed it quite a bit. Overall - it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Restored our sanity”
Reviews.Author: TomfromBalaclava
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a horror flight from Australia - delayed 12 hours in LAX and also lost our only suitase en-route. The Sheraton was a great place to restore our sanity - very comfortable room, good location (attached to the Prudential centre and close to everything), and last but not least, free internet terminals in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, connected to Hynes Convention Center, Prudential Center, and quick access to Newbury Street”
Reviews.Author: BeATraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a king room, 23rd floor, in the south tower, overlooking the First Church of Christ Scientist grounds. The lobby is very large with multiple places to gather, with free internet and use of multiple computers next to the Starbucks. My room was large with a nearly floor-to-ceiling window wall and a great view of the city. The bathroom was small and needs updating (pink tile shower surround -- really?), but very functional. I did not stay in the room very much during my stay, but the room was always quiet and comfortable--what more could I ask? The convenience of being located near everything in the Back Bay was the greatest asset to the hotel. If you take the escalators in the lobby to the second floor and pass the Sheraton meeting rooms, you have great access to the Hynes Convention Center as well as shopping and restaurants in the Prudential Center and along Newbury Street. It was a 5min walk to the public gardens of Boston Commons and an easy walk to downtown and the Freedom Trail. It's nice to have free wifi and computers in the lobby, but you still pay for internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dragonhart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton in Boston for four days. We had a great time. It is located close to many attractions and public transportation ( the T and bus lines). Within walking distance of Newbury Street, Copley square, the Boston public library and many other intresting sights. Many choices of restaurents and bars near by. Everyone we met at the hotel was very nice and customer service oriented. We had an amazing room with a view on the 29th floor. We can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We were overwhelmed!”
Reviews.Author: cockcrofthall
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation following my diagnosis of cancer. I requested a room in the quiet part of the hotel and to our amazement we were upgraded to a club room. This was a wonderful surprise and I would like to take this opportunity to say a very big thankyou. Your generosity was overwhelming and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The reception staff were very friendly and the staff in the club lounge were wonderful. The newly refurbished gym was great and the location of the hotel was spot on. Once again thankyou for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: BookbuyerMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in May using the birthday promotion which was excellent value. Wonderful room with a privacy screen to separate us from our 3 & 5 year old children (a nice feature seeing as we were about to spend the next seven weeks travelling around the world). Fantastic view from the room. Avoid valet parking as there is direct access to hotel from the public car park downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelmom006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Boston June 9th-12th while our son was attending music camp at Berklee. We cannot say enough good things about our stay. The location was convenient to the college. Also connected to the Prudential center that had great restaurants, shops, and a wonderful food court. Also attached to the subway which provided easy access for sight-seeing. We got a terrific rate via priceline for 2 rooms. At first we were a little apprehensive, worrying that we would get a room that is outdated since we got such a great rate. What a surprise! Our room was spacious, clean, and couldn't have been lovelier! The elevators were so efficient. Never had to wait to wait longer than 1 min. The pool was large and clean. The workout area was top-notch. The hours for both areas were convenient. The beds were very comfortable. Nice TV. Many channels. If we had to come with one area that could be improved, we would say the bathroom was a bit small. However it was modern and clean so a minor inconvenience. If we ever go to Boston again, we would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royality”
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Sheraton in the Prudential Center each year for the past 3 years. Over the last 2 years, the hotel was being renovated. When we returned this year, all the renovations had been complete. The Room: The views from the room were really nice looking towards the downtown area and the Backbay. The King bed was incredibly comfortable. They offer free Wifi and nice Starbucks coffee in the room. Amenities Although we didn't have time, I would have like to use the pool/gym. The mornings offer free breakfast of bagels, cereal, fruit and Starbucks coffee to get your days started. That was very much appreciated. One of the things that I like best about this location is the access to the other shops in the Prudential Center. We enjoyed dinner at P.F. Changs and could shop without ever leaving the building. Also being a Starwood rewards member also provided me with upgrades and free appetizers at the Sheraton bar. The stay at the Sheraton has only gotten better each year.

Reviews.Title: “Bustling Hotel in the Heart of the City!”
Reviews.Author: Czern
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days in April during the Boston Marathon and totally enjoyed it! Upon check in we were welcomed by a really nice guy who was friendly and very welcoming, wish I remembered his name. The room was recently renovated and was spacious and well appointed. There was a nice gym and indoor pool which is important to us since we are athletic and the location could not be beat! This hotel is connected to a large shopping center that even had a Church which made it easy for me to attend Mass, in addition there are numerous restaurants in the mall and a large food court. There is a Starbucks in the lobby of the hotelso you don't have to sit down to eat breakfast if you are on the run.It is also connected to the Convention Center. Boston is such a walkable Town so park the car and walk or use the Metro. I would stay here again and in fact, will next year for the Marathon. My only complaint is that the parking fees are exorbitant, even higher than in NYC where we live.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ohio63
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 4 or 5 times, and it has been a great experience each time. The hotel is located near a subway stop, restaurants, and shopping. The staff is very helpful, and the rooms are nice and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gadawg34
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! Great location and they allowed us to check into our room early. The staff was helpful in providing information on the area and even suggestions for dining and shopping. The hotel and rooms are clean although the bathrooms are a bit dated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Close to Fenway”
Reviews.Author: CCCharland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a Business Conference. The room was clean and comfortable. We had room service one day and dont recommend it - overpriced and food was lukewarm and eggs were rubbery. The hotel is connected to the Mall and is close to many excellent restaurants. We had a handicap room and the shower had a handheld shower sprayer but it was an older model and didnt work very well - this should be updated ASAP. The sheets were scratchy so we didnt sleep very well because of this. Parking was expensive around $40/night. All in All it was an ok visit - would choose this hotel again because of the location and not because of the comfort or food. They have been doing a big renovation at this hotel but I think they should have spent alittle on the shower, sheets, and food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: shiridh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice in terms of facilities and rooms. We usually do low-cost/high-value so 3-3.5 stars. This time my husband scored this one at "name your price" so we got a very good deal. Great location in the back bay right next to Prudential center. Note that there's no free wifi in the rooms, since it's a high-end hotel they charge extra for that. But lobby has wifi access for 45 minutes at a stretch. Had some trouble with that connection, and service on the issue was far from amazing. I really liked their option to opt-out of room service for $5 food/drinks coupon or 500 Starwood Preferred points given for each day you waive (except your last day). We're SPG members so we took the points happily for the two days we could. (We usually put a do-not-disturb sign on our door anyhow.) The valet was amazingly nice and helped me out of a bind (held the car for me for free for 15 minutes while I checked into the room). I didn't have cash to tip him, and when I tried to leave a tip at the concierge, I later discovered it was given to some other guy. Doh! All in all, it was a very pleasant stay and I would stay there again. Just be aware that the service is not the best out there. Still the hotel rooms are very clean, large and quite fancy by our standards. It's also walking distance to lots of attractions, and right on the T stop as well, so super convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cherco1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Sheraton June 3-10. Got the hotel at a great rate via Hotwire ($116 for 2 double beds). The hotel lobby is very nice, equipped with computers, WIFI, Starbucks, Restaurant/Lounge (expensive!) and a couple of shops. We notified the hotel that we would be arriving early (10am) and our room was ready! We requested a fridge and that too was waiting for us in the room (came in very handy - you should ask for this in advanced, as they only have a limited amount). Our room was nice, very comfy beds, bathroom has a large counter. Our room was noisy since it was right next to the elevator and ice machine, but I came with ear plugs so it didnt keep me up at night. You could hear other guests in the hallways (thin walls). The fitness room was excellent - very nice cardio machines. No free WIFI in the rooms themselves which was a drawback, had to go to the lobby to use free WIFI or the computers on site. Computers in the lobby had a printer you could use to print boarding passes etc. Arranged a trip to Wrentham Outlets via the hotel - this was quick and easy and well worth the day trip (great shopping). Overall the staff were helpful and friendly. Very easy to get a cab back to the airport, no need to book in advanced. The hotel's location is what sells it! It's attached to the Prudential Centre, which is attached to Copley - tons of shopping/restaurants and never have to step outside! It is about a 10-15 minute walk to Fenway and lots of site seeing around the neighbourhood. Trolley Tour picks you up right outside the hotel (couldnt ask for anything better!) I would recommend this hotel and would definitely go back~! Next time though, in advanced of arriving, I would ask for a quiet room, with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: Foghorn13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the the Sheraton for 4 nights with a "reduced" rate for Friends and Family. Good things: 26th floors. Great view of the Christian Scientist 's beautiful dome and church. Beds cannot be beat. Quiet. Relatively clean. Bad things: Scuffs on wall. One of the 3 bathroom light fixtures was missing so I looked like I had a case of jaundice. Outdated sink and faucets. Room was a little cramped. Price per night was excessive and that's with the special rate. Reception check-in was slow even though we were the only customers at the desk. If these are updated rooms, I wouldn't want to see the originals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great location but hotel outdated”
Reviews.Author: place-name-here
Reviews.Content: I am very particular about 2 things: location and cleanliness/maintenance If you're looking for a central location in Boston close to everything I highly recommend this hotel. The lobby is huge and well done but this is what majority of their clients probably see since its a hotel 85% dedicated to conferences and convention goers. The upkeep of the rooms are questionable though, the bathroom is the first place i look when checking into a room and it was disappointing. There was mold on the shower tiles and on the ceiling, the bathtub's paint was peeling (i didn't even know it could peel), the shower drain was 85% clogged, the toilet barely flushed, and the mirrors were filthy. I think the hotel decided to replace the sink and counter because these looked newer. Outside of the bathroom the room was spacious and the sheets were clean. There was NO mini fridge which was a huge inconvenience and the air conditioner made choking noises that we had to deal with or suffer with a overstuffed room. It's about time this hotel renovates their rooms but maybe they feel because its a convention mecca they have no need to? On the flip side the bed was very comfortable and looked clean, no worries on the sleep quality.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, a must stay!!”
Reviews.Author: redjimmy
Reviews.Content: this is the best hotel we have stayed in,really lovely hotel and staff very very helpful especially lady on concierge desk who helped us with a phone call issue thank you.all round you will not get a better hotel in boston,really clean and modern facilities brilliant and overall clean and for a tourist an excellent hotel for all the sights and shopping,we have been in boston 4 times now and it just gets better each visit,lots to do,the T and walking let`s you see all you need,the duck tours and bean trolley tours are worth the money all in all boston is fab and the sheraton is fantastic stay here and you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel2012
Reviews.Content: I got an amazing deal for this hotel (about $110/night), and was attending a business meeting in Boston, so thought I would try it out. I stayed for 3 nights. After reading the mixed Trip Advisor Reviews, I was a little worried, but overall, was pleasantly surprised during my stay. Here are my thoughts: Pros: -Location! The location is amazing. It is basically connected to the Prudential Center, which connects to a bunch of other things as well (shopping, subway, restaurants). As well, it is in a great and convenient area in town. -Service: pretty good. The front desk and concierge are very nice and helpful. -Price: I got a great price. -Rooms: The rooms seem newly renovated, so the furniture and decor is nice compared to some Sheratons (and even some higher end hotels) I've been to. VERY clean. Love the Sheraton beds. Cons: -Thin walls. I would hear people talking outside in the hallway (luckily this didn't happen at night when I was trying to fall asleep), and also the shower running in other adjacent rooms. -Common areas...some areas could use some renos. -Big groups of what looked like high school kids sitting in the lobby all the time.

Reviews.Title: “It ended up being a huge disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Holnek
Reviews.Content: I would've given 4 stars for this property, but my trip was ruined immediately after checking out at the front desk. Before going into that, a few things that I've liked about the Sheraton: - Great front desk staff - very attentive, knowledgeable, nice, courteous, and fast - lobby - great lobby with computers/internet, sitting areas, starbucks, games, etc. - rooms are consistent with what you would find at any other descent Sheraton - clean and recently renovated - location - if you've done some research, you already know that you can't go wrong by staying here. Other comparable choices would be Westin, Marriott, or the Hilton (however, for Hilton, you will have to cross the road to get into Prudential). Now, to the bad things and why this property can only get a 2 star, if not worse. - The bell desk is horrible. We were in line for about 15 min to check our luggage at the Bell desk since we had a few hours to kill. You can tell that they are pretty slow if we had to wait for 15 min already. In any case, there were many people behind us in line. Two bellmen were there. However, they dismissed our request to check our bags and told us to ask someone else to help us...wtf...they are the only ones there! To make things worse, they would go to those behind us and pick up bags for them...Very rude Bell Desk staff, and I was very offended by their attitude and behavior. People behind us even asked the Bell desk to help us since we were ahead in line, but since they were anxious to get tip, they wanted to pick up bags as opposed to check them in. Anyway, we ended up waiting for about 30-40 min...terrible. Some other cons about this property - rooms: although the rooms appear to be recently renovated, you can tell that the property is slightly dated by some of the details - need more front desk staff - while each staff is relatively quick, they cannot seem to handle the volume of people staying at the property - Internet is $9.95 for 24 h (not necessarily a bad thing, but just FYI) - No lobby convenient store - need to walk to Hilton or Walgreens - Rooms are quite small, particularly if you have a King bed room. Our party also had a two double bed room, and the room is considerably nicer/bigger. - Water pressure is so so. Not too bad considering it's Boston. - You can definitely hear people in the hallways. - Small pool - it's deifnitely not like the pictures you see on their website

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms with a AWESOME pool”
Reviews.Author: Kalib159
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here on our last trip to Boston because the subway was located in the same building and we thought since we were travelling with kids it might make it easier for us. Having the "T" right there in the prudential center was awesome. The hotel was hosting a convention while we were there which made getting elevators impossible. The rooms are what my husband called "city size". Our room had 2 beds a tv and a chair and desk. If someone was sitting at the desk you couldn't walk by them you had to either get them to move or crawl on the bed to get by. The bathroom was the smallest bathroom I had ever seen. The pool on the other hand was awesome. It had a roof that opened and closed depending on the weather and there were never many people there. The kids really enjoyed it. I wouldn't say we would never stay there again I think though we may look at other options before booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: joevdenne
Reviews.Content: We found a great deal for this hotel. The location was good. The rooms were very clean and nice. Elevators were really fast. The staff was nice including the concierge. It is attached to the Prudential Center with plenty of shopping. Great place to stay while in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: cctravelerCctx
Reviews.Content: Got a great room through Hotwire and was once again very satisfied. Starbucks downstairs, free wifi, along with 5 available computers. Lots of sitting areas with televisions-great for watching Boston sports as a group. One more stay coming up-hoping it's a good as the last 2 stays.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Grant0416
Reviews.Content: Staying here right now. 5 nights. Cons: at first we were put in a room right next to the ice machine. Horrendous noise. Asked to be moved and then got a co-joining room with a family next door. The walls are as thin as paper in the Sheraton Boston. You hear EVERYTHING. My gfirlfriend and I can hear every word of the people next door even when they are whispering so you can imagine how bad it gets ! But it gets worse. Seems we have all the hotels pipes running down the side of our room. Toilet flushes, shower noise etc every 5 minutes. The shower is broken with little water pressure. No fridge. Pros: service is ok. Staff are friendly enough. Free internet. Reasonably handy to things. Nice lobby. We've got 2 more nights. Very tired. No sleep. Beware. The Sheraton Boston is a bit tired and certainly suffers from room noise. Badly. Maybe we got shafted coz we booked through Hotwire ? Who knows.

Reviews.Title: “Really good location”
Reviews.Author: BUSTYBREEZER
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the hotel in May 2011, and we had a really nice time. The rooms were spacious and had recently been renovated. The only thing that was odd was that the rooms had roman blinds and the other tower which doesnt look as if it has been renovated was directly opposite us; so to change ect we had to close the blinds all the time as the windows are quite large and you can see in all the rooms opposite. Our check in and the elevators were really efficient. The hotel is huge and while we were there, there were a number of graduation events and conferences, which didnt really effect us. The hotel is ideally located and the sightseeing buses and ducktours leave from the hotel. You have a number of dining options at the Prudential tower which is attached to the hotel which includes loads of shops and PF Changs, Cheesecake factory and five napking burger, legal seafoods ect. We hired a car at Hertz which is also based at the hotel which was convienient. If you have never visted Boston before I would recommend the hotel and also the orange city sighseeing tours which were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: altagal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights at the end of May 2011. We had booked and paid in advance for our room to get a more reasonable rate. Our room in the North Tower had a great view of the city and had been recently renovated. Quite spacious. The location of the hotel was fantastic. We had turned in our rental car and certainly didn't miss it. We took advantage of the Old Town Trolley tour that stopped right in front of hotel and also used the subway to get around. Staff at the front desk very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons - Sheraton Boston versus Sheraton Commander Cambridge”
Reviews.Author: Gemma'smum
Reviews.Content: If you are SPG members and interested in Cash and Points stays, this review is meant for you. Although we have stayed in both of these hotels numerous times, we stayed at both of them during this past trip to Boston - We were at the Sheraton Boston for 5 nights and the Commander for 2 nights. Locations- The Sheraton Boston is attached to the shops and restaurants of the Prudential building, has 3 T stops within a short walk, is near Berkelee School of Music and very close to Boylston and Newberry Streets. It has easy entrance onto the freeway. The Sheraton Commander is in Cambridge near Harvard and has all of the charm of the shops and restaurants of Cambridge. The T stop is a 10 minute walk. Entry on and off the freeway is a little more difficult, but possible. Rooms - The Sheraton Boston has views and is multi-story with quick elevators and modern rooms. It is huge and a typical conference center hotel. The toiletries in the room are minimal. The corner suites are very spacious and modern. Rooms are similar. The Sheraton Commander is in a character filled older building, but is completely remodeled and very nice. Elevators are quirky. Toiletries are better and more plentiful. My daughter says their rollaway beds are far more comfortable as well. Air conditioning can be very noisy. No views. The rooms are spacious and very nice. I have stayed in 3 different styles (King, Double & Suite) over the years. The Suites have two bedrooms and a living room which is wonderful for families. Service - Parking at the Sheraton Boston is expensive. Service is mayhem and can be very slow. Front desk is helpful. We had to request a rollaway 4 times. Once by email. Once by phone. Once when we arrived. Once with housekeeping and 8 hours later from the front desk. The pool is nice but no attendant means towels everywhere and wild kids. The gym had a lot of kids 10-14 every morning. The bar was a total disappointment. 3 of the drinks we asked for on the cocktail list were not available. Service was sad and noone seemed to know what they were doing on the 4 times we went to the bar. The Sheraton Commander has a parking attendants next to the hotel making retrieving your car (especially for early morning flights) easy. Parking is nearly half the price of the Sheraton Boston. The service at the Commander is better in every way. The front desk is bright and informed. The bar is far far nicer and very accommodating. They were clearly professionals and since the remodel it is a nice place to sit. Which is the better hotel? They both have their pluses and it really depends what you plan to do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service! Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: sarahmas
Reviews.Content: From the moment I booked this hotel stay, I have been treated with respect by the considerate and friendly Sheraton staff. When I originally booked this hotel room through a block for my college reunion weekend, I wasn't sure of my flight plans. I booked Thursday and Friday nights. Last week, when I decided I was taking the redeye and wouldn't need the room Thursday night, they happily revised my reservation with no penalty. This morning, I got to the hotel a bit bleary-eyed aftr my overnight flight. No room was open yet, but the desk attendant offered a key to the fitness center and recommended I come back to check in on availability. I got a workout in in the really well-equipped center, and planned to use the roomy and clean locker room shower to get ready. I thought it wouldn't hurt to check in with the desk, and surprise! My room was ready! The room is clean and the bed is great. The fixtures could use a bit of updating, but they are all in good shape. I like my nice view of Mass Ave and the Christ Scientist church complex. There's free wi-fi and a Starbucks in the lobby (paid wi-fi in the guest rooms). I am so pleased with my experience at the Sheraton. With hotels being such a commodity these days, this experience will drive me towards choosing Sheraton over other comparable hotel chains in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for conference and shopping”
Reviews.Author: zabo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Sheraton whilst attending a conference in Boston and choose this hotel above others as it was ideally located and had direct access to the Hynes Conference centre as well as Prudential centre with shops and food court. This is a very busy business hotel with all facilities and the lobby always a hub of activity. Its ideal location so close to Boylston Rd and Newbury as well as shopping Malls , conferencing centre, The Prudential and train lines makes it a very popular hotel. Although there are many other 5 star hotels in the vicinity, I think the Sheraton has the best location. Rooms were comfortable and bed quality was excellent. However I found the bathroom very small and basic. Although WIFI is free in the lobby, internet access in the rooms comes with a charge. Considering that this is a business hotel, I would expect it to be free. The hotel does have a Starbucks in the lobby as well and the nearby Prudential shopping mall has an ample food court as well as many other dining options, so eating is never a problem. With limited time trying to attend as many conference sessions as possible as well as take in the sights of Boston such as Harvard, Quincy Market , Newbury and Boylston roads, as well as the Boston Common and Gardens, the train line is also well located for easy transportation. So to summerise: Good for Conferencing Comfortable rooms and beds Shopping location Good dining in vicinity Easy to access transportation Close enough to river and gardens Negatives: Small bathroom Busy concierge so be prepared to carry your own luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Better options elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: travelKC66205
Reviews.Content: So, the 2 most important things to me in a hotel; good beds and bedding, and good AC/heat. The Sheraton had very nice beds and bedding, however, the AC (80 degrees outside) was so poor that I never could get the room cool. With the fan on high, it barely blew any cool air. It was very uncomfortable. Good location, nice staff, average room service. But it just needs to be comfortable, so I would not return. Also, paint was peeling off the bathtub??

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: DogsFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May 2011. The check-in was quick and our room was ready and nicely cooled when we arrived. The free bottle of water was a nice touch and there was an in-room coffee maker with 3 kinds of coffee and two kinds of tea. Free Wi-fi is in the lobby. The beds were extremely comfortable. My only complaint was that we were in a room which had a connecting door to the room next to us. I woke up at about 2 AM when I heard moaning and realized it was actually an X rated movie rented by our neighbor. The next day I could hear every word of his phone conversation as he planned to meet with a friend. Not much privacy there! As others have said, this hotel is very centrally located. Walk right out and catch the T or a taxi. If you go before July be sure to plan time to visit the Boston Fine Arts Museum. The new building is amazing and the Chihuly show is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: icanflossu
Reviews.Content: I love reading reviews and researching EVERYTHING before I travel. The reviews on this property are so all over the place that I was initially concerned about staying here when I booked it four months in advance on HotWire. Every concern I had was not valid. The staff was wonderful. Although there was a line at checkin it went very quickly and with no time we were called over to the platinum line for check in. I room wasn't quite ready so they said they would find another room for us and that took all of about three and half minutes. We were so pleasantly surprised when we walked into our room on the 19th floor and saw how large and nice it was. The best part was the view to Fenway (the whole reason we came to Boston). The bathroom was very well stocked and the shower was wonderful. Plenty of hot water and great pressure. We needed bedding for the sofa bed and it was delivered very quickly. The location was perfect and we will definitely stay there again when we return to Boston. Take some of these reviews with a grain of salt. Some people want Four Season accommodations at Holiday Inn prices. This is a wonderful hotel with great amenities and is offered at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable big conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: abcdxyz
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston the second week of May, 2011 for 5 days of sightseeing. Normally, I travel on the cheap and would never spend the $$ to stay at a Sheraton, but I got a great deal through Hotwire for a 3 1/2 star hotel in Back Bay and was thrilled to get this hotel. The Sheraton is clearly a big conference hotel and has the amenities and rooms to match. The location is great, with a huge mall with restaurants and a T station directly accessible from the second floor of the hotel. I had breakfast every day at Au Bon Pain in the mall, and traveled everywhere by T from the station in the mall. The Old Town Trolley also stops right outside the front door of the hotel--very convenient! I had a nice time in Boston, and the Sheraton was a great place for me to stay.

Reviews.Title: “2814 noise”
Reviews.Author: miss58
Reviews.Content: This room is horrible!! We were below the executive breakfast lounge and at 6:30 am we could hear all the noise of tables and chairs moving above us until we had to get up from misery!!! Nice hotel but stay away from this room!!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TristaL_11
Reviews.Content: I haven't even stayed at this hotel yet and I honestly don't even want to!!!!! I can't believe how rude their staff is!!!!! Oh, and I will never book through Expedia again (which I realized later was the same price as their website) They will treat you like 2nd class citizens!! Unreal! I booked a room through Expedia and called the hotel to ask if I could get double beds. The woman said, "There will be no problem because you are calling so far in advance". (3 months to be exact!) That's all I wanted! So I called a few months later and never in my life have I dealt with the most obnoxious, rude people you will ever meet! I was put on hold multiple times, one time for 40 minutes just to be put into a random voicemail! I work in customer service and she should have picked up the phone and asked me if I could be directed somewhere else or if there was any other way she could help!!! Every person I talked to was pretty much said "You booked through Expedia so toooo bad"!!! WHEN IN FACT IT WAS THE SAME PRICE AS THEIR WEBSITE!!!!!!! I also asked if I could get a roll-away bed. NOPE! Not allowed in this room!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! BEYOND UPSET!!!! I am meeting friends at this hotel that I haven't seen in years and I guess we will all be just sleeping on the floor!!!!!!!!! AWESOME, THANK YOU SHERATON!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: natrat
Reviews.Content: I attended a meeting at Hynes Convention Center. The Hotwire price was about 40% off the convention rate. Rooms were clean. Elevators were easy to get. Easy to get to subway. Lot of shopping and restaurants around. Maid staff was honest - I left my wallet in the room when I checked out. I got back to the room and found the tip had been taken but my wallet was on the table without any contents missing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was okay, staff did not come through”
Reviews.Author: egyptianruin
Reviews.Content: I requested a fridge for my room due to medical reasons. I did not get one. I was told repeatedly I would have one and one never arrived for the entire three days I had to stay. We requested the Quiet Side for a convention that is often loud and having to work during the con we like to go to bed at a reasonable time. Even on the Quiet Side people ran up and down the hallways screaming at 3am. Room was much smaller than the last time we stayed for the same exact price. If the hotel wasn't the place I had to stay for the convention I wouldn't stay there - overpriced. Valet was nice, bell clerks were also nice and room service was fast and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: 21Ross
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Boston for 5 night. Were on the 26th floor & had access to the club lounge which included breakfast, which consisted of assorted fresh fruits, pastries, bread, bagels, yoghurts, cereal bars, juices, selection of teas & coffee & toaster. It made for a perfect start to our day. There was also a fridge with soft drinks & water & interest access. The club lounge has a beautiful view over Charles River. Our room was lovely & spacious. The bed was so comfortable - had the best sleeps ever. Bathroom was a bit small, but was immaculately clean & well stocked with towels & toiletries. Check in was very quick & the concierge was very help with booking trips. The trolley tour is worth doing as you get your bearings for the city. Went to Wrentham outlets which can be booked at hotel for $42 & they pick you up & drop off outside hotel. They stop off at other hotels along the way, but it didn't take too long as we were out at the outlets about 75mins after being picked up. The Chessecake Factory is right beside the hotel in the Prudential Centre. Great for food. There are also a number of good Irish Bars nearby like Lir on Boylston Street, which was also good for food. There are great Italian restaurants in the North End. Have a great stay at the Sheraton Boston & will definetly return. It was very handy having a shopping mall attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated”
Reviews.Author: travelbug61
Reviews.Content: When I won this hotel as an Expedia Unpublished Rate hotel, I felt disappointed, because I had stayed here some years ago, and found it shabby and worn. Well, I needn't have worried, because the hotel has since been renovated, and my room seemed brand-new. Even though I had a deeply discounted, prepaid rate, I was able to get a top (29th) floor room. The receptionist did warn me that the room was next to the elevators and would be noisy. This didn't bother me, as I had earplugs, so I slept like a lamb. Without earplugs, though, the elevators would make quite a racket. My bedroom was spacious and well decorated. The only things missing that would have made it perfect were a safe and a mini-fridge. The bathroom was very small but sparkling clean and perfectly functioning. No free wi-fi in the room, but it worked great in the lobby. Great location, very safe and convenient. Overall, a very pleasant weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sara7420
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 10 year old daughter at the Sheraton Boston after getting a deeply discounted rate via Hotwire. As it was my daughter's first trip to Boston, I requested a room on the highest floor possible and we were given a room on the 25th floor. The views over the Christian Science HQ and the rest of the city were amazing. The room was modern and clean with a well-equipped bathroom. The beds were very comfortable and we really enjoyed our swim in the pool. The only minor annoyance was that the Sheraton charges $9.95 for internet access. The location is absolutely fantastic and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Coilltebabe99
Reviews.Content: I traveled under a travel agent rate so we paid a reduced fare, had we paid full cost I probably would have demanded a refund. The doormen and valet at this hotel were not simply bad, they were exceptionally rude, given that this is the very first impression one gets of the hotel it really didn't set us up for a great stay. The hotel is excellently located and I would guess that is the only reason they may get repeat guests as the service overall was deplorable. The staff in the on site Starbucks were a pleasure, always friendly and happy to see you. Tip for families with infants, bring your own pack and play, the crib provided is unsafe, our 6 month old got his leg trapped in the crib bar.

Reviews.Title: “Well located for access to Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: LondonSunseeker22
Reviews.Content: good location with easy access to the T and the shops in the Prudential Center.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay on a cold night in Boston”
Reviews.Author: AnyMajorDude
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to Boston on an impromptu overnight getaway. Being a Starwood member I opted to pick out a property in their realm, and they had some decent rates that night. The valet parking was quick and efficient both arriving and leaving. The lobby was full of a very loud, young party, but that was as noisy as the place got. Upon check-in, the clerk was friendly (and recognized my club membership). Most staffers you would run into in the hallways would greet you as well. We ended up in a 24th floor corner room looking at the Prudential Center from one side and the Christian Science HQ on the other side. It was the perfect romantic view. The room wasn't huge but it was sufficient for a couple with a king bed. The bathroom was clean and modern. Additionally, the wind was whipping and it was brutally cold that night, but outside of a stray siren or two at street level you couldn't hear the wind blow much at all, even given that there was a bit more window than wall compared to most hotel rooms. Given the aforementioned midwinter chill, we opted to walk to the connected Shops at Prudential to grab some dinner. We didn't really bother with any hotel amenities but the lobby bar looked nice upon walking by. Only thing that went wrong was our ironing board was pretty much a twisted wreck, otherwise the Sheraton Boston is a place I'd easily stay at again, especially in foul weather.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to get a remodeled room”
Reviews.Author: suzyhBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed in corner room on the South Tower (1465). The two windows were breathtaking. We did not have a remodeled room, and clearly the bathroom requires an update as there was mold on the ceiling. But we really enjoyed our stay and the location is perfect. The housekeeping service was very professional, timely and something we noticed enough to mention. I did not catch her name, but she needs to be recognized Do not hesitate to stay there â€“ but ask for a room that has been through their remodeling efforts.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, Brilliant Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: rocco85
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent for exploring all Boston has to offer. It is attached to a shopping center and has easy access to everything. The rooms are very modern and the staff were exceptional. I would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: redsoxowen
Reviews.Content: Hotel has had a upgrade since the last time we stayed at this hotel. Very nice with the rooms being a good size. Downside is the staff. Bag check area is a total mess. People standing everywhere with no order. The people checking bags are slow and pick people at random to help. Be warned the staff check the tips you give them and then look rudely at you if you have not given them enough. As much as we liked the hotel would not use again as the bag check took a good ten minutes with no order and the staff are slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheLSUguy
Reviews.Content: Spend two nights in Boston for the Yankees/Sox home opener and had a great time. The hotel staff was very friendly. It was a great location. We walked to Fenway park, took the T-train to downtown, and the bus to Harvard square. Right in the middle of many things. The club lounge hit the spot every morning. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Rooms were very clean and spacious. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CaliLeo
Reviews.Content: Location-location-location. This hotel has a great location and for that reason alone I would stay there again. The fitness center and pool are more than ample for exercise. The room is a bit on the small side and my view was not optimal as I had to look at a rusty building. My one true complaint is my bathroom was incredibly small. Two people, forget it. However the bed was extremely cozy and provided a great nights sleep. The room was quiet and the staff was courteous and helpful. You can get to almost anywhere by foot from the hotel. If you are staying I recommend the freedom trail which starts just a few blocks away and the duck tours. Hint, if you do the freedom trail wait until you get in to N. Boston (lil Italy) to eat. AMAZING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: wwotn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights and the location is great joining the Prudential Mall with plenty of shops and restaurants you can even get the T (subway) from the Mall The Legal Seafood is a MUST food 1st class. We were upgraded to a suite as it was my husband's birthday and the fridge and kettle we requested were waiting in the room on arrival. The room was on 16th floor and the views over the Charles River were superb. The staff were all very helpful but special mention to John the Concierge was great I did not have my laptop but if you are a guest you have free access to computers next to the Concierge desk. A trip up to the Skywalk on top of the Prudential building is a must and the restaurant on the 52 floor has great views and wonderful food. We travelled to Hyannis on the Saturday but it was bitter cold and snowing the season does not start to April but it didn't put us off I will certainly use this hotel again Thanks to everyone who made our stay so great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerTom
Reviews.Content: Once again a really nice stay at the Sheraton Boston. I was upgraded to a club room on top of the free valet parking promo they have going now. First time at a club room here, and both the club room and the bedroom really are of a high quality fit and finish. Nice design touches abound...maybe this was part of the Sheraton renewal project? Highly recommended & great location, too.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: sanibeltravler
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Sheraton Boston and had quick, easy check-in. Room was newly renovated and very nice with view of the cityscape. Maybe a bit small, but very comfy bedding. I don't like to pay for internet$9.95 per day in the room, but know that most convention hotels do charge . Checked out pool/fitness room, nice but no hot tub. Conveniently located adjoining Prudential Center with lots of shops and restaurants. Housekeeping very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: ruqus
Reviews.Content: I showed up with a shirt straight out of the package, so many wrinkles so little time. Last time I ironed in the room I burnt my shirt. So I really needed housekeeping. When I got to Boston the service was close or could not get the shirt back to me in time for my conference. The housekeeping lead on duty, Luzia, said she would take care of it for me. What a great attitude, making sure my needs were met.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stay at the Sheraton!”
Reviews.Author: karenoid
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night at the Boston Sheraton while in town for business; and I have to say I was very impressed with the overall experience. The staff were all very friendly and professional, the room spacious and bright, and the location could not have been more convenient. There was one minor issue where I left behind a small, but expensive item in my room after checkout. When I called the hotel that evening to see if it had been collected by housekeeping, I was told that it had not. I was a little dismayed by this, and believe that housekeeping may have accidentally thrown out the object, not realizing it's value. When I expressed my disappointment, the housekeeping supervisor immediately offered to reimburse me for the item. I was very grateful for this offer, and did take them up on it. I think it shows a great concern for customer satisfaction that many hotels often fail to express. I will definitely stay at the Sheraton Boston the next time in town. And hopefully I will get to enjoy the hotel for more than just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel-Great location”
Reviews.Author: SekouRachel
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was friendly, room was clean and very comfortable, outstanding views, located next to many restaurants, shops, and the T train. There is a Starbucks, a restaurant, and a bar (which my husband enjoyed very much) and room service. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Read mine...I'm honest about it all! :)”
Reviews.Author: DonnasVirginia
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews, I wasn't sure if it would be the perfect place to stay, but because it was what we got on Hotwire, I was very happy w/ 1-the price, and 2-mostly everything about the hotel. We stayed at the Hilton right next door, and I have to agree with some reviewers that I would expect Sheraton to have a more comfortable bed...these beds are not the "Ahhh" type when you hop in...pretty firm, and the linen definitely wasn't of highest quality. The sheets and one cover actually felt very stiff, not like some other cozy ones (like Hilton's/Marriot's). The hotel itself is very clean, very pretty, and the service was wonderful!! Each time I called with a question, the staff members weren't the same, yet all very friendly. EVERYONE working there was friendly from what I saw. The housekeeper was especially nice and took great care of us (so take care of them, they work hard) :) Internet was NOT free in the room--another minus, but you could head to the lobby where many computers are free to be used. However, it does make it inconvenient not being offered for free in the rooms. The location is great, too...right next to the Prudential Center, or stay in the hotel and walk to the Hynes (the walk is indoor w/ a lot of shopping). All in all, I think everything was great about the hotel, but they could upgrade their mattresses and sheets, but that's about it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and quality”
Reviews.Author: liamsdad01007
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time I have stayed here with my family and every time I have enjoyed a fantastic experience. The hotel has been upgraded and the rooms are very good. The staff is fantastic and accommodating. The facilities are great, including a better than usual gym for a hotel. The location in the Back Bay is unbeatable, and you can walk to Fenway Park. I am a frequent business traveler, and I typically stay 100 nights a year in hotels all over the US and the world, and I highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel with a Caring Staff”
Reviews.Author: Singent
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to go to Boston on very short notice to see my elderly aunt who had fallen and broken her hip. We had to book our flight and hotel in a panic. Joseph Herrin who is the Guest Services Coordinator of the Sheraton did everything he could to make our stay more comfortable. He booked us a room with a wonderful view and that was very quiet. We even had access to breakfast everyday. We were able to take the orange line subway, which is about a ten minute walk from the hotel to Malden to see my aunt. When we returned to the hotel, Joseph had arranged a little dessert tray in our room with a lovely kind note for us. We stay at the Starwood hotels when ever we can, but this time was so different from being on vacation. Sheraton, you really came through for us during this difficult time and we are so grateful. Joey and Mem you are real stars!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly/helpful staff, good value. Nice all around hotel!”
Reviews.Author: impulse22281
Reviews.Content: I pretty much summed it up in the title. Nice hotel, got a great deal through Hotwire with the help of a fellow tripadvisorer. Was on the 28th floor. Great view of the city. Comfortable bed and pillows. Staff was friendly, concierge was helpful with questions. Had a small problem with the TV not working at 2am when I got in. Called front desk and they sent an engineer right away. I ended up figuring it out before engineer got there, somehow plug wasn't secure on back of TV. No biggie, and called front desk to cancel request. There was a blown out bulb in one of the lamps but now I'm really stretching and nit picking. Overall, a good experience. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: josh_eber
Reviews.Content: I was there with a large conference. Location was great, connected to a mall. The rooms was a little loud, located right behind the elevator which could be heard all night. Everything looked newly renovated. Overall great stay

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: austink1
Reviews.Content: I would agree with most of the reviews. We had a deluxe room on 27th floor with a great view on two sides. Room was very nice but bathroom was a bit small, but I don't spend a lot of time there anyways. Connection to the Prudential Center was convenient, especially when looking for somewhere to eat close by. Subway connection was connected to the Prudential Center. It's a very big place and a bit confusing at first on which set of elevators to take to your room. Avoid the Restaurant for breakfast!!! The buffet was good but at $21.00 not worth it! You can order off the menu for breakfast, but 1 order of Pancakes was $15.00!!! OUCH!!! We had a quick breakfast at Dunkin Donuts and saved our money for lunch elsewhere. Room was very quiet. Indoor pool was huge and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Excellent Design and equipped”
Reviews.Author: Bosseler
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Hotel is located close to the Prudential Center, and therefor close to the business life of Boston. Especially the friendly staff and the luxurious decoration of the hotel highlight its top position in the capital of MA. The rooms are very spacious, well designed and very clean. Furthermore I can recommend the excellent breakfast buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dian
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying at the Sheraton. Upon making the reservation, I requested feather free pillows, North Tower room and a room whereby no-one has stayed with a dog recently (allergies). All were provided easily, in fact got upgraded to a mini suite with 2 double beds. The location can't be beat, don't even have to go outside to take the T. If anything extra was needed (extra hangers), it was promptly delivered. Now about the beds, OMG. So comfortable and hated to get up every morning. I got the best sleep ever. My only complaint would be the size of the bathroom, but everything was in great working condition. The shower had fantastic water pressure and I made good use of the blow dryer and makeup mirror provided. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic...”
Reviews.Author: janifish
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 5 night stay in this hotel, with my 2 daughters. The hotel was a perfect choice for our stay - the room was spotless, very spacious for the 3 of us and had breathtaking views of the river. The staff we dealt with were both polite and efficient - helping us out with emergency supplies when we arrived without luggage! They also let us have a late check out at the end of our trip, which was very much appreciated. The hotel is in a perfect situation for sight seeing, shopping and the T subway, which we used a lot! Being attached to a large shopping mall was a definite plus, when we faced subzero temperatures and snow outside! We had a wonderful trip, and would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Equity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night on Feb. 19 on a short visit to Boston. I booked the room on Price Line for $129.00 which was an excellent value. Parking underneath the hotel is convenient in the Prudential Center garage and an online coupon saves $14.00 off the 24 hr. rate. Our room in the north tower was recently refurbished, nicely appointed, and being on a Starwood Preferred high floor and a corner room, the views were great. Bed was very comfortable, room was quiet and we slept great. Good amenities, bathroom on the small side. With the connection from the hotel to the Prudential Center and Copley Sq. Mall, you can walk to loads of shops and restaurants without going outside - we dined at the Palm and Legal Seafoods. I would definitely stay here again for this rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for a winter stay”
Reviews.Author: RuralMA
Reviews.Content: I work near the Sheraton and had to stay over recently because my daughter had a VERY early appointment at a Boston hospital. We got a recently remodeled 23rd floor room with modern furniture and a great views of the Christian Science plaza. The fact that it is attached to the Prudential mall makes it a great choice in inclement weather, and gives you some walkable / more affordable dining options. Staff was excellent all around.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs - you decide”
Reviews.Author: educationtogo
Reviews.Content: I admit that my circumstances are weird because I travel with my high school students. This time I had 12 students and 2 teachers including myself. It was a conference for approximately 3,000 students. The Ups: -great location -very helpful front desk staff -connection to mall with good food court + Cheesecake Factory + PF Changs -walking distance to MFA and Green E subway line -large, relaxed but dignified lobby with multiple areas to congregate -hotel staff very respectful towards the kids -hotel staff worked with the teachers to ensure security (lots of hotels refuse to take our input) The Downs: -bathrooms really need updating (and who puts wallpaper in a bathroom?) -possibly the worst Starbucks in North America in the lobby; the staff are rude and inattentive and the shelves were nearly bare most of the time. Several of my students bought stale brownies and I got a raspberry scone with very questionable raspberries in it. -elevators too slow / not enough capacity given the size of the hotel -free wi-fi in the lobby is painfully slow and inconsistent

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and wonderful staff made our trip outstanding! Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: ccamom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boston Sheraton for a week, July 12 - July 19, 2010. There were four of us (husband, wife, and 2 sons, ages 12 and 9). The staff was friendly, and the room we were given was wonderful. We had already stayed here for a weekend in June 2009 for our very first trip to Boston, and there was no question that we wanted to stay again for our July 2010 return trip. The hotel is very well maintained, the rooms are clean and spacious. The beds are comfortable, and our room was very quiet. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. You can't beat the location! It is so convenient. I loved the fact that we could walk to the mall, food court, subway, etc. without having to go outside in case it was raining. Also, we went to several Red Sox games at Fenway, and it was such an easy walk from the Sheraton. I hope we come back to visit in 2011, and there is no doubt we will stay at the Boston Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: saz331
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while we were in the city to see the Boston Celtics, Fantastic location rooms spotless, starbucks in the lobby great, and ease of use of the computers in lobby another great asset! Emailed to say we were celebrating my husbands 40th birthday and got an upgrade to a junior suite with a beautiful view of the frozen river! Staff very helpful would stay here again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy, stinky temporary fitness room”
Reviews.Author: abqtarheel
Reviews.Content: I just attended a conference where there was a choice of staying at the Sheraton, the Marriott, or the Westin, all connected to the convention center. I chose the Sheraton because of the advertised nice fitness room & pool, and because I'm a member of their customer loyalty program. Surprise! The fitness room and pool are still under renovation (which was NOT indicated on the hotel website) and so the current fitness room is in a dimly lit, poorly ventilated conference room off the hotel lobby. There are a few antique elliptical trainers and treadmills, a set of free weights, some deflated Bosus, and a couple of filthy yoga mats. As for my room on a "Preferred" floor, it was by no means special, and the bathroom was rather dingy. The business center is apparently also under renovation. My advice is to choose one of the other hotels if you are coming to Boston for a convention.

Reviews.Title: “So so good, it actually felt like we were really on holiday and away from everything.”
Reviews.Author: millyj1975
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had previously visited Boston and had stayed in another lovely hotel in the Back Bay area but the Sheraton hotel excelled on every count. Our flight was cancelled to Boston on the 26th due to severe weather conditions and the Sheraton very kindly honoured the dates and John Carbone ( Concierge) was such a great help and organised a wonderful room/suite for us on the 24th floor. Views were stunning, everywhere was so clean and pristine and we just didnt want to leave there yesterday.Im back in work already and we are already dreaming of our next trip to the Sheraton in Boston. PS My boyfriend is now my fiancee, we also got engaged the first night we got there, overlooking the wonderful view from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if attending a trade show at Hynes”
Reviews.Author: PAWS22
Reviews.Content: Find it overpriced and service lacking, parking and restaurant prices are outrageous, rooms are tiny and my client was bumped to another hotel for 1 night of a 2 night stay, but you can't beat it if you are doing a trade show at the Hynes Center. The fire alarm at 2am left a lot to be desired, especially since no one who worked at the hotel knew what to tell guests, good thing there was no emergency, but try to go back to sleep after being jolted out of bead with blaring alarms and no clear conclusion that there wasn't an emergency!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: icort
Reviews.Content: I stayed over NYE with friends and had an amazing time. The front desk staff was very knowledgable about the hotel and area and appointed an extremely nice room on the 6th floor. The room had a great view and more than enough space. The sleeping quality was great as well. I will definitely stay here again if I am in Boston and will recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Room, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: oscmj
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton Boston and would recommend it, the only thing that holds it back from being a truely outstanding hotel with our highest recommendation is the outside hall noise that can be heard quite clearly at night. There was a 2 inch gap at the bottom of our door and a slight gap on the side of the door and when someone went walking down the hall talking or going into the room you can hear it quite clearly from inside our room. It was noisey on the weekend with foot traffic but quieted down on Mon-Wed. Once you get past that, if you can, the hotel is fabulous, very friendly helpful staff, full intenet computers in the lobby for guest usage, great view, comfortable bed, large room and the location is unbeatable. You can access the Prudential Center Mall/Copley Square Mall directly form the second floor without setting foot outside. The hop on hop off bus picks you up in front of the Sheraton, easy walk to Beacon Hill, Newbury Street etc. This was our first trip to Boston and will be back as we found the people of Boston to be very friendly and helpful and there is so much to do and see. Overall a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Boston: another trainwreck of a stay for me”
Reviews.Author: signothetimes53
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood Platinum member, and I booked an SPG award and paid a lot of extra points for a full suite at the Sheraton Boston last nite. My wife is undergoing serious problems with her vision, and we drove 4 hours from our northern Vermont home to Boston to prepare for major "second opinion" exams with specialists in Boston. I arranged with my SPG Platinum concierge to alert the hotel staff that we wanted to make sure nothing went wrong with our stay, that this was not a "vacation" for us, but that my wife and I needed to relax the day before her critical medical exams. Despite my concierge's efforts, once again the Sheraton Boston absolutely botched my stay there. Here is what I wrote to her: I am disappointed to have to report to you that the Sheraton Boston made a mess of our stay, and needlessly added stress to something I was hoping would be a relaxing day before my wifeâ€™s serious medical tests. I should have known better than to book this particular hotel, it has routinely and regularly made mistakes nearly every time Iâ€™ve stayed here in recent years. (Thatâ€™s why I avoided it for most of 2010, as a check of the various Boston-area hotels I used this past year will demonstrate). The only reason I booked it was because the location was convenient to my wifeâ€™s doctorsâ€™ appointments. Hereâ€™s what happened: 1. The suite they assigned us was smaller than I had expected. Having stayed here in the past, I knew they had larger suites, especially one with a small dining table. Because my wife is visually-impaired, I wanted one of those suites so that we could eat in. 2. When I expressed my disappointment in the suite, I was told that nothing larger was available. 3. After hanging up with the front desk, I went into the bedroom and bathroom and discovered that the suite they had assigned me had not been cleaned by housekeeping. The bed was unmade, the bathroom had used towels, used soap dried in the soap dish, used water glass on the sink, and trash in the trash can that included used tissues and a tampon wrapper. 4. I asked for the manager to come to see what we had been assigned. A few minutes later, he arrived with the Housekeeping Manager. They were all very nice, and they apologized, and the manager offered me 5,000 points back, which is a nice gesture. They also quite magically found me the slightly larger suite that had the small dining table that I had been previously told was not available. 5. I thanked the manager for the points, but I told him that what I really wanted was for the hotel to do its job properly in the first place. I told him I didnâ€™t understand why this hotel makes so many mistakes whenever I stay here. I told him I didnâ€™t understand why this had to happen on this particular stay, when I had gone to the trouble of contacting my Starwood concierge (you) to arrange to make sure they understood in Boston that my visit here was not routine, and that I needed things to go smoothly. [Name of SPG Platinum concierge deleted], I donâ€™t want anything else done for me, other than this: would you file some sort of incident report via whatever systems you have in place, and send me a copy of that report? Staying at this hotel was a mistake, I blame myself for thinking that this time theyâ€™d get it right. At the same time, if a Platinum customer like me who has taken steps above and beyond the norm still has such a poor experience, I think that someone at the hotel should be held accountable by someone at Starwood. And thank you for trying to help with this. Unfortunately, the Sheraton Boston is simply an impossible cause.

Reviews.Title: “Give my money back”
Reviews.Author: horii001
Reviews.Content: I checked in about 11:30am and my room was not ready until 6pm. I wanted to pay by cash but they immediately charged on my debit account. I asked them to cancel and payed full by cash on the 1st day. After 10 days, I have not received refund yet. I've tried to reach them but have not been able to. The bathroom was moldy on the ceiling. The room was tiny. And I paid over 200$ per night. I could hear chatting next door. And if you want to use internet in your room, you need to pay for 10$/night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff /tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: HurdyGurdyMan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on hotwire for about 100$ so I wasn't expecting the biggest room but this was easily the smallest hotel room I've seen in outside of Europe or NYC. You don't see many supposed 4 stars with queen bed singles and no place to put your luggage on the floor. The bathroom was literally smaller than the bathroom in my 400 square foot apt. On the other hand the view was very nice. Perhaps they gave me the room thinking I preferred view over room size. The room was newly appointed so it wasn't too dirty but there was hair in the shower which is a big no-no and why I only gave it 2 stars for cleanliness. The bed was good but not great in comparison to other 4 stars. The positives were the staff. The front desk clerk (Alexander) was about the nicest guy I've dealt and gave me an early check-in with a big smile. Thanks. The concierge was also very helpful in getting some tickets printed with the hotel guest printer out of commission. The location is great for Fenway and about as good as you can get for shopping as it's only a short walk to Newbury street. Also , the hotel is attached to the Prudential mall which is in turn attached to the Copley mall. You can walk a long way to places like BackBay station or Copley square and get to the subway without submitting yourself to any bad weather. This Sheraton is basically on the western end of a big complex of malls/convention space/hotels. It's quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “See You Next Year My Friend....”
Reviews.Author: kingofsp8s
Reviews.Content: My corporate website doesn't pass on the "special conditions" announcements. Am a regular guest at this facility and was FRIGGIN SURPRISED upon arrival that the gym and pool was closed for what seems like an inoordinate amount of time (two to three months depending on whether you want the pool or the gym). The makeshift gym in the south ballroom is a joke - about 20% of the equipment they had before, and they couldn't even figure out how to hook up the remaining treadmills and ellipticals to the TVs???? C'mon. My sense is you could've haggled to get a daypass to one of many locations, but that wasn't offered in the letter put on the counter (the desk staff didn't have the courage to mention it). Disappointing is all I can say. And yes, this is one of those hotels where you can have heat or air but not both, so slept like crap for two nights. Won't be back 'til the gym is done and the air is cold enough that I can get the room under 72. I may not be expert at this, but would think if you need two months to revamp a gym like that, you could at least do it in blocks so you weren't disruptive and didn't lose total access to all the equipment. Now I'm going to use my points for a stay in December elsewhere as opposed to pay for an "approved" property here. Bummed. I expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Sheraton Boston -- because I had coupons!”
Reviews.Author: murphadelix
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Boston is what you would expect a Sheraton to be, except at 3 times the price. The hotel was clean and the staff at the reception and concierge desks were helpful. The rooms are kind of small but definitely comfortable. We were lucky to have a room overlooking the Charles River -- gorgeous view! On our tour of the city I heard that the Sheraton is the largest hotel in Boston with over 1000 rooms. I never would have guessed as I found our room quiet and we had ample room in the elevators, so they're definitely doing something right there. The location is great, we never had to wander far for food or entertainment and basically walked everywhere. And it's easy to find your way back home as the hotel is beside one of the tallest buildings in the city. Problem is that I've spent much less at other Sheratons around North America for the same thing. The size of and amenities in the room are not worth the price. Maybe we're paying for location? But there are MANY other hotels around. Parking is $44 a night with no cheap alternatives in sight. Local calls are $1.50 (even if the person on the other end accidently hangs up on you). Luckily, there are a ton of coffee and food options around so there's no need to splurge on hotel food and beverage. I would stay here again -- but only if I had the same coupons I had this time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jkelly611
Reviews.Content: Took my wife for her birthday. Hotel itself is nice, clean and in an excellent shopping/dinning location. We had a nice room overlooking the river. Emailed ahead but received no response which brings service down a notch. Room itself was cruise ship small but we basically used it for a before dinner drink and sleep so didn't matter. Payed $135 plus tax/fees from Priceline which was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a heart beat”
Reviews.Author: bettyh
Reviews.Content: Great location. Hop On Hop Off bus stops in front. Connected to Prudential Center for restaurants, shopping, etc. Can also get to Copley through Prudential Center. In case of rain (as we had) this all works out well. Just off Boylston with lots of restaurants and shops. Hugh hotel but we never felt crowded. Internet in lobby at no charge. Starbucks in lobby. We stayed on the club floor and the club for breakfast and cocktail hour was marvelous. The nicest attendants and excellent food. Also hat water, yogurt, snack bars, drinks, papers, large screen TV with comfortable sofas and internet stations available all day. Well worth the extra for the club floor. We had a room with a view of the Charles River that was lovely. Rooms are small but adequate and beds and bedding are wonderful. I was definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is going downhill”
Reviews.Author: steveo2287
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times. Stayed there on November 6th. If you are a Platinum member, there is no reason to stay here. There is no concierage lounge on weekends and they have discontinued breakfast coupons. Even through they advertise a beautiful fool and state of the art fitness center, it is under reconstruction and not available. If you want to use the pool, you can walk next door (in the winter) and use the Hilton pool. Next time, I will stay at the Hilton. Oh, they did raise the parking rates. Great job Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, Perfect location to access Hynes convention center”
Reviews.Author: ZingaroX
Reviews.Content: Attended a convention at The Hynes convention center and stayed at Sheraton. The two are connected by indoor hallways. Also part of Prudential Center with easy access to a food court, grocery store, and and the "T" (MBTA subway). Comfy room. Got comped a breakfast when our room wasn't ready at check in time. Nice, helpful staff. Frindly waitresses, front desk, bellmen. We walked to most sightseeing places.

Reviews.Title: “Easy with Lang Tu”
Reviews.Author: CraneMountain
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Boston has been remodeled and is looking good. But the hotel is only as good as its staff. Should you be lucky enough to have Lang Tu clean and restock your room, your stay will be even more pleasant. No calling down for extra towels or the forgotten bottle of shampoo. She refilled everything and gave you the correct amount of towels. Perhaps the Sheraton should hire more Lang Tuâ€™s!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ceejay80
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for shopping. Breakfast was great value - serving staff were lovely. Beds very comfortable - great views from hotel room over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good as expected”
Reviews.Author: TinaBull
Reviews.Content: Large room, small bathroom, comfortable bed. You can opt to have a $5 card to use in Starbucks instead of having your room serviced which we thought was a nice touch. Decor was a bit dated, but the room was clean and functional. No wifi in the rooms - only the lobby which these days seems a bit outdated. Good location attached to a mall. Starbucks inside and a 5 minute walk to Au Bon Pain for morning bagels. 10 minute walk to T stop. We had a great $82 rate via Hotwire so for us it was great value. I would have rated it lower if we'd paid the $300+ rack rate though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Downtown Sightseeing - especially with a toddler in tow”
Reviews.Author: Jimnindc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 13 month old for a 4-day weekend of sightseeing and it was a PERFECT location. 10 minute easy walk to blue and green lines on the subway, plenty of amenities nearby to acocomodate the toddler if needed (2 markets within 5 minute walk - nice green 'park-like' area for him to run around just outside the adjacent mall, plenty of restaurants etc). 5 minute walk to Newberry street and all the hop on/off tour buses stop right outside the hotel. We stayed on our starwood points and they upgraded us to an Executive suite which had a separate living area and views of the river. Living area furniture/coffe table were two ottomans with rounded corners - tendy to the casual adult ( which we used to be) but perfect for a toddler. Only caveat I'd say is if metroing from airport with stroller - the 'normal' green line train transfer stop has no elevator - and only an escalator down on th inbound way. Outbound to airpot - ther is nothing but stairs so ask the hotel for an altternate metro route/transfer station to better accommodate the stroller.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but no wireless!!!”
Reviews.Author: alexandria07
Reviews.Content: I chose the Sheraton because it's downtown and close to my business meeting. I was delighted with an upgraded corner room (no idea why they gave it to me) which has a sitting room and bedroom all with a mazing views of the river. The hotel is connected with a great mall that has plenty of restaurant options. BUT -- no wireless in the rooms (only in the lobby) just doesn't work for business travelers. Yes, there's a VERY short ethernet cord but this really doesn't compare to other major hotel chains. As far as I'm concerned, this is reason enough to go elsewhere on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for business. Standard room, high...”
Reviews.Author: RTTejas
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business. Standard room, high floor. Great view, location, and service. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location to city attractions and subway!”
Reviews.Author: travelmama78
Reviews.Content: We used Priceline and got a great room rate, much cheaper than most of the other hotels downtown. Rooms are on the small side, but clean and the location of the hotel can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Your usual hotel--except for the best bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: jkriggs
Reviews.Content: Seriously, literally, the most comfortable bed ever. And, thus, the best sleep ever. Otherwise, it was your typical Sheraton, slightly - above - average, average hotel. But it felt like sleeping on a giant pile of sheep.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location, good views”
Reviews.Author: JP488
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Boston is located at the Prudential center - which means plenty of shopping and plenty of good restaurants in the neighborhood. The views from the higher floors on the north wing are amazing. Would definitely recommend the California Pizza Kitchen and the P. F. Chang's restaurants. The hotel staff were very accommodating - they readily agreed to move me to a higher floor on a different wing - and even suggested rooms with good views...all with a smile! :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SallyPMK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 7 nights having got a really good deal from Hotwire.
