Having read previous reviews, I emailed in advance and requested a high floor with a view and surprise, surprise, that is what we got! Our room was great, but the bathroom was very small but this did not bother us unduly. Everything said in other reviews about the location - yes, it is very good and very convenient for getting around. One thing that did surprise us was the lack of hustle and bustle or noise in the corridors from other guests. Where were they? We only met about 2 people going along our corridor in 7 days. What interaction we had with staff was fine - friendly housekeeping staff who never bothered us or tried to clean our room until we had vacated it for the day and very quick check in and check out. Would recommend without hestitation although I would have avoided such a large hotel before our excellent stay at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly, business appropriate, and tons of fun”
Reviews.Author: midwestmainer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this location many times in the past 8 years. We have seen the hotel go through many changes including redecorating, installing wi-fi, and others. On each occasion, the hotel and staff adapted well to continue to offer services and on occasion, offer more. During a time when the hotel restaurant, Apropos, was closed for maintenance, we were offered a meal through room service. We have used and enjoyed the pool, the exercise facility, and the sauna. We have used and enjoyed the bar area (love the snacks) and appreciate the wi-fi connection. I love to use the Club Floors. My kids love it too! Over the years, due to our return visits, we have come to know a few employees as friends. We visit Boston at least once a year (usually more) and continue to return to the Sheraton. We have stayed at six different hotels/locations but prefer the Sheraton Prudential. A few things we like about the Sheraton are: the BED. soft, comfortable, like home but better. Access. skywalks connect to several other buildings where we can shop, read, walk, etc. the STAFF. they are nice. the location. Good Luck in Boston. a confusing, always changing, always amazing city. this hotel is close to all, including the subway (use it!) the Entrance. it's easy to get in and out. Valet parking is easy. Expensive, but easy. the Decor. It's simple, elegant, and updated. the Rooms. They are big. In comparison. the View. All of Boston. the Price. It varies, but we can often stay here for less than $150.

Reviews.Title: “Very busy convention hotel. Small room...”
Reviews.Author: Traveltheworld57_10
Reviews.Content: Very busy convention hotel. Small room and bath but great view of the River. Long waits for elevators and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shoppern
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before we began a Canadian cruise. It was a quick trip from the airport, check-in and checkout were VERY fast. Arrived late in the evening, and found some restaurants in the attached mall for dinner. Great spot for shopping and centrally located for touring. We've been in Boston several times before, so were familiar with the location. The room was lovely--very up-to-date. Very quiet, and the beds were very comfortable. No problem storing our luggage the next day while we did some shopping before embarkation. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Got a Good Price From Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: DMHYF
Reviews.Content: Thanks to advice from the Trip Advisor Boston Forum, I took a chance on a Hotwire deal so that I was able to book a 9-night stay for less than $800 in this very classy hotel. I'm surprised it is only rated 3 and half stars here, when it really looked higher class. The hotel is connected on its second floor to the Prudential Center Mall, which in turn is connected to the Copley Place Mall (via a glass bridge) and a Green Line Subway Station. The Hynes Convention Center Orange Line Subway Station is also nearby to go to Fenway Park (just one stop away). It has a Shaws Supermarket nearby, as well as the shops of Newbury and Boylston Sts. It was strange but we had fire alarms at about 1:30am TWICE during our 9-night stay. We had to run down from the 23rd floor to the lobby. When we reached the lobby, we were told everything is ok and we can return to our room. Cons: No refrigerator nor microwave in the room. No wi-fi in the room (had to use one of the 6 computer stations in the lobby, but free anyway). Can hear the elevators from our room. Snooty front desk people (although the concierge and security guys were more friendly).

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value, great location to start our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: L_K1509
Reviews.Content: We already got a brilliant deal from Hotwire then on top of that as we were on our honeymoon we were upgraded to a suite free of charge with a view of Charles river.The hotel has free internet, again easy to use and about 8 computers in the lobby. We took the offer of $5 instead of room cleaning and got Starbucks each morning with it. Bearing in mind we has such a big room the bathroom is strangely very small. We used the swimming pool and gym each morning which was not busy and a great way to start the day. The location is surrounded by restaurants, shops which are all walking distance. The metro is less than five mins walk and very easy to use. We walked most of the time around the city however did take advantage of the week ticket for $15 for the metro/bus, which worked out very well for getting to different points. We would rocommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Renovations & Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: pinkpanther8
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel for years when in Boston. Love the Back Bay section of the city. When I stayed in March I noticed the rooms were redone and loved the new decor. Just stayed in a junior suite last week which was wonderful with a view of the Charles River. They had a special rate where you pay the reg rate for the 1st night and for the 2nd and 3rd nights you pay the amount of the year you were born. If born in 1970 you pay $70. Tremendous value. Good service from all the staff we encountered. Only downfall is the bed is not as great as the Heavenly bed at Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Portastorm
Reviews.Content: A lot of the previous reviews I read about this place were "dead on." While the hotel generally looks good and the staff was helpful, there were too many negatives which to me offset the cost of this hotel. Clearly there are better places for the price in downtown Boston. The cons? Hard-wired Internet only in the rooms. I expect to pay $10/day in a large metro area at a hotel like this but at least I should get wireless out of it. The bathrooms were tiny. The room walls paper thin ... so much so that I heard my neighbors snoring two consecutive nights (that's a first!). Then there was the 15-minute wait one night for an elevator in the South Tower. There were other waits of 10 minutes and 5 minutes. If you are on an upper floor, God help you. The pros? Decent location, good (but pricey) breakfast buffet, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “crazy fire alarms and not really all that updated”
Reviews.Author: popedaddy
Reviews.Content: The fire alarm went off two night in a row...at 1:20am..sure was nice to get startled then have to walk down the stairs and wait outside...only to find out they had no idea why the alarm went off.....the manager wasnt very friendly when I called and ask what in the world was going on...never even offered anything in return for this HUGE inconvenience on my vacation... Good location, nice in the common areas...but the rooms are a bit dated..even though the website says its been redone...only thing that looked redone in my room was the tv and the bed spread. you wont catch me at this hotel again, unless its on hotwire for about $50...then it might be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Extra special service”
Reviews.Author: nicenrelaxed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the sheraton during a 6 night stay and had really good service. The hotel is in a perfect location close to Fenway park and plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. We were upgraded to a room with a beautiful view of the river, and as we were on a honeymoon break they brought us champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries on our first night. It felt like we were taken good care of the whole time we were there despite it being a big chain hotel. There was free internet in the lobby and computers for use too. We used the trolley tour for the first couple of days and got our bearings and then walked everywhere as Boston is not that big everywhere was close enough to get to on foot. And the hotel is in a great location to get around. We didn't eat in the hotel, but used the food court in the mall next door for breakfast and lunches sometimes. Our favourite place to eat was Whiskeys where we had a really good meal, we went there the first night and really liked it and had to go back on our last night. The worst meal was in the Summer shack which is right across the road from the Sheraton next to the Kings Bowling alley. The food was okay but it was an expensive meal for somewhere that looked a bit shabby and i've had better seafood. I would definately recommend staying in Back bay and the Sheraton is a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better late than never”
Reviews.Author: elaine4648
Reviews.Content: It's actually more than 9 months since we stayed at this hotel but I decided my Tripadvisor map was looking a tad insular so I am filling it out. It was indeed a lovely hotel: we were upgraded (free of charge) to a suite, which was vast, and comfortable with really sensitive heating/air conditioning controls. The staff were really helpful, ( I still say our transatlantic cousins can teach us oodles about high quality customer service) and the location was brilliant, both in terms of being within easy reach of a lot of the major Boston attractions (Boston Pops Christmas concert a life changing experience!) and in that and we didn't have to set foot outside to take the subway: a real plus when the temperature, in spite of the dazzling sunshine, fell to -15C! Would revisit in a heartbeat, but so much world, so little time left to see it in!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for College trip”
Reviews.Author: likestotravelChicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Boston for two days with our daughter looking at colleges. We used our Starpoints and we got a nice suite we could all stay in. Location nice - walked to Copley square and dinner on Newberry Street. Parking Garage fees were the only downside ($48 per night), but decided that we didn't really need a rental and next time would go without. Hotel attached, but not obviously, to the prudential center ( a large shopping mall) which made our daughter very happy. We enjoyed the nice cocktail lounge with TV's and the workout room/pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: emmysmommy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for a business meeting that was nearby. My business associates and I actually re-booked our original hotel (from the Brookline area) to be at the Sheraton. It did not disappoint. From our arrival and prompt check-in, to the very helpful concierge, to the huge rooms - I loved this hotel. I was given a corner room on the 25th floor overlooking the Charles River and the Prudential Center. Like I mentioned, the room was very large and had a comfy King bed. Since this was a short trip I didn't get to use many of the hotels amenities such as restaurants, the wifi area and the fitness center. I would definitely return to this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelin'grandma
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! My husband & I stayed at the Sheraton Boston for 4 nights at the end of August. We could not have made a better choice or have been more pleased with our stay. For 1st time visitors to Boston especially, the hotel was located in THE most perfect place. Not really walkers, we walked to the Public Garden, Fenway Park, & Newbury St., loaded with shops & restaurants. The hotel is also attached to the Prudential Center which is also loaded with shops & restaurants and a T station for destinations that were not walking distance. Our weather was magnificent but this could really be handy if it was not. We really felt like we were smack-dab in the middle of everything. The hotel itself was wonderful. It has a large & very comfortable lobby. We had absolutely delicious desserts there one night. Our accommodations were most comfortable & lovely. Every single person we came in contact with was as pleasant & helpful as itâ€™s possible to be. When I realized the 1st night that the display on the clock radio wasnâ€™t legible & called housekeeping, we had a new one in five minutes. Service like that is amazing for such a large hotel! I highly recommend the Sheraton Boston â€“ I truly canâ€™t think of a single negative! Itâ€™s the only place I would stay if Iâ€™m lucky enough to return to Boston (which I loved).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Wednesday1970
Reviews.Content: Spent 9 nights here in April 2010. The hotel couldn't be located in a better place! Adjacent to the Prudential Tower and all the shops in the complex, and the T station, it's great base for exploring the city. Booked through BA and were upgraded to a river view room, overlooking Cambridge and with a view of Fenway Park . Had arranged to have some Bruins and Red Sox delivered to the hotel on our behalf and the concierge (the fantastic Lisa) and the Business Centre were both incredibly helpful - as were all the hotel staff. Took advantage of the free internet access in the lobby to check in online for flights home etc, which was very convenient. Liked the place so much, we're back off there again for a longer stay next year :-) P.S. the beds are the Sealy Sheraton specials and are the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cleo034
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and our holiday got off to an excellent start as we were upgraded from a standard room to a massive, beautifully decorated room with a large sofa and a safe. The indoor pool was lovely with a glass roof and one of the best I've used in a hotel. Although we didn't eat in the hotel apart from at the Starbucks, we had drinks in the bar which had very nice nibbles. The hotel is excellently located - very close to the subway and the Prudential shopping complex which has many dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel in a great location. My room...”
Reviews.Author: pickybiz
Reviews.Content: Old hotel in a great location. My room was in the "old" tower. Elevators were painfully slow, hallways and room smelled musty. Conveniently attached to the prudential shopping arcades. Colleagues in the other tower had much better feedback about their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A Place You'd Want to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: drtcher
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton in Boston is a lovely Hotel. My husband, son and I loved the location as well as the friendly ,professional service that we experienced. We found it very nice to have a Starbucks in the Hotel for our morning coffee. The lobby was beautiful and welcoming. Last we walked right outside our hotel to find many wonderful places to eat , visit and shop.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, with a good room and location”
Reviews.Author: elderc
Reviews.Content: It's functional, with a good room and confortable bed. It has a great a location and it's an easy walk to Newburry Street or even the city downtown. There's a Starbucks in the lobby, wich is great if you're in a hurry early in the morning, and it's attached to the Prudential Center. Anyway, obviously you can get better food options nearby. This is a big and old chain hotel, so you'll find exactly what you usually find on big and old chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok, but in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kassi22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights over a weekend. Service: The service was fine overall. We where able to check in early which was nice. After our first night stay the room was not cleaned the next day for some odd reason? We didn't have anything hanging on the door and where gone the entire day. We came back thinking the beds would have been made (which in a hotel like this you would think. Ive stayed in lesser hotels and wouldn't expect as much) but nope. The room was as we left it. It was done the next day however. We noticed a worker in the lobby that was walking around. There was a tissue on the ground and instead of picking it up, he kicked it under a chair! I thought that was kind of gross. On leaving we asked for a trolley as we where in a hurry and just wanted to grab it and go, but no, they wouldn't allow that. Instead we hate to wait for them to send up a bell boy with a trolls. Very annoying when you are in a rush. Though, the bell boy was really nice. There was an emergency alarm that went off one night which was annoying bu I can't blame that on the hotel. They had it announced over the PA system and handled it the best they could. We did find a note of apology under the door in the morning. They handled that well. Rooms: The rooms where clean and comfortable. Though the room we had which was 2 double beds was small. The bathroom was the smallest Ive seen in a hotel. Two people getting ready at the same time was not possible. One major thing with the room that ruined this hotel for us was the air conditioner. It was loud and it rattled all night long. It was too warm to not have it on, but with it on it kept my partner awake most of the night. we ended up sleeping with ear plugs. Location: This is the best thing of this hotel. The location is perfect. Its attached to the Prudential shopping center which is attached to another center. You can walk most places inside. It was easy to get to the highway from there. The Trolley tours stopped right at the front door. It was perfect. Amenities: We never used the Fitness Center or Pool though I hear it is good. Over all I would recommend this hotel if you can get a good discount price on it, which is what we did so I can't really complain. Though I wouldn't recommend it otherwise as you have to pay $44 for parking a night, pay extra for internet and any other perks. I'm sure for the normal $300+ price tag a night you could find better in the area. If we had of paid full price we would have left after the first night due to the A/C issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bathroom needs some work....”
Reviews.Author: LeisureTraveller92
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can't be beat, very close to excellent restaurants and great shopping. We were assigned a room in the south tower which i'm assuming is the older tower. The elevators were dated and worn down, the door to the room and bathroom was much narrower and tighter than a standard width door. The room was renovated and included comfortable plush bedding; however the bathroom requires some attention. The tiling in the bathtub looked dated (pink tiles, appears that the last renovation was done the early 90s) and the bathtub surrounds including the grout and the caulking were mouldy and mildewy. The bathroom was so small that it was impossible to put down the bathmat and close the door at the same time. The pictures on their website were not representative of the room we had, I guess they must be in the midst of renovating their rooms and we got one of the "renovations in-progress" rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, rooms are just okay.”
Reviews.Author: Kmmo
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great. Very close to Fenway Park which was the purpose for our trip to catch a game and it was close to Newbury Street. You could access the shops at the Prudential Center very easily too since it is connected to the hotel. The line was a quick wait on our arrival, and the gracious people at Starbucks passed around mini cups of frappachino which my daughter loved. Our room was on the 7th floor, I prefer higher up and requested a corner room but I was told they were fully booked, so neither request was granted. The room was spacious, however the bathroom was very small. They advertise that the hotel has been renovated but it did not appear that way to me. The bathroom shower looked old, however the vanity area looked new. My biggest issues were the walls are very thin and you can hear everything. Traveling with my 7 year old we were doing everything we could to mask the sound coming from the couple next door by blasting the tv with my daughter continually asking what that noise could be, not fun! You could hear everything in the hallways, it was just very noisy which doesn't make for a great nights sleep. The beds are not comfortable. We had 2 double beds and you can't fit 2 adults comfortably in that, and the toilets are very, very loud. Someone else described it in their reveiw as the sound of an airplane toilet and thats just what it sounded like. The pool area was very nice and spacious. Overall the hotel was okay, but I like a good nights sleep and I didn't get that here. I think I will stick with the Westin which is where we usually stay. Parking is high $44 a night. I went to http://boston.bestparking.com and printed out a guarenteed rate for $50 total for our 2 night stay at the Prudential Center Parking garage and saved $38 which I suggest doing since the hotel is connected to the parking garage. You have to have the coupon printed out to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Room”
Reviews.Author: PegLegPete
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night, but it was so comfortable. Quick Check-in, lovely clean room on 20th floor, nice view, and the Best Bedding I have ever slept in! We would definitely return, good location for visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfort bed, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: C.Mood
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is pretty big. Bed is extremely comfortable. Only 2 things we feel uncomfortable is a bit unsteady elevator and old carpet. Room and other stuff inside are above average clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: Sun-and-Ski-Mom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Sheraton during a business meeting and found this hotel to be top notch in many ways. The rooms have been recently renovated and while on the small side, are very elegant. The location is great. We were able to walk to a number of great restaurants while there - our favorite was the Great Atlantic Fish Company - the fried clams and fried oyster appetizers there were delicious. There's a Starbucks inside the hotel for an alternative to a room service breakfast. In addition, the hotel is linked to a mall so you can find some convenient options for eating and shopping. It appeared to have a pretty nice pool, which unfortunately I couldn't take advantage of due to work. If you are having a business meeting there, you couldn't ask for a better conference services team. I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A safe bet”
Reviews.Author: AS251
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with my stay here and would definitely recommend it. PROS: -Location. It is connected to the Prudential Center so you don't even need to go outside to get to the Prudential stop on the T, which was very nice on the scorching hot days I was in Boston. Walking distance to many Boston sites. I never felt unsafe. -Price. Not sure how much a room is normally, but I scored my room here for $100 a night (that's including taxes and fees) on Hotwire. AMAZING for a hotel in this location. -Cleanliness. No complaints with the cleanliness! Rooms were cleaned nicely each day. -Service. All employees I dealt with were very friendly and helpful, with the exception of one bell hop who was a little surly. -Pool and hot tub! I was in Boston for touristic purposes, so I did a lot of walking around in the strong heat, and I can honestly say that my Boston experience would not have been as good as it was without the pool to cool off in and the hot tub to relax my muscles in. Of course, as with most pools, beware of the children. CONS: -No fridge or microwave in the rooms. Shame because I had to waste some leftover food because I had nowhere to store it. So the lack of a fridge forced me to spend more money on food than I would have wanted. -Small bathroom. Not a big deal to me, but should be noted. -Shower feels like you're being pelted with rocks. Even on the lowest setting, it is PAINFUL. -Air conditioning makes clicking sound through the night. It was annoying but I just put in my ear plugs and was fine for sleeping. -I had requested two double beds months prior to my arrival, but only got a room with one king sized bed and one pull out couch. It was sufficient but it would have been nice to have had an actual bed for myself and my friend. -Internet. WiFi is $10 per night (I think) in the rooms. You have to go to the lobby for the free WiFi or to use the computers. There are only 6 computers available for the whole hotel (the hotel is HUGE, by the way) and I had to wait on average 10-15 minutes each night for one to become available. Overall, I would definitely stay here again if I could get the same or a similar price that I did. I felt like it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice but the rooms are a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: srauhala
Reviews.Content: We decided to make a trip into the city for a 2 night getaway stay since we had show tickets Friday night and we hoped to catch the UFC fight the next night. I got a good rate off of Priceline for $81 a night for a Fri and Sat We got there in the early afternoon and parked in a nearby lot that is cheaper than the hotel parking. There was no line and we were able to check-in right away around 2:30pm. We got a king size bed room on the 22nd floor which was facing south. The view was nice and the room was very clean. It was nicely renovated, and the room was good size, but the bathroom was pretty small. The bathroom looked partly renovated but the shower portion was not. Although pretty clean, with nice hot water, the shower looked out of place since it looked old as compared to the rest. The toilet was one of the toilets that sounded like an airplane toilet. I think you could flush anything down the thing! I think the overall room would have been better if they moved the wall to the bathroom out a foot or two when they did the renovations. The bed we found to be on the hard side but we appreciated getting a king We also found the room to be quite noisy. I could clearly hear a person's alarm going off Sat morning at 7am. Then when they turned on the bathtub it sounded almost like it was ours. However, it was much better when they switched it to the shower. The staff was vacuuming a room or the hallway (couldn't tell) around 8am or so Saturday morning. With the large gap that was under the door it sounded pretty loud. However, for the amount of the time we were in the room, which was not much, it only seemed to be on the noisier side in the morning. The hotel itself is in a good location and being attached to the Prudential Center is convenient as well. It was also very nice to have a Starbucks in the lobby. Overall, the hotel was not bad for the money. If the room was a little more soundproof I would have given it little higher marks. I probably wouldn't stay there again for more than what I paid but it worked out fine for what we came into town for.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable room - huge conference centre nearby!”
Reviews.Author: bixgurl
Reviews.Content: Good points: 1. Comfy bed 2. Great view (was on 19th floor of North Tower) 3. Starbuck's coffee and perculator in the room, ice machine in the corridor 4. Option to swap room cleaning service for a $5 voucher to spend in hotel's shops (and this on each day if you want) 5. Very big TV 6. Right next to a shopping mall (short walk, under glass walkway) Bad points: 1. Expensive for such a small room 2. Breakfast was great (lovely egg white omlette and the muffins on the buffet are to die for!) but very expensive for what it is (especially when you add the tip, etc.) 3. No free internet in the rooms, only in the lobby Bottomline: Very comfortable, but you pay for it

Reviews.Title: “One of the best views of Boston ever!”
Reviews.Author: Mermaid929
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the Sheraton. It's a conference hotel and we never saw the lobby not crowded with people coming and going, but the check-in staff was quick and efficient. And remarkably courteous and helpful. We asked for a room with a view and were given a fabulous view of the Charles River and the Back Bay from the 23rd floor. Very nice touch. If the room weren't so small, I'd have given the Sheraton even better marks. We had a very nice stay and we loved the location. Very close to the T station and all the neighborhood attractions. I wouldn't mind staying at this Sheraton again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Perfect for Sox Games”
Reviews.Author: dsmtravelgal
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Sheraton Boston Hotel in June 2010. We were in Boston for a long weekend (Friday-Tuesday) and picked the hotel because of it's great location and access to public transportation and Fenway Park. The hotel was very clean and we had easy access to the metro. The rooms were very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: silarem
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 7pm and there were two clerks helping two customers, I waited around 20 minutes got our key went to the 14 floor and found the room to be very small and with no view, but well I got a good deal so canâ€™t complain. The rest of the hotel services were really expensive $3++ for a granola bar! No complimentary breakfast and the room service never replaced the teas in the room. Besides that the bed was comfortable, plenty of hot water with pressure and the best was the great location very close to the subway green line. Overall I think I was expecting more from a Sheraton, but in general my major purpose when selecting this hotel was location so the rest was secondary.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but I wouldn't pay $250”
Reviews.Author: navannavan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights recently. The location is very central for Boston being close to both Prudential and Hynes stops. When we arrived we were given our key etc. and made our way to our room which was not one of the large rooms (we had booked and paid through hotwire so had got a very very good price) with a nice queen size bed etc. The room was very comfortable and the shower was great. It was on the 15th floor. I reckon the view of the city gets very good from the 17th up. I agree with other reviewers that this hotel has no soul. It's lobby is just staid and dark above all. The worst thing I found about our stay was the lack of internet access in rooms (there is access but it's $10/day). We had to go to the lobby for free access and the lobby is peculiar here because it's full of people just there for the internet access; children on sofas playing games, business people holding laptops checking emails and travellers checking in online and printing boarding passes. Though this brought a bit of life to the place, it seems a bit ridiculous, that in an upmarket hotel, that internet is only free in the lobby. Everyone we dealt with was friendly and the offer to forego a room clean in exchange for a food voucher of $5. We felt this was very fair and took advantage of it. All in all, a good location got at a good price, shame about the (lack of) internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... Hotel could use Improvements”
Reviews.Author: tnmainsail
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week for a conference. The location was great! Very easy for colleagues to grab a quick bite to eat or take a quick break from working. However the hotel lacks greatly! We were booked into a room with heavy smoke. When we complained they offered to send someone up to change our rooms. After waiting quite awhile, I went downstairs, and tipped the bell captain. He immediately retrieved our new keys. Not sure why the front desk could not have done that? Also we were checked out a day early, and were repeatedly told how we made an error and I had to pay again with debit. Being a frequent traveller I knew this was out of the ordinary, but pressed for time I complied. Later that evening I spoke to another employee who was very friendly, answered all questions, and apologized for the other employee. I wish I had spoken to him instead of the other person, obviously! The lack of free internet draws a full crowd of teenagers to the free lobby computers. This creates a backup of business travelers needing to print travel arrangements, etc Plan ahead! Also know that they lock up the common restrooms around 10:30pm whether or not you are in there or not. The rooms were clean and we received fresh towels most of the days. This again is a great location! I'm just not sure the staff was able to handle the large crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Rather Chose one of the surrounding hotels”
Reviews.Author: ragatan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here now for 5 nights. Accommodation very average. Aircon makes such a noise you cant keep it on - room stuffy. No fridge, no mini bar. $10 internet access in rooms. Just your average convention hotel with hudreds of anonymous guests and no personal service. Only good thing is how it links up with shopping malls restaurants but so do all the other hotels nearby. Tired choice

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bartPlover
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent. We traveled with 2 small children - within one block there was this water feature - where you can run through water that is shooting out of the cement - it was so cool. Resturants were within walking distance. Rooms were very clean. Bathroom was tiny (up there with the tiniest bathroom at any hotel) - but clean and new. Beds were extremely comfortable. This was by far the best hotel we stayed at on our vacation. Parking was $ 44 - for the night and I know we could of parked for cheaper somewhere else - but we didn't want the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, well-located”
Reviews.Author: Go2Girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Boston with my husband and 2 Labrador Retreivers on August 2-4, 2010. We booked through Hotwire and got a great rate of $86 per night (compared to $250+ per night through the Sheraton website). This was a great stay. Our room - 1220 - was smallish but completely adequate and tastefully decorated. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean - both important points in my view. This hotel has a few things going for it. It is well-located in downtown Boston, within walking distance of major attractions like Fenway Park, Boston Common, the Public Garden, the Freedom Trail and Newbury St. shopping. The hotel allows dogs and does not charge a fee for them, unless "excessive" cleaning is required. It is also located directly across the street from a small dog-friendly park, which came in handy. Front desk was great - friendly, efficient, helpful. Finally, if you decline room service through Sheraton's "green" program, they'll give you a $5 voucher for use at any of the hotel's food service outlets - basically, just enough for 2 venti coffees in the morning at Starbucks. Nice. Just a few weaknesses to this property. First, hotel parking is excessively expensive - $39 for self-parking and $44 for valet parking although these seem to be market rates for the neighbourhood. We chose instead to take our chances parking on nearby streets and plugging a meter ($1/hour from 8-8). Second, the parking garage didn't allow adequate clearance for our roof-top cargo box (another reason that we chose to park on the strreet). Third, for out-of-towners who didn't know the streets in the area, it was kind of difficult to actually get to the hotel - we circled around it several times on nearby streets before actually finding out way onto Dalton St. Overall, I would rate this stay highly and came away quite satisfied with Sheraton (again).

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Road”
Reviews.Author: Frank1958
Reviews.Content: Large size and clean room, friendly staff - you might need to wait a while when checking in, and the lobby is a rather dark affair. Covered walkway to the conference center and shopping arcade with shops galore. Legal's (Seafood Restaurant) five minutes walk from Hotel. I had a couple of parcels sent to me, which were kept at the Business center, and I was charged an outrageous amount for the priviledge of receiving deliveries. All in all the Hotel is nothing to write home about, but a safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Greaty Location, Recently Renovated”
Reviews.Author: Alison G
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from my 2nd stay in the last year at this hotel, Its a great location next to the Prudental Center & Hynes Convention Center in the Back bay Area. Its a perfect base for exploring the city of Boston either on foot {the best way} or on the many tours that leave within walking distance of the hotel. The North Tower has been recently renovated in the last year and everything is brand new, the South Tower which has the better views has not yet been renovated. Starbucks in the Lobby, not always open only for a few hours a day and not open after 6pm in the evening, seems strange as its such a huge hotel that caters for conventions and travellers, dosent have a cafe in the lobby that isnt open for at least 8 hours a day. There is a 24 hour Walgreens accross the street, and a 24 hours Shaws groceries store a few mins walk from the hotel to stock up on essentials like bottled water and snacks. The nearest "T" {Boston city train} leaves from the prudential center {cheesecake factory entrance} and connects all over the city including to Logan Airport. Its within walking distance to the beautiful stores on Newbury St, Downtown Crossing, & Fenieul Hall, Dont forget to stroll through boston Common & if you have kids be sure to take them for a ride on the swan boats, Boston Harbour is beautiful in Summer, its just a short walk from Feniuel Hall, Dont Miss It! Boston is a beautiful city, Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the Sheraton. Employees made it great!”
Reviews.Author: Chiefy
Reviews.Content: Spent the better part of the last week of July at a conference at this hotel. Had a beautiful room with a poor view, but the comfortable bed, great work area, and large bathroom made up for the lack of something to look at out the window. Rm 1031 was clean, comfortable, easily adjustable AC unit, large closet and safe. Needed one minor repair and maintenance was there immediately and fixed the problem in about 4 minutes. Called for extra towels once, and they were there almost as soon as I hung up. Elevators were a little slow at checkout time. Computers in the lobby for email checking, etc. The GM, Jim Cook, was in the lobby on the day I checked in and introduced himself...how cool is that?? Two minor complaints would be that the shower head, while great in theory, was set for someone 5'8 or less...I had to crouch down to get under the spray. The other is the fact that wifi is a $10/day charge...paying almost $1200 for a five night stay (at conference rates) should be enough $$ to offer wifi. Ugh...its minor, but still a nuisance. Mall attached to the hotel had everything one could need or want, and then some! All touristy type stuff is within a brief walk. Superb location. Public transportation right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Still My Choice Hotel in Boston...for now”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the past 6 years. As a Platinum Starwood Preferred Guest member, I still get upgraded to a corner suite on one of the higher floors in the North Tower overlooking the Charles River and Back Bay, free internet access, and access to the club lounge on the 29th floor. The beds are of high quality, it is generally quiet in the hallways, I really like the free computer access in the lobby area, readily available Starbucks, complimentary USA Today newsaper, and lots of couches to sit on in the large lobby. It is probably the largest hotel closest to Fenway Park. Plenty of restaurants on nearby Newbury Street. I still prefer this hotel for now, however, I will start to explore others in the downtown Boston area. Simply put, this hotel's standards are decreasing. The room was barely cleaned for 3 nights we stayed there, there is always a huge crowd of people checking in at the front desk, front desk staff seem stressed, the quality and variety of food and drink in the club lounge is now poor, the club lounge renovation is ghastly, and the valet parking and bellboys seem disinterested. $44 per night valet parking is too high. Management from Starwood itself needs to take notice

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great.”
Reviews.Author: rodluver
Reviews.Content: The evelators were the slowest I have ever encounted. Housekeeping was slow cleaning the rooms. Also a room service tray was in the hall all afternoon one day

Reviews.Title: “Best location for evening, otherwise huge conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: 75xyr
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the valet was quick and efficient unloading luggage and taking my car. Front desk check in was absolutely delightful: courteous, gracious, and my request for a high floor king with unobstructed river view was fulfilled with a smile. The room has been renovated and is comfortable, though small with a tiny bathroom. But the magnificent view more than compensates. The pillowcases are not large enough to cover the entire pillow. This was annoying. Quite a few TV channels were fuzzy. Catered meals during a conference were delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anna L
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this Sheraton hotel a lot. The hotel is very big (rooms devided over 2 towers) and is situated next to the Prudential centre. Direct acccess from the hotel. Prefect for leisure or business trips. Our room was spacious and had a nice view on the river Charles, Cambridge and various parts of Boston. Bathroom nice, beds comfortable, newspaper in the morning. Of course parking ($42 per 24 hours with in and out possibilities) and internet not free of charge, but we knew that in advance. The hotel has a nice swimming pool. On nice sunny days the roof is open and you can enjoy the sun terrace. Staff friendly and helpfull. Area very nice and entertaining. Subway/busses/trains very close but if you don't mind walking: downtown only half an hour by foot and also riverside and park nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay....”
Reviews.Author: rustyfankathie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Boston for 6 nights to attend a conference at the Hynes Convention Center. I have no complaints about the service, the room, the staff. Granted, the room didn't have much of a view - we were in the South Tower with a great view of the North Tower, but we could see parts of the city on either side of the North Tower. The room was comfortable and large enough to accommodate two women with all their accessories! The bathroom was rather small, but had a nice sized vanity. We asked for extra hangers and they were delivered promptly. If I have any complaints, it's that the restaurant in the hotel (Apropos?) never seemed to be open. We ate breakfast every morning at one of the small restaurants in the Prudential Center (Au Ba Pain, Dunkin' Donuts). Lunch was most often in one of the restaurants on Boyleston Street across from the convention center or in the Pru Center food court. One other issue I had upon check out was that the entire room was charged to my roommate's credit card, rather than being split. We checked in at different times, and gave two different credit cards; both names were on the registration. I had a hard time explaining to the person at check out that it was to be split between the two cards. All in all, not a bad experience, and what I would expect from a Sheraton in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dawoz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days back in June of 2010. The hotel itself is huge. I believe it is in the 1250 room area, making it quite large... The hotel has tons of meeting rooms, in addition from being just a block away from a large convention center. The location is great. If you are playing tourist like I was, the "hop on, hop off" trolley tour stops directly in front of the hotel. The hotel is attached to a large shopping mall that also has a subway stop (Green line). In addition to being close to public transportation, it is walking distance to Fenway Park (20 minutes or so) and there are tons of great restaurants in Back Bay just a few minutes walk away. When going to Back Bay, I found it quicker to cut through the shopping center that is attached rather than walk all the way around... It will save you about 1/4 a mile of walking. There is a full service Starbucks in the HUGE lobby area... in addition to free-wifi and several computer stations set up to use if you don't have your own computer. You can also print boarding passes etc from there. We were upgraded to a very nice suite on the 26th floor that had incredible views of Back Bay, the harbor and of you even see Fenway park. This place is expensive. I think I paid 230+ a night which is expensive for me.... If you are visiting from out of town, don't wast the money on a rental car. They will charge you 40.00 per night to park a car you will never use. You are better off taking a taxi from the airport rather than renting a car. If in Boston, I would HIGHLY recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: CTTRVL
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great especially with the recent renovations! Love the location and its proximity to everything Boston.

Reviews.Title: “This is what you expect from a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: CanuckRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Ok, first off I'm an SPG Platinum member and a Marriott Gold member. I travel to tons of hotels and this is absolutely one of my favourite. The hotel has done some great reno's the past year. Excellent club lounge, rooms are great and if your an SPG Gold or Platinum member this hotel always upgrades you. I had a great suite upgrade but have also stayed in standard rooms which I have found to be great. The hotel has a Starbucks and a very good breakfast buffett. The bar is great and the staff excellent. Linda and Mary at the bar are wonderful. There is no real dinner dining but you can walk to dozens of restaurants within 10 minutes. The hotel location is excellent. We also walked to Fenway to see a game and its about 30 minutes for a casual walk. Parking is 42,00 a night which sucks but its the same every where downtown Boston. Gym and pool are nice and there is a good mix of families and business people. I travel a lot and this is the most consistent hotel I have come across. At this Sheraton you get what you expect from a Sheraton and more.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: vhasouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Sheraton. I will admit, when we first checked in I was disappointed that my original request for a room with a view of the River was not able to be fulfilled. But when we saw our room, we were very pleased. No, the view was not what I had hoped for, we had a view of the city and the reflection pool. But the size and comfort of the room was wonderful. We had four adults staying for 5 nights in one hotel room. We had no problems! The location was perfect for us. Being able to walk through the Prudential Center when it was raining was a wonderful perk. Our final morning a gentleman who was on staff at the Sheraton asked me how I had enjoyed my stay. I commented that I would've loved to have seen the view of the river from an upper floor. He went to the front desk and took myself and my family up to the 29th floor and pointed out the different sights. He went above and beyond. Basically we made the "postcard" pics as we were leaving. I look forward to returning to Boston and staying at the Sheraton again!!

Reviews.Title: “Room so small I would break a hip if I turned quickly”
Reviews.Author: NYerUWS
Reviews.Content: View of a parking deck. Small shelf masquerading as a desk. Bathroom even more ridiculous in size - absolutely miniscule. No hooks to hang a towel. So much for being green. One person on front desk with lots of people standing around looking irritated. Dark. Are they kidding with this place?

Reviews.Title: “roach in tub”
Reviews.Author: glo777
Reviews.Content: Ok, I was in Boston for a work project, and having been a Platinum member at Marriott, I naturally stayed at the Marriott Copley Place and recieved the Platinum member benefits. So, the week the Mariott was booked full, I stayed at the Sheraton with the rest of my team. Granted I wasn't staying in the "new wing" for not having any member status, but I was paying more than I pay at the Marriott, and expected more for that alone. I didn't get breakfast, the check in was not accomodating at all, and to make things worse, I walk in to the room and find a roach crawling around in the tub. When I told my boss about this, being a native Bostonian, she did mention that there are a lot of times roaches crawl up pipes and what not - no matter the age of building - but still. This was not acceptable. For the price and claims of "making it a better place to stay", do some pest control!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, right in the...”
Reviews.Author: TXKBaby
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay, right in the middle of everything! We walked to Fenway, Cheers, and other interesting sites. The hotel is connected to the Prudential Center, which has many stores and restaurants. There's a beautiful view of the city from this hotel. I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic view!”
Reviews.Author: pandmg
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 6 night stay in the Sheraton. We booked through Hotwire for the first time so were a bit anxious. As we were there for Independence Day I did some research through TA and emailed the hotel to request a high floor room in the North Tower which would give us a view of the river for the firework display - the view was amazing! Our room was on the 20th floor and situated directly opposite the barge where the fireworks were being let off. The room was designated as suitable for disabled use, so slightly wider doors and bigger bathroom which wasn't a problem at all! There was plenty of storage space in both the bedroom and bathroom, the bed very comfortable, a coffee maker, iron and board provided. The bedroom itself wasn't enormous but fine, the decor was smart and modern and the air con ultra efficient and quiet, a great plus as there was a heatwave going on at the time. Position wise its maybe a bit out on a limb from many of the sights, but the T is so efficient you can get around very easily. We didn't use the restaurant or gym and pool so can't comment but the bar was pleasant and prices about what you'd expect to pay in this standard of hotel. We also particularly liked the dedicated on-line check in facilty for our flights home!

Reviews.Title: “$42.00 per night for parking!!”
Reviews.Author: TREDLindsay_Ontario
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Hotwire. com. Paid $129.00 per night for a rating of 3 1/2 stars. Great hotel, great location. Subway (very efficient) and areas such as Newbury St. is one block away. Highly recommedn the Olde Town City Tour bus that stops right in front of the hotel. Boston was fantastic! Just beware of the title...$42.00 to park your car. I parked acrtoss the street for $30.00 per day. Saw Blue Man group..paid $68.00 on line, but found tickets at Quincy Market at the the BosTix kiosk for $40.00. Show is worth seeing. Hotel is attached to a shopping mall with lots of cheap eats in the food court.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service lacking”
Reviews.Author: sierranevada
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying here 3 nights before heading to NH. I am a lilttle disappointed in the hotel. Check in was a huge long line, no one at the Gold/Platnium desk. I had reserved 2 Club Level rooms which would not be ready until after 4 pm (late check out for Plat/Gold members - this I understood). Was reassigned to an executive suite with connecting Double/Double for the teens that was not on Club floor but had club access - or so I thought. Our key would not work - went back to front desk and was told I had to tell the check in person we had club access - hmmm, don't they know that??? Room was nice a big but if the bed is a Sweet Sleeper, then they have seriously gone downhill - extremely hard and not very comfortable. A/C is high on the wall near the window, works well but points directly at the other wall - not into the room - so the couch by the window is nice and cool but not the rest of the room. There is no WiFi in the rooms (paid or free) - very surprised about that considering they are a big convention hotel. PITA to use the wired internet since you have to sit at the desk. They really need to come into the 21st century! Not being on a club level was a little inconvenient since only 2 of the 6 elevators go to those floors. It usually took about 4 tries to get the right elevator. Club Lounge - again, big disappointment. Have stayed at many club level starwood hotels and have always had complimentary wine and beer - not here - they charge restaurant prices for the drinks. Non-alcoholic drinks were complimentary and well stocked. Food was just okay - a few hot apps, bread & cheese, veggie and dips and nuts. Breakfast was cereals, bagels, fresh fruit and yogurt. The good news is that the lounge is open 24 hours for access, sodas and water (not food) so I least I could use the free WiFi in the lounge. Service - the staff is all very nice but I always had to ask twice for things to be sent to the room. First Concierge was very helpful, the second one was very abrupt and borderline rude. Easy access to the underground/train, nice view of the Charles RIver. Overall, it is okay but I will try another hotel next time I am in Boston. I would cautiously recommend the hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Small complaints, but fine”
Reviews.Author: ladyfitch
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights recently and all in all it was an enjoyable stay. The lobby is quite gorgeous, but huge and there is a lot of walking involved to access different parts/shops/centres. The location is great, just by the prudential centre (with a walk way) and walking distance to many banks and fast food chains. Check in was very slow and the line was about 15 people deep - 3 hours before check in time. They did work through it quite quickly though and I was only there about 10 minutes. A guest agent came in and assisted people in line to ensure everyone was waiting only if they needed to. The room itself was fine. Not a fan of the curtains.. but the beds were comfy and it was modern enough. The bathroom was very small and there was no room to place your open shampoo or conditioner. I called up for a bathrobe and it was delivered quite promptly. The cleaning staff are non abstruse, but the hall ways are far too narrow with their carts. The fitness centre has limited equipment and closes at 10pm. This really pisses me off, as it's key card accessed anyway.. and many people enjoy working out after 10pm. Large pool, didn't go in but nice looking. Lockers rooms were impressive though with a bathers drying machine and nice lockers. Check out was very easy. I made a few local and toll free calls.. not charged for none. I told her this and she just said as much as 'oh well, hotels loss'. Nice lady. Lobby gets very busy at night. Social atmosphere. Few drunk sleazy men, but they were harmless.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: goldye
Reviews.Content: Date of stay: June 29, 2010. Classy hotel with all the amenities. Location is convenient with access on the 2nd Fl. in the North Tower. Takes you direct thru Prudential Center. Concierge was very helpful & reservation was quick & easy. One negative is driving to the hotel without a GPS is confusing if you're not familiar with Boston city streets. I parked on the other side of the hotel's garage & access to my car was a long walk but was made easier going thru the Prudential Center walkway. Even though I booked this hotel thru Priceline, I loved the hotel & would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Kittylitter_1
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends chose the hotel as I had previously stayed here and the service and comfort 4 years ago had stuck in my mind. Our room was large and spotless. The beds were so comfortable, we had fantastic sleeps! We loved being so near to the shopping centre and a variety of great restaurants. Our return flight was affected by strike action by one of the airlines and the staff were so helpful in assisting us with securing accomodation for the extra nights. In particular, Mr Cook passed us in the lobby and asked if we were ok. After explaining our predicament, he went away and secured us a rate that we had paid via our travel operator, much cheaper than the online price. This took away a lot of stress and it was much appreciated. We had a lovely meal in the dining area of the bar. The food was gorgeous and the portions were huge! We made the mistake of ordering an appetiser and an entree. I am looking forward to returning to this hotel, and I know the others in my party are planning to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: cpagia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a few Sheratons on a 3 month trip and this was the pick. The service was a cut above other sheraton properties, and the location was great, right in the centre of Boston, close to a metro stop, not too far from Back Bay train station, short walk to Boston Pops and a moderate walk to Fenway Park. No idea about parking, but a car would hardly be necessary. The usual Sheraton internet - annoyingly not free in room, but available wirelessly or with computer in "the Link". Also if you chose not to have your room made up, you get a $5 voucher every night which you can use in the onsite starbucks or other food shops. I know a lot of hotels pay lip service to being green, so good to see someone actively promoting it. Got a good deal on the hotel via priceline so superb value for money for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in beautiful Back Bay!”
Reviews.Author: indianatraveler33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights while on a quick sight-seeing trip in Boston. I had booked the hotel through a discount site and was a little nervous that we would be given a "bad" room but my worries were unfounded. The lady who checked us in was very kind and even asked us what kind of room we preferred. Our room was on the 22nd floor - wasn't too big, but plenty of room for the amount of time we spent there. We enjoyed the view as well as the desk, table and flat screen TV as well as a very comfortable king size bed. The hotel was very quiet - we didn't once wake up due to noise in the hallways which is unusual for any hotel. The only downside was the parking - had to pay $38 a day to park at the Prudential Center. A few other things we really loved - the pool and sunning deck, the computers with free internet use in the lobby, the Starbucks in the lobby and the hotel being connected to a very nice shopping mall with a T station right there. We would definitely stay here again should we be lucky enough to have another trip to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and located in the heart of Boston.”
Reviews.Author: DoubleDown71
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for company training. You can't beat the $150 corporate rate. This hotel is located in the Prudential center building with the shopping malls. I highly recommend staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time at Sheraton Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EMC_ASH
Reviews.Content: Date: May 20, 2010 It was my first visit to Boston and based on internet search and suggestions, i booked this hotel mainly because of location and its class. Itâ€™s in the heart of Boston, called downtown. My stay was really an amazing experience; firstly room was really big and with beautiful site out and all the luxury. The USP of this hotel is, it is connected to a big mall called Hynes convention center and mall, where you have great restaurants (all cuisines) and lot of shopping and hang out places. So even if you are late stay out late night, its very convenient to reach. Being in the center of town it is close to most of attractions in the city and few of them are just walk able such as Museum of Art, MIT, Hynes Mall, Public Library etc. All in all, its great places to stay, when you are in Boston, only thing is if you can afford the cost. As due to its location itâ€™s pretty expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: kymberand
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this hotel with my husband and toddler son, because my husband and I were both attending a conference held jointly at the (attached) Hynes Convention Center and in the Sheraton itself. Since we were travelling with our child the location was critical for us, since we needed to move between our hotel room and conference quickly and easily throughout the day. We booked a junior suite for $220 since we wanted a bit more space. The room was really nice, with a separate bedroom and living room area (separated by doors) so we could still use the room while our son slept. We were on a high floor and the view from our (very large) window over the Charles rive and Cambridge was amazing, especially in the evening. What we were most impressed by, however, was the friendly service and how helpful the staff were to businesspeople travelling with a young child. They provided us with a baby crib, small refridgerator and microwave in the room free of charge, without us even needing to request these. All of the staff, including desk staff and cleaning staff, took a moment to smile and chat with our son, which we did not expect at all for a business hotel. The cleaning staff in particular always took the time to check before entering if our son was sleeping, and ask specifically (each day!) if we required any extra amenities (towels, toiletries etc) because of the baby. As a side note, the conference facilities in the hotel were also entirely satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with Everything”
Reviews.Author: Rumples
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in June at the end of a road trip through New England with friends and couldn't have been more pleased with our lodging. First, we paid less than $100 for the room, which was a special on Hotwire. Second, the small-but-comfortable renovated room was clean and quiet, had a great double bed that ensured a good night's sleep and was located on the 14th floor of the North Tower with a wonderful view of the Charles River and Cambridge. It was magical to look out at the evening lights. Third, the elevators came quickly and we never had to wait longer than a few seconds. In our travels worldwide, we have found that free use of computers for Internet service is generally only provided at B&Bs and budget hotels. Thus, we were delighted to discover that the Sheraton Boston has bucked this trend, offering many free computers for guests to use near reception. A Starbucks is also in this area. The hotel's convenient location includes indoor walkways to the Prudential and Copley Place shops as well as the Hynes Convention Center. We walked inside the mall areas to Amtrak's Boston Back Bay Station for our morning train to New York City. The concierge alerted me to this option when I asked about taking the subway to Amtrak's Boston South Station. His suggestion saved us time and much hassle with our luggage. We found all hotel staff to be friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just not quite 5 star”
Reviews.Author: adventuremam
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Boston Hotel is in a great location for having fun in the city of Boston, and the conference facilities were very comfortable. We had two problems that made this hotel less than the 5 star prices for room rates. 1) The supposed "comfort beds" were too firm and the pillows too soft and squishy. I had requsted non-alergenic pillows and never did have them brought to the room. 2) My husband and I had a running bet for how long two dirty glasses on the floor in the hall by our door would stay there - they were there when we arrived and were finally removed 3 days later. Otherwise our stay was quite comfortable, and we really loved the view of the Charles river out of our window. If the Sheraton Boston Hotel wants to earn 5 stars from me - they need to do more training with their housekeeping staff, and pay attention to guest requests regarding bedding. It was also a bit of a mystery why the in house restaurant was closed during a very busy coference for the hotel - I would have appreciated being able to get a good breakfast without dealing with room service.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location for attending conference at hynes convention centre”
Reviews.Author: shaild
Reviews.Content: stayed for 6 nights.very good downtown location.hynes convention centre , prudential towers,copley place and food court are connected to the hotel.newbury street and fenway park are nearby. good connectivity by metro.if you find inhouse restaurant costly you can buy your daily needs, fruits and food from adjoining marts .that is what i did.rooms are nice and comfortable.hotel staff are helpful and knowledgeable about boston . its good value for money hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FunFamily05
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 days for a conference in the attached Convention Center. It is a very nice hotel with a very large lobby area...bar area in lobby plus 3 areas with computers sitting around for guests to use for free. Our room was over $200....and it wasn't worth that when compared to similar rooms, but I kept reminding myself I was in downtown Boston and for a downtown location that is not unusual. Family was with me and the size of the hotel room was larger than I thought it would be....however the bathroom was TINY. Hotel is also attached to the Prudential Mall with many nice shops/restaurants and the Prudential Subway stop is there, also. You are a 10 minute walk from Fenway.....and it is a safe walk since LOTS of fans park at the hotel/Prudential Center and walk from there to the game. The Duck boats also board next to the Prudential center and I HIGHLY recommend the Duck boats....best tour we had in Boston. If you plan on going to the North End or Faneuil Hall...you will need to take a cab or the subway...as the hotel is a good distance away from those areas. Parking at the hotel is $42 per day...which is expected. Staff of hotel/bell men/house keeping were all very nice. Beds are very nice and they felt like they were new.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suite”
Reviews.Author: kenji98
Reviews.Content: No complaints....everything there but it was a suite and had all....

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: sanantoniogirl
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I wasn't expecting this to be all that nice, but it's been renovated and my room (actually I got upgraded to a suite by John Carbone (sp?)) was spacious with a great view, super comfy bed, nice amenities, etc. I really liked it here - it was quiet in the room and the location was very convenient to just about everything. I would stay here again. I wouldn't pay over $200 for a regular room though.

Reviews.Title: “Central Modern Boston Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: artnuvo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this central modern (next to the Prudential Center tiwth cafes and shopping mall) hotel for two days on the 25th fl, North Tower which has updated recently refurbished rooms. Riverview is spectacular, elevators are fast, and the K and Q rooms are the same size, having tried both. There is free internet for guests in the lobby by the Starbucks and a separate boarding pass printing machine. Breakfast provided by the function we attended in Apropos was a nice buffet breakfast, but less expensive and better options available on nearby Newbury Street-try Charlie's. If you are an art & architecture fan seek out the free tour at the public library two blocks away and make sure you view the reading room, hammer beam ceiling on the third floor, and the EA Abbey murals on the 4th floor; currently, nice small Toulouse Lautrec show at the MFA. Metro is nearby, reached thru the Prudential Center-from the airport, change at Govt Center to Green Line, Heath St.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: star1984
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Sheraton. We loved it so much the first time round that we were delighted to get it for a fraction of the advertised price on Hotwire. (thanks to betterbidding.com we pretty much knew that the Sheraton was what we were gonna get) We paid $150 per night for a 3 person room in mid May. This was a geat deal as this is a busy period in Boston and The Sheraton's website was asking for $400 a nite (ridiculous). As we booked through Hotwire for the first time we were nervous that we would get crappy treatment and the worst room in the house. This wasnt the case we had a nice room with 2 queen beds in the South tower. We requested a free rollaway bed also which was surprisingly comfortable!! The location is unbeatable. You are around the corner from Newbury Street (Bostons fifth avenue!), you are attached to two upscale malls with great eating options and a T Station. You are on a direct line to the Galleria-great mall for affordable shopping! Plus the trolley tours leave from right outside the hotel. The hotel itself has a busy feel which I love but I guess some people might not. The lobby is alway full of people coming and going but I loved this. There is a constant sense of activity and a buzz about. My only complaints about the hotel are minor and insignificant given the price I paid but if I had paid full price I would be annoyed that there is no safe or mini fridge in the bedroom. Particularly, the safe when you have money and passports in the room. For shoppers I would definitely reccomend the Galleria Mall. For tourists we had such a great time on Old Town Trolley Tour. Its expensive enough but worth it and I know the reviews here are mixed but we LOVED top of the hub for dinner, The food and service was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Superb position”
Reviews.Author: Hoadswood
Reviews.Content: Got stuck in Boston 'cos of the Ash Cloud and Virgin Holidays put us up in the Sheraton. What a stroke of luck! I know it's a chain hotel, so you pretty much know what you're getting, but they looked after us superbly and we had a superior room on the 25th floor. At the start it was unclear whether they would have rooms for the weekend (it was the Boston marathon) but the director of rooms, Charmaine, made sure we stayed exactly where we were, and even sent up a surprise dessert â€“ a chocolate volcano! One particular lady at check-in could have tried smiling a little more often (well once would have been nice) but apart from that, a great stay. The hotel is joined on to the Prudential Mall, so eating in the evening was a breeze. If you're ever there, you have to try the Cheesecake factory â€“ not only mind-blowing cheesecakes, but the most reasonable dinner menu in town! Got stuck for 7 days in the end, so we can definitely recommend this eatery!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Divinman87
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were visiting this Sheraton on the last leg of our vacation and found it wonderful. Everyone was great and very helpful! Check in was smooth and the room had a great view of the city. The room was much bigger than i thought it would be given it was in a larger city. The only complaint I have qould have been the zombie like Bellmen. Everyone I encountered and needed help from was like pulling teeth to get them to help. Overall I had a great stay and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and service”
Reviews.Author: infrequenttraveler50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located next to the Prudential Center and Newbury Street. The staff were incredibly helpful. We made two requests during our 5 night stay -- one for extra bath supplies and the other for a refrigerator. Both times the items were delivered in between 5 and 10 minutes. For such a large hotel, the staff are very responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Apparently Sheraton are indeed getting better !”
Reviews.Author: Sylvainautourdumonde
Reviews.Content: What a difference a renovation and a new focus could do ! I never thought I would say anything good about Sheraton. To me it was a bunch of outdated properties, some badly, with rather ordinary to poor service. The newly renovated Sheraton Boston proved me wrong. The redone lobby is inviting, calming, nicely decorated with plenty of seating and places to hang out. Nicely done. It has a Starbuck Coffee and some computers available free (Links at Sheraton, they call it). The lobby can become a really busy place at times. The check-in was friendly and quick. Since the room was not ready they offered to call me on my cell when it would be ready. Nice touch. I was upgraded to an executive suite. (I'm SPG Gold, but that doesn't typically give you a suite). The room was a nice corner corner obviously recently renovated. It had a flat screen TV, a confortable working desk and a very confortable bed. The decor was really nice with pictures of Boston on the walls. Unfortunately no wi-fi access in the room and a rather high fee for wired internet. This hotel is well located in the Back Bay neighborhood a few minutes walk from the restaurants of Newbury St and the shops of Boylston St. A great stay. I will reconsider Sheraton. Renovated ones !

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice rooms. A B+ experience.”
Reviews.Author: Karch72
Reviews.Content: Stayed six days while attending a conference. Pros: Ideal location next to the Hynes Convention Center and close to Boylston St. and Newbury St., just 5 blocks or so away from Fenway Park, free Internet in the lobby. Cons: Room walls are paper thin ... I could hear every word that my next door neighbors were saying, cardio machines in the exercise room could use some updating, Overall, a good experience. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular panoramic view”
Reviews.Author: Taffeta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton for four nights while attending a conference in Boston. My room was very clean and nicely laid out. The thing that I remember the most is the wonderful panoramic view looking across the Back Bay area and over the Charles River. I was on a fairly high floor and there were no other tall buildings nearby. Any time I was in the room and not sleeping, the curtains were wide open so I could gaze out the window. I didn't have a computer with me, and was happy to see they had several computers with large monitors in the lobby for guests to use (one had to log in with name and room number to use them). I liked that this hotel is connected to the Prudential Center and a huge bunch of shops. It was also a good thing with somewhat inclement weather. I only used the restaurant once. Was not too impressed with it overall. The service was fine, but the food was not very good. Although usually I was at the conference, I did go to the Gardner museum once, and it was easy to get there on the T trains. Oh, they also had a computer where it was easy to check in for flights and print the boarding pass. That is a trend that more and more hotels seem to be adopting, and was glad to see it here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: triciabh1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton because I got a great price on Hotwire and I was a little nervous reading some of the reviews but seriously this was a great hotel! Our room seemed like it was a little older but had some updates. It wasn't a super fancy room but it was good in my standards. It was very clean and comfortable and we had a great view of the fountain and church nearby. My only complaint would be that I wished the shower had a curved shower curtain and maybe a light but that is very petty in the overall stay. The bed was sooooo comfortable and the location was spectacular. The staff were all very friendly as well. For someone who had never been to Boston before, this was perfect. We went to a Red Sox game and it was a short 10 minute walk...very close to great shopping and tons of restaurants. If I ever make it to Boston again, which I hope to, I would definitely stay in this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “New rooms are very small”
Reviews.Author: AlbanyL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the past and had a good stay. This time we were on the 5th floor in the north tower which I think is a new addition. The room was clean and modern but very small. There were two double beds and barely room for anything else. We're average size people buy in the bathroom we had to squeeze in order to close the door, and only then be able to stand and face the sink comfortably. Bathing the kids was nearly impossible. I wasn't too comfortable sleeping, although my family thought the beds were OK. One thing I can say for sure was that the blankets were very noisy... I know it sounds strange but I guess is the waterproof material or something in their detergent, we could hear every move and turn and it was quite annoying. The parking is pricey ($42/night). On the positive side - the service was good, the location is great, and the hotel overall is nice with good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: OzzyinBigD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights. I haven't looked closely at other reviews, but I really don't understand why this hotel isn't rated higher. I can say that unless the price is just hugely different, (I think the Sheraton is actually cheaper) I would stay here over the Hilton across the street any day. (I had friends staying at the Hilton - the rooms were the same, the Hilton offered a very quickie cheap free breakfast (big deal), and other then that, the Sheraton blew it away. My thoughts: Location - can't beat it if you're looking at the Back Bay area. The hotel is attached (we had wet cold weather for 3 days) to the Convention Center, the mall (all kinds of shops and restaurants), the Prudential building (if you have business there) and the closest T station (Prudential station). Fenway Park was a 10 minute walk one direction and Boston Commons was a 15-20 minute walk the other. Lobby - the hotel's biggest asset in my opinion. Extremely big, open and updated, which served as a nice meeting / hangout area for the party I was traveling with. Plenty of lounge chairs, a Starbucks (service WAS slow there) and about 10 computers comfortably spaced out to access the free internet. I didn't partake of the bar or restaurant so "no comment" there, but I really don't know why anyone would eat there, as there are dozens of other choices within the block.
