Rooms - small but big enough. This (like probably most hotels in the area) is an older building they've done their best to update. My one complaint w/b the shower - the shower head leaked and only about half the water came out the way it should have. (The Hilton room I saw was the exact same size.) Service - Thought it was good-to-great. We asked for an extra bed and it was quickly provided. The conceirge was friendly and helpful with all "how do I get here" questions. We also had a slight issue with the bill, and the Sheraton immediately took care of it in our favor, which was way above and beyond what we expected. My only other complaint (and I'm nitpicking) w/b that it seemed to take the receptionists a little too long to check people in (the computers seemed very slow). Stay here with no regrets!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Horrible restaurant...”
Reviews.Author: Finortner
Reviews.Content: Positives: 1)Staff: Valet, front desk, concierge, bell captain all very helpful...above and beyond. 2)Rooms: Great view of the Charles River, Great beds 3)Exercise: Very big pool and hot tub, exercise room top notch 4) Location: perfect access to shopping, tourist activities, restaurants Negatives: The hotel restaurant Cafe Apropos was, without a doubt, the worst experience in dining I have experienced in years. It was obvious that the wait staff was instructed to push the breakfast buffet. My kids wanted pancakes. I ordered pancakes and was told that the buffet was $8.95 for kids, a good deal. One problem: no pancakes on the buffet. I was instructed to order pancakes through the waiter, which is what i thought I did in the first place. I was coerced into trying the buffet, big mistake. Eggs and oatmeal were cold, bacon and sausage overdone. Yogurt had separated. It was obvious that the buffet was stocked hours earlier and never refreshed. The experienced reeked of laziness. It was as if the staff felt there was plenty of food left on the buffet to cover the rest of the morning. No need for made to order food.The waiter disappeared after coercing us into the buffet, never to be seen again. It is amazing how one negative experience can tarnish one's opinion. After great service from the rest of the staff, the horrible service at the restaurant would deter me from returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Rooms but indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: CTitzer
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a really great location if you're looking to jump off into the South End or head into Cambridge and a nice stroll to Boston Common. There really is no bad spot in Boston to stay, I soon realized when booking this hotel. I didn't really know what to expect location wise but it was great for what we were looking for. We arrived around 6 in the evening and the check in was very smooth. The gentleman who checked us in was very courteous, helpful, and friendly. He was a little stiff for my liking but this is what you must expect when staying in a Sheraton/Westin. They were not hired for their personality..more so their talent and to work like a machine and spill out the same information over and over 500x's per night. The room was a junior suite and was very nice. I even discovered that the sofa pulled out to be a bed as well, when needed. The view was very nice as well looking out into Cambridge. The only real complaint on the bathroom was the 'rainfall' shower head that was installed as a regular shower head. The design is off and in doing so the pressure suffers for the decor. The next complaint comes in the way of the evening concierge team; both men. I called down to the desk from the room inquiring about a restaurant a friend of mine had suggested. The concierge was unfamiliar with Myers+Chang so he looked it up and placed me on hold. He came back on the line and stated once again that he was unaware of the restaurant but the address was 'x'. I asked him what the cross streets were and his response was 'I do not know'. What concierge doesn't know how to use the zoom tools in Google Maps? Google should be their best friend. I let it slide. On our way out of the hotel to dinner i stopped by the concierge desk again and inquired what are the cross streets of the restaurant. Different guy this time, he had heard of the restaurant but was unfamiliar of the location. He pulled out a map and said that it was on washington and then pointed on the map between a 4 block radius. Again, not able to give us a cross street. I am not sure why these two gentleman who's sole purpose is to aid and guide the guests were so unhelpful...and the tone in their voice and their attitude was completely unacceptable. We decided to walk to the restaurant. Once outside we asked the doorman which direction was Boylston street. He said that he didn't have his glasses and just stood there. Unbelievable how many rude people we ran into in just a 1.5hr time period. I hate to think ho room service and the housekeepers act! Had breakfast buffet both mornings..service was very friendly and the food was mediocre. It is a buffet after all. Apart from the long negative paragraph i would still recommend this place. I am hoping that my experience was just a fluke - maybe not though? The rooms and location were very good!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mornado
Reviews.Content: My sisters cousin and I arrived from a red eye flight and thought we would take a chance and ask about early check in at the Sheraton.The very kind young lady who assisted us told us that would be no problem.Unfortunately I didn"t write her name down.We were given two rooms close to each other and it was great to freshen up after a sleepless night.The beds are the best hotel ones I have ever slept in.My sister called and was able to arrange for a small fridge (no charge) in one room.The rooms are clean and spacious.Another nice perk;you can opt to not have your sheets changed daily and for every day of that you receive a $5. credit towards a purchase at the hotel shops. Good location, we would all stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So noisy we had to check out early”
Reviews.Author: urbancocoa
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I were supposed to stay at the Sheraton for three nights, we ended up staying for only two. The Sheraton is in a great location close to the lovely restaurants and shops on Newbury St., walking distance to the Commons and Public Garden, attached to the Prudential Center,and near the T station. Unfortunately though the walls are paper thin. We had to check-out a day early because we couldn't sleep at night or have quiet time during the day. We could hear EVERYTHING the people next door were saying . And they were just speaking in normal voices, they weren't being loud. The hotel didn't care about the issue and didn't offer to put us in a different room. So I would not recommend staying here if you're at all sensitive to noise.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but there are better options”
Reviews.Author: OutWanderin
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference at this hotel. My room had seen better days. The wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling, there were stains on the ottoman, carpet, and a side chair. The shower curtain kept falling off the hooks. I could hardly sleep because my room was right next to the elevators. I heard them go up and down all night. I could also hear quite a bit from the room next door--especially when the person was in the bathroom. Parking was a bit of a scam--watch out! When I checked in, they did not tell me that valet had free in/out services. So I self-parked only to get stuck in the garage trying to find my way out. There is only one exit for cash-paying customers. I missed the 24-hour cut-off and had to pay $9 extra for the privilege of wandering around trying to find my way out. What a racket! The conference facilities were crowded and a bit confusing in layout. I practically had to tackle a staff member to find out how to log onto wifi in the lobby. Room service rates were among the most expensive I've seen anywhere. I've been to other Boston hotels that had better set-ups.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect...”
Reviews.Author: TheVacationAdvisors
Reviews.Content: For the full review, visit TheVacationAdvisors. We thought the location was great. The hotel is centrally located in the popular Back Bay area of Boston, close to shopping, dining and other attractions. For those of you that love to shop, the hotel is connected to the Prudential Center and upscale Copley Place Mall and is also just one block from the famous Newbury Street, known for its designer boutiques. The hotel is also just steps away from Boston's clean and efficient metro. We thought the location of the hotel was great. The hotel and our room were very clean. The bathroom was also very well maintained and clean. The hotel lobby, fitness center and pool were also very well maintained and clean. The staff were dressed in professional and clean uniforms. We stayed in a traditional guest room and found the room to be very comfortable and spacious. The room had a sitting area, a desk area and a very large and comfortable bed. The large windows also allowed a lot of natural light to enter the room. The bedding was soft and cozy. The decor was trendy and stylish. The bathroom was not as trendy as the room but was still nice. The bathroom was large and had a spacious marble countertop. The views of the city from the room were very nice. Toiletries were provided We really enjoyed our stay here and would make this our first choice of hotels in this category in Boston. The hotel room was very comfortable and the staff was very helpful. The location was also good. We really can't find anything to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: vazMiami
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is a good bet considering the Location. I have stayed several times and there il always a convetion going on (this time was the Anime convention) so it gets very congested. I would avoid staying there next time if there is a convention the Valet Parking and the Luggage Handlers are a separate company and they do not show the same level of service as if they were owned by the Starwood hotel directly (very rude service most of the time)

Reviews.Title: “very happy with my 5 stays”
Reviews.Author: oluap
Reviews.Content: As I have my daughter studing at NEU, every time I travel to Boston, I stay at this Hotel, well located, special during the winter, very nice front desk staff, despite very busy with the usual conventioners... I`ll be back next month and this time bringing to me my mother in law !!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Management Ever........Avoid EVER,EVER EVER going here!”
Reviews.Author: jma00a1
Reviews.Content: We had reserved 2 hotel rooms (1 a club and the other a regular Double) months ago. 1 hour prior to our arrival (my son is in a wheelchair) we were called and told we we being moved from the Hotel to another hotel about 2 miles away. The Sheraton is attached to the convention center...hence the reason we choose it. I was livid and demanded to know why we were being moved. The manager told us it was because we had booked online and that the reservation guarantee does not apply to people who book online, also that they had over booked the hotel due to short-sightedness on their part. So, we changed direction and head to the new Hotel. Once there the new hotel told us that we only had reservations for 1 room and that it begin until the next day. I explained the situation to the front desk manager, and the first thing he asked is whether Starwood was picking up the tab. I said I didn't know and that i would call to find out. The answer from the revenue manager at the Sheraton was no...I call their corporate offices...the first thing asked by the customer service person was " Is the Sheraton paying for your room?" After a bit of being on hold , she told me that she was going to call the Sheraton and figure out what the issues were. At this point i called Marriott (who I am a platinum member) and told them the story. they had rooms available in their Copley Marriott. as I was speaking to them, the front desk person came out to me and told me our rooms were being paid for by the Sheraton. Great i thought. NOT SO, Saturday afternoon the front desk person called me over and told me that the Sheraton had reneged on its promise and was only going to pay for the first night, not the entire weekend as was their original promise (BTW, there were actually 2 reservations- one for the first night a suite - and one for the rest of the weekend - 2 rooms..a club and regular). So here I am...another day to go, and stuck in a hotel very far away from the convention, with a son in a wheel chair. It is about $ 8.00 each way. I so HATE the Starwood Hotel chains. And hope that there is an investigation into their bait and switch policies.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Updated Facility, Good service!”
Reviews.Author: eastwest60
Reviews.Content: I knew that I was going to be checking in very late so I emailed the hotel through their website. I got a timely reply. The hotel is located in the Back Bay area and a short walk to the subway. It is connected to a shopping mall and food court, so it was very convenient for bad weather. The room was very clean and looked updated, with flat-screen TV. Internet access was an extra fee of about $10/day. Check-out was very easy with about three ways to do it. Basically, I just dropped off the room keys in a box provided in the lobby. You can also just call them and tell them you are checking out or use the check-out option on the TV.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Sheraton Boston”
Reviews.Author: tripthisbowie
Reviews.Content: This by far was the WORST stay I have ever experienced at a Sheraton Hotel. The valet parking attendents were just beyond RUDE! The woman behind the Concierge desk would not assist us with finding or printing directions and said "it was not her job and the real concierge would be back in a few minutes". We were excited to be checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel but Watch your Budget”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCapital
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a step above your typical Sheraton. We booked through priceline and were placed in the newly rennovated tower. This tower is everything you would expect from a Sheraton. New furniture, clean and comfortable bedding, decent bathroom with a nice showerhead. Free coffee in the room and very quick elevators. We actually had two rooms in the hotel. For some reason one was significantly larger than the other (about 4 feet wider the whole way across) but both rooms were acceptable. The negatives of this hotel are also standard for a Sheraton. Extras are alwys expensive. The parking here is insane ($42/night). One of the receptionists mentioned that the parking service is contracted out by the hotel. I did notice that parking in Boston in general is a bit nutty.. Compared with a few other Sheratons I've been to (Toronto, Hawaii, CDG) the room service is more expensive than the norm. Overall, this is as expected for a Sheraton. Location is convenient. A subway stop is right next door and you can easily walk to downtown. A recommended location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wanderlost16
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Sheraton. Was here on business. Grand foyer which made you feel very welcome. Here's the scoop: Location Connected to 2 malls to do all your souvenir shopping. As well, the food court in the first mall was excellent. Great chowdah! If you have 2 or more people coming from the airport, take a cab. It'll cost you roughly $25. We were 'tricked' by the van shuttle as he told us he was cheaper. It cost us over $32 (not including tip). Once you walk through the mall to Bolston Street, it'll take you about 15 minutes to get to Boston Commons, the start of the Freedom trail. Great walk. Really close to Fenway and lots of Irish pubs. Shopping is good: Trader Joe's within 5 minutes, Filenes Basement (I'm from the west coast so we don't have that there), etc. You really are close to everything. Rooms I'm not sure what people are talking about, but my room was really good. Not outdated, flat screen tv, great city view, very clean bathroom. I do admit that the noise barrier is a bit weak (you can hear the bathroom around you at times). But, not too bad overall. If you don't get your room cleaned that day, you get a $5 gift card to be used at any of the food outlets within the hotel. Starbucks (which is in the hotel lobby) everyday! Saved me some money there. Service All the staff super friendly. Internet 7 workstations in the lobby, free of charge. People were using WiFi throughout the lobby and convention area. Great perk. Overall Impression Great hotel, especially for the location. Would stay here again if I find a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Dated”
Reviews.Author: jaxx25
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, but for a business trip to no have wifi (you have to pay for internet and use a hookup on the desk), inconvenient and few outlets in the room (there was an extension cord in the room) and no fridge. I would not stay here again for work nor would I reccomend it to anyone else. None of the basic necessities for a high price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: KW_Philadelphia
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through hotwire at the last minute for much more than I thought it was worth (under $100 is probably appropriate). The standard room has enough room for the bed, dresser, chair, and desk. The bathroom was a little moldy but nothing that I haven't come to accept in a 3 star hotel. My main issue was the noise in the room. When the room upstairs did anything in the bathroom it sounded like we were being attacked! When the heat went on it made a loud rattling noise. Additionally, be prepared to spend $40/night to park in the garage and $10/day for internet in your room. The elevator service was extra slow. If I'm going to pay this much I'd expect a much nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in good location but a little loud.”
Reviews.Author: goodshink
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average. It's nothing special. However, it is in a good location with easy access to Fenway Park and numerous bars and restaurants. I have stayed here numerous times due to it's location. I will continue to stay here in the future. The food is average. They have a nice cozy lounge on the 1st level. The rooms are not very sound proof and there are alot of roody Red Sox fans walking through the hallways at all hours of the night. In order to get to the pool You must walk through the fitness center. This room stinks of sweat and is just nasty. It's not very appealing on your way to the pool. The hot tub at the pool had no water in it and was not functioning. The pool is large and the kid's enjoyed playing in it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, and great service”
Reviews.Author: 1stCircumdedistiMe
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well appointed, great location, and excellent views. My only complaint, is that they allow big dogs. I like dogs, but don't like to use the same bed with them.

Reviews.Title: “Awful. Avoid and stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: hifelicity
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel having prepaid for it with Expedia. Both a receptionist and a manager told me there was no record of my booking in their computer and seemed to expect me to just leave. After very diplomatically arguing my case (whilst wanting to scream with frustration and tiredness after a very drawn out transatlantic flight), I was eventually given a room with much reluctance and only after I'd handed over a debit card to be swiped. When it became obvious that, whatever the problem with the booking, it was not of my making, they were unapologetic. Every day (except for the weekend and New Year's Day) there was loud drilling above which made it impossible to stay in the room. This planned work was not advertised when we booked the hotel. I could actually hear it in the restrooms on the ground floor so moving room would have been pointless within that tower and we weren't offered a room in the other tower. However, that tower suffered a power cutout during our stay so I'm not sure which tower was the worse deal. The toilet in the room broke (would not stop flushing) and it took an hour and three calls from me for someone to come and fix it. The bloke was excellent and perhaps an hour's wait is not too bad but this was all happening at around 2130 and some advice on how long we would be waiting and if we would have to move room for the night would have been useful. The jacuzzi and women's changing room were in a disgusting state throughout the whole eight-night stay. The scum in the jacuzzi was tinged with grey. The changing room was thoroughly dirty with fixtures falling off the walls, horrible hair clogging up drains. The sauna and pool although not quite as disgusting as the other 'amenities' could at best be described as 'serviceable'. When I told the Sheraton about all of this at checkout the response was to clear my hotel bill which was for about 175 dollars, as an apology. Obviously I accepted this but it's pretty lame considering my friend and I spent Â£1500 on this trip (including flights). And the bill was outrageous in the first place. The 175 dollars was for a total of four very short international calls (probably totaling 10 minutes for all of the calls) to wish our families happy new year and a minute-long call to my friend's mobile when she was out and about in Boston. Yes, the beds were very comfortable, the shower was good and the location fantastic. However, this hotel is situated right next to every other major chain hotel in Boston so if I were you I'd advise going to one of the other ones. And if you do go for this one make sure you double-check your booking beforehand and ask about planned drilling work. Although I don't consider it acceptable to have to do this with a Sheraton in a major US city.

Reviews.Title: “Still My Favorite Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to believe that this hotel is rated as low as 42 out of 75 hotels in Boston. This is a great hotel! Free Internet on ground floor, large lobby area, several check-in desks with no lines, a Starbucks, breakfast buffet room, Hertz rental car counter, bar area, a few blocks from Fenway Park, connected to the huge Prudential Center shopping mall and restaurants such as P.F. Chang's and Cheesecake Factory, a few blocks from Copley Plaza, club lounge with superb views across the Charles River to Cambridge, North Tower has all recently renovated rooms, etc. This is my 5th stay at this hotel, and I love it. A few blocks from the charming area of Back Bay/Commonwealth Avenue area with superb shopping on famous Newbury Street plus Boylston. There is a Shaw's supermarket 2 blocks away or accessible through the indoor shopping mall. 2 blocks away from the famous Duck Tour. Old Town Trolley Tour stops right in front of hotel. This may not be the as fancy as the nearby Fairmont Copley Plaza or Mandarin Oriental, but it qualifies for me to be a Top 10 hotel in Boston for location, amenities, and price (about $200/night). The $42/night parking charge I could do without.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: sherine75
Reviews.Content: The room had outdated furniture- the water pressure in the room was beyond low - it takes 15min to wash your hands cause there is only a stream of water when you open the faucet to the max in the sink - I dare anyone to even attempt to shower. The room heater is like sleeping with a demolition guy in the room- it is beyond loud and innefective. Overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Could of been better...”
Reviews.Author: katyann1234
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru its own website about a month and a half prior to the date I wanted to stay. I wanted to stay there on New Years Eve, so I new it was going to be busy. We got there around 5, and as soon as we checked in the rooms were wrong. I requested a double bed room, on a high floor with a view. (Which was noted that they still had rooms left, when i booked the hotel) WHen i arrived, it was king bed only, on the 6th floor. How would that work with 4 of us guests? I complained that I wanted a high floor room and I ordered this at the time of booking. THey did change the room to the 21st floor with a spectacular view, but it was a handicap room and had only a queen bed. We had to take this, and get a rollaway bed brought to our room. THis also was a handicap room, so the bathroom was bigger than the entire room itself. After all was said and done, we decided to get a cpl drinks and hang out being New Years and all. When we returned to our room a cpl hours later, it was freezing. Our heater was not working. We had to call 5x before someone came up to finally fix it. Then it was so hot I could barely breathe. I would never order room service. FOr those prices, you might as well die. I mean 18.00 for a bowl of cold cereal? Theres a dunkin donuts inside the prudential center mall for realistic prices. Oh yeah, the other bad thing was the there was a hockey game at fenway and all the FLYERS fans were staying in our hotel. Im a boston fan, and theres nothing more annoying than people running around saying LETS GO FLYERS all night long. If i new this, I would of went to a hotel down the street. Other than that, the bed was comfy and the view was nice. THere was a nice 40" flatscreen too!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lazza999
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire for less than $100 a night and thought it was the best bargin of the trip. The location was perfect, great shopping outside outside the door, and the train went right through the connecting mall. The staff were super friendly and helpful and the free internet in the lobby was great. They also have a free airport check-in in the lobby where you can check-in and print your boarding pass out, which was really handy. I had room service one night and it was quick and great value for room service. This was my first trip to Boston, and I'll be back and I'll stay here again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Young707
Reviews.Content: In August, I booked and pre-paid single room for 3 weekend days in October at one of the popular online travel web site. Relived that Tripadvisor reviews are all positive. Sent email to hotel web site email and notify hotel of my prepaid reservation and my Starwood Preferred Guest membership number. I request to ensure I will arriving late on international flight, and ensure I have non-smoking, two beds, high floor quite room, away from ice makers and elevators. I received prompt reply from Alex Kandalaft and ensure of my confirmed reservation. Well, surprised when I arrive at check in. This man at the Starwood Preferred Guest check in counter gave me the riot act speech. He said Sheraton only give the left over (undesirable â€“ my interpretation) rooms to online travel web site guests. He was doing me the greatest favor of mankind just to check me in for any room with 2 beds. Whatever their previous hotel email responses and ensure of reservation, meant nothing. I was given room in 7th floor North Tower, take it or leave it. Outside our window is this giant Air Conditioning roof systems (see photo). Considerable and constant blowing loud noise flooded our room. Even the double plank noise isolating windows does not help. All night we seemed like in a jet plane flying at 35000 feet. Also, the ice maker next to the 7th floor elevator, is quite noisy, sounded like a small truck. Next morning, I called Alex Kandalaft, Director of Front Office, and told him of the noisy roof problem. He promptly moved me to 16th floor and a littler quieter room indeed. Now the Air conditioning system noise is a low hum. My thanks. Disappointments: tiny bath+toilet+shower room, no hot water or drinking water available, coffee maker only. Breakfast $16 to $20. Loud door slamming up and down the hallways in the morning. Room lacks dim night light. Shower control is hard to modulate because it only has one single temperature control handle and no flow control (however, I assume this is the future of America, wasting high volume of water in shower, and do not allow less flow). Internet access in room service is $9.50 per day. Free WiFi and / or Ethernet port in the South Tower lobby (crowed in the day time). North Towner 5th floor has gym and nice simple indoor pool for lapping. This hotel is part of the Prudential Center and two interconnecting malls complex. Plenty of shopping and very high end shop that offer major damages (by spouse), and plenty restaurants, food court, grocery & Duncan Donut. Room has large 40â€� LCD TV, but 30 channels of TV is only composite NTSC analog at the lowest 320x240 resolution pictures, what a waste.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Sheraton Boston”
Reviews.Author: dzul
Reviews.Content: The moment we arrived at 12 noon, the rooms were not ready and came back at 5. Since the club rooms are not available because of renovation, we were upgraded to executive suites which are bigger. They managed to provide 5 king size bed for the 5 rooms I requested but the check-in process took almost 15 minutes even though I already did it when first arrived at noon! The lobby of the hotel is really big and pleasant. Parking is easy and even complimentary with our 'Holiday Package'. We got $25 Starbucks card, free one in-room movie and free internet in the lobby and in the room. However, WiFi is only at the lobby but not in the room. Being a Starwood Hotel, Sheraton should already provide WiFi throughout the hotel. Check-in is at 3pm and check-out is at 12 noon. The Executive Suite I had was spacious and very clean. As it was just being renovated, I found it extremely nice. The bed is very comfortable. In the suite - flat screen tv, big couch and coffee maker. Toilet is quite small but it's fine. Perhaps they can consider bigger toilets especially to accommodate family with small kids etc. Overall, I found the Suite was excellent. Check-out was quick and smooth. I recommend this hotel for business traveller as it is in the middle of the city and close to Prudential Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay - Great Location - Recently renovated”
Reviews.Author: JLost
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here probably five times because of the location. We live in CT and travel to Boston often. I would recommend it with the new renovation. Got the room via Hotwire. The room we stayed in was newly renovated and had a nice LCD TV and the bed was very comfortable and didn't hear any noise from the neighboring rooms. The pool, gym and hot tub are just fine for a Sheraton-level hotel. The Sheraton was nice enough to let us check in early (10:30a.m.) and check out is at 1 p.m. which is also nice. It is adjacent to the Prudential Mall and Hynes Convention Center. If the weather is bad, the wife can shop at the mall and I'll take the kids to the pool. The mall is upscale with a Saks, Barney's, and Neiman Marcus. There is a Cheesecake Factory and PF Changs in the mall which are decent places to take the kids. There are T stops close by too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value when Purchased on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: tchefuncta
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights prior to our cruise on Priceline for less than $200. Front desk accomidated my request for a room overlooking the Charles without hesitation. The room was on the small side, but quite nicely decorated. New flatscreen TVs don't have HD. Old town trolly tours pick up right in front of the hotel. The food court in the adjacent Prudential Center is open in the evening if you don't want to do the restaurant thing. For the price we paid, I'd go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - updated and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: alandubo
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel a few years ago many times for work, so when we decided to head to Boston for one night with our parents we booked here again. Was very pleased to note the rooms have been renovated very nicely - flat screen TVs, new furniture, just overall a great new look. Free internet in the really nice lobby is always appreciated. We found the staff super friendly too. Location is perfect - in Back Bay and one of the main trolley tours stops right outside the hotel door. Will definitely stay here again and would recommend for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & unfriendly front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: busman44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sheraton in Boston at 39 Dalton Street. It was a good location. That's about the only positive thing I have to say. The cost of the room ($365 in cluding taxes & fees for a last minute room on a Saturday night) was very high relative to the room itself. The room was small, the cable TV had few channels, i.e. did not have expanded basic, the toilet paper was located in an awkward position behind me on the wall near the tank, the heating system was loud & inefficient, customer service at check in was very poor (the only words spoken to meby the short Asian female receptionist were â€œI need your ID and credit cardâ€� and â€œHow many keys do you need?â€�) and at checkout by the short Hispanic female desk clerk were (â€œYouâ€™re set.â€�). (Were these people being paid to say the fewest possible words? If so, I found a couple of winners). Charging for local calls and toll free calls was tacky at best and gouging at worst. In fact â€œgougingâ€� may be the word that sums up the whole experience best: it seems almost like it is Sheraton policy to get the most money out of people while giving them the least. This might make them money in the short term but itâ€™s a very poor strategy for long term, repeat business. As a businessperson who travels this is about the poorest example of customer service I can recall. They should at least be trained to greet guests with a rhetorical "Hello, how are you?" for the prices the charge. For the exorbitant hotel price Sheraton charged I donâ€™t feel I got real value for my money. This was the first time I stayed at a Sheraton and I will not stay at a Sheraton anywhere in the world at anytime. They had one chance to impress me and the hotel and front desk employees failed miserably. By the way, I spent the next night at a nearby Radisson hotel for a third of the cost of my night at the Sheraton. The rate they charge is the same every night. They had all the cable channels, and the room was much larger with a terrace and view of the city. Itâ€™s not too hard to figure out whoâ€™ll get my future business. The Radisson also conducted an in depth online survey of my experience at the Radisson and their competitors in Boston including the Sheraton. This shows that the Radisson while not perfect is at least interested in honest feedback and improvement. The Sheraton conducted no such survey but I sent them a letter anyway. Bottom line: Don't waste your money & do your research early!

Reviews.Title: “Completely unhelpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: cognitivepsych
Reviews.Content: I purchased a room here for an academic conference, and split it with a colleague. Universities are picky about reimbursement procedures, but I needed only one simple thing from the hotel: two receipts, one with each of our names, each showing half of the room cost. Otherwise, reimbursement is difficult or impossible. Two staffers completely refused this request, because my reservation was purchased on a discount site. They refused to even put my colleague's name on the reservation. They refused to print receipts showing the cost of the room. They refused to print a receipt with my colleague's name on it. I politely explained my situation to both. They both stared at me blankly and repeated that they could not help me. The inability to print simple documentation is a big problem for me. If the Sheraton Boston has inadequate abilities to properly document business travel, then they should be avoided lest you end up pocketing unnecessary costs. The worst part of this experience is that, after explaining my situation to multiple staffers, I could not get anyone to make even the slightest attempt to give me a hand with my issue.

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Taaaaaahmpaaa
Reviews.Content: great location adjacent to the convention center and two large malls with abundant dining choices.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Impolite hotel worker”
Reviews.Author: Elliejam
Reviews.Content: I did have a good first impression. Location was great. However, all the good first impression was completely erased when I approached the hotel worker on the lobby floor to ask for directions to a office within the Prudential center. I had checked in the night before and was supposed to meet the rest of the conference group in a nearby office. This was my first visit to Boston so I did not know my way around. I asked the worker who appeared to be helping others, if he knew where the office is. His response was "This is a hotel mam, I have no idea where you want!!". I was so startled I forgot to tell him that it was pretty obvious to me that it's a hotel because I slept there the night prior and would also be sleeping there the night after. Rude!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reliable name hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaybird51
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 17 year old for two nights in November. We got a great price on hotwire and we were very happy with the hotel and its location. We were in the North Tower in a double room, very spacious and comfortable. The location was perfect for shopping and dining out, which is what we came to Boston to do. Yes, room service and Starbucks was priced on the high side but we expected that in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Very Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: irishgirl814
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights while looking at colleges in Boston. The location cannot be beat. Close to 2 T stops and right in the heart of Back Bay. Everything is either a short walk or quick trip on the T. The rooms were very comfortable although they were a little small. They have the most comfortable beds. Didn't want to leave it behind. :( The bathroom was really small but we managed ok. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: akrsouth
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel but it is about 30% over priced, all of the hotel services are too. The restaurants and Starbucks are 30% over.

Reviews.Title: “Very Reliable Sheraton Property”
Reviews.Author: FairTaxBill
Reviews.Content: Very close to Back Bay station, shopping, convention center, restaurants, and T. The hotel will be nice again when the renovation is finished. If sensitive to dust, ensure that you ask for a floor that is finished, or better yet, in a different wing/tower. Excellent lobby, decent restaurant, nice bar, nice conference facilities. New tower has larger rooms, but less lacks a view of The Charles River; original tower has smaller rooms with a river view -- to get as many people in that hotel to see the river from up high. All rooms are nice, clean, and comfortable, with nice contemporary furnishings. N.B. Fitness center/pool area is managed by a third-party and leases space from Sheraton Boston; you pay a daily fee to use. They set and manager their hours. May or may not be worth it, depending upon your needs and schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: scarletletters
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal for the room on Priceline. I didn't know what to expect, but I ended up being impressed. It's next to the convention center and the Hynes T stop, and conveniently located in Back Bay. The lobby is huge, very polished and modern. The rooms are very comfortable. The staff was very helpful during my stay.There is free wifi in the lobby with either your own laptop or a shared computer. I would recommend this place and definitely consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: 234rhc
Reviews.Content: Centrally located (Prudential Center) with bus stops at the front door and 24/7 taxi stand that worked we enjoyed staying at a Sheraton much to my surprise. While not what I wanted to spend all hotels in Boston were more expensive we thought. We could have stayed further out for less but then what is the point? The Sheraton (and several other hotels)are attached to a two gigantic shopping mall or malls with every variety of price range. and type of shopping and food. Even Legal Seafgood which we enjoyed twice for lunch. Back Bay location near Bewbury street asnd museums was ideal. We arrived before noon expecting to wait, and had requested a river view room . The front desk clerk immedately gave us several options (the hotel was full). The concierge staff were also exemplary. Our room was good and we could see sail boats racing along the river. The views of the roofs of buildings were less than spectacular but it was still worth it. Any call was answered and responded to rapidly. With so many options right there we were very happy and the wide screen TV kept the sports fan happy, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great loaction and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Jami7300
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at the Hynes Convention Center in Boston and stayed at the Boston Sheraton, which is conveniently located in the same complex. The buildings are linked, thus providing visitors with easy access without the worry of catching a cab or dealing with the weather. The hotel rooms were nicely appointed and the staff were friendly and attentive. All in all, it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very nice stay here”
Reviews.Author: hinadori
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a long Labor Day weekend. The hotel was very nice if a bit far from the Freedom Trail. Room cleanliness and amenities were on par with the Sheraton brand. Staff was friendly and helpful, my room had a nice view of the river. The best feature is that it is attached to the Copley shopping mall. And the area is very trendy with lots of great places to eat and shop. I also got a great deal using Priceline's Name Your Own Price or less than $80/night.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you are going to a conference otherwise....”
Reviews.Author: heathway53
Reviews.Content: The Boston Sheraton was the first hotel on our trip round New England. We had a room on the 23th floor overlooking the river. Its a massive hotel and therefore very impersonal. Its part of the Prudential Centre so its easy to go shopping and eat locally if that's what you want to do. Have the say the room was one of the smallest I have ever been in in the the USA. It was, however, comfortable and very clean. We had discount vouchers, so the hotel breakfast turned out to be extremely good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Families”
Reviews.Author: hoopsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton October 13-17th. The location is fantastic for families. The rooms are quite small- look very closely at the photos. There is no dresser for clothing storage and the closet contains the safe, so there is limited floor space for bag storage. The bathroom is tiny - one person at a time. With three women in the family that made it a little tricky, but we didn't intend to spend much time there so it was just fine! The location is wonderful! The other reviews are correct there is every kind of store, restaurant, etc. attached to the hotel via the mall and even a subway stop. Our teens chose to stay in on two nights while we went out to dinner. They were happy to eat pizza from the food court in the mall and we felt safe allowing them to walk from the room to the food court to pick up their dinner on their own as it did not require them to leave the building! yeah! We would stay here again if we find ourselves in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Far from new convention center”
Reviews.Author: kappatraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was overflow hotel for a conference I attended in Boston this weekend. VERY far from the new convention center by the water. It took me 45 minutes to travel between the two in traffic - normally a 15 minute cab ride. Rooms are basic. Bathroom dirty with pink mold in the grout. Lobby is cool - lots of work stations and fast coffee bar.

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful- fantastic value via Priceline”
Reviews.Author: ethy12
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel for a holiday in Boston. It's in a smart, safe area with excellent restaurants and plenty to do and see within walking distance. The hotel is attached to The Prudential Center shopping mall with all its shops and foot outlets. It couldn't be more convenient. Good quality toiletries which are topped up during your stay, Starbucks coffee with maker in the room too. Feels really luxurious and we only paid Â£55 per night plus tax via Priceline 'name your own price'. Great pool, gym, jacuzzi, sauna etc with sunbeds outside for the summer. Free internet access in small area in lobby, but there is the Apple shop of the road where you can access the internet for free day and night too. On the downside, the bath towels were a bit small- I am a woman and weigh 140lbs- they only just wrapped round!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Back Bay Hotel-- We Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Erin74
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a stay at the Westin around the corner, but ended up at the Sheraton at the last minute. Long story. Anyway, I was sure I'd be disappointed in the Sheraton and that it couldn't compare to the Westin. I knew the Sheraton was attached to the convention center, and after reading some reviews here I had braced myself for a charmless, generic hotel experience. When we walked into the spacious, elegant Sheraton lobby I was surprised. It was lovely! It was just the first of many pleasant surprises we experienced at this hotel. We were traveling with a toddler and a bunch of heavy toddler gear. While I was trying to check in, my son ran over to the water fountain and stuck his hands in it, spraying water all over himself and the floor. In short, we were not the kind of guests a hotel is usually thrilled to see arrive. And yet, everyone had a smile for us. The bellhop took care of the floor in moments and the rep at the front desk smiled and said she thought maybe we could use some extra space for the little one. Complimentary upgrade! This never happens to families traveling with kids, I can assure you. We were shown to our room, which we were told had just been built and was brand new. Let's just say I nearly cried when I saw it. The room was huge, beautifully decorated and gave us tons of extra space for a crib and all that luggage. There was no view and the bathroom was a little small, but the space in the main room more than made up for it. We spent three days at this hotel and were completely comfortable the whole time. I was sad to leave. We requested a crib and a mini fridge. Both were brought to our room immediately after our arrival. Each and every employee we encountered at the Sheraton was friendly and helpful. There is free internet in the lobby and the hotel connects to the Prudential mall. In bad weather you can walk all the way to Copley Square under cover through the mall. The Hynes Convention Center T Stop is just up the street. Newbury Street and all its wonderful restaurants and shops is walking distance. In short, there was nothing we wanted for while we stayed at this hotel. It was a thoroughly pleasant experience for us from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. Two thumbs up for the Sheraton Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Bud2001
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The rooms were clean, the hotel staff was very friendly, and the location is great! We really liked that the hotel is connected to a mall. Also, the T(subway) stop is connected to the mall, so you never have to go outside to get to a T stop. The room was a little small, but that was our only complaint. We definitley recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: luckygirl_5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for free using Starwood points and we were pleasantly surprised. The Westin was full so we tried this but the recent remodel made it a very nice hotel. We had a corner room that had lots of windows and even included a sofa, chair and desk. The only complaint is that the fitness center is with the swimming pool so all of the equipment is sort of wet and slimy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TScout54
Reviews.Content: The Boston Sheraton is one of our favorites. This beautiful hotel is located within easy walking distance to most of Boston's best attractions. The hotel rooms are spacious and clean and the staff is always top notch. The Concierge desk staff is super helpful, even helped us plan some day trips to other nearby cities. The hotel's proximity to the Shops at the Prudential Center are a great added bonus. The resturants at the Pru are great for a quick bite to eat! I highly reccommend the Boston Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel in a Fine Location But NO Breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: chazLongBeach_Ca
Reviews.Content: This convention style hotel is located in the Back Bay. It is conveniently located two blocks from the "T"Green Line Prudential Station making for quick trip in and back to Logan Airport for only $ 2 each way and avoiding the rush hour traffic that would have made trip twice as long. The room was newly redecorated with a comfortable bed and the 15th floor offered a nice view of the Bay. Check in was quick and that is not always the case when conventioneers show all at once. The location is a couple blocks from Boylston and Newbury Streets with plenty of top notch restaurants and shops. Really a great neighborhood. There is a large shopping mall that you can get to without going outside. The one thing that I could not understand was why there was no breakfast restaurant? Everybody had to leave the hotel for breakfast or go with the coffee, pastry, yogurt, etc from the kiosk type food services. I would recommend this hotel for the convention trade. If I were on my own I would consider the Lennox on Boylston St.

Reviews.Title: “Our 1st Boston Experience”
Reviews.Author: engine6
Reviews.Content: My wife & I visited Boston for a long weekend 9/25 - 9/28. It was our 1st trip there and we can't wait to return. We took advantage of Southwest's $39 airfares. We booked our room, it was at the Sheraton Boston in the Copely Square/Back Bay section thru Hotwire. It appeared that the room had been recently refurbished and was very comfortable. The front desk staff was courtious and friendly. It was adjacent to the Prudential Center which had a subway stop in the basement and, thus, we didn't have to go outside to get the subway. We found the subway clean and effcient and used it extensively. On Friday we took a tour of the Lexington Concord area. Our guide was informative and entertaining. We then made our way to Fenway Park (no ball game) where we had a beer at the Bleacher Bar which is located underneath the "Green Monster". The view of the field is amazing. We had dinner Friday night at Fire & Ice, an experience that was enjoyable. It was close enough to the hotel so we were able to walk. Saturday we took a tour of the Freedom Trail. We were able to find a free one given by "I AM BOSTON". We had lunch at the Union Oyster House, where we enjoyed the "Chowda'". We then walked around Quincy Market and then walked to the North End. While there we had dinner at La Summa (reservations recommended). It was like eating in someone's dining room and the food was delicious. It rained off and on on Sunday so we headed to the Boston Public Garden to enjoy some piece and quiet. We had lunch at Cheers which is across from the garden and then did somemore walking and a little shopping. We returned to our room and after resting headed out for dinner to a small neighborhood Greek restaurant near the hotel on Newberry St. a block from the firehouse. The food there was also very good. Boston can be very expensive, but if you do a little homework, as we did, it can be a quite reasonable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jrj0924
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, right next to the Prudential Center and a T stop which made is super easy to get around the city. Loved the bar area which was quite popular at night. Fitness center was quite nice and enjoyed the lap pool, though it was a it small it did the job. Convenient having a Starbucks in the lobby if that's your thing. And the free internet in the lobby was a great perk. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SLeteneur
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Sheraton and were very pleased with our stay. We booked through priceline and got a rate of $105/night. We couldn't have been happier. Upon our arrival, the check in clerk upgraded to the concierge level. This included free breakfast (continental) and free snacks in the evening. We had a lovely room with fantastic view. I would agree that the room is on the smaller side and the bathroom is really tiny. Only one person can get ready at a time. The best part of this hotel is the location. The Back Bay area has a lot to do and if you aren't up for walking, the T stop couldn't be closer. This hotel is great for the business and leisure traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, smaller room, near the action”
Reviews.Author: carolyn_joe
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 10/2/09 after getting a great deal from Hotwire.com Back Bay is a great section of Boston to stay at, and sicne I had tickets to the red sox game it worked out perfectly. I parked across the st. at the Pilgrim parking garage and paid $30 for 24 hours, the hotel rate was $42. Check in was easy enough, and the lobby was nice, a starbucks and a series of free computers to check the internet if you wanted to. They also had a kiosk to print boarding passes for Logan and an on site rental car agency. Got a room in the North tower, 19th floor. Great views of the Charles river and back bay, also could see Fenway Park. The room itself was somewhat small, but nicely appointed. The bathroom was pretty small as well, bu every thing was nice and comfortable. Large 40" LCD TV in the room. Reviewed the Room service as it was our anniversary and we were thinking of breakfast in bed in the morning. To my surprise a bowl of cereal with milk and a juice was $16.50 with a $4.25 delivery fee, 15% service charge and sales taxes. That was one of the cheaper options..... Given that the area has tons of restaurants and bars, decided to go out. Check out was easy enough as well. Overall a good experience, not to upscale, but definitely nice. At the price I got on Hotwire (around $100) I would definitely stay there again, for the price of the rack rate, I would probably look at other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly, clean and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: travelwriter99
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel is ideally close to everything, walking distance to shopping, restaurants and a beautiful hotel with full staff, concierge, free internet access and pet friendly! The rooms do not smell like dogs or animals though...they are very clean and beautiful so it stays true to the Sheraton name, but for those that travel with pets it's a great place to stay. The only reason I knew it was pet friendly is I saw people checking in with pet carriers, otherwise I would have had no idea. It's in the Prudential center so you can literally walk from hotel to the shopping mall without having to leave the hotel. If you are doing any kind of Boston tours, one of the pick up stops is right in front of the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything !”
Reviews.Author: joyceinks
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice enough, clean, quiet at night- its best feature is that is is close to everything - subway, shopping, site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Khalifa_161
Reviews.Content: We selected Sheraton Boston because its location and name. Sheraton in general is quality hotel and this one is no exception. I was traveling my son because it was his first year in University at Boston. The hotel has two towers and huge lobby. Our total stay was 6 nights. The room was always clean and comfortable, no complain. The hotel had a tunnel connected to a huge mall were you may go shopping and eating. The hotel area is a historical side of Boston is a walking museum and pleasant streets where you will find famous historical buildings. Boston is also one of the safest cities in America. It seems that the hotel is great from every angles. The only downfall , in my opinion , is that the lost of personal touch between the staffs of the hotel and the gusts. But , again , this is true to all major hotels .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel don't understand why it is only a three star”
Reviews.Author: sarahabigailcollier
Reviews.Content: We walked through the front doors into an enormous lobby which is very clean with plenty of sofas and chairs to just sit and watch the world go by. The reception staff were excellent, very polite, extremely helpful and made the check in a pleasure. There are plenty of very quick elevators. We were staying on the 25th floor which gave us an excellent view of Boston. The room was not very big but fairly recently decorated, very clean and gave us everything which we could want. Plenty of storage for clothes and luggage, an easy to use safe. Plenty of hanging space. A nice big TV. The bathroom, again was very nice a nd clean. Easy to use tea/coffee making facilities. The beds were very comfortable. Had and issue with the remote control for the TV so went to the Concierge desk who sorted it immeadiatly and were very helpful and friendly. There are 7 computers in the lobby area which can be used for free by guests at the hotel for 5 mins a day. There is also free wireless in the lobby area which has unlimited usage on it. There are inside cirridors to the Hynes Convention Centre and also the Prudential Centre which has lots of shops and a good food court with something for every taste so excellent for travellers and also if the whether isn't great. Also can get to the T from insdie the Prudential Centre to get anywhere else in the city. There is a lage bar and also a Startbucks in the lobby area of the hotel. When coming back to Boston I would absolutely stay here again and would recomend this hotel to anyone travelling to Boston

Reviews.Title: “A Very Well Located and Large Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sky0000547
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel between 7-12 Sept 2009 and was given a room on the 15th floor of the North tower. The room was recently renovated and faces North with a distant view of Fenway Park to the West. The immediate view out of the room window would be the roof of the adjacent Hynes Convention Center. The room includes a large 37 inch LCD TV, air-conditioning/heating, in-room safe, Bliss toiletries, iron, ironing board, cafeteria and hair dryer. There is no fridge or mini bar in the room. The hotel is easily accessible from the Prudential T station on the red 'E' line. You would turn left upon exiting the T station barriers and taking the escalator up into The Prudential Center. Take the escalator up again outside The Cheesecake Factory and then turn left at the top. Walk down the mall corridor with P.F Chang restaurant and US postal office on your left hand side and the outdoor fountain (south garden) on your right. At the bottom of the corridor would be a Dunkin Donuts and turning left here you should see the Sheraton Hotel entrance. The hotel lobby would be one floor down. The hotel lobby is enormous with plenty of seating area. There are approximately 9 computer terminals with free internet access and free wifi is also available in the lobby. It was never too long to wait for an available computer. There is an on site Starbucks coffee however the prices are just slightly higher compare to a normal Starbucks on the streets. The hotel room is large and very quiet. The room is clean and the toilet is of a fair size. The air-conditioning unit is quite abit noisy though. The only complaint is you will get acceptable warm-hot water from the shower but not very hot water for some people who prefer. The pressure from the shower is very good and there is a bath tub. The bedding is good and soft. A duvet is also provided. A swimming pool and fitness center is availble for guests to use free of charge on the 5th floor. The fitness center is small and mainly concentrated on weights. I did not see a single treadmill being present. The hotel is very well located for the convenience of shopping and food. There are numerous restaurants in The Prudential Center providing take out and there is also a food court and Shaw's supermarket. There were nights I preferred to eat in the hotel room rather than in the restaurants. The adjoining Copley Place can be accessed from The Prudential Center via the connecting footbridge. Boylston Street and Newbury Street are easily accessible on foot. Taking the T to Downtown Crossing or Fanueil Hall will take approximately 20 minutes. To the airport T station will take approximately 20-25 minutes travelling time.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and large room.”
Reviews.Author: mrsocMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its proximity to back bay bus station (an easy walk through the Prudential Centre). Our room was very spacious and clean. Although it is a 15 minute walk to Boston Common, the location is still good. Lots of shops and restaurants on nearby Boylston and Newbury Streets are just around the corner. Jerry on the concierge desk was the best concierge we have ever dealt with.

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible...but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Beccaboo19
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked a night here for our trip to Boston for a red sox game. When we arrived, we were impressed by the lobby and multiple large screen computers for guests. There is even a starbucks in the lobby! We got our key and were informed that the room was a newly renovated room looking over the Charles river. The room was renovated and new, which was nice, but it was TINY! The bathroom was the smallest bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel, my fiance and I could not even stand in it together brushing our teeth! Along with the size, which really wasn't the biggest problem, there was no sound barrier between the rooms. I could hear our neighbors talking in their rooms like they were in our own room. Every time someone flushed the toilet or closed a door, I jumped out of bed because it sounded like they were in our room. The everyday noise that is usually hidden from quality sound-protected rooms resulted in no sleep and a a negative stay. Otherwise, this hotel was pretty decent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - polite, professional and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bajp23
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 10 days at this wonderful hotel - without a doubt the best hotel i have stayed in. The staff were helpful, polite and professional at all times. My room was on the 16th floor in the south tower. Huge comfortable bed and large screen tv. Very comfortable chairs and nice clean bathroom. I had a corner room and had two windows - one overlooking the North Tower and swimming pool and the other window - a fantastic view over the Back Bay and Fenway Park. There is a restaurant for both breakfast and dinner and also Starbucks in the lobby. There is also internet access in the lobby but there is usually a queue for this. The best thing is that the hotel is connected to the Prudential Shopping Centre/Mall. In the mall you have shops such as Saks, Barnes and Noble, access to the Prudential Tower and Skywalk Observatory - (breathtaking views) and restaurants The Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza Kitchen, PF Changs and Legal Sea Foods. The mall is also connected to the "T" underground transport system. I got the hotel in a wonderful deal via my travel agent. If you are going to Boston for business or travel - you must stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business traveler during winter.”
Reviews.Author: Ratalie
Reviews.Content: Most of the convention centers are very close to the hotel. Is perfect for the winter time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location, Great View!”
Reviews.Author: canarsie69
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two nights on the 25th floor in the North Tower. Could not beat the view! Housekeeping and the parking valet services were very good, front desk so-so. Got the room on Hotwire for $96/ nite. The location is fabulous with Newbury Street a short walk away and close to the T. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent hotel for the price we paid!”
Reviews.Author: Marjol
Reviews.Content: We slept at this hotel for three nights mid august. We booked the hotel through priceline for $85 a night. We checked in very late (11 pm) and got an excecutive suite, which was great and very roomy! The bed was very comfortable, we had a big tv and everything was very clean. The bathroom was a bit on the small side considering the size of the room, but we didn't think that was a big problem. The hotel was very quiet, we didn't hear anything from the outside while we were in our room! Location is very nice, a quick subway ride to the old centre and connected to the Prudential shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: qster11
Reviews.Content: We were overcharged - or you can say double charged. It is one week later and I still don' t have my refund. The hotel told me there is nothing they can do -they were very rude. Even Shearaton Corporate could care less. Find somewhere else unless you can afford to be overcharged.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay when u go to hynes convention center”
Reviews.Author: Antonio_spaulo
Reviews.Content: I went to Boston in july 09 for a medical meeting and i stayed in this hotel. Good hotel, great location inside the mall and convention center and a plus - the subway is in the underground. Big size bedrooms. Great view. The price was about $ 199/ night.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: nutstarr02
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice place. The rooms are new with new furniture. The bathrooms are spacious. We asked for a room with two beds and a view and got both. The best part is the location. It's connected to the Prudential so when we were hungry we just walked to one of the tons of nearby restaurants. There's a Starbuck's close to the lobby. There's also free internet in the lobby. There's lots of shopping there if you're interested. You can also walk to Newbury Street too. And the Boston Public Gardens aren't too far. It's also close to several T stations which we used a few times. The staff was very nice in helping us find our way around. We saw some guests with dogs in the lobby (a big plus for me since I occasionally travel with my pets). The con was the $42 charge for parking. I think that's everywhere in Boston though. Would definitely stay there again if we got a good rate as we did on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Boston Hotel at Prudential Center”
Reviews.Author: onemoretrip09
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three night stay in room 959 located in the South Tower with City view. Elevator was efficient and decorated with very classic wood panels. Hallways, however, are typical of older refurbished hotel, not as wide as some newer hotels. Absolutely wonderful large room with recently updated, modern furnishings, comfortable bed, and flat screen tv. Bathroom was on small size with tiles obviously outdated (one small blemish on an otherwise excellent update) although functional with soft towels and typical Sheraton products. Large, welcoming lobby with both "wifi" and PC's available in lobby for no charge. Very nice lap pool and exercise area. The hotel is located adjacent to the Prudential Center which provides numerous opportunities to spend money for food and shopping. MTA within a hundred yards and several blocks from the Charles River Esplanade, which is a pleasant walking area. This was a "Priceline" stay which was exceptionally inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't love this hotel but didn't hate it either”
Reviews.Author: TracyBMiddlesbrough
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fine except for poor weather. The location of the hotel was great in this instance as it is connected to the Prudential centre and in turn to Copley Square so we could shop and eat away from the elements - great shopping. We used the pool one fine afternoon and it was pleasant. Liked having a Starbucks in the lobby. Didn't like the tiny bathroom although the room was spacious. Staff were courteous. We have stayed in nicer hotels but also in worse.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent would stay again and longer next time”
Reviews.Author: RSox
Reviews.Content: My husband, 12 year old son and myself stayed a couple of nights to see a Red Sox game. This was a perfect location and the Staff was amazing, the building was well kept. The rooms were especially clean. Hats off to the housekeeping department and the Director of housekeeping. Well done all around. I manage a hotel myself and was pleased on how clean the entire building was. there was a pleasant smell in the lobby everytime I would walk in I commented on it. The pool area was always clean and picked up the fitness center was the same. Couldnt find not one thing wrong with our stay. The whole experience was great and will return. Our room was a corner unit on the 20th floor and my husband was so excited he could see fenway from our bedroom that was the best. He was like a little kid!

Reviews.Title: “Great base of operation for exploring Boston”
Reviews.Author: Need2TravelMuchMore
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right in the heart of Boston. Easy walking distance to many historical sights as well as to Fenway Park, Newburry St shopping district, restaurant row, and more. The hotel is physically connected to the Prudential Center with all of its amenities and right around the corner from the Prudential Center T stop. Upper floors offer spectacular views â€“ ours was of the Back Bay neighborhood, Charles river, sailing center and MIT campus. My wife and I attended a conference in the hotel, but extended our trip to include sightseeing. It was an excellent base for the long weekend. The hotel features moderately sized, but very nice rooms that feature great bedding, large flat screen TVs, ample desk space and nice modern bathrooms that appear to have been recently remodeled. The pool, gym and spa are of the hotel are fantastic. The pool is large and divided to allow for two lanes of lap swimming while leaving plenty of unrestricted space for leisurely swimming. The pool is under a retractable roof so on nice days it is open-air, but when it is cooler or the weather is bad it becomes an indoor space. The area also features a large hot tub, a sauna and a very nice workout facility. We were really impressed, and used the hot tub multiple times after long days of sightseeing to ease our aching feet and legs. We also appreciated the free computers in the lobby that registered guests could use. It also appeared that there was free WiFi in the lobby, but we were not traveling with a computer. The hotel is just minutes away from world-class dining, so we did not try the restaurants or room service. The staff were friendly and helpful and able to offer discounts to some attractions. My only complaint, and this is really minor, is that our room was not ready when we arrived (which was to be expected since we arrived before check-in). The front desk took a cell phone number and promised to call when it was ready. We never got the call, but when we returned from a pre-booked tour, the room was ready. NOTE: If you are traveling in the summer or fall of 2009, be aware that parts of the hotel are being renovated. Construction is limited to 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. Monday through Friday. The first morning we were there, very loud noise started directly above our room at exactly 7 a.m. We were up anyway for the conference, but would not have been happy if weâ€™d been on vacation. The other mornings were during the weekend and undisturbed. If you are traveling during the week and not on an early schedule I recommend requesting a room far away from the construction.

Reviews.Title: “Would do it again in a second!”
Reviews.Author: citygirlis
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for the long weekend with my husband & another couple and our stay at the Sheraton Boston was amazing. The hotel was in the perfect location in Back Bay, 5 mins to Fenway Park, attached to the shops at Prudential and there was a subway stop around the corner. The rooms were newly renovated with big comfy beds and an incredible view of the river. The lobby bar makes amazing Blueberry Martinins and Starbucks in the lobby made my mornings!!! We will definitely go back and stay there again. Amazing deal on Hotwire.com

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: pandacb
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 nights at the Sheraton during a family vacation in Boston Hotel: Very clean, renovated, and well-kept. Checking in and out can be a challenge though as there's only 1 or 2 people in the reception area, and many clients checking in or out. Valet parking at the hotel was at $42/day so we decided to self park at the nearby parking garage along Dalton Street for $30 a day. Room: Our room was at the South Tower which has been renovated 2 years ago. The furniture/decor was very nice. We decided to stay at the South Tower as we were told that it is bigger than the newly renovated rooms on the North Tower. The bedroom had 2 firm and comfortable double beds. We requested for a refrigerator and a microwave. There is wired internet connection available however it is for a fee of $10/day. The bathroom was very nice. There was also a flat screen TV. Amenities: There's a swimming pool which we weren't able to try during our stay. There is free internet connection and Starbucks in the lobby. Location: Couldn't ask for more. It is connected to the Prudential Centre and Copley Square shopping and dining area. Should you wish to take their subway system (T), it is right there in the Prudential Centre. Famed Newbury street is around an 8-minute walk. For groceries, you can go to nearby Shaws, along Huntington. The concierge desk was not very friendly though. Twice we have requested their assistance but service was luke warm.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaOKC
Reviews.Content: We booked an incredible rate and weren't sure what to expect. However, we received a renovated room and were very pleased with the entire experience. The lobby is spacious and a great place to catch up on e-mail (free wireless internet!).

Reviews.Title: “Started with a disappointment, ended very happily!”
Reviews.Author: joeganci
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late, around 11:30 pm and because the Sheraton was renovating some rooms they had run out of rooms. They put us up instead at the Hilton across the street for the night and then moved us to the Sheraton the next day for the remaining two nights. They were apologetic and treated us to free breakfasts the whole week, a room upgrade and some other nice benefits. We received a fruit dish in our room with a very nice card from Charmaine Taylor, the Director or Rooms, who afterward responded to my email and a personal visit by me with grace and generosity. Thank you to the Sheraton for taking good care of us after an initial disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel - Newly renovated room - Very Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: leceltique
Reviews.Content: Pros: If you can find a good deal, this hotel is great. Great pool area that our kids loved. Friendly service at front desk and good concierge. Well located next to the Prudential Tower and Center. Food Court and nearby grocery store. Also very close to the subway. Cons: Expensive parking and expensive restaurants in the hotel. No fridge in room. Small bathroom. Expensive Internet in the room (free in lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth the price of admission!”
Reviews.Author: woody87
Reviews.Content: Pros: Comfortable bed, clean room, excellent view (22nd floor), excellent housekeeping staff (tip a couple of bucks a day didn't hurt), efficient check in, connected to the Prudential center, fast elevators, courteous staff. Cons: Plumbing issue. Had to flush toilet multiple times to get rid of waste water. Room on the small size, but definitely worth the discounted rate. Will stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Location Trumps Rates and Room Issues”
Reviews.Author: MainerOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend trip that blended pleasure and work....a day-long meeting for one of us while the other played. Make similar trip a couple of times a year. Have never, and would not, pay rack rate. If we con't get a "deal" we'll stay elsewhere.... Don't get us wrong -- it's a fantastic location with a friendly staff that, for the most part, will do their best to meet your needs. If you have a meeting at the Hynes Convention Center in the Prudential Center, this is definitely the place for you. There's a direct, indoor connection from the hotel's meeting area to the Prudential Center. Grab breakfast at one of several places in The Pru on your way to the meeting.....hotel's restaurant breakfast will run you close to twenty dollars per person including tip! For meals not included in your meeting, The Pru has several good restaurant choices.....and it's connected by enclosed walkways to two other hotels/shopping areas. For non-work hours, this is the ideal location for getting around town! You can get to the Prudential "T" (subway) station without ever going outdoors. Publc bus transportation to areas not served by the subway is half a block away in one direction, a block away in another, and two blocks in a third. Hotel Concierge can be very helpful for the best way to get where you're going. In our experience, there may be some connection between the rate you're paying and the room you actually get (they aren't all the same size!). This most recent stay we got a deeply discounted rate through a Hilton promotion, were given one of the recently remodeled rooms in the North Tower (better security than in the South Tower based on a purse-snatching experience in the South Tower a few years ago). From experience we requested, and were granted, a room on a floor high enough to avoid looking directly at the wall of the Hynes Center next door (don't hesitate to ask about view during check-in). That said, the room itself had some real plusses and minuses -- the furnishings were obviously new and attractive -- nice work station for computer etc,. coffee table with a swiveling top making it very convenient for use from the easy chair, and a super shower with rain-fall shower head, However, there were no towel racks in the bathroom beyond one in the back of the shower, meaning the only convenient place to hang used towels and wash cloths was over the shower rod. And while the king-sized bed was very comfortable, it was located so close to the adjacent wall on one side that the person on that side of the bed had to turn sideways just to get to the head of the bed -- obviously no nightstand for eyeglasses, etc on that side of the bed....
