Had none of the problems (beyond the cost) with valet parking that others have mentioned. They were at carside immediately upon our arrival.. And, as requested, we called down about twenty minutes before check-out to ask them to bring it around -- it was being parked at curbside as we arrived downstairs with our luggage. As far as the cost, it's increased steadily over the past several years.....and it is what it is because there are few alternatives if you want to park anywhere near the hotel. We just figure it into our overall cost when deciding where to stay. So far, the other advantages of this location have outweighed their hefty parking fee. All in all, the room was above average for the price we paid -- but if we'd actually paid the rack rate, we probably would have been disappointed,,,,

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: twinkKenosha_WI
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a week long vacation in Boston and found the Sheraton to be a wonderful hotel. We stayed in the newly renovated portion of the hotel and had a corner room on the 21st floor...beautiful view of the city. The concierge desk was extremely helpful and helped us find a wonderful restaurant the first night in town. The room was clean and quiet for the most part..you can't pick your neighbors. The Starbucks coffee in the room was very much appreciated. The king size bed was quite comfortable as well. The location is great, could not ask for better. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aussiejmj
Reviews.Content: I got a deal on hotwire for $96 a night, which was pretty much one of the cheapest hotel deals I had seen in Boston. I wasnt expecting anything fantastic for that price but I was really suprised. The rooms were a little small, but nothing that I would complain about. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept it! The staff were really helpful with everything, they had free internet access in the lobby, which was all set up with comfy chairs everywhere where u could take your laptop and relax without feeling stupid sitting in a lobby on your laptop. The hotel is connected to a Shopping centre which was good.. had dinner at the Cheesecake factory next door one night and I couldnt recommend it enough! Fantastic food... Overall we loved our stay and i would definately return to that hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Concierge Service Ever Experienced!”
Reviews.Author: ccoyle449
Reviews.Content: This was a most pleasant stay, helped in no small part to the wonderful concierge service in the hotel. We stayed for a considerable period of time in one of the newly renovated rooms and found the hotel to be one of considerable quality. It's the largest hotel in Boston, and sometimes the lobby can be a bit crazy with the number of guests checking in and out, but we discovered the rooms to be quiet and relaxing. The Starbucks coffee maker in the room was also a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “A place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: sherbear8883
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is that it is centrally located. A short walk to the Pru T stop. Since the hotel is connected to the Prudential Center Mall, you have many food options for every meal of the day and then some. Duck Tours take off outside the Pru as well. Other than that there's not much to write home about. The pool is nice on a hot day. The excersize room is sufficient. The business center located in the lobby is helpful. The lobby is large and comfy...very busy...great for people watching. I picked this hotel for it's location and because of the under $100 price I found. Like other reviewers I wouldn't pay the rack rate for the room that the hotel website advertises. The location was extremely convenient and the room served its purpose as a place to rest our heads after our busy days in beautiful Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SF-Coast-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Boston for 3 nights. This two tower hotel is located adjacent to the Prudential Center Office and Shopping complex in the Back Bay area of Boston. The Prudential â€œTâ€� Station (Heath Street Green Line) is a short 5 minute walk from the hotel, either via the exterior of the building or through the Prudential Center. This â€œTâ€� line connects to the other lines at the Park Street, Government Center, and Haymarket stations. The Prudential Center is home to a moderate size shopping center with a good selection of restaurants including California Pizza Kitchen (CPK), PF Changs, Cheesecake Factory, a food court, a salad cafÃ©, and an Au Bon Pain bakery to name a few. There is a large, well stocked, market across the street from the CPK that offers a deli, bakery, and full service meat department. There is access to the Back Bay train station (about a 15 minute walk) via the Copley Place shopping complex. The front office staff were efficient and friendly and accommodated my request for a room in the South Tower as renovations were in progress in parts of the North Tower. The front desk clerk advised me my South Tower room had been renovated within the past few years. The room was a comfortable size with two twin beds, a desk, and a large LCD TV. An iron and ironing board were in the closet. The furniture and bed coverings appeared to be in good shape. I found the bed to be comfortable and the linens clean and crisp. The heating and air-conditioning unit worked well. The bathroom did not appear to have been renovated (I donâ€™t know this for sure) but nevertheless it was clean and well serviced. The toilet was the older â€œpower flushâ€� type and was a bit noisy. I did not use any of the food and beverage facilities at the hotel as there were a number of other choices within the immediate vicinity of the hotel. I did, however, visit the Starbucks outlet located in the lobby. There are several computer stations in the lobby with Internet access with 30 minutes of free access per day for hotel guests on a first come first served basis. Additionally there are several stations with Internet access ports for those guests with their own laptops. The hotelâ€™s pool is located on the mezzanine level between the hotelâ€™s two towers. I did not use the pool or visit the area directly, but looking down on the area from my room it appeared to be clean and the area well kept. I was able to secure a sub $100 room rate via Hotwire and found the hotel, especially because of its great location, to be good value for my money. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again. GETTING TO THE HOTEL VIA PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION (approximately 30 minutes at a cost of $2) From the airport; take the Blue Line subway to the Government Center Station. Exit the train, go up one level, and board the Green Line â€œHeath Streetâ€� train. Disembark at the Prudential Center Station and turn left as you exit the fare gates. At the top of the escalator, exit the doors in front of you, turn right and walk to the stop light. Turn right again and walk for five minutes and the hotel will be on your right. Or, you can access the hotel via the Prudential Center by turning right at the top of the station escalators, going through the glass doors, up the shopping center escalators, then turning left and following the corridor around to the other side of the shopping center and turning left again into the hotel. Walk through the ballroom area and down the escalators to the lobby. Because my flight departed at 6AM, the â€œTâ€� was not running that early in the morning. I took a taxi to the airport (approximately 15 minutes) which cost $28 inclusive of gratuity.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant staff brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: richyintipp
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel as part of honeymoon trip to usa, had disaster stay in paramount new york but sheraton made up for it, welcomed by friendly reception staff who asked us reason for visit when we told them for honeymoon put us in king room on top floor of hotel overlooking city, room was very big with the most comfortable hotel bed i've ever slept in, went for walk in beautiful surrounding backbay and on return had found champagne, chocolate covered strawberries and congratulations card from hotel. i would recommend this hotel highly, right next door to shopping mall and short distance from main shopping streets and sight seeing trolleys leave from front door could not fault this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Thick of Things”
Reviews.Author: CTTRVL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the July 4th weekend and we were not disappointed. Our room on the 21st floor had the best view (at least we thought so) of the Fireworks on the Charles River. We are going to stay here again next year! The hotel is attached to the Hynes Convention Center, Prudential Building, Copley, and sister hotel Westin. It's relatively close to Fenway in one direction and Boston Public Gardens the other direction. As for the hotel itself, it's under renovation so the club floor and lounges were not available this year for SPG members. However, the standard rooms were fine...just a little tight in bathroom. Overall, the rooms were updated, clean and comfortable. We had the opportunity to use the open air pool on the 5th floor..please be careful when walking around it. My son slipped since the tiles around the pool were more on the smooth side than the gritty side....Not really good when wet. Just a precaution. We enjoyed the swim and view of the Prudential building.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: JLW05
Reviews.Content: I got a very good deal for this hotel and had read all of the reviews so my expectations were not that high. We arrived at the Sheraton at about 5PM and requested we be placed on the same floor as our friends who had arrived earlier. We were informed that if we wanted to be on the same floor, the room would not be ready for a few hours. Since we were tired from traveling, we took a room on a different floor. I understand that it was a holiday weekend but I think that all rooms should be ready by check-in time. We got to our room in the North tour and it was newly renovated. It was nicely furnished and very clean. However, the room must have been the smallest American hotel room I have ever seen. It reminded me of rooms I have stayed in while visiting London where hotel rooms are notoriously small. The bathroom was tiny too and the toilet never flushed on the first attempt. We looked out of our window and faced a wall. No view whatsoever. The hotel staff was very nice and the lobby was attractive with lots of seating for weary travelers. The hotel is attached to the Prudential Center so you are not only near many shops but restaurants as well - Legal Seafood, The Cheesecake Factory, etc. Parking is expensive at $42 a night. For the rate I paid the hotel suited my purposes and if I return to Boston and can get a good rate I would probably stay at the Sheraton again but I wouldn't pay the rates asked on the Sheraton website. PS - Our friends lucked out and got a corner room (paid the same rate as we did) and their room was very, very nice and large too!

Reviews.Title: “great location and worth staying if you can find a reasonable deal”
Reviews.Author: jafojaz
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location and view. Room is clean and comfortable. By lucky chance, I booked a room via Travelocity and it was a great deal for the area. If I had to pay "rack" rate, I probably would not stay at this hotel. Not the most friendly front desk staff when I checked in. Valet parking staff was indifferent, even though they were not so busy. Hotel was busy with conference(s). Stay there if you can find a reasonable deal, otherwise look for another better and newer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed with my two young girls for a Mom & Girls nite out in the city”
Reviews.Author: femmbotttt
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room on the 17th floor with a great view of the Charles River. Our room was immaculate, quiet and nicely decorated. The bed was very comfortable. The staff were very friendly & particulary nice to my girls who were thrilled to be staying in the city. The Sheraton is in a great location, adjacent both the Prudential & Copley Malls. A very short walk will bring you to the subway. Highly rececommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton OK, wouldn't pay for it myself”
Reviews.Author: Timmycat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 24-26 while husband attending conference held on site. Teen daughter & I took the opportunity to visit colleges. Had seen alarmng things abt this hotel, esp. bugs, on the forum. No bugs, all clean. Our only serious complaint is that the lightweight down filled quilt is lined with some sort of plastic--it feels like it's vinyl when you rub the sides together in your hands---and because you are sleeping under what amounts to a shower curtain, you wake up drenched in sweat off & on all through the night. The pillows have the same problem. All three of us had this complaint, so it is not just me the middle aged lady having hot flashes (which I am all done with anyway). We had the AC turned to 65 and we still sweated to death. If we go there again I am bringing my own pillow! And maybe blanket. We arrived at nearly midnight without having had dinner & the very courteous bar ladies took our last minute order (the kitchen is open till midnight for orders from the bar) of clam chowder & chicken quesadillas. These were fine for late night & last minute, but $7/cup for soup & $14 for quesad. Did I say the staff was courteous & lovely? They were great; every experience we had with staff was excellent. Thanks to this site, we knew to ask about the construction noise, and the south tower was full, so the desk gave us a 6th floor room in the north. We never heard any noise while there, although we heard about it from other guests! Our room was one of the newly decorated ones---all new and angly and dark wood. The guest who commented on the TV is correct---while it is a nice flat screen, they give you about 12 channels, most of which are worthless. No PBS, no MSNBC, you had better like late night ads and Nancy Grace because that is all that they have on the channels they give. Although they do have NESN for the Sox fans. Oh, yes and about 4 channels advertising some aspect of Sheratons. They do have the Weather Channel & CNN (which while we were there rattled on endlessly about Michael Jackson; at least he knocked the philandering governor off the air). On the second day, the desk phone stopped working, which my husband needed. He was able to use the bedside one, but the other phone wasn't fixed/replaced during our stay. They have a sign in the room asking you to save water by reusing your towels, which we would gladly do if they installed towel bars for us to let them dry! There is just one small one, and it is in the shower -- your towel won't get dry there if the other person/s take a shower! The bathroom is tiny but if only one person uses it at a time it's OK. Oddly, there is no towel bar for a hand/face towel near the sink; you have to drape this one over the small dark wood bookcase under the sink--the damp will eventually wreck the wood of this piece. The table/desk on which the TV sits is long enough for you to place things to work or for family's items. There is also a wide shelf under the window the full width of the room, if you need to place suitcases, etc, on something. My daughter wanted to check facebook for birthday greetings f rom friends, but was usually frustrated by the long lines to use the lobby computers. My husband's company paid for our stay, so for the price I have no complaints! But if we had to pay for it, I would not go back to this one---I'd spend it elsewhere. The plastic lined quilt & pillows are the reason.

Reviews.Title: “"Pretty decent hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Chgo_Biz_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some pretty dodgy Sheratons in the past but they are apparently trying to upgrade the brand. The best thing about this hotel is that the rooms are very new. North Tower was rehabbed in 2009, South Tower in 2007. Everything is clean. My room was a standard room, nothing fancy, but well furnished, and clean. Flat screen TV (but with no high-def or digital channels). The finishes, etc., are not as nice as Westin but are fine. Bathroom was well -lit with good water pressure and very hot water, but tiny. Towels were pretty thin and worn out but that's not a big deal for me. Construction is finished except in Club Floors (26 - 29) of North Tower. Being on 23rd floor, I could hear the construction. I was up early so it didn't bother me but I could not have slept in past when the noise started (7 am). It was loud enough to awaken me but muffled enough that the noise did not bother me when I was awake. I think a few floors down and it would not have been audible. I chose this hotel because of the pool. It is 18 meters long, which is pretty decent for a center city hotel in an older city. The water was overchlorinated and a bit on the warm side for laps, and the pool was very crowded, but I did manage to get a decent swim. The large health club had a lot of cardio and treadmills. Lobby has free wi-fi, and lots of big tables with lighting that make it very user friendly. I worked there for several hours one night rather than being cooped up in my room. This is a major convention hotel. As someone else commented, the advantage of that is that if you have Starwood status, you'll likely get an upgrade since most guests probably don't have status. I never ate in the hotel, except for the Starbucks in the lobby. Because it's owned by the hotel, prices are 25% higher than in a "real" Starbucks, and they did not have breakfast sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great room, friendly & helpful staff, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: AlwynSouthamptonUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights, and did not encounter any of the negative aspects we had read about in other reviews. Shame about the weather but that was not the hotels fault.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeKFlorida
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the Sheraton-Boston on Dalton St by the Pru Center. Booked thru Hotwire at $89 per night. When I checked in asked about getting one of their renovated rooms, front desk clerk took care of it with a smile. Rooms are very comfortable, great bed, new tv's and remodeled bathrooms. Can't beat it for the price as rack rate is around $200 plus a night I believe. Free wireless in lobby and connected to Pru Center by the indoor mall. T station is 2 blocks or so and used the $15 Charlie pass that is good for a week on all subway, bus and inner harbor ferries. Used a shared van service from the airport...Ultimate/Zebra limos...booked on line, $14 each way and right on time. No complaints at all about hotel, service, rooms and great location. Just make sure you ask for an upgraded/renovated room when you check in....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great city.”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm2942
Reviews.Content: Given the mixed reviews, including comments about small rooms and possible bugs, we approached this stay with some trepidation. It was also the first time I had booked through Priceline, and I had been warned that this could sometimes result in bad service. In fact, we loved both the hotel and the city. Reception was courteous and efficient. Sure the room was a bit smaller than some, but then we only sleep there anyway. The view over the Charles River was outstanding, and everything was spotlessly clean. We didn't eat at the hotel - why would you, when the hotel is attached to a mall with an array of excellent restaurants. Loved Legal Sea Food and California Pizza Kitchen, for pizza with a difference. The hotel is well situated for the theatre district, and right on the "T" (the Boston subway). If I had paid the rack rate, I might have a different perspective, but for what we paid, I was more than happy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dagdabear
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have gained a liking for the larger downtown Sheraton hotels across the USA, so it was a no brainer to book into the Sheraton in Boston when visiting. We were not disappointed, it lived up to what we've grown to expect from this hotel group. Big hotel, plenty of facilities, good quality of staff. We were given one of the newly refurbished rooms which was excellent, with a flat screen HD TV although without HD input. Breakfast in the hotel was fine and reasonable price, there is also a Starbuck's for those wanting a quick caffeine fix and sandwich. We had a couple of issues because of the refurbishment ongoing. Which I must say we were warned about by the front desk on checking in. We lost partial power for an hour one afternoon, and the TV went down for a few hours another day. Neither was a major inconvenience and staff were helpful and quickly responded to our enquiries and fixed things. Being next to a conference centre the hotel has lots of business travellers, meetings and events going on all the time but these were no bother to us. Parking is expensive but so were local parking facilities. What sells this hotel however is the location as part of the Prudential Centre shopping complex it has 9 restaurants and many shops to hand. Many more eating places are within 5-15 minutes walk of the hotel. Three different Boston tour companies run past the hotel on a regular basis so you can get to all the sights, also there are metro and bus stops within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skamom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our second stay at this hotel. We love the location-right at the Prudential Center, near shopping and the T. We took an overnight flight from Los Angeles and emailed the hotel them to let them know. They were so accommodating and got us into our room around 7:30am! We were very pleasantly surprised, to say the least! The room had a great view and a wonderful king size bed. The hotel has a Starbucks in the lobby area and free use of computers as well. The staff is always ready to help--we really enjoyed our stay and will return in October. They have a great promotion going-we only paid the dollar amount of my husband's birth year for the second and third night. This hotel is in the Back Bay area-there are a lot of other nice hotels in the area-Newbury St. is very close and tons of places to eat. It's great!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MrsBond923
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in an 11th floor, North Tower queen room. Although the room was quite small, it was clean, newly renovated, and contained all the necessary modern amenities. We got a great deal on Hotwire so for the price we paid, it was an excellent value. The shower is awesome -- adjustable pressure from "rain" to "power wash." Toiletries by Bliss smell really nice. I absolutely love that they provide shelves in the bathroom so you can keep your stuff off the counter and out of the way. That may not make any difference to some people, but it's huge if you are a product junkie like me. My only minor complaint, aside from the smallness of the room, was the relative lack of insulation from hallway noise. There was a rather large gap under the door, which we needed to put a pillow over to keep out the light and noise. For us, not a big deal, but for those who need absolute quiet in order to sleep, it might be a problem. Other than that, we had a great stay and I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RonaldoC
Reviews.Content: Pricelined this hotel for $87 plus tax per night. Very happy with the hotel. There were three of us travelling together in two rooms and as I snore really loudly I got a huge double double room all to myself. Great views of Boston from the room, nice controllable aircon. Smallish bathroom though actually the same size as the one I had just stayed in NYC. Really comfortable beds and nice large LCD TV. The rooms have all been renovated in the past year and one of my travelling companions had stayed in this hotel before and confirmed that the rooms are much nicer now. They have put a really nice rain type shower in and upgraded the furnishings. The lobby is very plush and check in was smooth. Elevators were a little slow but not a real big issue. I used the Boston Common parking lot which was about $34 from Saturday evening to Monday morning. It would have been only $22 but we failed to get up before 8 am to get the car out in time. We took a cab back. Lots of shopping opportunities around the hotel and not too far from the T station although we took cabs mostly everywhere. We managed to hire a speedboat from a guy at the harbour for $75+ gas for two hours which was enough really. We took it quite a way out to sea and actually to the furthest lighthouse. It was also cool to see the aircraft taking off and landing at Logan whilst on a boat. All in al the hotel was pretty good especially for the price and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: fmpden
Reviews.Content: For business reasons had been in the Hyatt (financial district) earlier in the week and shifted to the Sheraton for five days of playing tourist. We got to the hotel via Hotwire and 3.5 star rating. Since it was a $100/day less than the Hyatt we have average expectations. Were we surprised. Much better than the Hyatt is all aspects from the front desk to the bathrooms. The Sheraton had free internet computers in a common area near the lobby. The room (18th floor, south tower) appeared to have been recently redone and very large and spacious. Two blocks from the subway, three blocks to Newberry St -- could not have been a more convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: prockCt
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed one night to see a Sox game, did not experience any of the negative things I've read in some reviews. We got a newly renovated room and were warned we may hear some construction noise in the morning, but it was a Sunday and we heard nothing. I booked on Priceline and was very happy with the hotel (paid way less than the $250 some people have reported paying). The bathroom was pretty small, but it got the job done. Just watch out for the parking fees, we each got soaked for $42 for using valet. The place is attached to a public garage and you may be better off just parking in there yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Chris Y
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Sheraton in Boston for two nights and was very pleased. I was a little concerned based on all these bad reviews which I don't understand. We arrived early in the morning and were not able to check in for a few hours which was understandable. Once we got into the room we were both floored! We had a suite on the 21st floor with a great view of the area around Fenway park. Plenty of space in the room with automatic blinds that shut with the turn of a switch. No problems with the service at the Hotel. As mentioned, it's in a great location right near a subway stop. Plenty of restaurants and a mall are connected to the Hotel. I Definitely recommend you check out a restaurant called Legal Seafoods. My GF loved the oysters. Said they were the best she's ever had. Our second night there, we walked to Fenway to check out a Redsox game. It's an easy walk. Duck tours leave right near the Hotel. No problems walking around the Hotel area. Safe and Secure. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Fabfourfan
Reviews.Content: My wife, my mother and I stayed here on a vacation trip to Boston. Over all, I was very pleased with this hotel. Our rooms were clean and comfortable. From our window, we had a nice view of the river and beyond. If you looked hard to the left, you could even see Fenway Park! And speaking of Fenway, it is an easy walk from this hotel so if you are in town to see a Red Sox game, this would be a good choice. The only negative experience we had was one morning when a man knocked on our door and told us he was with security. He said that he was there to oversee the installation of a new smoke detector. This man was dressed nicely but he did not have a photo ID to show to me when I asked to see one. I told him that without proper credentials, I would not allow him into our room. He seemed slightly irritated at this but I was adamant- no ID, no entry. He went away and came back later with a man carrying a ladder and they each had smoke detectors with them. I called down to the front desk and confirmed that they were both legitimate so I let them in. Odd though that a hotel like Sheraton did not provide a photo ID for their security. Either that or maybe he just left his at home that day.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: PalmTreeEnvy89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Anime Boston and it was the worst expirience at a hotel I have ever had. I had to wait 4 hours to get into my room because the maids couldn't clean it until 7:00 at night. Mind you check in time is at 3:00. I was given dirty sheets which no one would replace not matter how many times I called for service. Then to find out it's because apparently I wasn't registered at the hotel because the people at the front desk made a mistake. So I never got maid service either needless to say the room was a mess when I left. Oh and the best thing they charged me three times the price they were supposed to so now i'm negitive in my checking account. Needless to say I will be staying somewhere else for the convention next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff - great location”
Reviews.Author: venividiboggli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Boston Anime Con and loved it. MUCH better than Marriott we stayed at for last year's Con. Unlike the Marriott, no 45 minute waits for elevators and surly staff. Nicer rooms and great location.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MrsSea
Reviews.Content: My 18 year old daughter and I just returned yesterday from a four day trip to Boston. We were lucky to get a room on the 25th floor (with a water view) that was very recently renovated. The room was great! I booked this room about two months ago through Travelocity and paid only $100 per night for a room with two very comfortable beds! The location of the Sheraton is perfect. It is attached to the mall, the duck tours leave right outside the mall, the subway is very close, and there is great shopping (Filene's Basement) and good eating spots (we loved the Cheesecake Factory) within walking distance. Finally, the staff was very friendly and helpful in helping us plan our days.

Reviews.Title: “Highly disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: jenne1017
Reviews.Content: This is a verbatim letter I sent to the hotel a few minutes ago: I do not think I will ever stay at a Sheraton again because of the horrible stay we've had here at the Sheraton in Boston. My wife and I are in town for her commencement ceremonies at BU. Not only were the hotel rates outrageously high, but for that amount of money, you'd think we'd get more than a closet of a room. We arrived Friday May 15th. We were given a room in the North tower and told that on Monday, we might be woken up at 7a because of construction. We asked to switch towers because that was our one day of rest and relaxation. But, there were no rooms anywhere else available, or so we were told. We were told to come back on Saturday or Sunday night to see if we could be moved then but alas, we would be busy all day, each day. We were expected to miss graduation to be given accommodations that we should have received anyway. When we told the woman we'd be out and about until at least 10p each night, we were met with a shrug. When we got to our room, the chemical smell was so bad, my wife had an asthma attack. Suddenly, another room opened up on the 20th floor. The smell wasn't as bad but the room size sure was. We could barely fit the two of us in the room at the same time, never mind the bathroom. Our toilet was old and gross (already??!?!) and the guests that came into town for this special occasion couldn't even come up to the room because they wouldn't fit! Not to mention the bed. There is no way this old bed is a "Sweet Sleep" bed. It's a regular old mattress. The comforter is so old, it's actually bumpy. And we had 4 pillows, not one of them a special embroidered one. No silky sheets. Nadda. Then there is the internet. $9.95 (which I just had to pay again to type this to you...or re-type as it cut out on me the first time) a day for "high speed internet" that I have to use from a desk? No wireless? Get with the times! Especially in a room so small I can't sit at the desk nd have my wife pass by me to get to the only other chair in the room. For $250+ a night, we expected more. Especially after viewing the ads on TV that you have running in the lobby that make the standard rooms seem bigger than they really are. In these hard economic times, you'd think that you'd want to advertise getting more for your customer's dime, but I guess that's all just an illusion too? To make room for more of your new suites. You can keep your "amazing views" (not from the 11th floor they weren't) and give me a hotel with better service and one that's reached the technological advancements of 2005. The pool was being run amok with young kids with loud mouths and no adult supervision. It was all just a big disappointment for a weekend that was supposed to be so noteworthy (in a GOOD way).

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel, specially if you consider the price”
Reviews.Author: szmikedr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Sheraton in may. The rooms are smallish (I am from europe, where the rooms tend to be small, so I have nothing to complain. However it is very small for american standards), the bathroom was probably the smallest I have ever seen. It is impossible to get out of the tube/shower if the door is open. Wellnes/fitness facility is probably the worst in the hotel - old dated, would not be ok for a 2-3 star hotel either. Service was good. In quality the breakfast is comparable to the spa..... If you are willing to pay this price for a hotel, go and search for other in Boston. There are better hotels in this range in all aspects.

Reviews.Title: “Much better places to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: dnascimb
Reviews.Content: Got a room on the 27th floor. Paid about $250/night before taxes. Didn't have a flat screen TV (what year is it?), the room was last decorated in 1991, and the bathroom was extremely small. I've stayed at both the Hilton across the street and the Intercontinental down the road. Both are better and the same rate or even cheaper. I hear they are renovating the rooms, so you should stay below the 20th floor... however, why do that when you can just stay somewhere else?

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: katslappy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed on April 25th to go to the Red Sox game. We both woke up with welts on our legs and arms that itched like crazy. After some research we determined it had to be bed bugs. Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: nb1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week around Easter. Location is brilliant, T station right at the hotel was very handy for exploring Boston. Connection to the Prudential Center via a walkway was also great. We were in a refurbished room, which was nice. Very quiet room. Bed was very large. The hotel lobby was very nice, with the starbucks - very handy, although there were quite a few places in the Prudential Centre that were good for meals and snacks. My only complaint would be about the pool/jacuzzi area. The pool itself was fine, but the spa and changing areas were not very clean. We only used it once, so it wasn't a big deal - but if you were using these a lot, it would probably bothered you. Other than that, no other negatives about the hotel. I would easily recommend the hotel, and would stay there again, no problem. The surrounding area was great. A few nice bars on Boyleston Street, one in particular McGreevys was great. One tip for anyone going it that ID was required for us everywhere for drinking ( we are both 33). Some places even refused our UK driving licences as ID, so we had to go elsewhere. Other places that I have been to in the US have accepted our licences no problem, so it was a bit of a pain. We loved Boston and would easily go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay During the Boston Marathon”
Reviews.Author: JPHCBPA
Reviews.Content: Wife and I were in this great city for the Boston Marathon. We loved the room, location to the convention center and the start/finish of the marathon. Both agree we will stay here again. The service was most excellent as well. Love having a Starbucks in the lobby! :)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Forsyth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a meeting at the convention center. Our room was not "posh", but newly refurbished, with a big-screen tv; bathroom was tiny. I would have liked a refrigerator. Employees were pleasant and efficient. We did not eat here, since the convention center (connected to the Sheraton) is connected to two indoor malls which have an incredible number of shops and restaurants. The Sheraton is also only a couple of blocks away from Newbury Street's restaurants, Symphony Hall, and the Metro. Group rate was a good value, though if I came on my own I might try a hotel with more "personality."

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated rooms - great location”
Reviews.Author: vandyspider
Reviews.Content: The renovations are currently finishing up (one room per day). I had a newly renovated room on the 20th floor and both the room and view were great. Clean rooms and convenient access to the back bay area. The pool left something to be desired, but was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: purpleheather66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Boston from 25/03/2009 for 4 nights.The travel agent had indicated on our booking form,the reason for our visit was my friends 40th birthday.We were given a free dinner at the hotel,which was a great treat. Our room was lovely, plenty of space,very comfortable beds,Starbucks coffee was included free too! We asked for a safety deposit box which we got free,as was storage of our luggage while we waited for our flight time.The staff were all very helpful and friendly.We would definitely recommend this hotel and gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: jmwhite2
Reviews.Content: Like the previous traveler, I had to check out and move to another hotel after one night because of the construction noise. It started at 6:45AM and was so loud I could not stay in the room. At check-in, I was advised of some construction on the 16th floor and the possibility of "some noise", but nothing prepared me for the cacophony that went on all morning. I couldn't even talk on the phone it was so loud. It was irresponsible to rent these rooms, especially at $250 a night. Find another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: t2922
Reviews.Content: We reserved 3 nights (well in advance) at this hotel for a business trip at the convention center, but left after the first night because of extremely loud construction noise. When we checked in we were put on the 12th floor and told there might be a little construction noise on the 16th floor. This was a lie. The noise was directly above us and so loud we could not even hold a conversation. It literally sounded like they had a jackhammer in the floor above us. The noise started at 6:30 AM and was so bad we felt we couldn't work or even be in the room at all during the day. The hotel was full so they could not move us, and we heard other people complaining about the issue, yet they continued to rent out the rooms. Ridiculous. Other issues also make this hotel overpriced at $250 a night. (1) The internet connection (for $11 a night), is not wireless and EXTREMELY slow. It reminds me of the days of 9600 baud modems. (2) No breakfast included. There is a restaurant in the lobby but the food is terrible (fake egg mix and soggy hash browns) and expensive ($20 a person). (3) The room is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: PrestoSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Date of stay: March 9-10, 2009 I was in Boston for business and my company put me in the Sheraton, located downtown in the prestigious Prudential Center. I arrived one day early and was told that the only room they had would cost $459. They would not honor my $220 convention rate. Therefore I went up the street to the Marriott and was given an excellent room for $219. The next day I checked into the Sheraton. The lobby is impressively large, modern looking and with a comfortable bar. There are several areas where one can use computers for internet or printing boarding passes. Check in was efficient and the staff friendly. The room I was assigned was on the sixth floor, even side. Upon entering my initial impression was one of drab, tired and disappointing. It was dimly lit and my view was of a brick wall that was the side of the Hynes Convention Center. The view below was of vents protruding from a roof. By craning my head up I could see some sky. At least it was quiet. The â€œdouble bedâ€� promised by the desk clerk was really a double. This was probably fortunate in that if it had been any larger the room would have been more cramped. There was a dark blue comforter on the bed covering a not new pilled and snagged light brown polyester blanket. Ordinary sheets and mattress. The TV was an older Phillips analog type. After settling in I quickly noticed a number of anomalies. The most obvious a section of wall paper at the entrance to the bathroom that was peeled back several inches and just hanging. In the bathroom the sink had a Y shaped crack across the bottom and the drain plug was completely missing. There were several hairs on the floor and a corner beneath the sink had obviously not seen a mop for some time. A bit more investigating revealed dust bunnies behind the bed and end tables. Most surprisingly a mans blue sock lay beneath the foot of the bed where even the most cursory of cleaning would have encountered it. The peel-off part of a band aid was on the floor next to the wall by the door where anyone cleaning the room should have seen it. It remained there for my two day stay. I had only one meal which was the $20 breakfast buffet. For the money the selection was slim and the food quality no better than one would find in mid level hotel outside the city. It was certainly not on a level expected from a name brand hotel in a prestigious downtown Boston location. Overall I will summarize this Sheraton as an overpriced and underwhelming property that only survives due to its proximity to the Hynes Convention Center. It reminds me of a 1980s Holiday Inn found in the mid west. I checked out after my mandatory two nights and moved across the street to the Hilton for my last night in Boston. The room was $223. The Hilton was excellent in all aspects.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmisec2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, service was excellent and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the lobby bar was a great place to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “three rooms in three nights!”
Reviews.Author: iainb
Reviews.Content: the title says it all, first room was next to the lift shaft it was very noisy, the second room was an adjoining room and those next door were very loud and tried to get into our room. The third room was also next to the lift shaft and so every couple of seconds the room shook as the lifts travelled up and down. The hotel itself is adequate and attached to the Prudential Cente Shopping Mall. There is a Starbucks in the Lobby open at 6am which is handy. around the corner there are a couple of bars, the Pour House is one which is quite handy and reasonably priced for food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “No Clue what”
Reviews.Author: Starfish94
Reviews.Content: I attended the National Association of School Psychologists convention in Feb. 09' and stayed in the Sheraton. It was one of the three for which a discount was offered through the convention. The other two were the Marriott and the Westin. I knew people that stayed in both. For others considering GO TO ONE OF THOSE!!! The Westin is beautiful with a great breakfast. The Marriott is central to an convention activities. If attended for a convention I suggest the Marriott, if for leisure, the Westin. I stayed with someone who has sevre food alergies. We called the day before to confirm that we could have a fridge and microwave. They said it was no problem. Upon arrival neither were there, so we called down and were told that a fridge would be brought up but that no microwaves were available. When I asked why not when we had called ahead, they said it was first come first serve. I explained how we had requested it, that we were told it was no problem, and that someone in the room was unable to go out to eat due to allergies. We were there for FOUR days and to make a long story short -- NO MICROWAVE EVER!! Apparently they have no regard for people with medical complications as my poor friend ate cold cereal and bread for the 4 days we were there. To top it off -- we called each day asking for a microwave, being told we were "on the list," and then when one of us went down to ask face to face, they gave us a perplexed look and said, "We only have one, and it's broken." Nothing beats being LIED to for service!! They are really lucky my friend didn't contact ADA as I'm sure they would love to hear about how well they took care of someone who voiced a medical disability which was totally disregarded. We checked in using the Kiosk which apparently meant that we were not warned of the renovations going on above our heads starting at "7am everyday" when in reality they started no later than 6:30 every day. When we complained they basically told us it was our fault for checking in using the Kiosk because had we used a person, they would have warned us. Please, for your own sake, DO NOT STAY HERE. It has a good location in the financial area, and they are doing renovations to make their horrible rooms better supposedly, but do yourself a favor and stay at one of the other two if you need to stay in the area!!

Reviews.Title: “A very good, well appointed hotel and part of a Mall where there is everything you could want”
Reviews.Author: Brunnsum
Reviews.Content: This really is a very good, well appointed hotel and part of a Mall where there is everything you could want or need. The staff were all kind and helpful. We wanted to leave cases here while we went to New York for 3 days and they kindly looked after them. We came back for a night and they gave us a free upgrade to a great suite with the biggest bed we have ever seen. No breakfast included but there is a restaurant for a full American or a Starbucks in the foyer for alighter continental and of course plenty to go at in the Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: 2009leeds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it was our first trip to Boston and did not want to be too far out of the city. After reading some of the reviews we were a bit nervous about staying here. However we found the staff to be friendly, the rooms big, especially the bed and to be in great walking distance from the centre of Boston. We would definitely recommend staying here again. The only minor downside and this is the case with most hotels near the city, you have to pay for parking which is $38 for 24 hrs. But there is another car park about 2 mins drive from the hotel which cost $33. The plus of the $38 car park is that you could walk straight from the car park into the hotel lifts to the reception desk. We really enjoyed walking the FreedomTrail - a good way to explore the city for first timers. We also went to the Legal Seafood Restaurant - a bit pricey but definitely worth it, it was gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, avoid the conventions though”
Reviews.Author: BaronBazil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton hotel towards the end of November 2008. I confess we were here because the Jurys was fully booked, but we were still more than happy with our choice. Firstly, the hotel itself. Its a large towering hotel, split into two towers and forms part of the Prudential Centre, a large convention/conference facility as well as linking to a fairly classy shopping centre. We had a room in the South Tower, somewhere upwards of the 20th floor. The views from the room were gret, but we were the wrong side to get a vista over the centre of the city (images attached). The room was a good size and more than comfortable enough for two of us for 5 nights. Great big comfy bed, room to spread out in the room. The bathroom was big enough, but not the most stylish I've been in. There is cabled internet access in the rooms but wireless is only available in the lobby. there are also about eight desktop machines free for guests to use. They are however very busy and prone to crashing. On the occaisions we ate at the hotel.... room service is good and swift, either for dinner or breakfast. Breakfast in the restaurant is okay, but not the best value you'll find, or indeed the tastiest. The lobby bar is, unfortunately, the only bar. I find this surprising for a hotel of this size and it does get busy. The bar food is pretty good value though. As we were there for a birthday, I had requested a bottle of champagne and flowers for the room. This was arranged in advance, without fuss. I can recommend contacting Michael who was great and followed up to ensure we had everything. Indeed, all the staff we encountered, be it on reception, in the bar or on the door, were friendly, helpful and efficient. As I said, the hotel is tied to a large conference centre and towards the end of the stay a rather large gathering of religious scholars descended upon the place. Not ideal if you are after a quiet time as there is simply no escaping the delegates if they are in residence. Location wise, the hotel is great. A very short walk on to the lovely Newbury Street and a nice stroll into the centre of the city via the Hancock Tower and Boston Common. Sure, there are better hotels in Boston, but the Sheraton is good value and in a good location if you want to explore the Back Bay area.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating Experience”
Reviews.Author: JPNM
Reviews.Content: After three months, I am still waiting for the hotel to correct their billing. In my opinion this is symptomatic of decreasing customer service at this property (I've stayed at this property several times the last several years). Aside from problems with service, the rooms are dated, and the facilities are in poor functioning condition. In particular, I note that the rooms feature old CRT televisions, industrial-style bathrooms, no wireless internet in the rooms, and poorly functioning HVAC. The one amenity that the hotel does offer, its close proximity to the Convention Center, is overshadowed by these deficiencies. Both the Marriott and Westin Hotels that are a couple blocks away offer superior rooms and service, making the extra five minute walk to the Convention Center very worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great location hotel with some challenges”
Reviews.Author: swirlinabc
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a recent stay in Boston with my wife attending a conference and me enjoying Boston with my kids. As far as location goes, the Sheraton is great. It's connected to the Prudential Center and Copley Place, all indoors. There is very convenient access to the T through the Prudential or Back Bay stations without going outside. The Back Bay station also provide convenient access to Amtrak as well. Shopping, restaurants, and services abound. What more can you ask for? The beds and linens make for a great sleep. The rooms are on the smaller side with very limited dresser space. There is definitely not enough room for four people's clothes. The bathroom has very limited counter space for toiletry items. Our room was in need of maintenance as there was cracked ceiling plaster in the bathroom and in the room itself. The wallpaper was peeling in spots. The workout room and pool are well equipped. The indoor pool with retractable room is a definite plus. On the negative side is the pervasive smell of chlorine which is noticeable from the elevator. We were given some incorrect information by the conceirge prior to our arrival. Had I not checked the information given to us, there is a strong chance that we would have been stranded in Boston without a trip back to Providence airport. The most perplexing part of our hotel stay, however, revolved around the housekeeping issues that we encountered. Around day 3 of our stay, the hotel inexplicably ran out of washcloths. Never in my 40 plus years of hotel stays have I ever encountered a hotel that ran out of towels. We called several times asking for towels but were told each time that there weren't any. For a hotel of this caliber, I cannot understand how they could run out of towels. Granted, some people don't use a washcloth, but for those of us who did and asked for them, couldn't they have run to Costco to pick up some? Would I stay here again? The location is great, but with the number of nearby hotels, it's hard for me to justify saying yes when our experience had so many problems. I tried to give the hotel the benefit of a doubt and contacted the hotel after our stay to share my concerns, but the e-mail went unanswered. This pretty much tells me that customer satisfaction is not a priority. So, if I could do it again, I'd probably stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Once again a great stay”
Reviews.Author: emmachard
Reviews.Content: Booked our room with hotwire and got a rate of $114 per night. Check in was very smooth and we were upgraded to club level room as we are SPG members so that was a nice touch. Room was smaller than we have had on our previous stays but still nice and we had a nice view. I requested a crib for our son and it took a while to come up as guest services were very busy but after another call to them to explain we had just been traveling for 8 hours they delivered it straight away. Our son was unfortunately taken ill while we were there and they were very helpful in meeting our requirements for a humidifier and fridge for our room and very accommodating when we had to extend our stay for an extra few nights. The club rooms have access to the club lounge which is located on the 29th floor of the north tower (there is no club lounge in the south tower). The only thing is the hotel seems to close the club lounge if the hotel isnt running at capacity, we were the for 8 nights in total and it was only open twice. Reception gave us vouchers for breakfast in the hotel restaurant and also vouchers for appotizers in the side bar in reception. Compared to the breakfast that is served in the club lounge (muffins, bagels, tea/coffee, juice and fruit - continental) the breakfast in the main restaurant is much better value as you get full buffet access with hot and cold foods so it worked out really well for us to get given vouchers instead! Hotel location is excellent, connected to the prudential center so you dont even have to venture outside with lots of good shops and restaurants to choose from, P.F.Changs and Cheesecake Factory are a must. Once again a great stay at the Sheraton and will be back again im sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: TxJaysFan
Reviews.Content: Better than some reviews give it credit for. Overall, the rooms were a bit small but nice. Everything was clean, the view was wonderful and it is very well located (the Prudential Center makes shopping and eating easy and the T is nearby for jaunts out and about the city). Overall, it was a good experience and the staff was quite friendly.

Reviews.Title: “what a surprise”
Reviews.Author: kl5Lincolnshire
Reviews.Content: What a surprise the Sheraton was after reading some of the reviews. it would appear there is a massive difference in the rooms, the South tower being the best. Check in was very efficient and the room was lovely, very large with the most comfortable beds ever. The hotel as stated is in a fantastic location and the Wrentham Village outlet is well worth a visit for bargain shopping ( the bus picks up outside). The hotel bar is a little pricey ( not helped by the current dollar rate) but is a nice place to relax after a busy day shopping. There is a number of restaurants close by. A cab from the airport to the hotel can be cheaper than the shuttles depending what time of the day you go. If it is not rush hour it is just under $30.

Reviews.Title: “Find an alternative to the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: lbradders
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. I felt like we were staying in a motel. All toiletries apart from sampoo, conditioner and body lotion were not in the room. Even the robe was not there. For the price you pay, you do expect a little more. Cleaning was done at eratic times of the day, ie 3.30pm! The hotel is very busy with conferences and evening parties so there is alot of people around all the time. The lobby is like a train station with the people coming through. We felt that people staying at the Hilton accross the road, used the hotel as a short cut into the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Barely Tolerable”
Reviews.Author: getawaygirl5
Reviews.Content: If it were possible to give one and a half stars, I'd rather give that-- the stay wasn't "terrible" but it wasn't "okay" either. It was tolerable, and that's about it. I stayed at the Sheraton in Back Bay from November 21-25 for a business conference. For a hotel whose primary purpose is to serve business travelers, I was horrified at the lack of complimentary services and the quality of those that that I was charged for. Wired internet was $9.95 per night and very unreliable-- on the third night of my stay, the automatic prompt for daily payment wouldn't load. After an hour with no luck, I called the front desk only to learn there is no helpdesk within the hotel and I was instead patched through to Sprint. After over 30 minutes on the phone with a rep, I finally had the internet service reactivated, but for me having to go through this hassle was completely unacceptable while away on a business trip. I had three small packages (8, 10, and 13 lbs) shipped to me at the hotel; on my bill at checkout, there was a business center charge for $53. I was told by the front desk that "there's work involved" when guests receive packages and that the hotel charges a fee based on the weights of packages. I always have packages shipped to me at hotel, and in my numerous, numerous stays at other hotels have NEVER been charged a fee to receive parcels. Again, this is unacceptable for a hotel that claims it's for business travelers. As for my room, I had a spectacular view from the 24th floor in the north tower, but that was really where the postives stopped. My single room (queen bed) was incredibly small. The desk was positioned at the foot of the bed and it was impossible to push the desk chair back all the way out from under the desk to get in and out because it hit the bed! There was barely any clearance between the chair and bed even when the chair was pushed all the way under the desk. The closet doors when opened blocked the bathroom door. TV channels were limited and four out of five nights the satellite signal went out repeatedly while I was watching. Valet parking is absurdly expensive at $41 per night. Overall, the room was liveable but certainly no where near comfortable. The location is great and can't be argued, but there are other hotels in the area (like the Hilton across the street) which may be better choices. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kahlua716
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel September 5-7, 2008. We requested a room on a high floor in the south tower after reading that it was most recently renovated. We had amazing views and the room was beautiful! Bathroom was small, but clean and well stocked. I love the Bliss bath products! Bed was comfy and clean. Front desk was very helpful when we were trying to figure out how to get from here to there. I liked that the hotel was attached to the mall- I was able to do some shopping while my husband showered and dressed. It was a bit crowded because of conventions (it is primarily a business hotel) and a wedding, but it didn't bother us at all. No complaints- I would highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: colmac56
Reviews.Content: October 5 nights. Got the Sheraton on Priceline and went with a certain amount of trepidation having seen the variety of reports. What did we find? A wonderful hotel with wonderful staff, a wonderful breakfast, in a wonderful location. We loved it! We were warmly greeted by "Will" on reception with the words "I've got a nice suite for you on the 16th floor North Tower overlooking the Charles River". Oh yes! - I'll believe it when I see it!. And see it we did, exactly as described. I've lived in flats smaller than the room. King size bed in alcove and large chest of drawers, desk and 3 piece suite with coffee table. Two windows taking up virtually all the exterior wall with a view down to the river and to the Fenway on the left. Nice size bathroom in good condition. Even a small room off the main room with a work surface to house just an ice bucket and the coffee machine. No safe but used the very effecient safety deposit box system in the lobby. Hotel linked to the Prudential Centre so plenty of shops and eating places. Also T stop without going outside. We ate from the buffet breakfast each morning which filled us up until the evening. Staff friendly and helpful especially Sophia. We adopted her! Location is great with trolley tour stop right outside. It could not have been better in anyway at all. Would stay again at the drop of a hat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, but overall bad experience”
Reviews.Author: RickPJ
Reviews.Content: So there are a mixed bag of reviews for this hotel, I'll add mine based on a stay in Oct 2008. The hotel is connected to the Hynes Convention Center, you can't beat this for convenience. That's the single upside of this property. Now, for problems: old tube TV, turns out it didn't work at all. Maid went to the bathroom in my room, left soiled T.P in the wastebasket. Cost is quite high. Valet parking $46/nite. Wired internet in the rooms: $9.99, and it's slow. Carpets throughout the room areas, both inside the room I stayed in, and generally outside in the hallways were in need of replacement or at least significant cleaning. Room was dingy, old furniture, nicked and chipped up, Workspace for laptop work was stingy - no wrist supports, ethernet cable just barely stretched such that one can recline on the bed and compute. Room was quite small - reservation said "king", but when I arrived it was a queen bed jammed in this little room. Bathroom reminded me of high school, same kind of industrial, bowl-less design. Couple more pluses, actually: staff was pretty decent overall, and whoever does their elevator planning deserves an A+ - in spite of being quite busy, never had to wait for more than 10-15 seconds for an elevator at the lobby level. Note I've been mostly staying in B&B lately, so it had been a while since I've had to stay in a chain hotel. Never again - no more chain hotels, certainly Sheraton is pushed waaay down on the list now, Motel 6 for them.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice”
Reviews.Author: KCPlaza
Reviews.Content: This is great hotel for Boston visitors. Rooms are clean and updated and the staff is very friendly. The location is unbeatable. It has a T stop attached to the Prudential Center where the hotel is, as well as two other T stops within a few blocks. I would highly recommend the Sheraton in Back Bay

Reviews.Title: “Tiny tiny tiny6317453979”
Reviews.Author: Bukwaas
Reviews.Content: Booked it for $USD 415/night on the hotel website with an AAA discount. 2 interior hallways down from the Hynes Convention Centre. Free wifi on 1st and 2nd floors. Free access to onsite huge gym with lots of weight machines and treadmills, and massive pool and cozy hot tub. 7 minute run to Charles River. Lots of eateries in adjacent area (Newbury Street, Prudential Mall, etc.). Grocery store (Shaw's) directly across. Closest T stop (Prudential, Green Line) is within connected mall. Great view from 25th floor. Old, dusty and a bit dingy in decor. Small rooms, especially once crib and fridge placed for our baby. Ridiculously tiny bathrooms. Quick elevators. Uninterested frontdesk staff in response to complaints re: significant delay in arrival of requested crib to room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but inattentive to needs”
Reviews.Author: greenshorts
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Hynes Convention Ctr, and decided to stay at the Sheraton, which is actually connected to the convention center - just a short walk from the 2nd flr lobby. Parking was expensive at $41./day, but the surrounding public lots were only a bit cheaper with no in/out priveleges and no valet service. We had a 7 yr old and a 5 mo. old baby, so we requested for an early check-in. We were told at the desk that the room was not ready. The front desk lady did not seem interested in helping, and we were told to just wait. There were no changing tables in the lobby restrooms, so that was a challenge. We were disappointed because she wasn't really helpful and didn't offer any consolation or extra concern because we had a little one. I requested a room in the newly renovated wing, but was told there were none, bec. the hotel was full. We were put in a dark , small, old room in the 19th floor. The beds were ok, but the room was indeed tiny. Not advisable for a family with a baby.The bathroom was small, too. The crib and the fridge we requested arrived eventually. The doormen, and the bellhops were very nice and helpful. What really mattered a lot was the convenience of the hotel's proximity to the Hynes Conv. Ctr.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fakevirgo
Reviews.Content: I picked the Sheraton based on the location and availability. I wasn't expecting the hotel to be that nice but we were very happy with the service and accomodations as well as the location. We had a king suite on the 15th floor with a nice view of the city and St Charles River. We could also see Fenway Park. I would recommend that you request a room on the 15th floor or higher and facing the St Charles river. The room was spacious. The decor was just okay as was the bathroom. Its probably time for an upgrade to the decor. We enjoyed the pool, jacuzzi and sauna which weren't crowded at all. We had breakfast twice in the hotel restaurant. Both times we had the breakfast buffet, which is a little on the pricey side ($20) but a better deal than ordering a la carte. Our waitress both times was Sophie who is the sweetest women who gave us bottled water for the road. Overall, the staff was friendly and helpful. The location, Copley Place/Back Bay is excellent. There are many restaurants (recommend Sel De La Terre and Atlantic Fish Co), bars and historical sites in walking distance. The trolley tour we took picked us up right outfront of the hotel. Also, its right next to the Prudential Center and near Copley Place. Really the location can't be beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Air con bke one night and took two hours to fix. Got the night for free!”
Reviews.Author: TORN1
Reviews.Content: Just collecting points. Nice large hotel! Very convenient to many Boston sites including the Duck Tour, quick walk to Fenway and not far from the Commons, etc.... I've been to Boston a few times before and regardless where you stay no one location can cover all of Boston as the way the city is spreadout. We lucked out in our room assignment and were given a corner room which was very spacious with a little seeting area. Great decore and great views of the Back Bay and the Prudential Centre. Looked out onto anotehr wing of the hotel as well and am suprised what people do in thier rooms at night with the windows open. Very interesting pool which we never made it too although the retractable roof was neat. On the second night at the hotel the room started to get a little warmer and this was at about 1am. By 1:30 it was stiffling hot in the room. I contact the front desk who said they would send a maintenance man to our room. The problem was not resolved until after 3am as he needed to repair our A/C and make two or three trips to his supply room to get the correct part. The next morning I call the front desk to speak with someone in a management position to explain/complain of the issue with the air-con the night before but the operator told me that they were all in a meeting. I left a note for management followed by a subsequent email once I got home. After not hearing back from them I sent another email via the corporate website and within a day I got an email message back and the hotel credited me one nights stay to my credit card and apologized for this inconvenience. This is why I stay with Starwood Hotels. Definately do a duck tour from the Prudential Centre!

Reviews.Title: “disgusting (see photos)”
Reviews.Author: jujub34ns
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate through Travelocity. Maybe that was the problem. The room was outdated and desperately in need of a refurb. The bathroom was absolutely gross (see photos) with mold everywhere. Someone previously mentioned that being an SPG member got him a better room - that wasn't the case for me. Be prepared to struggle with your own luggage getting in and out of cabs as there were no doormen to be found. Security is a major issue for this hotel, especially the north tower. Most hotels have their elevators placed so that visitors would at least have to walk past either a concierge desk or the front desk. Not here! The north tower elevators are directly accessible from the shopping mall and there is no security desk, or security of any sort.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever, Please don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: augrain
Reviews.Content: This Sheraton Hotel is the worst of all hotels I have ever been. My husband and I ate breakfast at the buffet downstairs, and we paid the whole bill with a 20% tip. The waiter came to collect the money, and before he even open it, he had the guts to ask us if we gave him any tips! So, i have to say Sheraton is the worst of all hotels, and it is not a 4 star at all, with staff like this. I thought 4 star hotel means they are personal and friendly, but this is exactly opposite to what my experience has been. Please never ever pick this hotel. The staffs in the rooms are unfriendly, and provide the worst service.

Reviews.Title: “Hang on to your confirmation”
Reviews.Author: Warmwinds
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give 4 stars for the hotel and 2 stars for check-in. We stayed here for one night on 9/18. We had RESERVED a Club Level room through Starwood points (this is a great deal, only 1,000 points more than a regular room). After a rocky dropping off of the car (there were no valets around, so we got the attention of the doorman, then had to deal with the irate suddenly appearing valets because we usurped their "tip"...ah, it was not pleasant)...on to the inside...checking in and I knew in advance that the North Tower was the Club level, and where we were supposed to be, but the check in clerk assigns us a room in the South Tower...hmmm...I said "what a pain, you mean we have to come down in the elevator to the lobby, cross over, then go up to the North Tower for the concierge lounge?" He says "your room does not have access to the CL, but we can give you it for an extra fee"...I said I RESERVED the Club Level, he asked to see my confirmation, I whipped it out...AND HE HAD TO GO IN THE BACK TO CHECK WITH HIS SUPERVISOR>>>I felt like I was buying a car! "well, Ma'am, I'll go ask my boss if we can swing this monthly payment"...he comes back and tap tap tap on the computer and suddenly we were in a CL room that 10 minutes before had been "not available". Hors d'oeuvres were great, dessert was great, breakfast was fine (cold Continental)...well worth the 1,000 extra points. I loved sitting there overlooking the Charles...the room was nothing special - it DID have the Ralph Lauren decor as promised, but it's an old hotel built in the 70's or whenever so the rooms aren't HUGE, the bathrooms are SMALL, but the nicely renovated room and the club level were well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel designed by accountants”
Reviews.Author: Zann13
Reviews.Content: This is the second time this year I've stayed at a Sheraton, and the general experience is the same. The hotel feels as though it was designed by accountants. There is no attention to the comfort of those of us who stay here, rather the attention is on the photo-ops and the lobby. Lobby was lovely. Room was pretty bad. Bed was large, but the bedding was uncomfortable and scratchy and the pillows, though plentiful, were hard-as-a-rock horrors. The window didn't open though the view was ok. Curtains didn't close all the way. The bathroom was passable but no better than a cheap motel on the highway. Online access cost $$ and was by 1 ethernet cable - not wireless - so only one of us could go online at a time. Soda machines owned by Pepsi so a pathetic few overpriced choices of overly large pepsi products in hideous plastic bottles, no cans, no other brands. Complimentary USA Today which I really HATE. How about a Boston Globe, folks? Oh, and the decor in the hallways was flat out hideous. Hire a decorator with taste, Sheraton, how's that for a revolutionary idea? The price for this mediocrity was outrageous. Note to self: don't go to Sheratons, they rip you off.

Reviews.Title: “Room allocation is critical it would seem”
Reviews.Author: drc225
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in mid September whilst at a conference in the adjoining Hynes Convention Center. The hotel is convenient as it is part of the Prudential Center and thus its a very short inside walk to the convention center. As a result of this (and because of reading some of the reviews here on Trip Advisor regrading the food) we didn't use any of the hotel facilities as the Prudential Center has everything one needs. Room allocation appears to be key. This is borne out reading other reviews. My room was very small with an uncomfortably small bath room. The room suffered from significant plumbing noises. I couldn't decided whether this was something to do with the aircon or it was water rushing through pipes. Whatever there was an obtrusive rushing sound and then a 'bang' when it cut off. Given that the noise generally started about 4:00am ish and continued relentlessly throughout the remainder of the early morning I suspect it was the plumbing, or specifically, the flushing. On the plus side thee bed was very comfortable and everything in the room worked. The walls in this part of the hotel (North Tower - 20th floor) are thin and it was noisy. For example could hear next door flicking the light switches. Others have commented on this. So, judging on my experience alone, I'd not be impressed. However, my colleague down the hall had a much bigger room and none of the aforementioned issues! As a SPG member with a few points to my name I would have expected a better room - a feeling confirmed when it transpired that my colleague and I had inadvertently swapped rooms and I should have been in the bigger one without the plumbing noises. It does make me wonder however whether the 'noisy small' rooms are allocated to those paying the conference rate or whether it was just luck of the draw. Internet was $9.95 + $.50 'telephone tax' for 24 hours and worked fine. They also have free wifi in the lobby so if you just want to check email in the morning/evening you don't have to pay at all. For me the experience was adequate - my colleague would rate it higher. If I had the choice between this hotel and one of equal standard at the same rate I'd try the other.

Reviews.Title: “Treat the desk clerks nicely”
Reviews.Author: jetsetsarah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the sheraton boston for 3 nights at the beggining of the month. I was checking in late, around 8pm and the guy in front of me was arguing with the front desk clerk over not having club access, this is apparently the special top floor of the hotel with included breakfast and snacks as I was to find out later. When I got to the desk I was expecting the worst but was greeted with a smile even after he was just chewed out. The clerk made great small talk and after tipping him a 20 we were upgraded to a beautiful suite on the "Club" level which had a fantastic view and included access to a continental breakfast and some snacks at night. Im from Las Vegas and I know how far tipping the front desk goes. They have a beautiful swimming pool with a retractable roof and friendly cleaning staff. Even the made who spoke very little english was genuinely friendly and was always smiling. Theres a ton of great shopping within walking distance and great restaurants as well, try Haru for excellent sushi! The concierge staff blew me away with their knowledge of the area and Jerry was more than kind enough to help with any reservations or suggestions. Dont be afraid to walk this city if the weather is nice, you are walking distance from everything and we found ourselves walking from one place to another just exploring the sites until we found ourselves on the other side of town! but if you end up too far away theres always the subway which goes right to the prudential center where the hotel is located. all in all a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “No character but overall worth the money”
Reviews.Author: stevejackson375
Reviews.Content: Well positioned hotel (Prudential stop on the subway) - not a lot to recommend it from a character point of view but has excellent facilities - especially the beds that are enormous. Good service and pool and gym area was a bonus. Free internet access in the lobby and a starbucks made it the perfect base to explore Boston from for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “No compliants for the Sheraton Boston!”
Reviews.Author: 1hotam
Reviews.Content: Great room with a great view! Lovely to gaze out of the window when the city lights are on. Room was cosy, quiet, and spacious. The bed was dreamy indeed! I could have stayed in it and not gone to any of the 3-day conference which I came for. :-) Hotel is connected to Prudential Center, which offers lots of shopping (some not for cheap) and a food court. Browsed around there on some breaks from the conference. The Center has a beautiful courtyard you can go sit outside and read or eat. The Sheraton is within walking distance of restaurants, grocery stores, the T line, and other hotels. We took the T to all the touristy spots like Cheers and Havard. It's also minutes from the Charles River... so if you want to go for a walk on the paved paths, it's not far.
